pq_i763J2FR9pvr8qqmlqg.text: For me this is a "one time only" place. Had breakfast and was greeted by a large spider before the wait staff showed up to our table. No big deal, ordered food and specifically asked for no onions and saw the waitress write it down so knew she heard me.  My hash meal arrived and it had onions in the food.  Easy enough to pick them out but if I had a food allergy and someone served me food that I requested be removed in preparation it could have had serious consequences.  The food was meh.  Never saw the waitress until time to pick up plates and check in before the check is settled. Not that this was an excuse for a reduced meal cost but the waitress didn't seem to care after I pointed it out and no gesture on behalf of the restaurant to bring my experience into the realm of average.  I don't write many reviews but this was so disappointing that others should be made aware of at least my experience.  Perhaps this review will communicate that the wait staff should be more sensitive to customers who can't eat certain foods normally prepared in their standard menu.  Sorry Hash, perhaps this was an example of a bad day and this is not typical? Regardless, this was my first and last meal at your restaurant. Sorry, it was just awful.

DZfCStRPXYZy61Vc79EZpA.text: This is such an awesome and unique breakfast place. The plates are huge; from the S'mores French Toast to the Fruity Pebbles Pancakes. The dishes are super flavorful with awesome presentation. We came on a Sunday and there was a DJ. Domenic took care of us, getting us a seat at the busy bar.  The only downside was that the frozen drink machine was broken, so we weren't able to have a mimosa slushie, but the mimosa flight was great!  This was our 4th time here, but our first time on the weekend. The team looks like they really enjoy working here. The guests are very friendly with each other. We saw multiple tables talking to each other and asking about what they had to eat or drink. Such a great experience!

zJ-GsXnaVCr_5fr2BAG54A.text: Thank you Jessica for your food and beverage suggestions! My coworkers and I had a wonderful time today at brunch. Your honestly with recommendations really helped narrow our eager eyes down (although we will be back to try everything on our most wanted list!). Domenic, the manager, stopped by several times during our meal to ensure our satisfaction and we felt so welcomed. THIS is the kind of spot we needed in the Chandler area! Modern, lively, warm and welcoming with food and drinks WAY above par. Thank you, Hash Kitchen!! I will most definitely be back!

TJvaaEq4Pjpm2ClLwb557A.text: Went to hash kitchen a couple of weekends ago and it was absolutely excellent. Between the service and the food we will definitely be returning. Dominic and his wife, melody were too sweet. They came around and checked on us to make sure the food and service were great, you could tell they truly cared. We ever brought our puppies who are not the most well behaved and they were so loved.

I8AA39R5bFkr96xrLLgctQ.text: My sister and I met here for breakfast on a weekday morning and we had a lovely time. The staff were attentive and helpful, and the food was good.   I got the French Press coffee, which I would have preferred stronger but I really like a proverbial punch in the face with my coffee.    I also ordered the Avocado Toast and it was rather stunning. It was 2 huge slices of fried brioche bread with avocado, braised pork, bacon, a fried egg and crispy leeks (the leeks were a first for me). It also came with a green Chile hollandaise. I recommend sharing or planning on taking a piece home because it truly was enormous.  It was also delicious. It read on the menu that it would have bacon jam but instead it just seemed to have 2 thick slices of bacon. I didn't complain, though the bacon jam would have been a nice touch.  My sister ordered a Blueberry Mimosa, which she enjoyed, and the original French Toast. This was the same brioche bread they used for my avocado toast, so this was also a huge serving. I think there were 3 pieces total. I didn't taste it but she said it was good.  Domenic, the Manager, came and spoke to us for a bit. He's a transplant from the E. Coast and loves AZ so far.  You can tell he really cares about each person's experience.  We'll definitely go back. For now I would rate the service a 5 and the food a 4.   I wish I'd taken more pics.

j3NR-JCBOlIttr6NxBv13g.text: Loved this place!! The Crab Egg Benedict and the bloody bar were on point!  The manager Dominic and our server were amazing and super friendly. We will be back!

7Ow8MI6ajAEr8H91lBBk2w.text: This is a most go to brunch place!! The food was amazing, entire staff is friendly!! Dev gave us great recommendations and Domenic ensured we were taking care of!! My new favorite place!!

_ygzhDBp1Qz798N3cpcLVA.text: Our group of 10 celebrated a birthday here and it was a first visit for all of us. They don't take reservations so one of us went a half hour early to be sure we could get a big table. There is only one table that could seat us all. A bit crowded, but it was located in its own little area to the side of the main restaurant so it was nice to feel cozy and be able to hear everyone at the table.   Everyone enjoyed their selection. Portions are generous and the presentation on each plate was appetizing. The French toast was the big winner for fun!  The Bloody Marys were great. Prices are a bit on the high side, but quality is there.   Our server, Amy, was efficient and got everything right (with a group this large we almost always have errors on the separate checks).  Dominick, the manager, was impressive. He greeted us early on and then checked back more than once to be sure everything was perfect.   We will be back, and bring our husbands next time. One request: open a restaurant in our area - Queen Creek!

iRsx14-OtpOhG8IlUfxA1A.text: This place is incredible! The food and service is outstanding! The manager, Dominic took really good care of us! He was professional and very attentive. He came over several times to check on everything, I was very impressed. I can't wait to come back!

M11SYGCCkuUbU1N6zJzzow.text: Honestly was so impressed with this place. I got the carnitas hash and it was delicious. Flavorful and the carnitas didn't have a lot of fat (that's how I like it, I hate lots of chewy fat). We ordered the mimosa flight. They hit the spot and I got a nice buzz from them. The canoli pancakes were alright. I loved the carnitas hash more. My sister got the avocado toast. Talk about HUGE. The portions here are large which is nice to share with others especially when you can't decide between savory or sweet as your brunch entree. When we came, the a/c was broken so that was the only part that made it unpleasant. Service was friendly and attentive. We waited like 45 min on a Saturday. I've been living in California for 4 years, so I've had my fair share of great restaurants. I'm happy to see AZ stepping it up with food especially in my hometown. Will be visiting again when I'm in town!

wW6KyNcHtaIiCq6fMKmh1A.text: I wanted to try this place two weeks ago. As soon as I drove by and saw a huge crowd out the door (and I was super starving), I decided to go eat some place else instead. A week later, I made sure I snack on something before the long wait, surprisingly we got seated in less than 5 minutes. Yay!  I ordered a corn beef hash and it has too much potatoes for my taste. I wish it had more beef in it. The Avocado sandwich was so huge we could barely finished one of the two. I highly recommend a party of two to share this meal. If you like to drink, they do have a huge bar. They service was great, the restaurant is trendy looking, but the music was way too loud. We literally had to yell across the table and eventually decided not to speak at all until we left the place. If you want to have conversation with friends during breakfast, I will not recommend it. If you want to hang out enjoying alcohols and loud music, this is the place to be.   I probably will not order the same dish again, but do plan on coming back and try their pancakes or toasts. I saw other tables ordering it and it sure looked delicious.

ZZiWGZKhPK6sZtKcg5b1Wg.text: The manager Domenic is amazing. We called in advance for a Birthday Brunch, and he reserved a table for us and our dogs! He spoke to us before and after our meal to ensure it was all up to standard. I've never had such a welcome customer service at a restaurant.  The carnitas hash was very good. Crispy fried onions, creamy avocado, and fresh cilantro really elevated the plate. If anything, the carnitas could've had more of that coke-braised marinated flavor; but it was far from flavorless.   The mimosa flight was fun, and each flavor was refreshing, and just boozy enough. Speaking of booze, the 25oz Mega Boba Mimosa was unexpectedly entertaining to share. BUT, my favorite drink was the Captain Crunch Shooter. Captain crunch with cinnamon cream rum was to die for... and I'm lactose intolerant! I don't care for bloody marys, but they have an expansive bloody mary bar, if you so fancy.   I was really impressed with the service and food upon my first visit to Hash Kitchen. Next time: I'll order a Hash with a side of Reese's pancakes. No judgement, right?

txIrdbd4iBJ75SEovkWzbg.text: This place. THIS PLACE! Overall great experience!   Staff: It was a packed Sunday and I was seeking a table for two. I was told it would be a 40 minute wait, but based on what I could see I knew it would be worth the wait. After walking outside, the SWEETEST manager Domenic came to ask if we'd be willing to sit at the open bar seats as it would be a faster option than a 40 minute wait for a table. He personally walked us over and made sure we were content. Throughout the 2.5 hour stay (Yes, we were in no rush to leave enjoying both the food and company), Domenic came and checked in with us multiple times. In addition, the waitstaff was overall charismatic and informative.   Atmosphere: I felt like Scottsdale came to Chandler!  Trendy, modern, and a great DJ. It wasn't a "party" scene like Old Town, but a great atmosphere (again we were there 2.5 hours!!) that you didn't want to leave. The whole room had grins ear to ear.   Food: I ordered the Avocado Toast and OH. MY. GOSH! Delicious!! And so much food! I could barely finish one slice and took the other one home for leftovers. Plenty of food for the price and it came in a timely manor for being so busy!   We will definitely be coming back. If there is ever a restaurant I want to "show off" for an out-of-towner this will be the place!

I6rHhEvi64sst8gYE1oVxA.text: This was a GREAT brunch! The food and service were fantastic- even with a packed restaurant, and the atmosphere was really energizing! They had a live DJ, so it's not a quiet little brunch spot, but it will definitely get your Sunday Funday started! The Bloody Mary bar has an impressive amount of toppings, but if you don't like spicy, make sure to tell them when you're picking the spice level. I thought I was getting a little bit of spice but WHEW!  We will definitely be back!

4EEx39ilv3okA4JJQpFkLA.text: We met up with friends for breakfast and had a fantastic time.  The Bloody Mary bar was the best we'd ever seen.  So many choices of infused vodka and mixes it will take us several visits to try them all.    The food was spot on!  A perfect blend of flavors that were outside the ordinary, making them extra special.  The Monte Christo sandwich was delicious and I'll have a hard time trying new items!  The wait staff were friendly and attentive.  The manager checked on us twice during our visit making sure were were happy and taken care of to our expectations.    The environment was a little loud for our liking but not so loud that it interrupted our enjoyment.  We will most definitely be back!

OdIxxfxKmxlqTVpdDXp91g.text: Waited 2 hours and 10 minutes to get a table for brunch! Not kidding. At the end, it was great but wasn't worth the extreme wait time!

EwBBlRxsexTcq4PXnMoluw.text: LOVE hash kitchen! Love the fun and loud atmosphere and the wide variety of eats and drinks on the menu! It reminds me a bit of Hash Hash A Go go. Can't wait to go back!

mCTcYMvxsHnTAgMpMVHXQw.text: Came here for brunch on a Friday around 11:30. Waited for about 15 minutes to be seated that was after getting up to tell the hostesses that other people that arrived after us were being seated before us. Her explanation was that the parties were smaller than ours (we had 4 in our party) even though I clearly saw at least 3 tables that seated 4 or more, available, when I got up to speak with the hostesses. As soon as you go inside there's a DJ blaring music. The music did vary but was a bit loud. It was hard  for our server to hear us. I did notice a Bloody Mary bar with a ton of ingredients available. I went with a tea. I would've loved to try the Bloody Mary bar but it was a bit pricey, 34.00 for a 32oz glass (go big or go home is my motto!) I can't remember what I ordered but it was a breakfast. I wasn't impressed with the portion size for the price. Looking around I did notice that the burgers and sandwiches were a good size. If I go back, I'll order a burger or sandwich instead. Over all the atmosphere was fun. I'm glad I tried it, not sure if I'll go back.

uqCBA1YfCAkEVXsDD7NXdw.text: This is my second time here. My first go around I wasn't a big fan of my first dish. This time around I got the coconut/almond French toast and it was DELISH! We started our morning with the mimosa flight and Bloody Mary bar. Both are fabulous and the presentation was great. Dominic the manager was friendly and made us feel welcomed! We came in with our luggage from the airport and he offered to keep them in a safe location. Our server Amanda was helpful and provided amazing service. It made us definitely want to come back! Try this place out if your in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

nRxRsLnJASQ0J2NBHwVA3w.text: Never heard of this place before today. I had a lunch meeting scheduled here with some co-workers and a vendor. Looked at the menu and photos beforehand to get an idea of what they offered so I was excited to try it out. Upon arrival we sat in back near the restrooms and kitchen; there was a lot of foot traffic. The windows are not tinted and it's extremely bright and there is a lot of glare inside. Table was large and sat us 7 comfortably. We started with the bacon board; this thing I absolutely loved so I was even more amped for the meal. The bacon is thick and tastes just right. Comes with a few small bagels, some Brie, and bacon jam. We all ordered our meals and it took about 20 minutes to get our food. I was the last of the 7 to get their meal and my dish came out about 4-5 minutes after the first dish came to the table. I ordered the Cuban sandwich with fries. Snapped my obligatory photos for yelp and then took a huge bite and noticed something was off...hmmmm...that's weird. "I taste mayo" I thought to myself. Sure thing, I look at the bread and both sides are slathered in it. I look again at the menu and the Cuban comes with grain mustard. At that point with almost everyone else at my table finished with their meals I scrapped the bread (I personally think mayo is the most disgusting thing in the planet) and just ate the ham and pulled pork. After I ate I politely spoke with the manager and explained what happened; he said the grain mustard is actually a mayo/mustard mixture. The mix that was spread on my sandwich was all white...no yellow in sight. I was disappointed because the ciabatta looked so dang good! Alas, those things happen but I informed the manager they should probably change the description on the menu to say such. My co-workers said their meals were mediocre; one said his skillet came with onions even though the dish was not listed on the menu as having onions. I might stop in again and try a breakfast item.

Gxa17Vtg1eNprPS8a6x5OA.text: My first visit I had the Mexicana Scramble, I didn't care for it at all (and forgot to take a pic). I went again the following week with friends for Sunday Funday. This time I tried the Bloody Mary bar (AMAZING) and I ordered the banana split brioche OMG. My boyfriend had the Avocado Toast which he said was really good. For 2 bloody Mary's it was $15, kinda steep if you ask me, but they were really tasty. Expect to wait over and hour easily. There was a Dj on Sunday that played some good music. Cool atmosphere, good vibes.

fpClutcvFVjdQ6lHzyvKtg.text: After researching a brunch location my husband and I decided on going to Hash. We loved it. The atmosphere is just perfect for my mid 30 self. Not too clubby but not too conservative. The DJ was awesome! It took me back to my younger years. The food was delicious. I had the fried chicken salad sandwich and it was simple yet so flavorful! The blueberry mimosa was just the perfect size. Can't wait to go back again

fEU9PW0jkg4cUVe0aQlylw.text: If you're lookin for an amazing brunch experience (it is an experience) look no further than hash kitchen. Hash kitchen is owned by "the little Italian" Domenic, and he cares SO much about his guests and their dining perspective. The food..... good God, is extraordinary. The aesthetic is hip and modern but not too cool for a family breakfast. Just get your ass here and discover this gem. You'll thank me later!!!

U7iBU2ceaXtB3833_uxk5A.text: Came for my boyfriend's birthday for the first time and had a great experience. The wait was a bit long, as expected from other reviews. We got quoted an hour and a half on a Sunday morning @ 11:30, but got sat around 12:30. Dominic was very engaging and hospitable. Our server (I believe Kendra was her name) was on top of her stuff and gave us great service. My boyfriend got a free dessert for his birthday, too and it was delicious.   I thought the chicken and waffles were pretty great, and would recommend the mimosa flight if you're not a big Bloody Mary person.   The atmosphere was lively and there was a live DJ. Can't wait to try it again soon!

BZ8IuRS6ZcPkdekXiNpLig.text: Went here at 12:30 on a Tuesday-still busy but no wait.  Tried the mimosa flight and was not disappointed-delicious.  Usually I like the Bloody Mary bar but this was good since I had the tamale eggs Benedict which was absolutely fantastic.  There was some spice which I liked so the mimosas helped with that.  It was so much food!  This was my third time and each time I'm so impressed.  Manager Dominic checked on us to make sure we were satisfied as he has every time I've been here.  He is passionate and friendly which I really appreciate.  Better than First Watch by far!  I'll be back!

AjyxcGi-BiIX6yT9B7ptiw.text: This is by far my favorite brunch spot! Dominic always makes us feel welcome and always checking in on every table. The food is amazing no matter what we order! The mimosa flight is always a favorite of mine!! I'm so glad they opened one in Chandler so close to my home. They were so good though we always traveled to the ones in Scottsdale.

yYANI6Y652Xz7TrJXectZg.text: We just got finished with my birthday brunch celebration and I can't think of a better place to have gone. The food was wonderful. I had the eggs Benedict, subbed bacon for the Canadian bacon. The sauce was buttery and velvety smooth. The eggs were perfectly poached with no hint of vinegar (which can happen). My husband's huevos rancheros we're also delicious. I also had the blueberry mimosa which paired perfectly with the dance club vibe. Our waiter Jesus was equally great and even brought out a cannoli donut for my birthday. Thanks Hash for getting my day off to a great start!

i4YKZY8tonCnXRVx00W5dw.text: Open airy comfortable modern food establishment..had good first experience ..Bloody Mary bar awesome...steak n potato skillet delicious..shared by 2 so much to eat...fresh cannoli donuts yummy..food came out fast and hot...very nice waitress and feel bad and forgot her name :-(    she had nice eyelashes lol we talked about... Suggestions: fresh lemonade..instead of minute maid..and extra bar to stop feet from dangling when sitting against back wall booth...other than that...So far pretty close to  perfect...especially for just opening within past couple days.

aVBvdgPDVAsnD1X4bBsjYg.text: This place is amazing. My friends came to visit me from California and Domenic made sure we were well taken care of. He went above and beyond to accommodate us and make us feel like we were back home in Cali. The food was delicious, definitely picture perfect plate presentation. Our server Melissa was very attentive and personable. She answered all our questions and gave us recommendations. The dj made the atmosphere feel very fun and energetic. I will definitely be back and recommend this place to friends.

h_HunbbdJjW2QDw9HNzTWw.text: I have waited patiently since the grand opening for the right time to dine here, the location is new and the anticipation before opening was all the buzzzzz. I tried the seasonal menu and ordered the carved turkey Beni  carved turkey, cornbread caked with a side of potatoes and smothered with fried leeks, sounds delicious right??? What I received was.. carved turkey, mashed potatoes and gravy.. my order was way wrong. It sound yummy but was completely heavy and non complimentary of flavors. When our waitress asked how our food was I asked her politely if my order was incorrect. After minutes of scrambling and confusion the manager came to our table to tell us they ran out of cornbread cakes. So simple yet not communicated to me because I happily would have ordered another dish.  Second, we ordered carved turkey with stuffing waffles and we received a regular Belgian waffle. Totally bogus. No comp, no apologies, no communication.  Long story short, we happily won't return.

PuifrKjU2vdmutz4VFsOww.text: This is probably my favorite new breakfast spot!!! Super cute, modern, good for all ages! Our server Kendra, was spectacular. So sweet, attentive, and personable. One of the managers Dominic, came by to our table, and as also super friendly! 10/10 will be back

PjaVOLmqbMWTuX-LXoqKFg.text: Great place for breakfast.  Huge portions so split. A cant  miss. Nothing is bad on the menu

SlL25IPuHL9WXIBD8TrUwg.text: The food is good but I don't understand why the music has to be so loud. The one in Scottsdale is not this loud. It's hard to have a conversation.

UiluEJNGs31HXI6ebnfeRw.text: Really great food, service, and atmosphere! Great menu, on one bloody mary bar, and a bunch of different types of mimosas! The only issue is that Sunday you literally have 1hr+ wait all the time and they dont take reservations. Other than that its it's fantastic !

DTn7Cer_vw4ahi3293aHlQ.text: Visited Hash last week. Had a great time. The food was phenomenal. The frittata was amazing. And the Capt. Crunch was a great way to top it off. Our server Amy was sweet, attentive, and professional. I would definitely visit again. And I would definitely request Amy as our server again. She rocks.

f6q1VlHOuK8AcPSdx8FmRw.text: The  food and service were excellent!  I have been trying to get into this place for a few weeks and today was my lucky day.   Our waiter Patrick was very prompt and attentive.  Dominic stopped by to see how our service was that was really great.  Shows this location is trying to be personable with their patrons

HmNhfKxk3VHTH5mAj31u2Q.text: Food is great, atmosphere is fantastic.  Seating can be a little chaotic but it is worth the wait!

ZTfYUV60HTOSdimFZUyeGw.text: The service sucks, we ordered food to go and when it was time to come back they didn't even put in our order yet. The waitress that helped us hadn't put out order in so now we have to wait another 30 minutes for our food.

7knNSeEkchR37j4BJgJkoQ.text: Every month we have a ladies lunch. Each person gets to pick where we go next. This month my friend picked the Hash Kitchen mostly because of the Bloody Mary bar. They don't take reservations and we arrived around 10:30. We were there early knowing there was going to be a wait. Numerous pairs go in and out. An hour later, my friend asked what's going on. We finally get seated an hour later. We order Bloody Marys. Which is an amazing bar. Music is a little loud but it was very good. Food is Average nothing that would make me come back. You can get the same for few dollars less anywhere. My vegetarian friend had the Quinoa burger, she said it was very bland, not a lot of flavor. Average cost for a cocktail and a plate between us was $25. Service was good just takes a long long time to get seated if you are more than 2 people.

fiQ9_rGgq3VtgfwgXTxAUw.text: Food was delicious and unique. I had sweet potato and crab hash. Yummy!  Of coarse Bloody Mary bar great. My daughter had smoked salmon board. Amazing flavors with all food. Dominic, manager, was welcoming and attentive and made sure we had a wonderful experience. Service was impeccable. We definitely will return.

Tk4Jl_aphKo5MUN-wcJxgQ.text: Love this place! It is so good and so much fun. This is the place for weekend brunch! Between their food and drinks, they have such a good and unique variety. Although it gets super busy and the wait can be pretty long, the service is always amazing and the staff is super friendly.

qQwNNWXr7YEoPAIJ8kOwfg.text: What an amazing spot!!! Not only is the staff beyond helpful and friendly, the establishment is clean and well laid out. The Bloody Mary bar is a sight to be seen! The manager Dominic came to our table and introduced himself and really made us feel at home. Living across the street from this place is heaven sent! We will be coming back for brunch time and time again! Recommend to anyone and everyone!! Plus, look at this avocado toast!!

TKRaNeWCaj3gRRKhz9anKw.text: Good spot for Brunch, the food is amazing. Domenic the manager was very friendly and attentive to our needs. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone for breakfast or lunch.

FHYt03qi8yw6GIZTyN7d4w.text: This place is fabulous!  So glad that there is a location here in the East Valley.  Food is always hot, fresh, and served up quickly.  The mimosa flights are my favorite, tho' one of these days I'm going to try the bloody mary bar...which could be a small meal on it's own!  The D.J. on the weekend is fun - great place for gatherings and celebrations.  The manager is friendly, and has stopped by the table each time I've been there to make sure that everything is up to par.   Highly recommended.

NO7vVPz0NKWaE4uxdP9A1g.text: The atmosphere is great, the food is wonderful and the staff is Amazing. Dominic and Vanessa were very friendly and took great care of my friends and me. I ordered the Avacodo toast (totally recommend) which was enormous and so flavorful. Everything was above and beyond my expectations. They have a great Bloody Mary bar that I will be looking forward to trying(next trip) along with another selection of food from the great list of foods on the menu.

AQpIGe9JRJr0lvUKAwcO4A.text: Our party of 7 for brunch was super excited to try this place, especially after seeing the 'Build Your Own Bloody Mary' bar! We are well aware of how popular brunch is on a Sunday, especially at a new place.  We got there at 11am, got our buzzer and found a seat our quoted wait time of 1hour and 15 minutes and were totally ok with it.  Well, at about an hour in we asked for an update on time and were told 'we're just waiting for a big party to leave'.  Now, any good wait staff knows how to seat tables and the manager should have known better. So they have maybe 2 tables that seat 6-7 people without having to push tables together or bring an extra...but they were literally waiting for those big parties to leave before seating us.  We saw several opportunities for them to maybe hold off on a two-top to accommodate us with a couple smaller tables in the same grouping which would have been perfect but nope, none of the four ladies standing at the check-in counter thought of that. So after the hour and 15 minutes wait time with no end in sight we stood and saw no clear tables. A lady approached and apologiozed but made it a point to say they were still within the quoted wait time. LOL. After that lack of good friendly customer service, we left and went to a delicious Mexican Restaurant right next door that was featured on 'Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.

svIM4KbI0ajGylynPfqLww.text: Love love love this place! They do everything right! The ambiance is so fun! Bright and open .. they have a DJ on the weekends (so awesome!), best Bloody Mary bar ever, amazing champagne flights and the food is delicious! Huge portions! Domenic the manager went above and beyond for us to make my Daughter's Birthday celebration so smooth and fun! He is so friendly and helpful and truly takes pride in what he does! No wonder this restaurant is always packed! We will definitely be back!!

Da3cHQ48SypPzqmzOz1vZQ.text: Anytime you want to go to an awesome atmosphere,  this is the place, food was amazing, the service was on point and music/DJ rocked. He played up beat brunch from all era's. The mimosas are to die for and the bloody bar was THE BOMB, great job Hash Kitchen.   We will be back

BMLfxlVCb0BbBy2wVWVltg.text: My daughter and I are regulars, love this place! Great atmosphere and delicious food! Highly recommend!

T4FKuIVwo7T21SQ-BIPaDw.text: One of the best Bloody Mary bars I have ever seen!  Service was great from the time we walked in. The food was amazing which matched the atmosphere!  Dominic, the manager, stopped by to see how everything was.  This is my new favorite spot!!

u_QAs14Fz13G9D37GAEnYQ.text: The atmosphere and friendliness of the staff is very pleasing. Kendra was our server and was very adamant about serving us in a Timely manner. Domenic was a very friendly manager that made us feel at home in the restaurant! The dishes are very well known but have a nice twist to each of them to make them unique. I enjoyed my fried chicken dish however it was a little dry. Otherwise their mimosas are phenomenal and their hue is rancheros is fabulous in flavor and aesthetic! We will be back to try more of their extensive menu!

eqrYXX44CuCdkz3KNfo_0Q.text: Had a very nice brunch today. The food and bloody marys are definitely 5 stars here, just the service is sooooo slow.

TAMdc-zTTcFawA8GF67PLg.text: Love the atmosphere, food and hospitality at Hash Kitchen.  The manager Dominic is so helpful and friendly.  Loved our food- delicious and fresh!  Highly recommend bringing your friends and family.

NAs9MQ5ym7tBXqKBOjCOuQ.text: Amazing breakfast and mimosa bar. Manager Domenic and waitress Angelina were so hospitable and sweet. Will definitely return.

37xB2cONkqtEIuoBWdkW2A.text: It is a great place... if you enjoy being lied to. Beware that when they tell you about wait time they just make it up as they go. You come in, they tell you about 30 minute wait time. And in 30 minutes it is another 10 to 15 minutes. And in 45 minutes it is another 10 to 15 minutes. And in one hour it is... you get the gist. I've been there before and the food is pretty good, but hardly any food is worth 1+ hour wait time. And no food is worth  this ridiculousness.

a-IdQ_uiO4BW5gEPL_thkw.text: What a cute place! This place was so fun! Bloody Mary bar was so great. Domenic was awesome and we had great service.! I'll for sure be back!

kI6XQJeHDntLXW-jl6QJPQ.text: I went with a personal friend on memorial weekend to observe the holiday and catchup. It was a great day and we were seated smoothly after a normal wait for the amount of clientele this Saturday. My friend whom is a geriatric decided she would best enjoy her meal outside and I can't explain enough how accomodating they were to my friend. I had the flight of mimosas and my buddy had breakfast and and a mimosa , as we converse about game of thrones and catch up as planned. Our waiter was a very well spoken and helpful man by the name of saichon I believe . However later we were greeted by what looked like the GM Dom . He greeted us cordial and asked  how everything was as is expected. After numerous compliments of the food , the service , accommodations and even the cleanliness my friend explained her distaste for one of the mimosas in 6 that we tried. His response was abhorrent to say the least., I'll check on that or , a quick response of a review  would have been sufficient , however Dom continued to drone on with long winded words closely related to the culinary field, criticized her palette , and explained decided it would be a good idea to remind my friend she asked for a special accommodation earlier. It was so rude,and shocking to my friend on this holiday . No words . I ended up paying for the whole meal to make up for his announcements to us in front of a busy restaurant. The place is great , get Dom off the floor back in the office ! Wish the Amex group had blog to post instead of just the business review forum .oh well

4uod95OSwXMSXDDnzwuW4Q.text: I am really middle of the road on this one. Plusses: 1) Concept is awesome. 2) Space is great! Lots of fun - great music. (Lots of old school hip hop, 90s stuff that I like.) I love the vibe. 3) I love a Bloody Mary bar! I love me some condiments in my Mary!  4) I love mimosas! I love that there are lots of flavors of mimosas. 5) I love brunch. There is an extensive brunch menu. I loved the Chicken Tinga Fritatta. It was flavorful, and delicious. Everything I want a brunch entree to be. I would definitely order it again.  Minuses: 1) Bloody Mary bar is expensive. $12 for one drink. I don't love Bloody Marys or condiments (even though they look awesome!) that much. A regular bloody is $9. Still.. I'm not there. Maybe if I decide that I am going to have the bloody as my lunch and load up on the condiments - then I can see where this makes sense. If I am going to eat - this is a little too much for me.  2) Mimosas - a flight of 4 is $16. Now, it may be one of those things where the glasses look smaller in a flight, or they might actually be. Either way - all mimosas are pre-mixed and have a ration of too much juice to champagne. All mimosas I have tried (although beautiful in presentation) are way too sweet and small for my liking. A regular mimosa is $6. See again - too sweet - and pre-mixed. 3) The New York scramble - flavorless - not worth it. The biscuit tastes like flour/baking soda. The potatoes are dry and really not great.   Overall - I will meet in the middle. I really like the concept, and I like the vibe - and one of 2 of the entrees I have had.  BTW - If you are looking for something like Hash House a Go Go - this is not it. A lot smaller entrees, less creative cuisine but has a Vegas-y vibe.

BzrXo9L-daskb-UNh8s5QQ.text: Love, love this place! The food is creative, delicious and amazing! The staff is friendly and helpful too! You feel like family with the great service and Dominique is always interested in his customers.

aOXveVgp_Ki8tu4VGhxxCQ.text: My friends and I decided to go to Hash Kitchen in Chandler. One of my friends got the carne asada and eggs the other got huevos rancheros and I got the carnitas hash. I have been to a hash kitchen before my friends have not. Everything was very beautiful and inviting. Our server was very attentive and very nice. I think she was also the bartender. The manager on duty was always present I believe her name was Natalie. Because we are servers ourselves we always notice these things. I will be bringing more friends to this location. Maybe on a weekend where the DJ is playing. Thank you so much for being attentive and having great food we will be back

yGffWMObWl3m0oM4RUbUBg.text: Better than the average breakfast/lunch restaurants in the area. Awesome Bloody Mary bar, advertised as AZ's largest. Service was good, but it was Dominick's attention to details & customers that won us over.

qLYL7dGVlREfOqRcfgxn4g.text: Love Hash Kitchen in Chandler! The manager Domenic and server Angelina were both wonderful and made sure we were happy! The food was awesome. We had the chicken and waffles and the salmon board and it was both amazing! Our new favorite brunch spot!!

XDf_WvNvCLpR0-nquKWuRw.text: This place is amazing!!! My best friends were visiting from Ohio & we went there for a Bloody Mary & breakfast. Omg. The atmosphere was awesome!! Huge portions & the Bloody Mary bar was on fire!!! Definitely recommend this place!!!

xpzHr4lSKgTalKmqOK6Z7A.text: Great food! Get there early on weekends to avoid the long wait. Jesus was our server and he was excellent!

QCMgBPUm48NjPmbafatVDA.text: Amazing service, food and drinks. The Bloody Mary bar was a fun experience. Went as a group for a ladies bachelorette brunch and they were extremely accommodating. Dominic is outstanding!

NEzzyzPUPSbjPpww4E01oA.text: What can I say... what a great breakfast spot! The food was on point and the Bloody Mary bar is something you dream about. Great music and perfect atmosphere. Go and make sure you say hello to Domenic. Thank you sir for a great experience! Till next time

H9DJiZ5RH-FB-Rpp58ioNA.text: Really good service and cool ambience, but the food not so good. Second time here and still not impressed by food. Had the Spaniard Quiche and it was over cooked and flavorless. So sad, this place is so close to our house that we can walk there, but won't .

QWp_75j_gqKEN91FSnNn8Q.text: Ok so.. Great Bloody Mary bar! The blue cheese stuffed olives were fire. But... no cubed cheeses?!? Now that I can't get on board with. To the main meal: my hash was so good! The waitress very nicely let me customize my order, which is a great perk to the restaurant if you want to switch up any ingredients in a scrambler or hash.   Drum roll.... the oddest part is the manager/or maybe owner was next to our table asking another customer to go give him 5 stars on YELP and to make sure to do it outside the restaurant so it didn't show up on his WiFi. I mean, I respect the hustle but cmon man.   But ... dog friendly .... fab!

3n17W8mEMBx0mjX__MZXWg.text: What a treat! Awesome spot my girlfriend's and I stumbled upon. The avocado toast was amazing and the menu has some creative breakfast items I can't wait to try. Portions are huge so either share or plan on leftovers. Flight of mimosas was great because I am indecisive.  And bloody mary bar was marvelous.  Will definitely be back.

vIkhGBGXREmY9ElbwTs69A.text: This is by far a five star restaurant!! The service was amazing,the managed Dominick came to our table and told us we are now apart of the Hash Kitchen family and was very welcoming.The food was exquisite,I would highly recommend the pretzel Benedict or the salmon Benedict.The waiters and waitresses were so nice nice and very fast with taking our orders and bringing us our food.If you are gluten free the restaurant has a gluten free menu. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place for breakfast and or brunch!!!

ljsGU-ri5l8JOyRgryvSFA.text: A little on the expensive side, although I was impressed and happy with the service and food.

M0U8iA7BU4j990U1A7LK-g.text: Great service!   We are from California and we brought our dog out to visit family here in AZ.   Thank God they allowed our dog to dine with us because California is all about it! aWsAmNGPPcmuNHIBqfqgLw.text: Minus 1 Star for the unsanitary conditions at the Bloody Mary Bar. I saw several people who don't use the provided tongs, skewars or toothpicks to add items to their drinks. They reached right into the jars of meats and cheeses with their dirty hands. Unacceptable.  Minus 1 star for the exessively loud music so loud you can't enjoy conversing with your dining party.  The food is very good but if you are going to get a bloody mary get it while you are waiting. I ordered mine after we sat down and the line was so long my food came before I got my drink.  Hash Kitchen definitely needs to address to efficiency of the Bloody Mary Bar. One bar tender taking the orders, payments and prepping the base drinks really backed up the line.  They also need to come up with a better method of keeping people from sticking their hands into the condiment jars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. BYO Virgin Bloody Mary and Herb Chicken Hash Skillet

AHznFs8Rr9k11KSm_8jVJA.text: The best thing about it was being greeted by the hostess, who was very nice. It was all downhill after that. The pancakes were flavorless, even with syrup. I also had to send the bacon back because when I asked for crispy, I didn't expect slightly cooked.The bacon was very, very salty as well.   In terms of my waiter I saw him not only welcome the couple that came and sat next to me, but also saw him explain the specials and the overall menu to them. All I got was "are you ready to order?". He was nice, but watching him greet them differently and explain all the menu had to offer was confusing.....kinda.   The place does have a cool vibe, with a bar and is relatively large so it can accommodate large parties. I went on a weekday, so there wasn't a wait at all and I was sat immediately.   In the process of posting this review, I received a prompt from Yelp saying that multiple positive reviews came from the same IP address, as if someone was trying to inflate the reviews here.  If someone did, I can see why because this place was truly a waste of calories...and time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bacon
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pancakes

3IcUyjbUMlPRoduXoyzchQ.text: The dude and I love the Hash Kitchen up in North Scottsdale, so we were stoked about one opening up a little closer! Extra bonus points to them for hiring a local artist to paint the dope murals that line the interior. Unfortunately, that's pretty much the only part of the ambience that we were feeling. It was like... clubby? There was a DJ and it was super loud, we could barely even hear each other from across the table. It seemed way more fitting for like an old town brunch place, whereas Hash Kitchen (the other location, anyways) is classy and modern and clean.   We got to there around 9:30 on a Sunday, and there was no wait for 2 people. We were surprised, but definitely not gonna fight our luck. Our server was awesome: really friendly, quick, and helpful. We started with a flight of mimosas, which were tasty. The champs level was a little weak for most of them, except for the orange.   I had the herb chicken hash at the recommendation of our server, and the dude had the lump crab hash, which is probably his all time favorite breakfast dish at the OG HK. My dish was fine, every part of it was prepared well but it was lacking flavor. A little salt and pepper in fried chicken batter goes a long way, just saying. I'm glad I asked for sriracha because that was basically the only part of the dish that had any flavor. The dude felt pretty much the same way about his hash. He said there was barely any old bay in it, and everything was fine but not at all as mindblowing as the one at the other location. The biscuits that came with both of our hashes were very good.   I don't really know if HK just needs some time to figure out their vibe, but we were pretty disappointed by our experience here. Extra disappointed definitely when comparing it to the other location.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight (Front to back: blueberry, passion fruit, strawberry, orange)

HBNp3DEgXgYkuf5KUqM_Fw.text: Hash kitchen was great!! The food was really good and came out super fast. We did choose to come on a less busy day because we had our kids. But everything was great! Angelina was our sever and she was very nice. And Domenic stopped by our table to make sure everything was ok and we were enjoying our experience. He's a very nice and friendly owner/manager. We will be back on a busy day with friends, we truly enjoyed the drinks and the atmosphere.

ehK4VgKNkZPYEOA8lym26g.text: Great looking restaurant and location. Dominic the manager right away greeted us and stopped by after our meal to see how everything was. Again, very friendly and personable.   My buddy ordered the Fruity Pebbles pancakes and he enjoyed them. I ordered the Mexican scramble which was eggs scrambled with chorizo, green peppers, onions and cherry tomatoes. My meal came with a side of potatoes and a biscuit. All was delicious.

gcTCv124j8EtBD15jLj7Hg.text: I absolutely love Hash Kitchen! I've been to a different location and really loved it and am so happy that they opened one in Chandler!  It was awhile since I've been there but I ordered pancakes, I want to say it was Boston creme or something custard. ( I can't find it on their website) It was really good and a very large portion.   We came on a Saturday morning so it was really busy. The wait was about 30 minutes or so. I'm not sure if they do reservations, but if they do, you should definitely make one. I really wish that I could drink, because their drink menu looks amazing!They also have a dj there on Saturdays, which is good and bad. Good because they played really good music, bad because it was really loud, so I couldn't hear my friend that well.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

fiPQ3cpqLvVFygF_9oQ6tg.text: Dominic (the manager) and Kendra (our waitress) was great! Got the Avocado toast hash style and man oh man that thing is huge. Also did the bloody Mary bar. Didn't realize the end had bacon, ravioli, and meatballs. Half way through my drink Dom told me and insisted I go back. They didn't have any meatballs but he sent some to the table once they were out fresh. Meatballs we're good. Everything is good. Service was the best.

37Cix8qJo-71FUA4sAxyUw.text: We came on a Thursday around 11am. The place was packed (some schools are on break this week) We were seated promptly and shortly greeted by our server. The menu has SO much to choose from! Benedict's, French toast, waffles, eggs, lox, a ton of sandwiches, I could go on... At the entrance there is a station to make your own bloody Mary's. FAB! The place is decorated with hip breakfast/brunch words and hashtags all over as well. The place is nicely lite with natural light. The bar faces the patio that offers outdoor fireplaces too.  We ordered the classic French toast, the avocado toast and the tamales with eggs. Dear Lord! Portions are HHUUUGGGEEE! They offer a full bar as well. BONUS! Don't forget to get a "selfie" on the way out!  Food was well prepared, fresh and has excellent table presentation. Looking around I saw sandwiches that would feed 3 people they were so big. Our server Ashley was attentive, answered questions honestly, made awesome suggestions. She told us on weekend they have music and people dance!! DEFINITELY RETURNING. Praying to become a regular here.... lol  Ack! I forgot MANY GLUTEN FREE OPTIONS HERE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tamales and eggs... more like a sweet corn risotto
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Avocado toast!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Classic French toast

cHT_UmcWU9cpQ3ekn2oF0g.text: Long wait. Mediocre food. Overpriced. Meh all around. Skip this place. Go to Marks Cafe in Tempe instead. French toast was dry. Sausage was dry. Really disappointed.

9HGdn7rRWRZj3JFxOjatRQ.text: I am unsure about the negative reviews on here. My experience here was excellent!! The love DJ adds a great vibe to the restaurant.  As with many restaurants who serve brunch it's expected to have long wait times. But it's worth the wait! Ended up waiting it out and scored a seat at the bar before my table was ready. The bartender serving us was super sweet! She had just moved to AZ from the Midwest I believe. My friend and I ordered a mimosa flight as well as some regular mimosas. If you're a Bloody Mary fan however then this is definitely the place for you! The Bloody Mary Bar is out of this world! So many toppings and spices to pick from. Now when ordering food be aware that the portions are pretty large, they can easily be split by 2 people. I recommend the skillets they are delicious!!!

WaJFCtCiq9QSCe0yAMHQoA.text: Really good food. Little pricey but worth it for the portions. Really nice service. The French toast I got was crazy huge shown in pics. Got the mimosa platter, They use decent champagne. Food came out fast which is always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hash Kitchen

sevs7PTaujbBHjrfKBGBgA.text: The manager of Hash Kitchen Domenic has one of the most popular brunch places in Chandler that even the superficial people of Scottsdale drive their golden yachts down to check it out. I ordered the mimosa flight (super tasty) and one of the hashes that had carnitas (just as super tasty).     What I liked about Domenic the most is despite having a super popular venue (where he's making god knows how much) he knows it could just be a fad and is really hustling customer relations so you dont just visit once and never return. Also had some funny stories and a level of self awareness that I rarely see in managerial positions such as his.  I know you're reading this the day it gets posted Domenic but we were the group that talked about how they call it a "drinking" or "water fountain" not the term I now use which is "bubbler" .   If you ever want to run a comedy show at one of your businesses let me know. I can get you the best line-up in Arizona as I've got my ear to the ground in the scene. For anyone in Arizona (including Domenic) reading this please check out a free local comedy show I have a minor role in every Thursday @ Stand-Up Live 10:30PM called "This Week Sucks Tonight!"   It starts late because we have to wait for "normal" people, who don't understand comedy, to go to bed so they don't complain and cancel the show on Twitter. No drink minimum either! Come on down!   TLDR: Awesome venue, great management and I plugged a free weekly Thursday comedy show @ another venue because I wanted to get something out of this review as well .

ATSq5CQ-a7yfffwrgVUDOw.text: Food was delicious, great selections!  Service was also great despite being very busy. Sammy served us and was very friendly, helpful, and attentive.    The bloody mary bar was AMAZING!!  I was a first timer and the bartender started advising me about 2/3's through.  There is a very specific but easy technique.  My next visit will include an epic bloody mary! (checkout my pic, did pretty well)   Main critique, trash on the ground on the patio/outside bar.. The patio was very nice with the misters and AC wind wall but that wind/ac mister blew too many napkins, straws, etc. to the ground. Someone needs to be picking up trash regularly.   Overall, great experience and will be back!!

qtLBF363Fv4kK8X32Y4ZNA.text: If you're looking for a fun brunch spot, this is it! We came out after hearing of the Bloody Mary bar that certainly exceeded expectations - it's a moderate price that includes all the yummy skewers and toppings that you get to add to your drink yourself! (: Although the place was crowded on a Saturday morning, we were able to hit the bar and enjoy the awesome DJ while we waited for our table and once seated the service was fast and friendly thanks to Dom and Nick! The food portions are large and filling but if you really want to over indulge, you have to go with the Mega Mimosa - topped with boba poppers and cotton candy! The menu is huge so there's definitely something for everyone's tastes, I'm sure we'll be back soon for more good times!

fUXbPXRr9LJLfw6s2Gl2hA.text: Met up the girlfriends for brunch on a Saturday. It is busy but the wait is worth it.    We got the flight of mimosas also tried out the bloody mary bar. Next time, I will ask for help b/c there's so much to choose from. Plus the hot bar, that we totally missed! (i.e. bacon!!)  We sat on the patio and didn't feel rushed when we finished our meal. The portion sizes are pretty large so if you aren't so hungry, I would suggest to split a meal.  Service was fast and friendly and the manager, Dominic stopped by to say 'hello'.  Overall, very good experience, just bring a dose of patience since it's usually pretty busy during brunch hours :)

gDgIvDYDH3f-N2M5ZMamcw.text: We are very happy to finally have a good breakfast/brunch spot in the neighborhood! So excited, I'm fact, that we came two weekends in a row! The food is out of this world. On our first trip, we did the s'mores French toast (heavenly and just as ridiculous as it sounds) and the steak breakfast burrito. Both were gigantic, so we ended up with an extra meal to take home! This time we shared the carnitas hash, and it was to die for. We nearly had to get a to-go box even after sharing it! The servers have all been super accommodating, especially today when we brought our dog to enjoy the patio! The manager, Dominic, checked in with us on both occasions and was a total gem. He is very appreciative of his patrons which makes us feel very special! Overall, this is a dynamite spot that was long overdue.

Bacon lovers will just die for the Craft Bacon Board.   Domenic, the manager, is very untuned with his staff and the customers.   Because of this experience, I can't wait to try the Sicilian Butcher.

-tMxA8k_w_iSP10NNF1tFw.text: Finally hash kitchen in chandler! Went in this morning! Early to beat the rush! But I have to say it's cute but it's not like the one in north Scottsdale- but they are really trying- the food was amazing- it was hot and quick-  Dominic the manger!! Amazing amazing! Very very diligent and aware of the patrons in the restaurant. He wanted to hear critiques but I really didn't have any. I just can't wait for it to get cooler and we can sit outside!  I am not giving it 5 stars today because i don't think our server was the best- however food was great

FAlhwQda5eafOTqhsE5BEw.text: Very creative menu with enormous portions.   We loved the food but walked out with plenty of leftovers that didn't stack up the next day.   Loud, fun environment that has a bloody bar and mimosa flights.   Instagram worthy dishes. Can be pricey... but cheap if you split the dishes.

3I4eFx_SmvQLivJdqesdvw.text: A wise foodie once told me that the place with the longest wait is the one you want to be at. Hash Kitchen is that place for breakfast. While you will wait a while, it is worth it! Everyone knows (hash kitchen included) that brunch is really about the booze! Well, don't fret my fellow brunch babe, they have a walk up bar outside equipped with lounge chairs where you can get started on your Bloody Mary's and Mimosas while you wait. Don't forget to take that Bloody Mary inside to the garnish bar though. Rookie mistake! Aside from all that, the food and vibe is amazing! The bartender was killer and made sure we were taken care of even at our table. They also have gluten free options even for the pancakes. While you are there try their huevos rancheros hash. So yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

xy9ckVjvuG3Z3OT_gpu34A.text: Finally, a creative and fun breakfast place in the East Valley! I got the Avocado Toast, best I've had! My kids got the French toast and pancakes, both really good. My sisters and niece got the cannoli pancakes, coconut crusted French toast and pretzel Benedict.  We all shared a little and enjoyed it all but the avocado toast was the favorite! It's a must try! So. Much. Flavor.  The manager, Dominic, checked on us a few times and we recognized his accent, also being from Boston! Our server was friendly and on top of everything and our food came out fast. Bummed I can't remember her name because her service was excellent.  We went on a Sunday and there's a live DJ, loud music, the Bloody Mary bar looks amazing, and there were mimosa flights and cocktails with cotton candy- I will be going back with my husband and some friends via Uber! It was over an hour wait, but well worth it!

K_YlLKDbNBCr6s8n5ABlTA.text: Hash kitchen has the best breakfast in town. My family and I have been going to both hash's in Scottsdale. Today was the first time we tried the Chandler Hash. This breakfast place is good for big groups 8+. Lots of big and small tables. There's a huge patio out in the back too.   Huevo hash, coffee, cannoli donuts, mimosas, and bruschetta board are always a favorite of mine. Dominic was a great manager! He was on top of everything and kept us well fed. Will definitely be back to this place. Only thing that would be nice would be reservations for parties less than 10.

YmMswZpnJglTpWbljQbkGQ.text: Excellent food and great service! If you are looking for a fun brunch spot, this is the place for you! I highly recommend the carnitas hash and for a drink-- the mimosa flight with 4 different flavors! Best brunch spot ever!!

tsmMbMWB54mGsk9Hrfd05w.text: BYOBM Bar was to die for!! We were told a 30 minute wait, but waited close to an hour and 20 minutes for our table. Management was irritated when we asked how long it would be (after waiting for an hour). Food was good, and atmosphere was super upbeat and fun!!

FeOa_08uLbNlyLr3giQ3eA.text: This place isn't my cup of tea. I really like the passion fruit mimosa and the food is alright. I personally do not like the dj/loud music. It was SO loud today, I couldn't have proper conversations with the people I was with and we had to repeat ourselves to the server because she couldn't hear us either. The food came out quick but she took off right away and didnt ask if we needed anything else so we had to track her down to ask for hot sauce. My eggs in my Benedict were a little overdone and it was on the cool side, like it was sitting for a bit. I also had two random tiny pieces of pepper in my hash browns and one random little piece of onion? No one else at my table had those mixed in their hashbrowns and again there were only 3 tiny pieces of them so they obviously shouldn't have been there. When all was said and done and we were ready for the check the server just completely vanished and it took forever for her to come back and give us the bill. There were only 3 of us and the two tables around us were empty so I don't know what she was doing. I think I really only care for the mimosas at this place.

XDhp_sXgDI_ZhpYTnkEA-Q.text: Our group, Girl Take A Hike, has been wanting to visit Hash Kitchen for a while now and see what all the hype was about, and it did NOT disappoint! We were greeted enthustically and seated promptly! The food was delicious, I had the chilequilles. The server was very attentive and even the manager came over to Check on us and make sure we were OK. Domenic Viscariello, manager, was super sweet and friendly and restaurant was clean and vibrant. We really enjoyed our morning there and will definitely be back!

IZ0SPBbbKH0Du95YcPL4_w.text: We had lunch here on a Friday afternoon and it was busy! Yay for business! The Live DJ was a nice plus. Service was attentive and fast. We had the lump crab sweet potato hash for our meal it was delish! Dominick the manager made sure to stop by to say hi and to make sure our experience was to our expectations. A personal touch you don't find from management unless a complaint is involved. Super cool spot that is close to home!

xXS_q9mbfPgA9h95mtiszg.text: I wish we had the chance to take a picture of our food but it was really delicious! My fiance and I ordered the herb chicken and waffles. Our best friends ordered the lamb hash and corn beef hash and they loved it as well. We had clean plates by the time we finished. They have really great service. Our server, December, was super nice and she was very attentive. Also the Domenic, the manager, took time to say hi to us and thanked us for trying out the restaurant. So I'm pretty surprised why they don't have more stars on here. We're definitely coming back!
