Food was worth the wait and the entire restaurant is instagram worthy with amazing hashtags and decor!!! This place is amazing!!! You have to try it

Sx2XRYgvBHgpkvsxEPUIKQ.text: Fantastic brunch spot. I had a delicious flight of Mimosas and a breakfast steak burrito. I can see why both of these are specialties, as they were fantastic. Atmosphere is very trendy and clean. Service was great, and surprisingly fast! I  Will be coming back.

-dNdj3vcguDzmvJ77mMOTA.text: This is my new favorite restaurant in Chandler for breakfast and brunch. The food is wonderful and the ambiance is a party atmosphere. We were a party of ten and the waiter made sure he got our orders right.  Dom, the manager was attentive and he came over to make sure we were all happy with our orders.  A great time was had by all and we will definitely be back.

2_oh6tRr3sc5XEK-CljK4A.text: Our friends recommended we checked this place out and it's awesome! The service was top notch, we were checked on several times by our server and the manager. Food was delicious and we loved the clean modern look. We will most definitely be back!

Y8_BHXn5bUkukYRL-1GjDQ.text: Food was delicious staff is really friendly even the manager Dominic came in and checked on us. We will definitely be back

DK_K_p8_nt85S7u2bepDIw.text: Wow! ThT sums up my experience! Fun for any celebration! Great food, great Bloody Mary Bar, great service, Owner was so friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

le8gF2I-tX7zUhPPBBCCRQ.text: Bloody Mary bar is spectacular but other then that there is nothing else good to this place. Food did not taste good whatsoever. My girlfriend and I were very displeased and will more than likely never return.

ePLlB9n2t6su1mtrAlsy9w.text: We had THE BEST TIME AND awesome FOOD.  Dominic and all the staff were incredible.  The menu is crazy good and the Bloody Mary bar amazing.  We will be back and take friends.  Diverse and great options for all tastes.

p_20OfZGQq7xcSM2pci8Rg.text: Just got back from breakfast and the food... oh the food was amazing. It started off a little rocky. Our server Truman (based off the receipt) greeted me initially where I said I was waiting for someone and needed to look at the drink choices first. After my wife met me we waited... waited... waited some more. Domenic the manager was quick to remedy the situation. He was very personable and apologized sincerely for our servers lack of attention. Now the food... I don't want to be that guy who takes pictures of food but we ordered the Pretzel Benedict and Asada Hash. Both were absolutely delicious. The Asada Hash (my meal) had the perfect amount of eggs, potatoes, meat, and corn bread. That cornbread itself is amazing. Despite our  rough start we know that we'll definitely be back for that build your own Bloody Mary bar... that in itself is impressive. Great food and look forward to returning sometime very soon.

MVyNcIu1khE1slbIFb5cMw.text: Fun environment! I got the hash and it was huge and delicious. All the drinks are amazing and a great place to go for a fun brunch with friends.

wxC_EF5GefHLPrH0mETw2A.text: Dominic the manager was amazing and was very attentive to our table of five. The food was fantastic we will be back-- best Mamosas and Breakfast-- portions are huge! We can't wait to check out their new restaurant when it's built in Chandler.

ElHClUebL1rONfac9Qo-gQ.text: What an experience!! Fabulous Mother's Day brunch, the Bloody Mary bar was amazing . Wish we had one in Seattle . Met the owner Dominic he was very friendly

aVyMl_Tx-mkTaHsJxdqqmA.text: What a fantastic experience!  I was with a group of 5 others for brunch earlier today. We had a wonderful time sitting on the patio. The food was nothing short of exceptional and the staff is second to none. Dominic, the owner, is very personable. Dominic came to our table three times to check on us, say hello, and gave us a few laughs.  Dominic, we hope your TS resolves itself sooner rather than later. :-)

hQ0pANnL0gIZMojbmjKuGA.text: Great food - I really enjoyed the Carnitas Hash!! They have really big portions as well. Our waitress was knoweldgeable about the menu and very friendly. The interior was decorated very nicely, and it was very bright. Really great dining experience!

vNyUbmfY1E0K8_T5uruT9w.text: I came here with my friends from work, and the hospitality was over the five stars I gave. Dominic the manager was talking to us and making it feel more like home then just another restuarant.  Sammie worked in the bar area when we were there and took care of us. The food and atmosphere  was great and there is a DJ fri-sun. Check them out

IKdntAJZ1d3wmtneRzej-A.text: First time there today, I ordered an Italian hash skillet. It came out luke warm. I asked for a second as the first one was unacceptable...that also came out luke warm. A skillet should be hot....that's the point of a skillet. I could literally hold both in my hand for as long as I wanted. Can get a much hotter skillet at Denny's for half the price that's an issue....Will not be returning.

zwMlyCldpAXZXp5z18kt7A.text: Hash Kitchen is probably one of the most underwhelming brunch places I've ever been-so much so it prompt me to write my first yelp review. We waited 45 min which I'm always excited about cause it means something good is going on at the place for people to be waiting that long.   I had the Corned Beef Hash bene and my friend had the lump crab bene. The corned beef had literally no flavor (!!!), potato cakes were under-seasoned and the crab was fiiishhhyyyy. I found myself salting the entire dish twice over.  The bloody bar is great in theory but damn they need to get a grip on how to keep it sanitary. There's skewers to help and one pair of tongs for every 10 items but I almost starting grabbing things out of the jars out of frustration. Maybe have plates? Or different vessels for the toppings? Multiple tongs? One of the managers,Dominic, came by and made sure everything was great which it was at the time before I started to dive into my food. The service and the management are great which is the only reason why I gave the place two stars. Half way through the meal my friend and I sort of realized we were feeling the same way about the food. Dominic/other management and staff! You guys got a great idea goin on but the food needs to get a little more attention rather than the zany mimosas and bloodys toppings. I manage a restaurant about the same size as you and your service and floor work was attentive and personal and it made me want to like the food but I just couldn't.  The vibe and the restaurant is hype worthy but the execution of flavor in any of food was missed. Once you get your seasoning and flavors on point you got yourself an amazing brunch spot.

INkPXJou8djJJA5LdIL4fg.text: This place was amazing!! Came here on the morning of my birthday after work with some friends. We arrived around 710 and the place was very nice and appealing to the eye. The owner was super friendly and very helpful in deciding what to order. We all ordered the large Bloody Mary and got to pick our toppings. That was the highlight of my experience!! Staff was very helpful and nice when suggesting what we should get. Our waiter Ryan was attentive and patient with us. When our food came out it was fresh, hot and so delicious. I had nothing but positivity when dining here. They even gave me a fresh cannoli donut for my birthday. Which was very fresh because it was still hot from the fryer! I would highly recommend this establishment. There was nothing negative that we experienced here. Worth the wait!!

vRFsEWPfe8j3xiiJYaWpDg.text: My girlfriends and I braved the crowd on Sunday to check the place out and we had a fantastic time. Even though we had about an hour wait, we were able to enjoy their awesome mimosas and enjoy the music from the DJ. Manager Domenic was super friendly and made us feel welcome immediately. Food was wonderful!

qQgA2O6Iq_8tc7zKfCsX7g.text: Absolutely great place! Bloody Mary Bar is unreal! Vanessa was an awesome service, and Dominic checked in to make sure our service was superb!

CYbVGSeszjUeR94lSmLZgw.text: Great food! My wife and I came to this new location and loved it. Big portions of food and the price is not bad at all. I ordered the Avocado Toast but only ate half. The wife ordered smoked salmon and locks. No complaints at all. Bloody Mary bar is dope. Will definitely come here again.

4C_rpBadxEA7GZw-pWGKrA.text: Went for breakfast with my mom. She had the coconut brioche french toast and I had the Huevos Rancheros hash.  Both were deliscious, and our waiter, Jesus, gave us free coffee, which was very sweet Great food - more decadent than the other breakfast places  in town. Reason they aren't getting a five from me is that we asked for the rancheros sauce in the side which they forgot t do, so my mom who is super sensitive to spice couldn't share my dish as planned.  But overall a great experience.

xNSt0ChZm_WAiaauS5BSMg.text: I've been wanting to go here since I first heard about it last year.  I don't plan on coming back.  Birthday breakfast for my daughter, we sat outside and that was the best part of the time spent here. Waiter took 10 minutes to come to our table, (mind you it's Friday at noon, maybe 70% of restaurant full) I ordered the Bloody Mary and asked about tequilas instead, he looked at me and said we have patron, I asked about the house tequila, he said 2 more I asked if any were silver and he said the patron, i just ordered that.  We waited another 12 minutes for our drinks, and then had to ask for the garnish as described on the menu, he took our orders and it was 15 for our food. My scrambled eggs were runny. We were never checked on, dropped the check and said no hurry.  I would not come here again, first impressions mean a lot, and this place just doesn't deserve my hard earned money. Big disappointment.

GKCvvGSxcUtOfxx8Q-Hb4A.text: Don't miss this new eatery in Chandler. The atmosphere is open, very stylish and sharp. The menu has all the regular items, but with fun, inventive twists. Coconut almond encrusted French toast? Dipped in vanilla cream?  My, my! Of course there are many yummy sounding lighter items to choose from. I had a delicious toasted kale and couscous salad, which was very light and refreshing. The dressing was tasty and subtly flavored. My friends had some of the delightful breakfast items, all of which could have been shared. Very generous portions.. Went with the girls for lunch so missed the build your own Bloody Mary bar, but we will be back! There were about six types of pickle available... and that's only the beginning. We were told of the DJ on the weekends, and that it can be a little loud. It was perfect on our weekday visit, not too loud at all. But we heard the weekends are very popular with the music , and that's wonderful. One of the managers, Dominic, greeted us warmly and entertained us with his great charm and wit. A new transplant from Cape Cod, welcome to Chandler, Dominic!  I get the sense that Hash is doing very well already, and I hope they stay for a long time to come. We enjoyed our lunch thoroughly, and will be back very soon. Ciao!

Tpo8k7GH1Ndb_9bc-0kgNQ.text: Mimosa flight was delicious. Overall good skillet, I wish the carnitas had a crispy sear on the ends. The chicken fried steak with gravy and waffle was food, minus the fried onions. It was nice for manager Dominic stopped by twice to see how our first experience was going. The server Ryan was very attentive to gluten free needs, but there is no gluten menu as mentioned in their regular menu. We'll be back to try other menu items.

h5cX20_NzXnLG7PEelMhwA.text: Kim our server is beyond Excellant. The Manager Dominick was more than gracious and welcoming. Thanks for a great experience and food

3iJIBx4EeL7fgR9cO8XHeg.text: Great service, friendly staff, and tasty food! It was packed so the wait was a little longer but it was 100% worth it. I can't wait to come here again!

ZPpGpVW_uUYfIIj1CrbcTg.text: The earlier you get here the better! Especially on Sundays! Food is great, and can't complain about a Bloody Mary bar. Perfect place for brunch.

0QZk5G8Y9eqg535JSABzaw.text: Great vibe (they had a live DJ on Sunday morning), killer looking bloody mary bar (too bad i don't partake in the bloody mary myself), great mimosa selection, and what a great menu! This was our first visit to Hash Kitchen, and i always rate a new breakfast place by how good their eggs benedict are.  I am happy to report they were excellent. I can't wait to come back and try more.  The one bummer was paying $9 for a 6 oz glass of Tito's and OJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody mary bar and DJ
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Boring Benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Our first visit...hoping it&#39;s as good as it looks.

7G6O1vIBc_SXrEJuAS-T1A.text: Went there Friday to celebrate with friends. I was so excited to do the BYOBM BAR!  This was my first time there. Place is bigger than I expected and very loud. There is an actual dj playing songs. We ordered our brunch items along with mimosas and my byobm.  I was told I would get a ticket to visit the bar and that the bar tender would show me around the items that you add to your Bloody Mary.  I never received my ticket. The manager came over and visited with us, asking if he could check back mid-meal with us on how things were.  He visited with us for about 10 minutes.  In the meantime, my friends mimosas were sitting for quite a few minutes at the bar, waiting to be served at our table. Then, our good came out. I was immediately struck at how small the servings are. Wow!  For the price it should fill the plate. As for my byobm, still no ticket. My friend asked about the mimosas, still sitting at the bar.  The gal asked about my Bloody Mary/ticket...I told her that I never got it. So, the mimosas are delivered, our food is here, and I don't feel like spending 5-7 minutes building my Bloody Mary on the other side of the restaurant while my friends eat and my food sits back at the table getting cold. One waitress said 'Since you never got your ticket do you want just a regular Bloody Mary?  Sure.  It was okay. Just okay. A good management would have comped my Bloody Mary for the error that they made, but they didn't. I've never had sweet gherkin pickles in one before.  So, I left very disappointed.  Never did get to experience the very reason I went there. Will I go back?  Probably not.

rGJtBzvdkOOsu3RuS0jMIw.text: Great location, quick service and awesome food! Highly recommend for fun mimosa options, and great atmosphere

Zz_0zpGa-aKAR9TMyETwDg.text: Bloody mary bar was awesome! Our server Amy was great, she had just the right amount of checking in and made good recommendations. Food was really good! Dominic the manager checked in and was very personable. All the staff was friendly. Very cool atmosphere, especially with the DJ and disco ball! Food portions are big and everything looks amazing so it was really hard to make a choice!

lFNGKBFSBVDQaBiQ5E_X1A.text: Dominic did a great job making us feel welcome. The scramblers were awesome, the Bloody Mary was outstanding and the pineapple mimosa were great too.

dw92Edu1CarQwCqrEEEX8Q.text: Went here for breakfast on a Sunday morning... got in with no waiting and had quick service! Jesus was our server and he was great... he was efficient and quick! They had a Dj playing too which made for a fun energetic atmosphere. The food was awesome. I had the chicken Benedict and he had the huevos ranchero... both were huge portions and delicious! We will definitely be back!

8EN0q9WAr6Va6hcJPEcgSg.text: Food on point. Service on point. Music on point. Everything on point ! It's not just brunch it's an experience !

CnKI1E72o2NrBVjubJlgOQ.text: This is hands down my favorite brunch spot. The drink menu is worth the trip alone, lots of mimosa options and the best Bloody Mary bar you'll ever see. Phenomenal pancakes (even Gluten free) and egg dishes and excellent service. The manager Dominic was so friendly and kind to us. We will be there weekly!!!

LGaCt8Le4MaB_hS_fGnR9Q.text: This is our favorite brunch spot!  Great music with a live DJ, Mimosas and amazing food options.  They also have a very popular Bloody Mary Bar as well.  The patio is pet friendly and the staff here always makes sure our experience is great!  We love coming here and today even walked here and ate on the patio with the perfect weather in Arizona we have!  I highly recommend the Banana Split Brioche French Toast!

-2eI9r-1-Ap73IhisauC-Q.text: This is an amazing brunch spot that always has amazing food, drinks, and service. The food comes out fast and is hot, the drinks are delicious. Such a fun menu! Domenic, one of the managers, is always so welcoming and helpful, and goes above and beyond to make sure you're having the best brunch ever. 100% recommend

cDyarAIsoAuNWQg8b1WU1A.text: Had breakfast here for the first time today, it was great! Will be visiting again in the near future. Good food, great trendy ambiance, quality service! Highly recommend the Avocado Toast it was great and can honestly feed two.

vwOkBTL2TAVe7x9PnHNoRA.text: Really good breakfast place. Ricotta pancakes are amazing. Live music on the weekend, bar open to the patio. Amazing atmosphere. Dominic is really welcoming and accommodating.

cMVbGrkoXIJslpJyNCmaFg.text: We love love love this place. Food is great, mimosa flight and coffee drinks are creative and fun. The only compliant was the hostess. This place is extremely busy. We come prepared to wait but we've interacted with the hostess on two occasions and she's grumpy and rude every time. She told me if I wandered off out of the buzzer's range they wouldn't hesitate to seat someone else. I appreciated the info but she didn't have to be so nasty about it. I've seen her be rude to other customers as well. Just seems like an unhappy employee. Just unfortunate that's the first impression for guests.

X92bq_GHOTS0uiPUBw2_Fg.text: What a fun spot for brunch and having a few cocktails! The best of both worlds- amazing food (huge portions) and dranks! Dominic the manager, is so hospitable and ensures everyone is enjoying themselves! Will definitely be coming on a regular basis!

cCTeHUOpZbJvLe7Rh9eY1g.text: The food here is absolutely delicious. The Bloody Mary bar is fantastic and the Mimosas are a great deal. But my favorite part of the restaurant is the manager Dominic. He is so, so friendly and really takes the time to speak with every guest. He remembers us every time we come. He is really the best. We keep coming back just for him!

NKZPbHAuWclV8jhaCAl-bA.text: Dominic was amazing and I love, love, love this place!! The food and drinks were amazing and I would highly recommend!

heJScCxc9PBE5fux0-4quw.text: We had been waiting to give this place a try since the reviews were good. We expected a wait because it's always busy and the novelty of a new hip brunch place hasn't worn off yet. Surprisingly we only had to wait about 20 mins maybe because it was Sunday around one. There were four of us. The atmosphere was urban chic and industrial which looked really nice. The hostess was also very pleasant. The problem started once we were seated. We sat for over ten minutes without ANY acknowledgement from anyone. The place wasn't even at full capacity busy and all we were asking for was some simple eye contact and a "be with you shortly but we see you" kinda comment...we got NADA! We decided to try to give it another few minutes than once it encroached on sitting for 15 mins without even a glass of water...we decided enough was enough...why drop the cash here? As we got up to leave a server says "I hope everything is ok?" No, no it's not...I spoke to the hostess but it's not her fault at all. Anyways, I'm disappointed in this lackluster experience to say the least...since the menu did look eclectic and appealing but there's nothing like bad service to immediately ruin a place for us.

wK4L7slS_p2nQsJlGZVPxw.text: Went here for brunch my boyfriend and his mom.  We arrived at around noon and there was a small wait, but we got a table pretty quickly considering it was a Saturday, nice weather and peak brunch hours. Domenic (the manager, I believe) checked in on the table shortly after being seated and followed up towards the end of the meal. Our server Jesus was very attentive and the food was great!

YWL4_1B4eO-TWGfu3rsQXA.text: The second you walk into Hash you are welcomed with an incredible atmosphere. The service, music, decor are far above nearby breakfast spots. Each time we come, the manager Dominic makes an effort to check on our table several times. He truly creates a welcoming environment where everyone feels like family. Our most recent visit we had Melissa as our server she was AMAZING! She made sure that all of our requests were met! We come often and have never had a bad expierence. The bloody mary bar is loaded with options and can be a meal in itself! We love Hash and enjoy bringing company each time to show off our neighborhood brunch options!

hpI4B-g9Lq0kbLA7_n9G4Q.text: The food is great, very upscale and different.  The initial service is quite good, but the follow-on service leaves a lot to be desired.  I have had the same experience both during their opening week and about a week ago.  Once you have ordered and your food is ready, the person who serves it to you is not your server - it appears to be someone from the kitchen.  They have on both occasions failed to bring butter to accompany the biscuit.  When I have requested it, the person actually serving the food agrees to bring it out right away along with the hot sauce I requested at the same time.  Ten minutes later and there is neither butter nor hot sauce, so I have to flag down a manager, since I cannot find my server, and make the same request again.  That works well, but by now the food is growing cold.  They really need to raise their game on this score.

WdSbeOB6Lugsice0iMBhTg.text: So i went here for the first time this past Sunday. Just myself. There was a line outside, but i went in and asked if they had a bar area. They did but it was full. They said i could sit outside if a server would be able to take me. They were short staffed, each server already had a lot on their plates. But one was willing to take me. So i got seated quickly. The selection is actually pretty good, some unique and standard stuff. Something for each type of diner it looks like. I got the carne asada breakfast burrito. Now i was thinking this thing would be small and over priced. The thing i liked was that i had my food out very quickly considering how busy it was. Even more so, this burrito was huge. Larger than standard breakfast burritos i normally get. It was not mostly tortilla either. It's was very flavorful, the pico was the right heat. I can't really handle spicy, but this had just the right touch of heat that gave me that kick but allowed me to enjoy my food. My server was very friendly and checked on me in a timely manner, which was nice since she was so busy. The manager even took the time to check on me. It was a bit pricey, which would be a my only issue. 21 bucks for my whole bill, including the 5 dollar tip. I only got the burrito and water. I'll go back, the atmosphere is great for a Sunday morning to set a good mood for the day. If your on a budget, plan for 15 to 20 a person with meal,  basic drink and tip.

Aa4sXqR2kXd8hfYEB37qkg.text: One of the best breakfast/brunch places in the East Valley. Friendly and fast service. Great tasting food - the hash skillets are the best I have ever had. The manager, Domenic, is so welcoming and attentive. One downside - its so popular, the wait times on weekends can be quite long.

KcYImSzLoAWFro4Ye8AUJg.text: My husband and I went in for brunch on a Thursday morning. It was relatively busy for a weekday morning, but we only waited about five minutes to be sat. When the hostess seated us we asked if we could move to a larger, more comfortable table and the host told us we could not because she needed to save those tables for parties of three or more. There were several larger tables available, but we did not argue. Less then five minutes later, we watched her seat a group of two at a four top directly next to us. After ordering our food, we sat and waited. 30 minutes later, we noticed the table behind us, who sat right as we were ordering, got their food, which consisted of a well done hamburger as well as several other dishes. We had asked our server a few times where our food was, and he brushed us off saying it would be right out. When our food finally arrived at our table, it was not correct. At this point my husband approached the manager and he told us that he would take care of the dish for us. A few minutes later, a different manager came out with my Avocado toast. After finally getting my food, I tasted it and was not a huge fan. The pork was sweet which i did not love and my husbands food was cold at this point because he was waiting to eat with me. We did not see our server for the rest of our meal, except for when he came out to drop off our check. We were surprised to see that the avocado toast had not been taken care of, like the manager said he would do. At this point one manager came to clear my plate, which was still full of food, and asked if I did not like it. I told him it was just okay. Instead of just taking care of this, he went to the back and sent a different manager out. We had already paid our tab, and just wanted to leave because we had already had such a terrible experience. My husband and myself have both worked as managers in the food service industry for several years, and always try to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt, but this was all around a horrible dining experience. I would give zero stars if I could.

FA0x_l7Drs1WxR903gXY9g.text: Great service and great food. I had breakfast there few times. I suggested the manager to offer different types of potatoes as part of the hash. Let's see if they accommodate my suggestion. Overall, the location is perfect near residential and commercial area. The place is always busy and during the weekend it's crazy. Offers variety of morning alcoholic beverages with normal coffee and tea.

SdBQWve-ILXifKXN-1t3QA.text: Great brunch place! Had an amazing server named Serena! Loved the kale Caesar salad with blacken chicken sooo good. Also loved the dj!

paaf61T0i2-8TNT4xyWcww.text: Went here with Gilbert Girlfriends for breakfast. The Bloody Mary bar is SOOO COOL!! If Bloody Mary's are not your thing they also have a bunch of different fruity mimosas that are really good. I had the avocado toast that was HUGE and YUMMY! I had enough leftovers for the rest of my family to enjoy when I got home. All of the portions are very generous and so many great things on the menu it was hard to decide what to get. All Of the staff and management was very accommodating even with our large group. I will be good by back very soon!

yoDwjWDQa2YD8Qm_a0MkiA.text: We started with the Original Mimosas, the spicy option and it didn't have any spice at all. The carnitas hash was delicious, and the portion was a nice size I couldn't finish it! They had a DJ who's music choice was great but the music was too loud and made it hard to hold a conversation.

oFV7AeNziCT9IS2N3YIkjg.text: This is a hopping place! The Bloody Mary bar is absolutely amazing. The Cannoli Pancakes and the Lemon Ricotta pancakes are bomb! Most of the savory menu items haven't been great, so I suggest the sweet selections for sure.

usg0oPyKtzptvYSN6jrJyw.text: Brunch anyone???? Yes, please!!!My girlfriend, basset hound and I just had an amazing brunch at this very millennial friendly restaurant. I mention the millennial part because we,  being baby boomers, were immediately caught up in the positive atmospheric vibe and the promise of delicIous food and AMAZING mimosas and of course the Bloody Mary bar.  Domenic, the manager and the wait staff were attentive. Domenic checked on us no less than 3 times. We did  have a slight spillage mishap; however, the staff took care of it quickly and topped off our drinks. We're definitely making our way back.

nkxC4wdZZAWLX-F5r1MQ4g.text: Love everything about this eatery!  Over-the-top menu choices; the best hash I've had since moving here 42 years ago!  Pancakes are yummy too - I want to try EVERYTHING!  Coffee is great...and they leave a pot on the table.  Dominic, the manager, is a fantastic host.  Friendly, interested in keeping his patrons happy, and he is constantly circulating checking on each table.  The wait staff is friendly and extremely attentive but not intrusive.  Ambiance = fabulous!  DJ spinning Fri-Sun.  The restaurant itself is fresh and current.  Patio seating available, dog friendly.  Extensive drink bar, including a bloody Mary bar.  I can't say enough about or how much I love this place!  Try it - you'll love it too!

jjnVHEWmgiz-f6xqXv9zJw.text: First time I ever decide to eat at your restaurant, place a to go order tell me it will take 15-20 minutes, I get here and my order was never placed. And all I get offered is free bacon. That's some bs. Speak to the manager and she makes it no better. Free bacon is not going to compensate the time I have to spend waiting. Gets pissed because I said it's bs. That's crazy you call place an order and no one places the order. Yeah super bad impression on my first time here. Don't get this type of service at Cracker Barrel.

HRhIZ-OKy3yHA06BwHg47w.text: Love this place! Amazing breakfast, but the real treat is the Bloody Mary bar! They seriously have almost anything you could imagine. Even though it gets busy, the wait has never been that long.

iBFgbbRODS0veNM-HvMGTg.text: Fabulous place!! Been there twice now and both times sat at the bar and the food was great and the service was good too.

QKc2p-FqlsakdkfUtuqlFQ.text: I absolutely love the ambiance of this place and I love the staff from the dancing greeter to the waitresses. Food is amazing and the Bloody Mary bar is delicious and unique.

dt0gKoyJEkTW9kX7z6IaMg.text: Had Rosa ! She was great. I let her know I was in a hurry and she offered to bring the check with the food so I wouldn't have to wait on her. Ordered the scrambler ! The eggs were amazing. You can definitely taste the freshness and quality!

PstafEN90QZJ1qDkkOGqMQ.text: This was my first time at Hash Kitchen, and let me tell you, this place was THE BEST! Dominic is amazing. Everyone is super friendly. The Bloody Mary Bar was $12, Which is super affordable considering it was bottomless and they had EVERY topping you could imagine! Super clean and fun atmosphere. Our waitress didn't even rush out to leave the table even though the place was PACKED! The DJ started around 9am, spinning great tunes, which helped with digestion. Lol. Make sure to get there early and bring friends! I'm planning on going back soon!

rRb29e0Rd52TL7jya6DNyA.text: This place is amazing!! Great food, great drinks! Doeminic and Jesus were awesome. We will definitely be back. We highly recommend if u want an awesome experience.

7amm8Z8jVV3TepFBp1nsrw.text: Our new go to breakfast spot.  Fantastic menu and food is wonderful.  Dominic and the staff make you feel like friends.

JMyNk9xLxfd2y0yJCkKuhw.text: This was everything I have read about it. Great vibe from the time we walked in..to the service, drinks and food. The music sets the atmosphere as you enter. My 3yr old dancing as we waited...even with a lady who was also waiting. Great seating all around. Love the bar area. The menu was amazing and I couldn't make up my mind. I picked the Avocado toast and Mimosa flight. A M A Z I N G. Great service from Jacquelyn. What topped off my amazing first time here was the manager Dominic came over to ask how our experience was. THAT is what a great place does. Has management involved first hand. Super impressed and recommend this place to anyone.

IcvmOrhERnUY9iIsblzcrA.text: This is probably my new favorite breakfast spot. Food is delicious, portions are HUGE! Decor is very open, fresh, and clean. The manager Dominic was very friendly, he made us feel welcomed and valued. Will definitely be back for some mimosas and Bloody Mary.

lQ4QJlmjUFCAYXKMawIqRg.text: Being a yelper I never go anywhere before looking it up.  That is how we found Hash Kitchen. There were people outside and the parking lot was full with people walking to this restaurant from Whole foods parking lot, so I hoped that this was going to be a treat for us.  We love breakfast and brunch! Nothing starts your day off when your first meal is delicious.  We were not disappointed.  I was greeted right away and surprised that I was seated right away even though my husband was parking our car.  Gabriel our waiter was at our table with in minutes and answering questions and explaining the menu to us since this was our first time.  Let's talk about Gabriel for a second.  It is very nice and very unusual to find a waiter in AZ who is service oriented. Gabriel is just that, during our meal I watched him help other customers with the same kind words and actions.  Usually waiters will plop down a menu and come back in less than 5 minutes to get your order so that they can rush customers out fast to make bigger tips.  Okay I know that the fast music is make you eat faster to get more customers in, but we never felt rushed.  Thank you Gabriel, for making our first time at  Hash kitchen an enjoyable one.  The food was delicious.  Hash Kitchen serves huge portions with a very creative menu.  I am an egg's benedict snob.  The hollandaise sauce was perfect, and the eggs were cooked to perfection.  I was also very impressed how the whole staff worked as a team.  Everyone removed dishes not just the wait staff but the managers too.  Will we come back let's see? Friendly hard working staff, wonderful atmosphere, fabulous food, Mimosa which are yummy, and make your own Bloody Mary Bar.   YOU BET!!

vJqGdqLBvovmVzmXNYjRYQ.text: The only reason I'm not rating this restaurant a 5 star is that there is no such thing as perfection, but DAMN this place is close.  The menu has great variety backed up by quality AND quantity. I was impressed from the minute I walked in. The layout is open and comfortable, the bloody mary bar is gigantic, the bar has plenty of seating, and they have an outside dining area.  I can't say enough about Hash Kitchen. I believe I've found my new favorite breakfast place!

d4f44adTiR-wTaPmSAqutw.text: LOUD! LOUD! LOUD! Went there for brunch on the weekend. The DJ played music so loud that we literally had to yell at each other across the table. I felt like I was in a nightclub. The food and service were fabulous, but I left with a migraine due to the noise level. Not exactly a relaxing, enjoyable weekend brunch.

xUD1iDl8nfIUUk_IVbdK1Q.text: Amazing place. Fun atmosphere. Clean. Great service! Dominic came and checked in on us and was very attentive; he also made great suggestions for drinks and food! Kendra, our server was great. She made sure we had full drinks and bellies! Awesome place! So happy to have it in the area!

UrBMTNPYuVGCfGhK94_QkQ.text: Came here with two girlfriends for sunday brunch and drinks, we waited 1 hour for a table but the food and drinks came so quickly once we sat down and ordered!  The waitress was pretty snobby and short. I definitely wouldn't want to be served by her again, but all the other staff we encountered were amazing! Domenic the manager came around to our table on the patio to check on our service and food, and he also came by after we had moved inside to sit at the bar and make sure we were taken care of. We all agreed that we never receive great customer service like Domenic provided, probably because we're younger, but he is absolutely amazing at what he does!

gucRmHKTUdwHfOLw7oKP2w.text: Well, this place's menu is mouthwatering. Everything sounds good. That doesn't always translate to being good. I had the Pretzel Benedict. It was decent, but the cheese sauce overwhelmed the entire thing. It was also hard to cut. I think a Pretzel Bagel may be a better choice, but it wouldn't look as cool. If I ever got this again, I would ask for the cheese sauce on the side. My friend had a lovely frittata. It was good but not seasoned a lot. The side hash potatoes were nothing special. Still... we would definitely go back to try other items. Even their pancakes looked amazing. Presentation of everything was on point.  The atmosphere is hip and fun, but it is LOUD. We only waited about 5 minutes but it was for lunch on a Thursday.  Service - our guy was meh. He didn't offer hot sauce or ketchup for the hashbrowns, we had to flag him down for refills, and he just seemed like he could not wait to escape.

rn8gmpeKHzGDAQS07WBrTw.text: It was my first time at Hash Kitchen in Chandler, So I ordered the corn beef hash with scrambled eggs and cheddar and OMG!!! I had to tap out and get a togo box.  The portions are humongous. The food was delicious!!...Imma say it again...the food was delicious!! Best biscuits in the universe, hands down. Domenic was the coolest guy and very accommodating for my large party. I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

2rW7EEoKaoRtGALPl8QKww.text: Great breakfast/brunch restaurant. The food is great! I love the French toast and the monkey bread. I don't drink Bloody Mary's but if I did this would be the place to get one! Their Bloody Mary bar has everything you would want to have! Gave it 4 stars because the outdoor patio every time I have been has always seemed to be in need of a good cleaning. A morning spray down of the patio and patio seats would go a long way. Dried bird poop on some of the cushions isn't the most appealing. It's outside, I get it however, as I said a morning power wash of the patio would go a very long way to make for a more pleasant dining experience. Staff is nice but sometimes there's a wait to be seated even thou there isn't a line because no one is manning the front. Other than those small things, I love coming here. The food is great. Came in on a Friday morning once and they had a DJ which was pretty cool.

_dHdFG5MGGQev95vXjS2PQ.text: Great place to stop in for a home style cooked meal,with family friendly service, Domenic one of the managers made it appoint to know us and the refreshing feeling of making sure our food and service was perfect, lemon ricotta pancakes light and fluffy,huevos rancheros tons of flavor! Bring your appetite portions are "HUGE"

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bacon platter variety of fresh,thick cut bacon,side of Bree cheese and butter brioche bread
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Awesome fresh brewed coffee

T1bRXHGeuCvaQc71iRjk6A.text: Stopped in for breakfast.  Ordered corned beef hash and biscuits and gravy.  Overall ok, but not spectacular and not quite worth $42 for two.  Some observations...  - Running a corned beef through a buffalo chopper (suspect that's how they prepared it) does not make it hash. - Putting the aforementioned chopped corned beef over potatoes does not make it hash. - Notwithstanding the above the corned beef was good, but it wasn't hash. - Two eggs we cook properly and were placed over the corned beef. - Biscuits were extremely meh.  Far too dense and frankly were closer to being dumplings (albeit not boiled) than a biscuit. - Gravy was ok.  Oddly enough it came out boiling (it is served in a heated skillet).  The boiling gravy continuedd to cook the over easy eggs until they were over hard...not cool (how do they not know that?).   - The sausage in the gravy uses an Italian sausage that's better suited to being in spaghetti sauce for dinner than gravy for breakfast.  - They have a bloody mary bar...if that's your thing.  Good news, we were able to be seated right away.  I suspect that's not the case on the weekend.  Pretty sure I wouldn't be willing to wait.

a9C2ROw1Zk_pkKKP2QeKmA.text: What a great breakfast spot!  I went after reading the great Yelp reviews and can't wait to have breakfast there again.  They have great customer service led by manager Domenic!  The menu is creative and fun, I had the Dr "Art" Mullen frittata choosing to stay with a "healthier" vegetarian option and drooled at my dad's Cannoli pancakes which my very picky father ate with unusual gusto!  The place fills up quickly even on a Friday morning and the atmosphere was very lively and great people watching.  Next visit will include either a Bloody Mary or mimosa, seeing them delivered to the tables around me made it a must have next time

gsEvEkzTzVxntEZk8meuwg.text: This location is super cute inside! Good service and the food came out quickly. I ordered the salmon Benedict and a coffee. The coffee was good and hot and they brought us almond milk which was appreciated. The food was pretty tasty but not quite hot enough. I think this place is a bit overpriced for breakfast but it was still a pretty lovely brunch and I would return.

8pQw_rJGZxwf7LZPdJXCfg.text: Our experience started off questionable.  One of the Bartenders wasn't in such a good mood.  But!! The managers Natalie and Dom made things right, food was awesome and service was stellar.  I will be supporting their new restaurant "The Sicilian Butcher" in Chandler when it opens.

NmSAMjMeJ6Uu2o3LC7yO0A.text: Food was delicious. Drinks were awesome. And the atmosphere was off the chain. Server was very knowledgeable. Manager Dominck was a joy to talk to.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosas sampler
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; egg hash

lpFTmxYSuLVZy1DxDgtKGg.text: I'll be honest, i went in here expecting not to like it.  I mean, read the reviews.  You'd think it was like eating an omelet at a Las Vegas pool party.  I'm glad the actual experience was nothing like that.    Is there a DJ with your breakfast?  Yes, but DJ Pancakes (our given name for him, not his stage name...probably) wasn't annoying, wasn't overly loud, and, mercifully, he wasn't playing EDM.  It was the equivalent of having a top-40 station playing a bit loudly.    The Bloody Mary bar is fun.  It's $12 and you could literally eat that for your meal.  There are dozens of toppings including the basics (olives, pickles, bacon, cheese) and the absurd (chicken wings, meatballs, kimchi). The nice part here is if you're waiting for your table you can step right up and start with a bloody, no wait required.   Speaking of bars, the bar is first come first served.  You can skip the long wait if you see spots open.  The service there was great.    The food was very good.  I went with the Italian Hash which had ample amounts of sausage, delicious potatoes (not greasy at all), and two perfectly poached eggs.  Other items we saw come out looked great too.    There are definitely some eye catching choices.  The giant full bottle mimosas are a sight to be seen and the cereal shooters seemed to be a hit.  I'll stick with a Bloody and a hash next time, though.    The prices are a bit high but so was the quality.  Besides, DJ Pancakes has to put Lil' Syrup through college and we all need to do our part to make sure that happens.

36rfY-8QfVoFXwzc_z2WQg.text: Visited while visiting friends in Phoenix... WOW.... Thats the most amazing Bloody Mary Bar that I have EVER seen...

GSiUtFrJfRWAhZ0wR50J1A.text: My wife and I have eaten here numerous times the food is great and Dominic the manager is outstanding we had Zeus today as our waiter and he was just as good had the Mexicana breakfast and my beautiful wife had chicken and waffles I've give it more stars if I could.

RtpmXGErCTiqMSlSeCsQZg.text: Mixed emotions about this place.  The food is really good, so I guess I don't see the need to act like a club.  Being my first time here, I was a little surprised by the DJ and club volume level music.  Never have had a DJ while eating eggs, lol.  I guess it works though, the placed was packed but surprisingly we got right in.  I had the build your own scramble, which was awesome, and my girlfriend had an egg Benedict on a giant pretzel!    Too bad I don't like bloody Mary's.  They have a make your own bar, I seen a few people really getting down on the toppings!  We will be back again just cause of the food, maybe we will wait for cooler temps so we can sit outside and not have to listen to DJ Omelet.

XY8Qe5BJRJrpPPFWblRwOQ.text: The food and atmosphere was great. We had a large party and were taken care of like we were royalty. Our server Amanda, was awesome, so attentive and polite. Domenic Viscariello the manager, was just a gem. He came by twice to talk and see how we were doing.  Great guy, funny stories.  Can't wait to visit the new restaurant they will be opening by the Chandler Mall.  Thank you for a lovely experience.  Lisa Smith

moxsI0yXN4Gz2wi5VVIL6g.text: Drinks are amazing and the atmosphere makes you feel right at home. Dominick was very hospitable and provided excellent service 10/10 would come back and the live Dj was jamming

8CbtvgGo6P5D-nqXYSco1w.text: Love love love this place, and love Dominic the manager even more. Amazing place, amazing manager who makes everyone feel special the moment they walk through the door. He kept checking in on my table of 4 girls to make sure we were happy. He even sent us a little treat because he liked us  now that's what I call service.  Actually been back 3 times since as I am excited to treat people so they get to experience good old fashioned customer service.

Eb7RHAm2LHxC-NwAij3Qtw.text: I don't like bloody Mary's, but this place may have changed me! I had a flavorful and perfectly cooked pork eggs Benedict and my friend had the carne Asada. We will be back before the trip ends

oV7vdNaWLCfoHKiKEtfs6g.text: Probably one of the worst experiences here. The waitress was terrible. She took our order after maybe 15 into getting seated. After she delivered our food, she never came back to us. Even after the manager came by he said he would be back and didn't. The Bloody Mary bar was not worth it. Even with all the fixings, the Bloody Mary mix and infused vodka needed some work. I doubt we'll be back but if we do, I hope they've made some improvements.

gVxRjBpZtx46gYSqWOvf8g.text: Absolute amazing service from the moment you walk in. Dominic is friendly and makes you feel like an old friend. Food is a work of art and comes out quickly!! Sad I don't live closer or else this place would be a weekly trip for me!

EzFhafdOv_K8k8AU7wvymA.text: After waiting for over an hour,  we were seated. The waitress argued with a person in my party that they didn't have the beer here that he ordered.  Although He just had one at the bar.   I got the salmon Benedict. I had ONE bite and almost threw up! I'm a big fish lover so it wasn't that I don't like fish as the Mgr tried to tell me!  A few of the people in my party were served room temperature food that was only mediocre.   I'm really bummed because I was looking forward to loving this place!   I ended up getting sick in the restroom before the check was even delivered.    Needless to say; we won't go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

I8Y9a0pF-JUgpIqvQcBkPQ.text: My family and I frequent Hash once a week. Usually Sunday's or Mondays to avoid the crowd . The food is usually delicious, served hot, and the bloody Mary's delicious. The last couple weeks the service has been really slow. We didn't get what we ordered, and the food served cold. It was odd because it wasn't busy. We were sitting on the patio. Someone was mowing weeds outside and leaves and dirt blew into our drinks and food. The server said she'd remedy the issue but only returned with our bill.   We didn't have much time left, due to the terrible service that day so we paid and left. I'm hoping this is just an off past couple of experiences. The avacodo toast is so good and the Bloody Mary Bar really is like going to Disneyland.

W19EfAYO-z2rqzXTW_WIAA.text: Let's start with the positives. The place is very comfortable and nicely decorated. There's a good amount of seating and the restaurant is kept clean and presentable. The service was friendly from the time we arrived until we left. The food was okay, but overpriced. The french toast that I had was ridiculously thick - to the point where it wasn't cooked consistently. The inside was soggy and the outside was very crisp. That was disappointing. The bacon was very good but needed to be better drained. The burrito that the hubby had was tasty and my son's egg scramble was disappointing. It's not that we wouldn't try the place again, but we wouldn't go out of our way to do so.

s46weuWk_1TaDCSDfAistw.text: My hubby was in Arizona for a few days for work and he happened to eat here and said it was pretty good food. He ordered the Italian sausage frittata and enjoyed it. He said it was very filling!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

A2JX9RscX6xccCZrLREqDg.text: I have been waiting to get in here for quite awhile! Well, I finally made it only to feel like I'm glad I didn't  wait an hour or more to eat here. I would've been pretty upset. The reviews make the Hash kitchen sound like a world renown restaurant run by one of those famous TV chefs. However, I hate to admit it the food fell short on expectations.   I had the HK Hash Fried Chicken, potatoes  and eggs. My husband had the scramble with bacon, eggs, onions and peppers with a side of potatoes.   I loved the chicken! It was cooked perfectly and so flavorful. The potatoes were dry and the eggs were O.K.                             My husband's scramble had lots of cheese and looked yummy. However, he said it lacked flavor and he felt the portion was small for the price. He gave it a 3 out of 5 stars.                               We both had the Craft Mimosas with orange juice. I didn't taste very much champagne. Although, I hear the other options and the bloody Mary's are better.             Service: We were greeted immediately upon entering and seated immediately. I hear that this rare. Our waiter brought us water promptly. Our food and mimosas were delivered pretty fast also. The one downside was that the waiter brought my husband the wrong food and he had to wait a little longer to get the correct order. The waiter wasn't very attentive after bringing us our food and drinks. He did not come around to refill our water or see if we wanted another drink.   Overall, it was OK. I'd try it again but a different dish and drink. The DJ wasn't here today as well. That would have made the atmosphere more exciting.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosas anyone?
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Craft Mimosas with orange juice
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. HK Hash Fried Chicken,  potatoes and eggs.  The chicken was delish!

isGeQLbi3lA3j34EPYF5LA.text: I really wanted to like this place, the reviews are really good. I will say that the mimosa flight I had was delicious (though it was supposed to come with the pineapple flavored one and didn't, which is fine, but I was told this as it was put down in front of me instead of ahead of time). However the menu is one of those menus where the breakfast place is trying to "do up" classics. That usually translates into a huge mess that's almost impossible to eat. I ordered the egg McMuffin hash style. It indicated that it had a giant English muffin (I even questioned how large and she showed me with her hand). What she didn't mention is that it is not an English muffin at all, but a huge crunchy roll that is impossible to bite into. I wish I had taken a picture of what it looked like when it arrived.  It was so tall there was no way I could get my mouth around it. Even when I smashed it down it still was too big. So then I tried to cut the thing, however they give it to you on a tiny little board and all I managed to do was mush the entire thing all around. It was in my lap, it was on the table, it was ridiculous. I asked for a plate, but by then it was just too late. I've included a picture so you can see what I was talking about. I really wish breakfast places wouldn't try to doll up classics and would just do them classic. Maybe if I had ordered something else I would've enjoyed this place better, not sure I'm willing to give it another try to find out though when there are so many other places around that I love, like BLD, Biscuits, Gilbert House, and The Farmhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Egg McMuffin Hash Style

RPYONN4ImVR6ilshVdGFZA.text: This place definitely has a fun vibe! However, the food sucks. The drinks are good but stay away from the cereal shooters. The cereal shooter look good but they were served warm and nothing that is supposed to be milky should be served warm...   My girlfriend and I ordered the chilaquiles and the banana split brioche.  The chilaquiles was comprised of chips, topped with a salsa verde that wasn't even "simmered" and an egg on top. She asked for no chicken because she can't eat chicken. They forgot to add the cotija and sour cream. It was basically a $14 chips with salsa.   The Banana split was advertised like this: caramelized bananas / sweet mascarpone / seasonal berries / warm salted caramel drizzle / walnuts   The bread was dry and they put literally 2 small slices of bananas, 2 blueberries, 2 slices of strawberry and they forgot the walnuts.   Basically, I'm giving 2 stars for the drinks and not the food. I would suggest eating somewhere else first then grabbing drinks here with friends because they had a fun atmosphere and a DJ playing a good set.   I wish I liked it more so I could eat and drink all in one place.  We were going to bring these issues up in person but we never got a chance because the server was running around and didnt ask us how everything was.

_yx5rJcHoZJPF06p3I9wpA.text: I was very excited to see Hash Kitchen open up a location in Chandler! I've personally gone there almost a handful of times now. The wait is usually lengthy (45 minutes to 1 hour) especially on Saturday & Sunday mornings but they do have a set up to grab a fun drink & wait outside. Now that it has cooled down, the patio would be a good choice to enjoy brunch.  After trying several of their menu items, I've been a fan of the sweeter items. My favorites have been the Coconut / Almond Encrusted French Toast & Fruity Pebble Pancakes. The hashes are good too and they have similar options in form of Benedicts & Frittatas.  The service has usually been good but don't be surprised if it's a time consuming experience. The food is good though, so it's usually worth the wait. It is nice that they have a DJ who plays music but it does get loud .. again, the patio may be a better option for to avoid that!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Brunch spread! ... Cannoli pancakes / Chilaquiles / Fruity Pebble pancakes / Notorious Burger (with grilled chicken).

R0JL2j6W3SifD2f596egwQ.text: Always have an amazing time at the hash kitchen.  Midweek brunch and bloody Mary's.  Domenic always takes care of us with a smile and good conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Good mimosas equal tiny eyes

5NqZL8a2QCM1LY_dA6DAaQ.text: Came in with some pretty high expectations, unfortunately, the food didn't match the ambiance.   Weekends can be really busy so we decided a weekday stop would give us a chance to let the food and the place sink in. Everything about the appearance gets 5 Star from me. It looks like a Magazine staged restaurant showcase/showroom floor. The Bloody Mary bar, boom.... staff (Dominic the manager & our server) ... on point. So what could go wrong right your asking???   Nothing on the menu jumped out to our likings (took us forever to decide) so I hit Yelp and looked at pictures. We decided on the Avocado Toast, kids chocolate chip pancakes & the flat iron Steak & eggs. When the food came I was surprised that my steak was so small. Eggs were hot, but the steak was well done (ask for it medium) and the hash-browns were like baby ice cubes... cold. No issues when I told the staff but it should of never came out to the table that way. Kids pancakes were the same way, just lukewarm. Got the new steak and realized it's just s tough piece of meat and not good. The sauce with the steak wasn't that good either. I ate the avocado toast (way to many leeks) but it was bland. I've had so much better.   The presentations have people at nearby tables complimenting left & right... but I think they were lit from the drinks. This will sound weird, but I think the presentations & stellar menu of drinks make everyone down play the flavors of the food. (Not just my observation)  I plan to come back as everything from the vibe to the drinks are enticing, but with the hopes of changing my 1st experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs... very small &amp; tuff piece of meat... pass

jok8p0KDyq9EzdrgVN0tcw.text: Overall great experience.   The wait is about 30 to 45 minutes if you go there on a Saturday or Sunday. It be awesome if they had a digital no waitlist through Yelp. I would save so much time and also help with organization and the chaos of people waiting outside of their doors.   The staff was so friendly. The managers go around and say hi to every single person that walks in and every table.  The bar is always packed.  There is a separate bloody Mary bar at the front entrance right by the waiting area/ host stand.  ** WARNING: bloody Mary bar is overpriced and so expensive. Our group ended up getting one really tall glass (32 OZ cost $30!) and two normal glasses ($15 each) cost us $75!   The bartenders will try to upgrade you and get you to spend a little more by asking you if you want it's a double or if you want extra stuff on it and I would just recommend just ordering from your table instead of ordering from the bloody Mary bar because the prices are not listed and then you end up spending a lot more than you need to for a couple of drinks.   I am just being honest...  Food overall is great. The donuts are absolutely my favorite because they're deep-fried have so much texture and there's a cheesecake type of frosting in the center of the donut plus a donut hole place on top which is just so beautiful, and taste sooooo good!  The only reason I'm giving them a four out of five is honestly because of the wait time I just don't think it makes any sense at all to have something so well-known be so on organized when it comes up to waiting to get seated. Just makes sense to do reservations or Yelp "no wait".

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sooooo yummmy

jsr43JnDBdKFkxTjd5t8-A.text: So, food was once again amazing! But what topped it was service. They made up for it. From the gentleman that sat us (Dominic) to our server (Jose), superb! And to top it off, our food came out super fast! Way to fix a situation! A+

prXdu87S281x8Sdkw-tuYA.text: Great Bloody Mary bar. Tried the cereal flight and mimosa flight. Great food with large portions. And ended with a yummy adult Capri sun that we could take home. Definitely worth the drive up from Tucson. We need one down here! Friendly staff, great music and atmosphere, and the manger Domenic checked on us and made sure we were 100% pleased. Love this place

_o7gxTuhV3mrJfz9mOVmQw.text: We had a table of 6 for breakfast.  Got seated right away, luckily for us we beat the crowd.  The place is loud because of the live DJ but not so loud that you can't still have conversation at the table.  Most of us had coffee so our waitress left us a carafe which was refilled throughout our meal.  Staff is friendly, manager Dominick came by our table to chat and later checked on us after our meals were delivered which was a nice touch.  We ordered the donuts to share, they are amazing and could only be better with perhaps a powder sugar dusting.  The menu choices are widespread so there is something for every craving.  The best was the avocado toast, so many flavors mixed into one bite full.  If you're looking for quiet and greasy comfort food this is not your spot.  But, if you want a lively upbeat place with some spunk in their menu choices then definitely check out Hash.

MYI4x3T2PuJa689DGC7ilg.text: 9/30/18 Yelp Review Chandler, AZ Hash Kitchen 2855 w Ray Road Unit 3 85249          I heard about Hash Kitchen through several friends, but never went because I thought it was only an over 21 place with unique bloody Mary's and mimosa's. I did some more research on the menu and found that they had way more than their famous bloody Mary bar. They had very unique food combinations that sounded very appealing to me and my girlfriend. Once I looked over the menu and saw food options like cannoli pancakes, s'mores French toast, and chicken fried steak served on a waffle, I knew I had to go there.   When we arrived at the restaurant at about 10:15 am on a Sunday the wait was about 30-45 minutes. They had a little outside waiting area with chairs and a bar where you can order alcoholic drinks or coffee which made the wait feel like 15 minutes. We ordered a hazelnut cappuccino which was prepared perfectly. The cappuccino was $3.75 which is a very normal price for that drink. The only thing better than the cappuccino was the service by the young male bartender with about shoulder length hair. Not only did he take his time explaining the ladies bloody Mary in front of me. He made sure she absolutely loved it. He not only was doing a great job but was having fun at the same time. He made sure we got our drink and made the experience way more enjoyable than a normal breakfast spot.   The wait was finally over and we were seated at our table. It was very loud inside because they had a DJ playing the whole time. I liked it because it was a unique experience for a breakfast spot. Our server was great and our food was out very quickly. It took us a while to order because of all the options. We wanted everything on the menu. We ended up deciding on Cannoli donuts as a starter, coconut almond encrusted French toast, and the carnitas hash.   The cannoli donuts came out about 5 minutes after we ordered. They were served to us by the same bartender that served us before we were seated. He served us the food with the same incredible customer service he had before. The donuts were incredible. They were so warm and soft so you can tell they just made them. The hole in the middle of the donut was filled with the sweetened ricotta cheese and they were sprinkled with powder sugar. I loved the taste and ate two of them which made me feel almost full before the main dishes came out.   Approximately 10 minutes later the French toast and carnitas hash came out. We started on the carnitas hash and it was scrumptious. The carnitas was sweet and savory, while the potatoes were perfectly cooked, and the toppings perfectly complimented the Mexican carnita meat. Now it was time for the coconut almond encrusted French toast. By this time, we were both very full and tired, however we knew we had to finish or at least try to eat the French toast. We had some and it was delectable. The warm thick brioche bread, with burnt coconut shavings on top, the glazed banana slices, and the sweet syrup made it irresistible. Overall the atmosphere is a more young or upbeat setting, the service was top notch, and the food was magnificent. The only tiny downside is the price was a little higher for breakfast. The cappuccino was $3.75, donuts $12, Carnitas hash $16, and French toast $13. The total was about $55 with tax and tip. Although it was a little pricier than the average breakfast place, the quantities were well worth the price. Hash Kitchen was an incredible experience that will have you taking a nap after eating yourself into a food coma. I will definitely  recommend this place to anyone.

n1PY7uMWOVEP5mrIs20QLQ.text: Great place to eat, friendly staff especially Domenic the manager. He came to our table and welcomed us to the restaurant and kept checking in. Food was great and I will definitely come back.

Manager was very rude and said keeping the garage door open to sell drinks at the bar was more important than everyone's comfort and safety inside. We were told it "wasn't worth it" to shut the garage.  Women's bathroom stall also did not have a door on it. Very negative experience.

q2gUVMsZwWdJ7ZW5DfGXeg.text: Great place to take people you don't like very much.  The food is great, the service was amazing, nice cocktail menu, the decor is cool.... so why only two stars ?   It's loud.  Not just loud, but ear bleeding, teenagers bedroom when the parents are out of town, you'll be deaf by the time you are 30 loud. We read the reviews, but thought maybe it was a few people who didn't like the music system - nope. It's so loud you literally can't talk. The wait staff can't take your order.  There was a child on a table near us who had her ears covered and was c.r.y.i.n.g !  We should be able to work out how loud because they had a decimal counter out and were monitoring how loud it is.  Here is a top tip for the management - if you have to measure to see if it's too loud -it's too loud !!!  The ladies who was taking the measurements mouthed "it's too loud" - so we were hopeful that it might get turned down.  Nope, it got a fraction quieter and then went up to blast levels again once she left.  There was a line to get in, and I can't blame people for loving the food, but next time we will order delivery.  Take your ear defenders - I wish I was joking.

hqwtmoLpJ02eY6ZIvTOxuA.text: My Ladies Breakfast group went here for the first time this morning. Me made a reservation because there were 12 of us. Only 2 had ever been before. From the moment we arrived everything was fantastic.  Our large table in the back was ready and the speakers even turned off so we could converse easier, without yelling.   The decor is quite cute- mostly white, offset with green "planty" things covering some if the walls.   Our waitress was friendly and patient with us, having to come back several times to take our order because we were so indecisive since everything looked amazing on the menu.   I believe we all had different dishes-from as simple oatmeal to as traditional as omelets to smoked salmon sliders. Everyone quite enjoyed their food.   There was an amazing Bloody Mary bar with at least 30 choices to add. The price was a reasonable $13! Only one of our group got one but it was amazing to watch her build it.   There was a DJ playing great music and it wasnt intrusive to the ears at any point- not only because the speaker was off at our table but even next to him at the Bloody Mary bar, the volume was quite comfortable.   Dont miss the selfie and picture "booth" next to the Bloody Mary bar. A few of us took pics and had them sent straight to our phones.   Finally, and perhaps the highlight of our visit, was when Dominic, the manager, stopped by to chat with us. He seemed to be a great guy, albeit, with terrible taste in football teams (the Pats! Hahaha). He was very animated and fun and was like the cherry on top of the sundae for our visit.   I highly recommend this place. Privately owned and not some big chain place. Give it a shot- you will not be disappointed!

v8xDEixmu5ZdGBpOAUu-iA.text: Joey I love Hash Kitchen. Bloody Mary bar has everything . At the table salmon board, monti Cristo, Christine' tamale cakes. And lemon ricotta pancakes all so yummy. HhijSQzgJBZ_zq6LCY5FQQ.text: Love love love this place! But the wait times are horrible. The server's service are 7/10, but the environment, the food, the drinks are all amazing!! I love the DJs. Although I've been here about an hour before and the DJ stopped playing right when we got in. Like why couldn't he play the whole time?  Anyways, definitely would recommend. Sunday's are the worst days to go after 11am. The wait is about an hour.

br435nbvLMdPhX6HVB2xMA.text: SO GOOD! Everything was incredible and the portions were huge! Next time we come, we are going to share one dish! My husband made his own Bloody Mary and I ordered a pineapple mimosa. I'm excited to come back and try their other dishes! I highly recommend Hash Kitchen.

j3flx3CMd1tHAxwzZJ80Aw.text: Let's start with understanding the concept of Hash Kitchen.  Yes, It is a club like atmosphere, intentionally Yes, It is loud and crowded Yes, there is a long wait Yes, it is brunch  Yes, you can enjoy a quiet breakfast before 9am.  Can we not bash businesses because they have a different concept of a brunch experience???  Ok, now to the review....  I was Impressed by the customer service from start o finish. Our server, Jesus, was attentive throughout the entire dining experience He asked if it was our 1st time and we said yes. He then asked if we would like recommendations and again we said yes. He explained the concept and the bloody mary bar  The food was good. I ordered the huevos Rancheros and my wife had a custom scramble. Psst, the biscuits are yummy.  The bloody mary bar is fun. You get to choose your own options   The manager, Dominic came by and checked on us to make sure everything went well. That was nice.  Overall, this was a good experience with lots of options.  If you have a young family or dont like the loud environment, come before 9am. The DJ starts at 9am and I gets pretty vibrant.  We will definitely be returning

IAta9FdJGL-MGT6Wh22OSA.text: Pros: Huge portions. Food was pretty good.  Tons of creative options.  Kids portions were large. You can get a half order of regular pancakes, which is 2 instead of 4 pancakes. A DJ, TVs and a huge Bloody Mary bar.   Cons: Incredibly loud. Did not see a single staff member smile- everyone working looked miserable.  Waitress was down right rude. No manager every came around.  Waters weren't refilled.   Although I would come back for the food, I hope they find some staff who enjoy working and want to do their job.

ux7OjsbidUlAzSlwrdsY_g.text: Such a good place for brunch.  They have bomb mimosas.  All of my friends loved their food.  The patio has umbrellas, fans and misters.  The manager Dominick even came up to say hello & ask how it was going.   & best of all they have a a Dj and good music playing to keep the vibe up.

VTG7hcnYgXtXA8dSgzfNeQ.text: We had been wanting to try Hash Kitchen for a while and decided to try it today. The music was very loud even though we got there on a Friday at 11:30 AM. Impossible to talk and be easily heard.  But we decided to stay and see about the food. It  was not remarkable. We had one of the hash dishes. It was flavorless. This might be a place for the younger crowd who drink their brunch.

xfMTHig8stodsLfoQKWtOg.text: Great brunch food with creative twists. AMAZING, massive Bloody Mary Bar. The DJ played an awesome mix of 90s and early 2000s Hip Hop. Dominic exemplifies great customer service and energy! Can't wait to go back!!

hC58gfqCxL-vUWmlKSG1lQ.text: This was my second time at Hash, I had previously gone to the Scottsdale location, but the location on Ray is hands down my favorite. They had a DJ playing great music that made me want to dance the entire time! There is even a waiting area around the corner where you could order a drink and hang out until your table is ready. Shortly after being seated we were approached by Dominic, one of the managers, and he was so genuine! It's not everyday you encounter people who truly care about your experience. This will definitely be my go to brunch spot from now on!

4jScuL9KAKrHon7O3yjxEw.text: I got a wonderful follow up. Overall my review wasn't to totally bash the company. It was moreso the way the situation was handled and how it needed to become an opportunity to teach. I deal with customer service a lot and it was a situation that could have been handled differently and I'm glad to say that Chris took my experience very seriously. I'm happy we spoke about it and better explained the companies policy.   Overall.  I'm excited to go back, the food portions are NO JOKE. If you order the avocado toast hash style is amazing, huge.  Definitely share! Everything my girlfriends and I had was very shareable, so if there is anything I could recommend is don't order the same thing. You definitely will have left overs to try everything.

ROW2QOMXOSjGe0PaUEtgWA.text: The vibe at this place was great! Fun atmosphere with good food and drinks to match. Our server (Serena) was great she shared a few items she thought we would enjoy, and they did not disappoint! The bloody mary bar is as good as it shows on pictures, we also tried a flight of mimosas which were great!  I tried the avocodo toast which was great in flavor, the only downside to that was the board it is served on. It was very hard to eat without making a mess, the toppings, including the runny egg yolk went all over the table.

uk_Pxj86IIUt_GkIonc1Jg.text: Hash doesn't even deserve one star. It's 100+ degrees outside, people in the restaurant are fanning themselves, children are red in the face, people are sweating so much they have to put their hair up and they still refuse to close the bar window. The safety of all the customers and children sitting indoors trying to escape the heat is the priority, Not the couple extra dollars the restaurant will make from the bar. This is completely ridiculous.

dYuPMyE3MDSNehsmF1oMnA.text: Visiting Phoenix from Tucson to do some shopping, we yelped breakfast places before heading home. We were not disappointed!!! The food, the atmosphere, the Bloody Mary bar, my god what an incredible breakfast place. The hostess was incredibly kind, got us seated quickly as we told her we were traveling home that morning. Domenic, one of the managers, is a dynamic presence in the restaurant and greeted every table with sincere interest in our experience. The restaurant was packed with a lively crowd and everything that came out looked like a piece of art. Hard to do with breakfast. If you're looking for a fun atmosphere, unbelievably huge and artistic dishes, and the most amazing Bloody Mary (like a salad bar buffet), this is the place to go. Thanks again for the super warm and personal experience, Domenic. You guys rock. I beg you, come to Tucson.

KjxEarh0Ej6fsEjtMmeNoQ.text: Had the best experience at Hash Kitchen on Monday morning. We were sat right away in Jessica's section where she was very attentive. My friend chose to get a coffee cocktail and was just a tad disappointed there were not any options for HOT coffee cocktails only iced. I went with the Bloody Mary bar where there were too many options for my own good. We shared the Huevos Ranchero Hash which was amazing and more than enough food for us. It also came out pretty quick! Homemade biscuits were delicious!! We later had a friend join and we ordered the XXL Strawberry mimosa which was AMAZING. It has little strawberry poppers at the bottom which was fun. Dominic stopped by our table a couple of times and was very communicative. Nonetheless our experience was phenomenal and everyone at Hash kitchen did amazing!

The manager Domenic Viscariello was full of hospitality and made sure we had outstanding service. I highly recommend this place, if you want great food, and a great atmosphere.

96tvlJyWdd_rIppCN6f9hQ.text: Came in for a great lunch and we were not disappointed!  My friend had the Avocado Toast and I had the Notorious Burger.  Both were amazing! Neither one of us could finish our food so we both have dinner for tonight.  I cannot wait to bring my husband back and try out the OMG Bloody Mary bar and the Mimosa flight.  Only suggestion is to have half portions available.  Waitresses were very nice and place was very clean and friendly environment.  Can't wait to go back!

rQeIdek-WrhZM5_MPCDmhA.text: I had my birthday brunch here. They're such a popular spot for brunch, so I was nervous inviting around 15 - 20 people here to celebrate with me. I called weeks in advance and they were able to reserve a large high top table for our group. Thankfully our reservation time was later in the afternoon, so there weren't any issues. Their Bloody Mary Bar is to die for and their dishes are just as good too. Such a fun atmosphere!

5AWb5LRWjTN2k319TDPvRA.text: Your meal will be served with hearing loss.   The music is at a level that will most likely cause damage.    Won't be returning, no matter how good the food is.

NXpQFtbGayANAYflxE5Xpg.text: The place was great and I understand why it's so busy and popular. I'd recommend going around 1 thats when I was finishing my meal up and I noticed it was emptying. Anyways it's worth the wait!!

HKkexpEK3ciaA9LS2FHxag.text: Good food.  Loud, lively atmosphere.  Great for a group party brunch.  The Bloody Mary bar looked legit, I will try next time.

smdgQRTkdnMLLk0hE6uKqQ.text: Me and my girlfriend came here and we were not disappointed! We were greeted by one of the managers, Domenic who was very friendly and welcoming. We both ordered eggs Benedict, I ordered the chicken and my girlfriend ordered the pretzel eggs Benedict. Both were extraordinary. We also had to order the mimosa flight as seen on social media. They were all very good! If you are staying in Arizona, or are just a local I would definitely recommend!

1OASPN0okfJ0d2mCY_yOuQ.text: Would have given 5 stars if it hadn't been for the tiny table. Two of us at a 2 person table does not work if you decide to try a flight, drink coffee and water plus eat food. I am not an experienced juggler so it forces you to drink fast to clear space. I suppose have a DD or eat slow if you sit at a little table and have more than drinks. Go before 9am on a weekend or prepare to wait an hour but even if you wait it will be worth it. Not a quiet place so make sure you were not looking for cozy and quaint. Fun and open? Yes!! Mimosa flight was delish, my favorite was the kiwi-$16. Bloody Mary bar? Hell yes! Who doesn't want a spicy bloody with jalapeno poppers, bacon, cheese, meatballs, and slim Jim's- $15? Lemon ricotta pancake was amazing not overly sweet and super light- no syrup required. The chicken tinga frittata was massive and could have fed 2. Super fresh flavors. The savory chicken and waffle was also a huge plate of food. Meals average 12-15 per plate and you can get 1/2 orders of pancakes etc. 1/2 of the LR pancakes was 2 huge ones which would have been a meal.  Staff were friendly, full bar opens to the patio, took a few for a server to show up. Patio is shaded by massive umbrellas and is dog friendly, bringing my pup next time.
