wixoKhRXaPR892XjpHru5A.text: Such great food and good service. We found a place st the bar to enjoy a mimosa while we waited for our table. The manager Dominick checked in on our table and was very friendly and wanted to make sure everything was going well. Everything was great!

rQjzj7F3dn-lAAUp5RloFw.text: 1st time here, very impressed with the atmosphere, the food is exciting and i wanted pictures of all the dishes! Our group of 4 ordered some mimosas while we wait for our food. Dominic personally came to greet us and was very nice, we learned he is new to AZ and is enjoying the culture here as much as we are enjoying Hash Kitchens culture! Cant wait to come back and experience a new dish

JUU-UymOK4ibjHdY7Hi9WA.text: Our first time dining at this place was a success! The food was amazing, drinks were good and the DJ inside was a fun touch. I was most impressed with the manager Dominic. He approached us before our meal started and introduced himself and made sure we were taken care of and we had been helped. Mid meal he came back and checked in with us. Overall a great experience and I highly recommend!

vSSEdjLPrddJcMPTfY6hoA.text: When we first got there we sat at the bar took about 5-7 min for the bartender to ask us if we wanted something to drink, looked at us twice but continued on. Hostess was friendly and 45 min on a Saturday is probably the average wait time. It's a hipster type of place dj and drinks. I got the chicken and waffles and it was very bland. Chicken was bland waffles was bland as well. Would I try this place again probably because I saw the French toast that was dipped in vanilla sauce. Mamosa was strong and good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

uFtbBozqPxh1H3W7rn1-Ag.text: Let me start by saying if I was reviewing Dominic (sp) and Jesus, our server, it would be a 5 all day long!! They were both fantastic!!! Great service!  We arrived and we were told it would be about 15-20 minutes for a table. We were waiting for a table on the patio. After about a half hour I went in to check on our table because there were several available and had been since we arrived. The blonde, stalky, manager/hostess said it was because the kitchen was bombarded. I completely understand that. She said they would rather us wait a little longer than wait for our food. I said I would think they would just communicate that to us and maybe let us sit and have drinks. (I would assume they would like the revenue from the bar while we waited.) I went back outside and our alert went off. Now, here's where the low star review comes in. The blonde lady sat us at a table on purpose against a pillar. My husband asked if we could sit at the one next to it and she said no, somebody was sitting there. Lol. Nobody sat there. There were 15 empty tables on the patio. We were VERY WELL AWARE this was her way of "putting me in my place" for voicing my concern. We literally had to move the table at an angle to be able to sit at it. I'm sure she was giggling. It's OK. We won't be back because of her and this "customer service."

r4MquyNuBAOIEQqIkZiIzA.text: Had some delicious French toast this morning. For sure recommend the coconut almond crusted French toast. Dom came by to check on the meal and make sure everything is going good. Were for sure coming back to get that bacon platter and brunch bruschettas

E02s6LifIYVPRgSJPWJM1g.text: This place came highly recommended by a friend, so I made the plans to have a surprise brunch for my friend's 30th bday. The food was just "ok" and maybe I would be more forgiving of that if the service was good. It was a MONDAY at 11am (not even a weekend or holiday).  First issue: I called the place twice and was told they don't do reservations. I was not at the place when the group first got there, as I was bringing the birthday girl, but my friends told me that our waitress had a slight attitude about having to serve/seat 8 people. When I did get to the place, the waitress was ok, but I and the rest of my table could tell she did not care to work with us.   Secondly, my favorite part was when I asked our waitress if we could take a quick picture below a cute sign. The table in front of it was still dirty and I did not want to take someone else's table. She agreed and as we got up to head over, the lady who was I guess the hostess for the morning, let out an audible sigh and very clearly rolled her eyes (Not discreet at all) as if we just ruined her whole day or took the table (no one sat at that table for quite a while, so I know she was just having an incredibly rude attitude and wanted us to see it.)   Get better employees.  Like I said, the food was just "ok" for all the hype, but I think the staff attitude also put a bad taste in our mouths.

182Nl5V1PsaHgV1Abxi8lw.text: Visiting from California, meeting up with my mom and my best friend. First time eating here or even hearing about it. I was VERY pleased with my experience. She took the time to listen to my food allergy needs, gave me a ton of information about the ways things are cooked, and check on us to make sure everything was perfect. Highly recommend : )

QUXPZPU2be3xb2z3xOWEmQ.text: 5 stars all around. The food is absolutely delicious and the presentations will make you smile. This place was packed and the DJ was hip. The music fit the ambience perfectly making this a very pleasurable experience. I love the decor, it's definitely trendy and fun! I highly recommend this place for a fun, enjoyable and delicious brunch with friends and family. I'm bringing my kids next time!

The carne asada was super tasty and tender! My husband and son shared a berry waffle and they both inhaled it. Our waiter was super nice, patient and welcoming. The manager (Dominic) was friendly and had great customer service. He even brought our son crayons and coloring sheet so he wouldnt be bored. ij2KUpFEAdy98PjFVmwabA.text: Yum! We shared the Almond Coconut French Toast and the "Boring Benedict" ...both were good but the French toast was AMAZING. So fluffy and delicious. 3sVXl9U6odBpmHwvgQFi9g.text: Amazing!!!! What a cool place and fun atmosphere. On the weekends they have a DJ spinning toons which was awesome!!! The place is big and open and they offer outside seating as well. Our waitress was fantastic! Super friendly and very attentive.  Let me tell you about their Blood Mary bar. What an amazing concept!!! So many options. As much as you can cram on as many skewers you'd like and fit into your drink. Tons of pickled items and even hot items like meatballs, cheese ravioli and hot bacon. I created a master piece!!! Check out my photo. They offer 6 different infused vodkas but unfortunately did not offer plain vodka which I would have preferred.   The menu offers phenomenal options for breakfast and lunch. We decided to try the pretzel Benedict and the breakfast sandwich sliders with fried. The pretzel Benedict with poached eggs, bacon, and beer cheese sauce was the BOMB!!! The sliders had crispy bacon, onion jam, fried egg and ham on a delicious bun. We shared both meals and still had one slider left.   I definitely recommend this place!!! You will have a fantastic experience.

tfIx2pV-g87burWE1riWHQ.text: I have always had a great experience at Hash Kitchen. it's become one of my favorite restaurants to go to with my girlfriends, and I tell everyone about it when they're looking for a breakfast and brunch spot. The management is great. Sincere and genuine. I work in food service so I can tell the authenticity. Love the menu items and the fun, creative cocktails.

FOZ4Q0_9id39UbP7xghIlA.text: It was better than good. Parts of it I really liked (the service). Parts of it are overplayed brunch stuff (Bloody Mary bars and hipster food). Parts of it were not so good (the seating arrangements.) Overall, I would go back, but I am not in a huge rush to do so.  First of all, this place is BUSY. Of course, we went on a Sunday morning, so that is on us, but wow - packed. We were seated immediately, but we got one of the last open tables and this place is not small. By 9am the line was out the door and around the corner. So, being that it was so packed we felt a little cramped. We were at a small table smooshed in between other tables and it was hard to even get out of my seat without bumping the tables next to me. I do not like splurging on brunch and being so cramped that I cannot enjoy it. So, not a fan of the seating.  The food that we ordered was really good. Husband had to have breakfast poutines as an appetizer (I mean who orders an appetizer at brunch???), but they were out of this world delicious. I really liked them a lot. Who knew that fried leek straws were so tasty?  For meals I had the pineapple pancakes which were fine, but nothing terribly special. Think regular pancakes with candied pineapple rings in between them. And he ordered the carne asada breakfast burrito which he really enjoyed.  I ordered a peach mimosa which tasted like a regular mimosa, which was fine, but nothing special.They also have a ridiculous bloody mary bar if you are talented enough to craft one of these. I am not, and I much prefer a bar tender to do it for me because mine never taste right, but there were a lot of people having fun doing this if that is your thing. There was even a guy hanging out behind the bar (I am assuming to help people like me) so maybe you will have better luck than I usually do.  So, hipster food, really busy and getting to know the table next to you was our overall first time experience. Which is fine, but nothing that I am going to rush right out and do again.

jFuJvqrKLmvoayP3VC23iA.text: I'd like to start off this review stating that the Manager Dominic was awesome and very friendly. Unfortunately the food did not reach the high bar set by the management. My wife said the french toast was the worst she has ever had and my daughter refused to eat the scrambled eggs which is usually her favorite breakfast food.   Combine this with the weird attempts to be "hip and cool" like a dj playing music for breakfast, an unnecessarily complicated bloody mary bar and high prices, you get a place that focuses on flash and frills before getting the food right.   I really wish we had liked the food because I would have liked to come back and seen Dominic again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Although the french toast is big the perimeter is inedible

8eRS0f6PP06XutQUVH3aFg.text: Now I see why they are so packed in the weekend!!  I was able to get in on a Thursday to celebrate my friends birthday. It was just the two of us but asked for a four-top as we tend to order a lot and we was happily accommodated. And we did use a lot of table.  Got my friend the Cereal drinks flight. That was a lot of fun, I tried a little bit of each and dang those are strong.  I got the Torta with carne asada and it was very good, although next time I'll skip on the grilled green onions, I couldn't bite them and they just slid out, gross. But they do put friend onion strings on it and those are wonderful.  I also ordered a pancake for the table, I like a little sweet with my salty food. It was decent, not dissatisfied.  My friend ordered something with salmon, she's a salmon fiend. She ordered the frittata I think but didn't discover they had a salmon board until it was too late. So she said we are definitely going back.  I will be back. Probably not on a weekend still, but that's okay, as long as business is good for them.

N3LQSEOrEaD_UPoEdJL2LA.text: If you want some big eats and a fun time, Hash Kitchen is the place to go.  Both the food and service are excellent.  Be prepared for some huge portions and some wild dishes.  Also it is loud, but so much fun.  I just wished that they would take reservations or have a call ahead list.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

JLCf1w2O0syfxLMfhryDgA.text: Hash Kitchen is an indulgent, boisterous, trendy, sensory overload, party.   We ended up sitting outside because it was the first available spot after an insanely long wait (over an hour for brunch)! Our waitress was personable and attentive. She said weekends are cray-cray but if you visit Monday-Thursday you have much different experience and easier time getting into the restaurant.   The menu is pretty much a carb/sugar bomb and the drinks are the same. But the offerings are certainly instagramable with with fancy presentations that feature drinks in disco ball mugs top with cotton candy, colorful fruity pebbles pancakes, and crunchy fried leeks adorning breakfast skillets. Eat here and your insta-story will be strong.   WE DRANK:   Bloody Mary - undrinkable due to it being far too salty. I sent it back which I never do! I will note that my friend's bloody mary was good so not sure where the overly saltiness came from in my drink.  Matcha Latte - the replacement drink was made so strong that it has no discernible flavor other than straight alcohol.   WE ATE:  Cannoli Donuts - were too dense for my liking with not enough filling to balance out.  Herb Fried Chicken - The chicken was moist and not dry so that was a win. However, salt again dominated the dish and that seems lazy to rely so heavily on salt alone when there are so many other seasoning out there to use for flavor.    I'm all for being inventive and having fun with food but the taste needs to be there too. Unfortunately, I was disappointed by pretty much everything I ordered, add to that the long wait-time and I haven't been back to Hash Kitchen since this poor visit.

SVuf2HZm3UCeY7VjD-CA5g.text: I'm giving them two stars because my potatoes were good and the atmosphere is nice. That's where it starts and stops, my food was underwhelming and didn't meet my expectations. I had the side order of pancakes, they were tasteless and borderline plain gross. The third visit wasn't a charm and we won't be back. Not sure why there's always a wait a such a mediocre place. Done and some.

LnsdRtnF_DIWHkkaDgayig.text: Came back and service was stellar, food was fantastic..  Lemon pancakes were fluffy and full of flavor.  Mimosa flight was fantastic!  Definitely sharable, but I didn't!!!   The vibe/atmosphere is such a great party..   Recommended to anyone for brunch!

7UYUuv9QpTmrxTsn8BT3Dw.text: At the recommendation of my son to stop by the Hash Kitchen for a late breakfast. All I can say is, WOW! This is place is the place to be for breakfast and brunch. Located on Ray just east of the 101 freeway in Chandler the spacious restaurant offers a menu that will satisfy everyone.  My wife ordered the chicken and waffles and let me tell you this is definitely a go-to dish if you want chicken that is full of flavor topped with leeks. The waffles are very tasty and compliments the dish to perfection. My son ordered the French toast and he said it made his top 5 list of the best French toast he has ever had. I ordered the veggie scrambler, this dish was loaded with veggies from sun dried tomatoes to asparagus mixed in with egg whites. The pancakes were awesome and is a must have.  Pack some patience if you are planning on going mid-morning, wait times can be up to 1hr. We went around 2pm and we were able be seated right away....this place is well worth the wait.  The service was magnificent, Kendra waited on us and she was awesome, attentive, friendly, and made our visit worth going back. Dominic one of the managers stopped by to give some background on the restaurant and to share some long-term vision for expansion.   We circled back the next day after church for a pick up order and dayum!!!  YES MISTER!!!!!

f-O_uRsLqpZUoZUwb4hu4Q.text: The place was extremely busy on Saturday before Memorial Day! It was our first time here, the DJ was a little to loud:( nice touch though. The Bloody Mary Bar was amazing ( Little To pricey ) glass not big enough for the amount of stuff you could put in it! Staff super attentive! c1_rLrlJMsCMt-_uRV5LmQ.text: Fun atmosphere & good place to brunch & grab drinks with your friends. You can expect to wait about 40min - 1 hour to be seated when you during the weekend. They try to seat you as fast they can but with people taking full advantage of the Bloody Mary bar, getting a table can take you awhile. They also don't take reservations unless you come with a large party.   Not sure about during the week, but the weekends they have a DJ so the music is good. It's pretty loud in there so if you bring little ones, bring some headphones for them. I loved the Build your own Bloody Mary bar. Lots of toppings available to fit everyone's tastebuds. My friends and I ordered the avocado toast, breakfast burrito and banana split French toast. Food portions are huge so you can easily share a dish or not :) I'll definitely be back to try some more food!

OtULMATA5nlCOTxi6fvxSA.text: I have eaten here a few times. I like the breakfast bagel sandwiches! The waiters are always great and attentive. The last time I went I had the pleasure of meeting the manager Dominic. He was great and truly cares about his customers! Looking forward to going back. (Also his other restaurant is opening soon *Sicilian Butcher   Edit: I really hope Sicilian butcher doesn't play the music as loud as Hash...it's even loud outside. My dad can only hear out of one ear so it sucks.

HcJUoTyGfORNhqUze2mGeg.text: Food was great, coffee even better.  Dominic was super nice and the service was great.

XUP_7UIhpgP5A7B18P8cvA.text: This is a must visit. Brought my best friend visiting from Alabama and she loved it. The food and service was great as always. The Banana Split Brioche French Toast is amazing! Dom came by our table and was so welcoming. Super nice guy. Made sure our experience was awesome!  The atmosphere was electric. I absolutely love this place. Great for everyone.

-DYgVmEzqTfc3eQBKvnpPQ.text: Fun place with a different vibe for the Chandler scene. It's  a great experience  to build your own bloody and there is nothing else like it in Chandler. Large portions, friendly service. Good place to have a Sunday Funday. Look forward to their future concepts and menu updates, especially with an addition of a GF menu.

2O2Pni7hFeLWYxhGbx7L4w.text: I was really excited to check this place out! I heard about their breakfast cocktails and knew immediately I needed to visit.  The first thing that really put me off was the entrance to the restaurant...... there is really no clear sign to distinguish the "front" door, they have two doors at the front of the building both on different sides, there were no signs outside pointing to the "correct" door, nor was the "correct" door propped open so when I approached the building- being that this was my first time here, I went to enter on the far left, and I noticed through the window that there were chairs in front of the door- as if to use them as a barrier, I was confused so when I reached for the door handle and the door opened I also noticed that there was no host podium near by and there was a family to my immediate left that was busy eating their breakfast...... That "front entrance" situation SERIOUSLY needs to be revised. One, the "wrong" door should not have been unlocked, two, put up a sign or something, it looked rather tacky having the chairs sitting in front of the door... my friend that I met with said she also did the same thing when entering and I also observed 3 other couples make the same "mistake".   I was slightly disappointed when the cereal shooters arrived- although they were delicious, I wish they were a little larger in size, or that 1/3 of the drink wasn't whip cream topping.. I also ordered the chicken tinga frittata, the taste was alright but was a little disappointed that the dish only came with 2 tortillas, especially since it was a $15 plate.... I feel 3-4 tortillas would have been appropriate for the price and for the amount of egg the plate comes with.  I definitely plan on coming back to try a different dish and to try out the Bloody Mary bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

1-3iapqTL19sLYrpzUjB7g.text: Great food, fast service, bloody mary bar, in a beautiful people part of town, and a frickin DJ people! This is a must try for a great experience. Opening up a spot off 98th and Northern next year too. Thank you to Dominic, "guest relations" great guy and our waiter, Soufiane, was on point!

PHS5bFhXFpQJqmWHWuTa_w.text: If you want to grab an expensive, okay breakfast at an extremely loud place, this place is for you. We decided to come here because the reviews were all remotely good, wait time wasn't bad and food looked good.  It's basically a bar with loud club music. Not great for families or if you want to have a quiet breakfast to talk and relax.  Waitress could barely hear us as we ordered.  Food wasn't bad but lacked in some ways. We ordered the coconut - almost French toast: barely any syrup, never tasted almond, and only had like 5 small pieces of caramelized bananas (definitely not enough). So we ordered some more bananas that came out cold and chopped up in a cup that they charged us an extra $2 for.  Also ordered their Huevos Rancheros hash: meat was too tough, lacking in flavor. Honestly couldn't even taste the "guacamole" that was on top.  My friends ordered the avocado toast and said it was good so I guess that's something.  But we'll probably never be willing to come back here again.

Ac3sfXEA87H981JZucrClw.text: Great location, food, and Service. Best Bloody Mary bar I've been to.   The  avocado toast has an awesome twist. Pork, bacon, and avocado on brioche bread! It was GIANT. Shared it with my wife which filled us both up and made for a light check.

Tv7sD_10sZ6CV5YL84BdfQ.text: This place is good. I would give 5 stars but some important details was missed with our service. Overall the food was delicious and flavorful just lukewarm. I got the Mexicana and my husband got Christina's  Tamale Cakes, which he felt was very flavorful. We will be back for sure.

_9aQDf7CJnCrEgT0a53zGg.text: This is hands down my favorite place for brunch.  Their coffee is unbelievable, and they give you an giant mug to drink it from.  The menu is varied and everyone can find something that suits their taste.  I adore the chicken and waffles.  Even better than the food and coffee is the staff.  Dominic the manager comes by for a chat and to see how things are going every meal.  It is rare to find a restaurant where you feel so welcome, it's truly one of my favorites.

GjZC71mO1yYYhZDm2oVXqQ.text: Excellent food and service! Jesus and Zack were our servers, very attentive, great service. Dominic the manager checked on us several times, very nice. Restaurant is very clean, modern decor, nice atmosphere. I went on a Friday, our server mentioned they have a DJ on the weekends. Food was great! I had the veggie scramble, veggies were fresh and crisp! I also had the mocha coffee which was very tasty. They have a Bloody Mary bar that we did not try this time but it looked great! My husband had the herb fried chicken hash, he enjoyed it a lot. Our girls had a kids waffle with fruit, they liked it and the fruit was fresh. Overall great experience, we will be back again soon!  Second visit as good as the first! Added pics below!

ABeOLJWMOif1cgg6UgF_lg.text: Well this was my 1st time here and will definitely be my last !  I have no idea where to start as from beginning to end , it just wasn't good. The service was awful, the manager did not listen, food was cold and tasteless, even after it was sent back. I just don't see the hype around this place.   My waitress from the beginning did not want to listen to what I wanted, i explained I was vegetarian but she did not go over the menu with me when I was trying to ask questions about topping that could be added from the list of veggies all she said was ok. So one would assume the others would come on it, well that's not the case she said she chose the four items I could have herself ..... huh ? Why would you not ask me have to choose the four toppings I like ? Nope,she decided to pick them. So of course I didn't like it ( SHOCKER). I asked for the eggs on the side as I don't eat them, they came out on top. ( I sent this back twice, I  was over it )  My husbands food was Luke warm ( biscuits & gravy ) he was so disappointed as this is his favorite. It Didn't have  much taste either. He had to ask for a straw three times and never got it. Could not get a refill of coffee to save his life. ( this is a weekday mind you. No one is in there). The manager came over, NEVER apologized for the miscommunication or food. Never asked me what was going on . Just was telling me what was on the menu and where I read it wrong. Obviously I said ,Since I don't work here she could  have told me, this is my options .....she was not concerned with my experience or cold food at ALL-  Bottom line they all seemed a bit on edge as well as rude.  I hope if you try this place it's better for you , definitely not on my top places to eat.

We met with Dominic The manager he's running a great service. I had the Spanish frittata and it was delicious.  I'm definitely going back and bringing another friend

afUvoPDC6M0tVx2kuCXQ_w.text: This is my second time at this restaurant and they did not disappoint. Our server Amy recommended the carnitas hash and it was AH-MAZING. Our drinks (Mimosa Flight) and food came out quickly and Amy checked on us often. The manager Domenic was so nice and welcoming; he came by our table and made sure we were satisfied. p6zNwHtEWLgc19HS-yjBzA.text: Second time here, and the food was delicious. Great place for brunch, only thing was it was very busy and wished we would've gotten a better table and a bit cooler inside. It was a bit hot inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Connoli pancakes

nMUvuqlxWqlZs7WRYy06Uw.text: The atmosphere is awesome, no doubt about that. It's loud and fun. The wait is amazing, it's like waiting in line at a packed club for lunch on a weekend. It's definitely a spot to take out of town visitors for me. The prices are very high, the presentation of the food is terrific. It's definitely picturesque food porn. But now we get down to the taste:  Breakfast bruschetta: This was very good, some better than others with the 3 different flavors. But overall very good.   Chicken and waffles: the waffle was good, but the chicken was sooooo dry. Very disappointing because the presentation is so beautiful. Overall, not willing to try that out again. Could've just been this time, but for a $14 piece of chicken. I expect that thing to be tender and juicy.   Ranchero hash: It was good but nothing great. The carne asada was dry and very thin. It was tough to cut so you really ended up eating the meat way faster than the rest of the hash bowl. The amount of potatoes in the hash skillet is ridiculous.  Carne asada corn bread hash: same with this one, dry piece of meat but everything around it was good. For the price of these meals, the meat definitely needs some work.   Carnitas hash: probably the best one out of the bunch because the carnitas is somewhat cut up. So it's much easier to eat a little of the meat with the different combinations of sides.   S'mores French toast: AWESOME. But then again it's very hard to mess up French toast and adding Nutella, graham cracker, melted marshmallows, powdered sugar, and maple syrup will make just about anything taste amazing. Overall, damn good.   S'mores hot chocolate: $9?!? Really?!? The hot chocolate didn't even taste as good as the $1 pack of 4 Hershey's Pre mixed ones. The toppings of course were awesome, see the description of the s'mores French toast above. Overall, no way worth the price.   Chocolate coffee in a cone: the concept was very new to me. It didn't taste bad at all, but $10 is a little too much for a shot of coffee and a small waffle cone.   Overall, it's somewhere I'd probably visit a few times a year when I have visitors in town. But I wouldn't make this my regular weekend spot. They really do have some cool twists on breakfast food. But the looks definitely outshine the taste while the price is pretty damn expensive. 4 of us came out to $160

oBgDgXbzlvWFcherBRTtRQ.text: I took my family here for the first time based on the excellent reviews that Hash Kitchen has received. Unfortunately we left completely frustrated. First of all this is a breakfast restaurant yet at 9:00am Sunday morning you would think that it's a hip hop dance club. We had to yell over the music in order to talk to each other. I am a big fan of eggs Benedict so I ordered the original style and others ordered the specialty styles. When our food came everyone looked at mine and said "what the heck is that". It's as if they didn't even try to make the regular Eggs Benedict impressive at all in comparison to the others, it is plain, boring and small. Lastly, we ordered a bowl of fruit for our 2 year old and after she ate a couple of pieces we noticed that the pieces of fruit at the bottom of the bowl had been eaten already. I understand that trendy hipster restaurants are the new thing and I could of left peacefully with the loud music and half assed Eggs Benedict but serving food that has been eaten to a 2 year old is just plain unacceptable.

JuhEz--rJ2mf9GvPSRhbpQ.text: Went here for a birthday breakfast celebration on October 9th and was not disappointed!  The manager and server paid special attention to us, and even surprised us with special drinks with cotton candy!  Tried several things on the menu, and they were all delicious!  You have to try the bacon board!  Mimosa flight was enjoyable too!  This place is worth the wait!

K7hlSwP5ueovOaVD9gHzgw.text: So happy that they opened a location in Chandler.  The food is amazing.  The service is great.  The manager Dominic is awesome.  He is always checking on everyone to make sure they are happy and of course we are always happy to meet a fellow Cape Codder!  The only negative is how loud they play the music.  You have to yell your order to the server.

J-aXxbXvjwL0UYZ_qhDJIw.text: We loved the food and atmosphere. Kendra and Dom are fabulous.  The Bloody Mary bar is so yummy with so many options.

TU6x5jGT4VR0x052ZEYFLg.text: Such a great new place. Amanda was awesome.  We will for sure be back!!  The Bloody Mary bar is something to check out. Really appreciated Dominick chatting with us.

eU6i83NtPim6VH1WAXgR1w.text: We've been looking at coming here for about 8 months since moving here across the country. Coming from New England we've been pressed hard to find a brunch place that rivalled that of our home favourites but this could certainly be it. Normally we shy away because of the line out the door but we got here about 8:30 on a Saturday and were able to get seated right away. We had very prompt service coffee and water within minutes of walking in the door and a very knowledgeable server let us know the crowd favourites. We ended up ordering the Corned Beef Poutine hash (ended up being to-go since our eyes were bigger than our stomachs), pretzel Benedict and Pineapple upside down pancakes. I got a pineapple mimosa and my friend got the cereal shooters. Overall was a great experience, came out quickly and was delicious. Huge portions. Domenic came over to ask about our experience, now, normally I get why the managers come around they're trying to check in so I usually brush them off with the yup everything was great and move on but Domenic seemed so genuine and sincere he genuinely was interested in our personal experience and let us know that if it's ever just the two of us the bar is almost always open so we can skip that line we've been avoiding for two months if that interests us he also let us know about their other resteraunt The Sicilian Butcher that we will definitely be trying out it the future. Thank you Domenic and your staff for a very enjoyable and delicious brunch experience. We will definitely be back.

30S0n9OMnO9hNKjeGRMlzg.text: Been to other Hash Kitchen locations but this one is by far the best! Not only is the atmosphere and decor awesome but the service was outstanding and they have items on the menu that aren't available at other locations. Dominic, one of the owners kept checking up on us, which was great, he really made us feel appreciated and welcomed! Bloody Mary bar is outstanding! Literally so many toppings to choose from! I tried the cannoli pancakes this time and they did not disappoint! Can't wait to go back and work my way through their menu!!

7-iybj5LuCDmbqRhGLeofQ.text: if you want brunch go here!!! best service, fun atmosphere and domenic is the best!! love this place, food and mimosas!!

dwNZxh3HIHDhmou7QAFPeg.text: Came to celebrate my beautiful friends birthday and enjoy a great brunch. First off... the environment was perfect for a morning date with my girls. Fun music dancing as we ate the amazing breakfast! The lemon ricotta pancakes to die for! Dominic the manager was so sweet and super attentive! And our server Gabby was the best. Just be ready to enjoy a party and great food and it's all good! Will definitely be back!

Li8FRT0sYCNqRmy0IP8gdw.text: Love the Bloody Mary bar! Fun place for Sunday Funday brunch. Good menu - lots of good choices.

h47-NdEG9FdiUtQzAJF5cg.text: This is an interesting place for brunch. I was really surprised about DJ. It is basically like eating in a club. The food there is a little overpriced based on the taste. The Bloody Mary bar is really fancy, you basically can put anything in your bloody Mary, but you should ask a sample before you order because it is really spicy. One major disappointment is that the water cup smell and taste like bacon. That is a little gross. I think hygiene should be the most important thing to a restaurant.

XD5u_MpshRmBBR1Z1C-pQg.text: First off, the carnitas hash is delicious! Every meal we ordered was a very generous portion. Still a vey new location so there are some kinks to work out but very attentive service. Dominic, one of the managers, is very enjoyable to talk with and he was very receptive to constructive criticism and had even asked us for feedback. He has a very friendly and welcoming personality and really was the highlight of the meal!

TH00xuax4iwzvMYMk1Y8kw.text: Great atmosphere! The menu has many ambitious ideas for breakfast foods but unfortunately the cooks are missing the mark. From cold quarter diced potatoes as a side to overcooked poached eggs on top of a completely unseasoned potato cake it was just simply not good. I have seen a recent trend of using corned beef lunch meat in place of homemade corned beef and is extremely disappointing to see that this imaginative of a venue is taking the easy route and doing just this. The over arching theme here is if they executed their recipes better it would easily be my go to spot.

cjj9cAZheHBKRqArVEp9Fw.text: Jesus was extremely helpful with the menu, upbeat and fast service! Definitely will be coming to visit him again!!

B4nxdjUowolvWCBpu8wIAg.text: Great place.  I'm from Cali and my brother took us there amazing!!  The owner Gino and our waiter Toby were awesome!!  Thank you now going to try there new place the Sicilian Butcher!!!!

Eutzi-_5PSH_wu3DPnvmjg.text: Great first experience at Hash Kitchen! When we arrived on Saturday morning, there was an hour wait for 4 people, but we were excited to try this new place so we decided to wait. There were a couple of hiccups once we made it inside (the poached eggs were overcooked on my dish) but all of our concerns were quickly taken care of. The service was excellent, the manager Dominic came by multiple times to chat and make sure everything was alright. Our server was super efficient and another manager (blond lady) came by a couple times as well to check on the food. The Corn Cakes and Carnitas Hash were the best dishes we tried.  The music is a bit loud but gave a great energy. We will be back!

fRPV-CB4dA4-YTnWkH1wgQ.text: I went today and the kitchen was running slow. I ordered a drink and when it finally got to the table ... I informed the server we'd have to head out, due to being in a time crunch. She still charged me $12 for my drink! I didn't even touch it!

QukDiFatQP7ffQhwhzWtpw.text: Very trendy brunch spot you'll want to check out. Prepare yourself for a wait but it is definitely worth it. Something for everyone and Dominic is the most accommodating host you could ask for. Try it out!

BsF1wGjrrzZ3jc5-qU9FNA.text: Last minute find on Yelp early Sunday morning. Thanks Yelp for the suggestion. What an awesome experience from ambience to decor to service. Their team members Melisa, Javier and Dominic were welcoming, informative and energetic . Shout out to the Dj who played an awesome set new and old hit. Thank you everyone for making this visit an awesome experience!

hVRPX5TuVMx2vWeLK0RqMw.text: This restaurant is extremely fun! Not only that but the manager Dominic takes great care of you. I have a gluten allergy and he went out of his way to modify my dish for me. Highly recommend it

WNWWduC1zCv4L_265jlklw.text: Such a lively fun place for breakfast/brunch. Food is amazing and the Bloody Mary bar and mimosas are great. All ages will enjoy this place

gvFi6owlBBGeEnkEmg4shA.text: All the food was so amazing! We showed up with about 16 + people and they accommodated us right away, and Dominic was so awesome to keep coming over and checking on us and asking how everything was. It was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back!

zR2dqafw-xItBVXBUXdPyg.text: Went to Hash this morning - Wow!!  Charming atmosphere, great Mimosa bar, and great food.  Lots of sugar on the menu - and so many ways to enjoy it!  The highlight was Dom "Guido", our host.  He greeted us, and keep coming over to our table to see how we were doing.  So fun, friendly, and an all around great guy to have as the face of your establishment!  I would love to see a "Sampler" of many of the items on their menu - all sounded so good, and I want just a bite of each one.  Hopefully, next time we come back, they will have that.  And, we WILL be back - it is a shame they close so early (2:00 pm).  I could definitely spend more time at that Bloody Mary bar!  :)  Thanks, Dom Guido, for a wonderful breakfast!

V60uBXmGOyHJ2pc2lFOVmw.text: Fun fun fun! Vibrant great people watching fantastic menus and the Bloody Mary bar -WOWSA. Very impressed that the management checked in to see how we were doing!

JQEwwYtUmYggUBBZbn07Dw.text: Holly hell their food is good.  Drinks to boot...

j5ayUOTvTykxKu7wZm8CyA.text: Wow! This was our first visit here and I can say we will be frequent customers. Everything about the Hash Kitchen in Chandler was outstanding! The atmosphere is welcoming. Our server, Kendra, was wonderful and very attentive. My strawberry Mimosa was delicious. Dominic came over to the table to welcome us to the Hash Kitchen. The food? Fantastic! Everything was delicious and we cannot wait to go back to try some of the other items on the menu. It's going to be a difficult decision, because there is such a great selection. They are definitely deserving of a 5 star rating and probably even a 10 star rating!

e2kkVWAiOETED8ktBV7m4Q.text: We had our Christmas party here last Saturday morning. I never even knew this place was here. It was awesome! There were 9 of us. The server was friendly and very efficient. Even with the place being busy he was attentive. I had the cereal shooters. Loved them! I never liked Captain Crunch as a kid so it surprised me that it was my favorite. Some of my coworkers had the mimosa flight which they said were good. I ordered Cristina's tamale cakes which were very tasty. The corn cakes had a sweet flavor so if you don't like sweet with your savory then this might not be for you. I like the 2 paired together. The only disappointment for me is the Brooklyn Brew that I ordered at the end. My fault for not reading the menu more thoroughly but I thought it had coffee in it because it was under the "craft caffeine" section. Holy cow that drink was strong! Anyway, it was supposed to come with a bomboloni and alas, mine was missing. :-(  If not for the missing bomboloni this would have definitely been 5 stars. Unfortunately, I didn't realize it was missing until I went to write the review or else I would have said something to our server. It was probably the shooters that dulled my memory. LOL! Anyway, we all had a lot of fun. I plan to return many more times now that I know it exists and is right down the road from me. I've got to try the chilaquiles next, or maybe the avocado toast or the monti cristo!

Nkt1OVNsy-FOjP4SgveO4Q.text: My husband took me here last Friday 3/8 for my birthday. First time here and it was amazing. The food was delicious and to top it off the flights of mimosas were PERFECT! Dom, who was the manager over the restaurant was very personable. He came up to our table asked how was the food, the service and if we needed anything. He checked on us periodically which was nice (most supervisors or mangers at restaurants don't do that unless something wrong with the meal) and made us feel very welcomed. I would definitely be going again. Have to get there before 9am when the morning rush comes.

Doi9cZ4ROuzFGmnSK76wSw.text: Ate at Hash Kitchen last week for the first time. Loved it! After a 20 minute wait, we were seated and helped immediately...mimosas all around! Two of us got the chicken and waffles. Wow! The chicken was crunchy on the outside, and tender inside and so, so tasty. My friend had the carne asada hash with a poached egg and loved that. I wish I like bloody marys because the bar looked fantastic.  We will be back for sure as there is so much more to try!

qiYnMbJKK68CBdiHvsQ--A.text: Well- with all the great reviews-we thought we'd give it a try. When I went to give our name- the noise including music blasting on high gear hit us full force. It was packed and New Years weekend. I'll try it later on a non holiday. I know the trend is for loud music but we come to enjoy good food and good conversation over the food. BitFN_2Q3SV2RkIG434YQw.text: I came for a quick breakfast this morning, as soon as I walked in the hostesses and Manager (Dominic) greeted me as if I was family. My bartender (Alex) was phenomenal. rvHZxXCekOjx4N1Z_4Eaww.text: This place is AMAZING! This was my first time in and the place was packed. I was concerned the wait would be ridiculous. We were told 15 minutes, but only waited 10. Every member of the staff was cordial, inviting and professional. This establishment is a well oiled machine, everyone works together to ensure guests have a premium experience. Our server was Amanda and she was so nice. She took time to talk to us and ensured we had a pleasant experience. The manager, Domenic visited every table to genuinely check on every guest (not like other places where the managers are just showing their face). The owner, Joey, has really nailed it with this restaurant. The food is EXCELLENT, the service was superb and the atmosphere is fun & inviting. Oh, and they have a killer Bloody Mary Bar AND a live DJ!! These really add to the ambiance and atmosphere. I can't wait to come back!

M7-3SEy-o6zeyaJBBx7pZA.text: I love this place the people are awesome, service is great and the food is delicious. I recommend anyone to go from an amazing brunch experience.

vC-PoFkFq7FBlTnXI6MJ1A.text: I've been remiss is posting this. We absolutely LOVE this place!  My family and I have been to Hash Kitchen twice now, both times on a Sunday for brunch. The second time we came we brought our friends, so we had a party of 14 in total. Even with that large of a group at their busiest time, the team led by Dominic Viscariello (guest relations) made sure we were comfortable and got us seated as soon as possible.  Dominic came by and checked on us a few times to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. Our server Jessica was super-friendly and helpful. She made sure our friend's baby got food ASAP so as to prevent a potential meltdown. We even had three different checks based on families that were scattered about the long set of tables -- i.e. kids we sitting with their friends, adults were seated as couples but not next to their kids, etc. -- none of it was an issue for Jess.   The atmosphere, the food (including the mimosas), the friendly service.... and the DJ spinning the tunes during brunch... has made Hash Kitchen one of our favorite spots. We'll be going there regularly.

JS6uRi5YSDwdGA_C3E-C2A.text: This place is incredible! I come almost weekly! The food is phenomenal and the service is even better. Dominic Viscariello, the manager, is possibly the best human I've met! He always makes sure our food comes out on time, is delicious and that we're happy. I appreciate customer service and that is exactly why I come back to Hash Kitchen. If you want a delicious meal, great atmosphere and "home" like vibe come here!

The real reason to come here and the reason for the 4 star review is the Bloody Mary bar. It's glorious. All sorts of stuff to spear for the drink.   So skip the food and go for the bar.

My only gripe is the $32 Bloody Mary. You really have to put a lot of items to be worth it.   I recommend this place. Get there before 8:00 on Sunday if you don't want to wait.

VmBc7zFSTmhx-7M7cRCjsQ.text: Started my birthday with breakfast at Hash Kitchen in Chandler and what a great experience!!  Dominic the manager was so friendly and the food was delicious and have leftovers!!

HowA9K6Q2OVFcY5arljksQ.text: Stopped for lunch and WOW.  Service was caring and excellent, and the food, SUPERB.  We had the smoked salmon frittata,  which while excellent,  was a poor second to Christina's tamale cakes. WOW. Worth going back again and again for that alone. Small parking area in this corner of the lot so park a little away...  very busy, but I don't mind the wait when the fare is so excellent.  Attracts a younger crowd, loud music by on site DJ, and Bloody Mary bar.  Yup. Going back.

What a great concept..Brunch and Beats!! The Manager Dominic stopped by a couple times to make sure we were satisfied. Will definitely be back!

YSiEl22qCX7ixbalLpTh1Q.text: I came here this morning for a birthday brunch with my family and I am so happy we found this place! The atmosphere is nice and lively with a DJ playing music in the restaurant. I personally liked the music although I'm sure people with different preferences might not. There is an outdoor seating if the music is too loud.  We arrived at the restaurant around 9:30am and our wait time was approx 15 min they said but I think we were seated even earlier than that time.   Our waitress was sooo nice and although the restaurant was packed and bustling, she took her time to provide us with everything we needed and gave us recommendations from the menu. She consistently checked up on our table throughout our meal and gave us a warning beforehand that the size of each dish is large. For a family of three adults and one child we ordered three dishes and we were all stuffed by the end of it. Our dishes came out quite fast and we were stunned by the size and appearance of the dishes. I ordered the banana split french toast which was SO good. If you have a sweet tooth like I do in the morning, I highly recommend this dish!   Will be coming back here in the near future! We had a very great experience.

uEAsSHut3t7B2703lDilUg.text: Excellent food, service was great, very clean. And best of all was Dominic the manager. He was awesome and very friendly. We will definitely be back.

DoidiXFnEpS-r9jB6xM0Ng.text: Came here after pats run without any wait! Enjoyed a fantastic mimosa flight and all the dishes were to die for!!! Domenic the manager came over and made us feel so welcome and ensured our time was fantastic! I can't wait to come back here soon and try the rest of the menu!

9ct81tQVGBVX_6GEIrNyTw.text: Food and drinks are totally amazing. One of the best breakfast spots in the Phoenix area. Service however.......ok ---horrible. Sat at the bar because I'm a bartender myself and usually that's where you get the best service. Not the case here. The bartenders act like you are being a pain in the ass. Admittedly we have been here for 2.5 hrs. But we have continually ordered either food or drinks and planned on paying our "rent". But the bartenders have such attitudes. And take forever to bring stuff you asked for even though you've paid for it. Not talking about refills, which they also suck at. Spent almost $150 here for 2 ppl and kind of regretting not just walking over to Whole Foods for a couple drinks. It's really unfortunate because their bar stools are super comfy and I could hang out and spend another $100.

A47IO_cTbLAZyvb2bo-8cA.text: Ok this is our new fave breakfast/brunch spot! Less than a mile from where I live, it is a new-age place with a HUGE Bloody Mary bar, if you're into bloody Mary's. I have ordered the carne asada breakfast burrito both times I've been there and WOW. Loved it. My fiance ordered the banana split French toast, it had mascarpone cheese in an Ice cream cone.. TO DIE FOR. Love this place!!

VC6rpSsr0j895CNcEQu7Ig.text: I love Hash Kitchen! I am a sucker for anything brunch and this place takes brunch to the next level.  The food options have something for everyone. Although the prices seem a little high the amount of food you get is well worth it. Every time I come in I order something different and I have never been upset with any of the dishes.  The drink options make it even more of a fun experience. I ordered the Mega Boba Mimosa once and it was like I was at a carnival. The 25oz mimosa class topped off cotton candy and a pin wheel was such a treat. The Bloody Mary bar is also spectacular. They have so many different options.  Thanks to the staff for always making me feel welcome. Jessica, our server multiple times, is always smiling and very attentive. She goes above and beyond for her customers without any hesitation. Keri and Dominic (the managers) love the community and make a point to say hi to everyone with a smile. They remember there customers and have no problem taking by the time to get to know you. Don't miss this place. Even if it's as a special occasion to treat yourself it's worth it.

z7AMpKdA18jD6N8p2XMx9A.text: I have been craving to try this place out for quite some time, and finally got the chance. I have tried before but weekend's seem to be really busy at this place, for good reason. I would plan to get on a wait list if coming on the weekend's. However, Monday I was able to get seated without having to wait. That being said, I had the Avocado Toast which was amazing! A little messy which I didn't mind because the food was great! Service was fast, which was awesome.  Great experience overall!!

qbaLtJmf6dAnTPGwJU5EcQ.text: Had the best experience here! Domenic the manager was an absolute delight and made us feel so welcome. The food was delicious and. Came out quickly! vWAQoAn1D_mvRUBiD1NEiQ.text: We came here from out of town and it was quite delicious. The menu has so many options I wanted to get everything! I ended up getting corned beef Benedict which came served on a fried potato patty. We decided to share the gigantic Bloody Mary to try out the bar. So let me just tell you we did not look at the price when we got this and to our surprise this Bloody Mary cost more than our food. About $30 so you best believe we loaded our Bloody Mary with three of everything in the bar. To be honest we could have just had that as our meal the thing was HUGE! The vibe here is really cool, a DJ anywhere is always a good time. Dominic was super sweet and attentive as a manager should be. I'd give this place more stars but I just think $30 for a Bloody Mary is insane but maybe I'm just a cheap college student? Food was amazing, vibe is great, Bloody Mary was intense.

ILrk7vjH2IFu58C9J8bDJw.text: We love love love, Hash Kitchen! The food and Bloody Mary bar are our favorite. Domenic seriously makes our visit over the top. He always makes us feel special and like family.

NKMoLPVS81jLf69UqYugDw.text: Came here for brunch with my boyfriends mom and we had an amazing time! We were seated quickly and warmly by the hosts on the patio and greeted in a timely manner by our server. Though we chose not to partake in the Bloody Mary bar or mimosa flight, it all looked amazing and Instagram-worthy. We ordered the Pretzel Benedict and the Corned Beef Benedict and were impressed my how quickly it came out based on how busy it was! My Benedict was so good I didn't even take a picture. Poached eggs, bacon, beer cheese and fried onion strings atop a warm soft pretzel? Sign me UP! Dominic, the manager on duty came to the table at the end of our meal and made sure we were having a great experience which really elevated everything! Having been open only 7 weeks I'm impressed! This place will be a new favorite of ours! See you again soon!

Uy_amdG4849kCqvIgpFYng.text: Yesterday I visited Hash Kitchen for the very first time with a friend.  The young ladies that greeted us at the front desk were super friendly. The place was busy which to me speaks volumes of a restaurant.  We were seated within about 6 minutes from arrival.  Our waiter, Patrick, was great.  He answered all of our questions.  He suggested the Crab Benedict which I ordered. I absolutely loved it!  Great suggestion!  Our waiter made his rounds at the appropriate times. Domenic, the Guest Relations rep, stopped by our table and introduced himself.  He was making sure that we were being taken care of to our satisfaction.  The place had a fun and inviting atmosphere. We really enjoyed our visit.  Thank you!

9GmiKIa-Tc05oY6heQxnAA.text: We went back two weekends in a row just for the Fall Turkey brunch specials! The food is always amazing, they have a huge selection. Cocktails and mimosas are a must and when they get the slushy machine back up and running I highly recommend the mimosa slushie. Domenic stopped by our table several times to make sure we had what we needed and to chat with us a little bit. He truly wants to make your brunch experience the best it can be and is so friendly. Build you own Bloody Mary bar is always fun and this place is great for bringing out of towners for a proper weekend brunch. I can't say enough good things about Hash Kitchen! It's always worth the wait

EbPGAgj4vyk8reoX6wV2vQ.text: If you decide to go to Hash Kitchen here's what you'll get: loud, bumpin' music, a fun and delicious assortment of adult beverages, and generous portions of brunch food with a twist. If you expect to go somewhere for a quiet cup of joe and some bland food this is not your place.  This place is FUN!! My mom, son and I went here for brunch this AM. I loved that it was loud enough so my 3 year old could just be a toddler without people judging us. I did the Bloody Mary bar and my mom did a mimosa flight, both were delicious! To eat I got the Bacon Board with an assortment of bacon, cheese, fig jam and bagels... yum. The jalapeno bacon was AMAZING. My mom got the avocado toast which is HUGE!! Oh my gosh that looked like a ton of food. So worth it. And my son got the chocolate chip pancakes which were delicious also.  Food was great. Drinks great. The manager Dominic was very welcoming and genuinely made sure all of the customers in the restaurant were having a great time. We will definitely be back again!

_B7PqioTy0tZgOP5NGg9lA.text: Let me start by saying this place has a fun vibe.  Great Bloody Mary bar, lively music and an intriguing menu.  Sunday at 10:30 is when we arrived and were told the wait was 40 minutes.  We waited an hour and they told us they were running behind.  After another 20 minutes we found 2 seats at the bar,  so we just seated ourselves.  I love avocado toast, so that is what I ordered.  Let me warn you, if you love avocado toast, do not order the avocado toast here. It is 2 very thick pieces of brioche with a very, very thin layer of avocado spread topped with a shredded sweet pork, a layer of thick slab bacon, an egg and greasy fried shoestring onions.  There is nothing light or healthy about this dish, which in and of itself is not a bad thing.  But there was no relief from it.  Not an herb, fruit or leaf of any kind on the plate. It was extremely heavy.  I did not enjoy it.  My friend had the berry pancakes.  He was saddened by the fact that there were very few berries in his dish.  The batter itself was tasty but the blueberries were scarce at best. And on top of the pancakes was a very simple garnish of a few blueberries and half of a strawberry.  The coffee was just ok.  They serve lots of cocktails that look interesting, but i don't see myself coming back to try them.  I believe the place would benefit from improved management, and a more thoughtful approach to preparing and serving dishes.

j7w7-QpkP6AR0JzgaiiLmg.text: Manager Dominic was amazing!! Nice to see him not only representing the Hash Kitchen brand but living it! I brought my parents to eat here for the first time. They don't get out much and so I decided to bring them here as the food here is amazing! We  had a great time! Seeing my parents smile while talking to Dominic was very heart warming and so appreciated! I love my parents sooo much and I am so happy he made this experience for us so special! We will definitely be back!

0_Gq3eyZELMY6VjvwGD5yA.text: Best brunch place in AZ!! Always the best service, best food, best drinks etc. Been here 3 times in 1.5 months! Go see Domenic he is awesome !

LiCQGXqy_wP8I6tWt5_kRQ.text: The place has appealing decor and a diverse menu. This was our first visit. We chose to come early and beat the crowds. The hosts who greeted us were the proprietors, so they were very friendly. The server was...lacking in personality.  We asked for recommendations and she was not too helpful. Our food looked better than it tasted, but we are willing to give it another try. The DJ and Bloody Mary Bar are a big draw for us. The patio is a great place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Avocado Toast. Brioche is too much bread and soggy. Would have preferred a nice (thinner) slice of hearty wheat.

We had a great experience, loved the food and place! We asked a couple other servers for recommendations for the area and everyone was helpful!Thanks for having us! We'll be back next visit!

6cOBy5MB0Zjr72N44pNaOQ.text: Jesus saved me with his flight of mimosas. The best mimosa I've ever had. Food was great and the Bloody Mary bar is fantastic. Tons of options for a brunch place, a great and friendly atmosphere. Can't wait to come back!

qFrlitqgdPH5wso9j7u5-Q.text: I didn't like my experience at all. Perhaps I'm not the demographic for this place. First, the music volume and choice is overwhelming. This isn't a restaurant. I feel like I am clubbing in Miami. Second I'm not a day drinker which could explain why I felt the music noise level was awful. We literally had to shout to talk to each other. Third I don't enjoy waiting 30 minutes from the time I order to get my food. This doesn't count for the 15 minutes I waited to sit and the 10 plus minutes I waited to give my order. As for The food it was flavorful for the most part although they reinvented food styles that didn't need reinventing IMHO. Pancakes were very good. Eggs cooked excellent. But it was a huge miss for me. I guess my expectations were out of line for this experience. I was there for a yummy relaxing brunch and that place was not relaxing. I won't be back unless it's a day drinking bachelorette or some other booze fest clubbing day.

n2Fobl9ur0t4sffzx_7TXA.text: Holy moly this place is fabulous! We started with the Bloody Mary bar which has to be one of the best I have ever been to. From there we were seated and waited on by the sweetest waitress who had great recommendations for first time here. It was very difficult to make a decision because everything on the menu looks so good! Our food was absolutely delicious! Cannot wait to go back for the Bloody Mary bar and to try something different on the menu.

icmkalMRNUYUuJ5PYLtaAA.text: Came by a couple of weekends ago - place was packed but well worth it!  Dominic the manager is EXTREMELY friendly!  He makes it a point to stop by each table to ensure that guests are having a good experience!  The bloody Mary bar is by far the best in Arizona!  Will be back this weekend for Sunday Funday!

8WlE7w6IaD7DT4FG7Sddsg.text: Amazeballs! Fun, great service and great food. Managers come around to make sure that you're having a great experience. Avocado toast that rivals any other and the bloody mary bar? Forget about it!

6O9sOyP2s6oSto6ZkUOWZw.text: Nice to have a new place in the area for breakfast business meetings. I give Hash Kitchen 5 stars for the decor and atmosphere. Super comfortable, clean and bright. Since I'm vegan/gluten-free, I got the fruit plate (thanks for having this HK!) and the fruit was fresh and sweet. I didn't partake of the bloody mary bar, but the concept is cool. Check this place out! I'll be back.

Gpe0ie3UJaj-eW3EWVL-1Q.text: Great place to eat! I've eaten the biscuits and gravy with sausage every time. My wife keeps having the Chilaquiles. My kids share the french toast since the slices are gigantic. Domenic, a manager, always makes you feel like family and is genuine when he asks about your experience and the food.

QUDvJSh3EDGY57LJ33KGAg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE hash kitchen! We ordered and shared the bacon board, cannoli and berries pancake (since one order of pancakes include 4 stacks, we ordered 2 kinds!) and they were absolutely to die for! I thought the cannoli pancake was genius. The staff are super friendly also. The manager came up to our table and asked us how our experience is and to say the least, I will definitely be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

VA7wstHzIcK-m5kS5-Wqzg.text: I had a terrible experience at Hash Kitchen in Chandler today. A woman who was clearly overly intoxicated caused a scene and said the worst thing a person can say to another person. It was not only uncomfortable for me but for the family standing behind us and the employees that witnessed it. I was shaking and very confused why a random person would threaten my safety at a restaurant at 11:30 in the morning. I told the hostesses what had happened and they were very thoughtful and comforting. The general manager named Anh was anything but helpful. After myself and the employee that witnessed the incident told the manager what had happened he said he would talk to the woman. I watched him walk away from me and never actually speak to the woman that threatened me and caused a scene. I also told him that I thought she was overly intoxicated but they kept serving her at the bar anyway. This was the worst restaurant experience I've ever had and I'm extremely disappointed that the general manager wasn't able to make the situation better or make me feel comfortable. Because of this I left the restaurant and my friends and I will never be back. It's important that customers not only have a good time at your establishment but feel safe. It may be uncomfortable to cut someone off from drinking but as a server (especially the GM) of a restaurant it's your job to make sure guests are not over served and to deal with any issues involving an overly intoxicated person appropriately.

A0I2WviPVX1M3BJuf6z0yA.text: Breakfast clubbing.... DJ's mixing some Bruno, Disco Ball spinning, Bobbys "lost the avocado" toast and the most amazing Mary Bar...... Alex behind the bar and Domenic the manager were spot on on!  Service, food, ambiance are all Bomb! A must visit! Thanks Hash Kitchen, we will be regulars

KQGM-1jNmpTP0GiUxfyYfw.text: This place is awesome, very welcoming and attractive. Vegetarian friendly and the food is delicious and the portion is perfect. Dom, the Italian guy was very nice and sincere.. I'm from California and this was a perfect start for my weekend!!!

v0Ma8mIjIU7QXEmpjNHw7Q.text: There's always a lot of "miscommunication " between them and the kitchen.  Don't come if you are hungry or except your order done right the first time.  This was my third visit.

L2Lzcr3Nxk-lytJdMbc_WA.text: Staff is extremely friendly, manager Dominic came to our table and was super kind and made sure we were well taken care of. Great place for breakfast or lunch and fun environment. Definitely recommend.

R3pcFHYpk1KKYtZG9oDcwQ.text: This is my 3 rd time coming and it is absolutely amazing. The food is fabulous, the mimosas are amazing and the Bloody Mary bar will blow  your mind.  What stands out to  me are the employees and Management.  They seem to be genuinely happy and enjoying their job and it makes me happy to come in .  I think the manager Dominic is outstanding.  He remembers you , asks how you are and if you need anything . He also goes around and asks the employees if they need help  Today I witnessed him talking to his employees and after he walked away they could not stop Talking about what a genuine person he is and an awesome boss  Looking forward to my next visit

HGujPaNpT078HdIR0APtpg.text: I recently had breakfast at Hash Kitchen with my husband and 3-year old daughter. The food was very good for the most part, but I'm giving it only three stars because the music is incredibly loud. So much so that's it's difficult to have a conversation. My daughter was really bothered by the noise level and wanted to leave, which is unusual for her as she enjoys being at restaurants. I wanted to like this place because of the food quality, but the overall experience was sub standard due to the noise level. Judging by the crowds, this isn't an issue for many people but if you're someone who wants to enjoy a nice breakfast with family or friends while carrying on a conversation, this is not the place. I will say, however, that the food is very good overall. The only exception is the gluten free pancakes, which were terrible (Snooze, by comparison, has great gluten free pancakes). As for the service, it was about average, although the servers are very friendly. Another good aspect of this place is the decor. They did a great job with the interior. If it weren't for the noise, we would return but won't be going back because the excessively loud music made for a poor experience.

yd3vldPJ8rXY1woDKr08wQ.text: This place was AMAZING! My sister and I were first time visitors to AZ and to Hash Kitchen! This by far was one of the best experiences we have had while here! Dominic was nothing short of phenomenal! Definitely will be coming back for this weekend brunch with a Dj too!  Can't wait! The atmosphere, food and service is impeccable!

hq9LvxKPyle56lk6DELWCQ.text: Love the simple contemporary decor and the Bloody Mary bar! Our server Jose was excellent! Food was good presentation was good. Overall it was a great experience. I would go back again.

sGgemQBcDg9YdqmIPlSQqA.text: This is by FAR, my favorite breakfast/brunch place. The food is seriously incredible. My favorite thing is the Huevos Rachero Hash, it's unlike anything I've had before I literally crave it and will drive out of my way just to eat it. They also have really great mimosas, with fresh fruit!! The cereal shooters are a must. It's a fun atmosphere as well, I would definitely recommend.

UwYqBcnjyrioX7cVzJFBnw.text: We love hash! Dominic is the best and makes brunch so fun! Food is amazing and atmosphere is incredible. Fun girls morning.

IkRNWbqTuBKTut3faCe3SA.text: Great food, clean place great atmosphere. Management came by to chat and see if there was anything they could do better. Very attentive. .

swOHwdH4jBYWR1AxomV90g.text: ALL OF THE WORKERS ARE THE MOST AMAZING PEOPLE!!!! Angelina the bartender is an absolute angel! She is so sweet and down to earth and actually cared to get to know us. After going just a few times we we're recognized by all the workers and it was like a family. Plus the food is amazing but I'm all about customer service so that's all I care about.
