3GBdR_CJ9Gan3PprxykoaQ.text: This restaurant is my new favorite go to breakfast spot. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. The manager, Domenic, takes the time to stop by each table to check in and make sure everything is nothing short of excellent. Great place to bring friends and family to enjoy a nice brunch.

K8DKuFEUnIESuTUuliBMow.text: Love how fun this place is! I've been a few times with family and with friends. It's all instagram worthy everywhere but not only that it has an amazing menu! The food is delicious and fun combinations! The bloody bar, cereal flights, and mimosa flights were a big hit!

utn3_Antj4ockvhrlfNdKA.text: Amazing food and fantastic service  Jesus, our server paid attention to every detail of our large group.  Dominic the manager went out of his way to welcome us and make sure all our needs were met. We will be back dor sure.

KKJx7M23hwN5vcoiC6S_6w.text: First time going to Hash and were really impressed with the level of service and attention. One of the managers Dominic approached us to make sure everything was going well! The food is tasty, the mimosa flight was delicious, the fruit was fresh and sweet. I was really impressed by the green chili sauce in the Carnitas hash!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

FamMqP7NOOiZFnq0fZSl-g.text: Hash Kitchen was great! The atmosphere and the food, but most of all - The service. Kim was our server and she spoke our "language." Getting a great recommended dish your server loves themselves is a bonus. She was there when we needed and smiled as she walked past when we didn't. Kim was great.  Dominic, the manager, was great too. We had a conversation quickly that went beyond the usual of "how is everything," and he made a genuine connection with my fiancee and I. I'm glad he lives in the community and that he excels in his hospitality.   Monday breakfast here was awesome and we didn't even have any drinks. We can't wait to experience a weekend now.

WmGeRZsJzUr9MVy_6jd5_A.text: Loved this place! I ordered French toast and a fried chicken skillet! I would recommend this place and if there is a wait, I'd wait!

Q20PcpgUJm5hHoybbVrJyw.text: This is the real deal when it comes to brunch. A DJ, a bloody mary station, mimosa flights, and a great selection of food, what more can you ask for? I live in New York and my boyfriend has talked Hash up all the time and when he brought me here he was not lying at all. The first time I went, we ended up waiting a little bit (30-45 min?) but I generally am used to waits so it really didn't bother me, plus there's a bar and ample waiting space for you to occupy yourself within that time.  I ordered the avocado toast hash style and I'm not sure if I'm more excited to visit my boyfriend or visit Hash just for that meal when I come back(don't tell him). Last time I visited we went straight to the bar and ended up staying there for our whole meal and Dominic started up a chat and we got into a serious convo about furniture shopping. Let me tell you, he really went above and beyond to help us out with our shopping quest that day and he was so nice!  Safe to say, I'll definitely be coming back!

xJxWnReEz72f3j9kT-LVfg.text: Amazing friendly staff, handful of mimosa flavors, management makes sure everything is served to perfection. Very clean and DJ on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Salmon board

KZyG42qwj8sRAeZHfr5dfg.text: Officially our family's favorite breakfast place. The food choices are vast and the quality served to your table is above expectations. Our server Jesus was by far one of the best servers I've experienced. Dominic, the manager introduced himself to our family and welcomed us in. We will be back for sure.  Last but NOT least.... the Bloody Mary bar is spot on with tons of choices.  Thanks Hash Kitchen for a great family breakfast.

Yrm-P-sMpE8uM6ytU0FkHA.text: Brunch on the weekends with the girls is my favorite and Hash Kitchen did not disappoint! The drink menu is fun and creative and the food was excellent. Our server was fun and super attentive, even with a full house on a Saturday morning. If you're looking for a more low key, quiet breakfast atmosphere, I wouldn't suggest Hash Kitchen. I can see that for some people, it might not be the first choice if you aren't into a more energetic, loud atmosphere at 9am. It was perfect for what we had in mind for our girls brunch though! Great music and a DJ, giant mimosas topped with cotton candy, and a HUGE build your own Bloody Mary bar! We will be returning for our next brunch, no doubt! Loved this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

G_29yPTn6pv4XwqsWzCq2w.text: Just wanted to give credit where credit is due. This place is amazing. We were in town for a festival and one of our people found the place. We did have to wait a while to get seated but we had a larger group.   Every menu item we ordered was amazing. The two stars, for me, were the bacon board and the cannoli doughnuts. I was completely floored. Wish I had a chance to try more items on the menu. Someday I will.   If you have a chance to eat here, do it. Amazing.

RH1g50J3Q4W77oEJPOiCjw.text: Hash was awesome Jesus was the best server we have ever had here! He was awesome! Thank you for the great experience!  Ask for him next time you go!

j_ujnjbAuHQ_dleLSxlSgw.text: This is by far our favorite breakfast/brunch joint in the valley! Not even mentioning our server that helps us out everytime, Jesus! He's fast, pleasant to speak too, and helpful! His manager Dominic came to our table and greeted us and thanked us for coming in and also checked up on us after our meals. He was extremely welcoming and loved our 7 month old daughter (who appreciated their avocados lol) We've brought friends with us everytime to introduce them to this place. The mimosa flight, fried chicken Benedict, breakfast bruschetta and mini bagels are an absolute must try! Thank you Jesus for making our visit to hash kitchen delicious and fun everytime.

JwYrYntpHdP_iG1OQp6YhA.text: Visiting from Los Angeles. Perfect Sunday brunch!  The people waiting to be seated overwhelmed us, the wait about 15-20 min.  Great Sunday Brunch!  worth the wait.  We enjoyed a lovely, relaxing brunch on the patio.  Great style, atmosphere, food and service.  The manager, Domenic Viscariello came by the table to introduce himself.  Super lovely person.  Love the mimosa flights.  Breakfast, egg & bacon scramble and  Lemon riccotta cakes,  amazing.  Excellent service.

2urltnCtdTmYaJRnn_81OQ.text: I had been meaning to make it to Scottsdale to check this place out for quite some time now but never quite made it up there. Then one day the Paradise Bakery next to my cycle studio was suddenly closed and I saw the signs for Hash Kitchen - coming soon! I have been so excited since then and finally made it in today.   This place is absolutely everything it is cracked up to be and then some! The Bloody Mary bar was insane and even included meatballs and chicken wings. The 25oz boba mimosas definitely caught my eye too. We ended up going with the mimosa flight and the cereal shooter flight, both of which were outstanding!   The service was spot on. Our server, Kim, was everything you want in a server, especially when it is your first time visiting a place. She was knowledgeable and patient with us and she made great recommendations. It would be easy for a server in a busy place like this to rush her tables through the dining experience, but she took her time and made us feel like we were her only table. One of the managers, Dominic, was also outstanding. He introduced himself to us and took the time to tell us about the place and genuinely wanted to make sure our experience was fantastic, which it most certainly was.   As far as the food, we were only able to scratch the surface and will definitely need to come back multiple times to try everything that stood out on the menu. The highlights for me were the breakfast bruschetta, the peanut butter infused pancakes, and the s'mores French toast. The avocado toast that my friends ordered also looked incredible, but I stuck with the sweet stuff today.   Definitely will be back again and again, and definitely will request Kim as my server. Great experience, atmosphere, food, and beverages! Great everything!

i_DldMDDHRCqKntLwjK1Uw.text: This was my second time and it was just as great as the first time. I kept it simple with the buttermilk pancakes and they were excellent! I had the salmon board first time and that is a MUST TRY! Soooo good! Angelina served us with a smile and great conversation and later we met Dominic who treated us like family and made us feel as if we were having a meal at his own home. No complaints!!! Great servicing, great environment and delicious food!!!

4ffjJdA3IMgxvBmmPDGn3Q.text: The food, service, cocktails and atmosphere are all amazing.  They are always packed! Go early, be prepared to wait, or go during an off time. I will definitely go back.

SGwLu3LUeIDjuiP1UzS6Eg.text: One word...WOW! This place is amazing! Such a hip spot and the food is delicious. I had the smoked salmon egg Benedict and it was truly amazing. If you're looking for a fun, new breakfast place to hang out with your favorite people- this is the place to be! My friends and I met the manager, Domenic, and he informed us that they have a live DJ Friday-Sunday. I mean, COME ON

rGnDVQRiU1q5EnYnyUcHTA.text: Our first time in, probably won't be back. Our server seemed so unhappy to be there, he couldn't even muster up a smile; just unpleasant all around. Food was just ok; way heavy on salt, not a lot of other flavors going on. Seems this whole place invested everything in to their image, and being flashy or "instagram-able" rather than invest in proper staff and quality food.

GFxyHkv3UYX5ePwuOPNseg.text: *UPDATED REVIEW* After an amazing first experience (see below for my initial review) we were super excited to go back and try something new from the menu. We were seated quickly and told our server would be around to greet us soon. Well, maybe 10 mins later some guy rolls up, doesn't look at us, doesn't say anything. Just starts filling up our glasses with water. He then stood there and stared at us until he asked "want anything other then water guys?" We were so confused whether or not he was our server and were so uncomfortable. We gave him our drink orders which came out in about another 10 mins. He then said "do you know what you want to order?" And we ordered. He never came back to check on us, we were never even told his name. I haven't ever had such poor service. We ended up going to the bar if we needed anything or snagging another nearby server. We left feeling disappointed to say the least as our first experience was stellar. According to the receipt, our server's name was "Souflane". I will likely go back because the food is so good, but I will refuse to sit in his section ever again. Hopefully this guy will get the training he needs. *ORIGINAL REVIEW* I didn't think I could love any brunch more than Snooze...until I tried Hash Kitchen! I can't remember our server's name, but she said she is the Duchess of the place and she did not disappoint! We loved the Bloody Mary bar so much! I loved the fruity pebbles pancakes and my husband really enjoyed the pretzel Benedict. We will be back FOR SURE. #droolworthy

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pretzel benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar!!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fruity pebbles pancakes

yTzZhFkrfIzI1Lqe-Q8xkw.text: Went to Hash Kitchen for the first time today with a few girlfriends for brunch and before we even left we decided this would be our new brunch spot. The food was amazing, our server was fantastic, and the manager Dominic was so friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Try the cannoli pancakes they were the table favorite but honestly everything we ate today was delicious. I loved the atmosphere too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight!

2QgbTaC1lkr09bytWSg12A.text: Love this place! Went last week for the first time and it was so good that I was back by the end of the week with my family for Sunday brunch. They did a great job decorating the restaurant and have a killer patio with a DJ on the weekends. There are so many delicious things to choose from on the menu and the food has been a home run both times I've been there. Food came out fast and we had stellar service. Shout out to Dominic who swung by to ask us about our experience, it was very nice to meet you!!  Can't wait to bring some friends by to check it out and try something new on the menu. I'll be back soon

C1qFxss01Im-AU33KGyABA.text: The food and ambiance is so worth it! Food comes fast, but with flavor you won't forget. Plus, I've always had leftovers! Delish!

UJNH37dhJ1BEeYr8NsD25A.text: I can't even say enough great things about this place!!!!! We came here for the first time today and we will definitely be back! Dominic greeted us at the door and started conversation and made us feel right at home. I love when managers take a sincere interest in their stores and it shows here. The build your own Bloody Mary bar is to die for and the food was amazing. It didn't take long for our order and we never had to ask for refills or anything. I can't wait to come back again soon!!!!!!

WoFWAsYCtNjGR5uBWA0yXw.text: Truman was amazing! He provided fantastic customer service while owning the bar on a busy Saturday morning. Thanks for the 10/10 service Truman!

kyQO46uWkARPLfb4dUsIfg.text: Great service, great food, I'm never disappointed when I come here!  Try the Hash Avocado Toast- you won't be disappointed!  Thanks Dominic!  #TheLittleItalian

I92foN7jFOkLCXAUtNM6dw.text: 1 Star for atmosphere/music/menu concept! And Amanda she is great!! 1 Star for service! But I came for food.  So the -3 was for the food  11 people, waited a long time for orders.  Busy.  Expected.  My eggs were so over cooked and dry I sent them back.  Lost appetite.  My husband's pretzel Benedict came with HARD boiled yolks.  See photo.  The manager in white shirt comes over to me and says "what's wrong" I tell him "my husbands Benedict has a hard yolks" to which he replies "what should they be" to which I replied, eggs benedict, drippy yolk, not hard boiled.  To which he replied "I know".  Daughters boyfriend ordered the carnitas hash, super dry eggs but was too hungry to send them back.  My father in law the birthday boy hated his Benedict crab and said the Hollandaise did not taste like hollondaise.  Over all - great atmosphere, great menu, incompetent kitchen.  4/11 plates dry/over cooked after an hour wait.   Husbands second plate arrives.  What appears to be owner asks "how is it" husband cuts into a medium boiled yolk this time and is so starving, doesn't care and says "perfect" because it's two hours since we walked in door.  Fun place for friends/drinks/vibe, but won't come back to eat.   Of course, if you drink more, you will notice less.    If the food changes, or entire kitchen staff turns over, invite us back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

UyCrkCi-kDtmG5pu43wxaw.text: The food was great and Domenic the manager was so friendly and welcoming. The Bloody Mary bar is a must!  I would have given the place 5 stars but our server Bridget was awful. She was cold, unfriendly, and slow. Honestly I didn't enjoy my experience as much just because of her.

_hDThV3MCFwxnnddE4G8mA.text: Interested in a culinary experience that surprises your tastebuds? Hash Kitchen my friends. We've tried the mimosa flight, brunch bruschetta, the cannoli pancakes, the fried chicken Benedict, the carnitas hash, a cannoli donut and the avocado toast. All were at various levels of the taste spectrum between the points of how yummy to holy wow that is incredible. First time we came in on a Friday and got a table right away. I was dreading the potential wait on a Sunday during prime time but was delightfully surprised that we only had to wait about 15 minutes. Service is quick and pleasant and the atmosphere worked for everyone in our groups. Can't wait to come back and try more!

xeM44YCbYLmG1zgV5GnIdw.text: First of all, let me say that I've been to Hash several times & have always enjoyed it.  Today was a different story.  I knew that with it being a holiday, Hash was likely to be crowded, it was.  I ordered a short stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes, & a side of bacon.  Unfortunately the pancakes were ice cold.  I was very shocked by this & thought that someone in the kitchen was not doing there job.  I told the waitress, & they happily made another order.  It was disappointing to say the least, especially with the prices they charge.  Finally, I stepped into the restroom before leaving, both stalls had absolutely not toilet paper.  Surely they must check the restrooms on a routine basis for cleanliness, & supplies.  Overall, I can only give a 2 star rating for a restaurant I normally give 4 or 5 stars to.

dOKXOfgX6BXUPIxud3hxWA.text: First time here & it was a great spot! Great drinks & food & the best Bloody Mary bar ever! Great decor & super fun atmosphere. Domenic the manager was great as well!

IGhmOLbCdWE3w7mJwfpokw.text: This was our first time really busy but you can kill time at the bloody Mary bar and didn't seen that long of a wait. The service was really good along with the food. The manager Domenic came to our table and was very nice made sure everything was good with us, very friendly. We will be going back soon love this place!

a_N-r1K_eTAGcCeVP2VuOg.text: What a great place! Wonderful food- very creative and delicious! The service, the happy festive environment, and the bloody Mary's were outstanding! Our server Sean was outstanding and manager Domenic stopped by and made really feel like we were home!  If you are looking for a great festive ambient, great service and creative and delicious dishes - with incredible bloody Mary's this is your place

ViGKaMi0DumtIgUVBPXOUw.text: The coffee is phenomenal, the menu choices are innovative and the atmosphere is upbeat. Great way to wake up on a Sunday morning. DJ with thumping music and the restaurant bustles with activity.  Most likely will be a wait on the weekend, but it's worth the wait.

dny4VMH6klh8TVgg3TVbMA.text: The food is AMAZING. I tend to be picky about brunch menus as most places are similar but their food is so good. Highly recommend the biscuits and gravy or their bagel breakfast sliders- to DIE for. The atmosphere is so cute and happy. They also have an awesome Bloody Mary bar. Dominic is the nicest guy, make sure you ask to speak to him!!

2QqA1jqDz26K5X3iTAT3rg.text: Myself, boyfriend, bfs mom and his two brothers came for an early Mother's Day brunch on a Saturday morning. The wait was long, but nothing out of the ordinary on a Saturday morning. Her and I got the mimosa flights and they were delicious however I would have liked them to be a little colder. I had the breakfast burrito and it was really good. Nothing to jump up and down about though. The family had different dishes such as the quiche and green chili chicken entree while my bfs mom had the pancakes and they were all really good. Lost a star for lukewarm drinks, and pretty slow service but otherwise good. Would probably come again to give it another shot and to try different things on the menu.

Nuy7U73XTKGr0qRNSyKbUw.text: Food was fabulous!!  Drinks are incredible. The manager Dominic was so kind. I went twice last weekend and I'm going back again today.

p7fXJLJGtXdAAfjBF4borg.text: 2nd visit to Hash Kitchen in Chandler and for the 2nd time...it did not disappoint!  Domenic is a True gentleman and brings a great spirit to the very hip establishment. Not to mention we love the same football team as him.  This morning I tried the chilaquiles and they were delicious. Definitely had a bit of a kick to them, so if you don't mind a hint of spice..you will love them!  My son tried the infused fruity pebbles pancakes.  They were a hit!  My husband tried the Monte Cristo & fries.  Needless to say we all left there feeling completely satisfied.   High energy, staff is always wonderful, the music and atmosphere make you feel like you are ready to party and get your Sunday started on the right foot!  Welcome to Chandler Hash Kitchen!!!  GO PATRIOTS!!

kt8vfpzqyp-GryYPu3V6OA.text: You guys have got to try this place don't think, don't hesitate just go!!! The Bloody Mary bar is just the beginning of an amazing breakfast/brunch. The Monte Cristo, bagel and lox, Christina's tamale cakes and ricotta pancakes for the table was heaven in our mouths!! Service was great and Dominic the general manager was gracious and fun. Seriously guys, just try this place; you'll be hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. O. M. Gee!!!! Bloody Mary Bar is just the beginning of an awesome(!) breakfast!!

WLb8Qt5wuUbcfBa1z3zsCw.text: I love this place I'm from Boston visited during my stay and fell In love the dj the atmosphere and the service was incredible Amy was our server she was awesome. And Domenic the owner personality came to our table see how the service was. Loved that.

r-uX4CYlnS0NEVep8Hmx_Q.text: AMAZING SERVICE AND FOOD. I came in for lunch and only had an hour away from work so I asked the manager, Domenic, if that was enough time to get in and out. He was so helpful and courteous - the staff was all great. Our food came out very quickly and was delicious!! Very happy with this restaurant, we will definitely be back but maybe on a Friday next time as they have a live DJ all day.

sDGUFl7zvDacN2aMmOxoMg.text: I went to hash kitchen for the first time this morning with my girls for brunch. I really enjoyed the atmosphere, loved the DJ ( he was playing some old school R&B).The wait wasn't long at all, and the hostesses were very nice. I got an egg scrambler with chorizo and avocado, really good! And of course I got the mimosa flight, they were all delicious but I must say the strawberry was my favorite! One of the owners Domenic even came by to make sure we were happy with everything. Will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight (blueberry, passion fruit, strawberry, and classic orange)

Gwreu27d_HGPpyNC4zJG-Q.text: OH MY GOSH. Where do I even start. I never want to leave, I want to move my bed in here and live here. The food AMAZING, the Bloody Mary bar EVEN MORE AMAZING, and the service was EVEN MORE AMAZING THAN THAT! I told my waitress and bar tender that I wanted a mimosa with a lot of champagne and a little orange juice. They filled my glass full of champagne and gave it 6 drops of orange juice. THAT IS HOW I LIKE IT. Huge thank you to our waitress Audrina, she took great care of us and very very friendly and attentive. Also thank you to Domenic who made our experience extra special and made sure everything was top notch for us. I'm coming back with my girlfriends tomorrow or the next day. THANK YOU!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

0sHVVMMhqF3uJRCYcy6I7Q.text: This place was amazing the first time we went. Today I went and the food was amazing but the service was not. We sat at the bar top. She was visibly busy. Understandable, it's Sunday brunch. However, no "hi", no smiles. We were asked if we wanted drinks. Ordered them. Took a few minutes but no biggie. After 20 minutes we had to flag her down to order food. The food was delivered, no one asked if we needed anything, or if we got the correct order even. No condiments offered no check back whatsoever. We had to ask the bar back for salt and pepper and hot sauce and ketchup. Then we had to flag her down to get our check. We're at the bar top!!! She's been standing in front of us for two hours and has barely uttered more than a couple sentences and not smiling at all. They look overwhelmed and stressed and too worried about putting out the orders from service bar (where there was another bartender) than she was worried that her bar guests were having a good experience. The place is all about experience, hence the DJ. The bar was the most unfriendly and non experience that I've seen for such a well thought and executed concept.

LlHzcJ6EHPD4kbxizHypMA.text: This place is OK if you are 25 or younger, but a bit loud if you want to talk with the other people at your table while you share a meal. If you spend all your time posting to social media, your good to go. The food was OK, but a bit pricey for a pile of potatoes with 2 eggs and some basic corned beef: $14.00. The servers and hosts were great. If your idea of breakfast includes alcohol and a DJ, this is the place to be.

zln74m7G6hk3hnMxX7lwCQ.text: Arrived around 9:30 am didn't have to wait at all, nice big place, played music and food was unusual and delicious. If you want basic pancakes and eggs don't go there. I have picky eaters and they all found something to eat and were full that they couldn't even finish. Large portions so consider sharing. Definitely unique and worthy of a return visit.

49h_CfVgLVEKgIaidA-dmA.text: Second visit to Hash Kitchen in a week.  Busy with breakfast crowd, but seated quickly.  Jesus was attentive server.  Tried Pastry Board (again), Avocado Toast and Create Your Own Scramble.  Time waiting for food delivery was quite lengthy, but pastries came out steaming hot.  Scramble very tasty.  Avocado Toast portion huge, but was not overwhelmed by flavor or temperature.  Looking forward to trying another dish on menu next time.  Missed very personable manager Dominic today.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s Pastry Board
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Avocado Toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar

LOcr7ONDHAvFXdSX8_S-Gw.text: First of all, Domenic's the man. So incredibly nice, as is his wife. The food was so good, and Amanda (our server) was/is a Rockstar. Also....DJ Life. #SundayFunday. Definitely coming back.   Go. Patriots.

CYx2HzxFD3FLbzFdIz6XRw.text: My wife and I have been coming here almost weekly. Fun atmosphere, good food and drinks. One of the best parts of Hash Kitchen is Domenic. He is part of the fun here. He recognizes so many people and takes a moment to find out your name, shake your hand and make you feel important. He appreciates everyone and humble to be part of Hash Kitchen.

UuL43EK2DRsiFSXzYe-cGg.text: The food was awesome! Great atmosphere!  We were there to celebrate our daughter's birthday for brunch - with all the food we ordered one plate came out late.  Domenic the General manager came over and apologized for the plate coming out late and offered us $ off and was really friendly making sure we were completely satisfied with food and service.  We understand busy restaurants get busy but managers who care is the best!

sobOQ57rOqhLalIA9bSuzw.text: Great food, service can be hit or miss.  Servers are very rushed and don't check back very often to see if you need anything.

2BuRQez_fU5Xb_gecN-rBg.text: In was looking for a cool brunch place and was impressed by the reviews. However, it was way cooler than expected!  They had a DJ playing chill, but fun music. The food was super yummy with some unique options, and the restaurant lends itself well to taking pictures if you want to up your instagram game. I will definitely be a repeat customer. Be warned this place does get packed!

4z6Yu8xmwvBWSM35sb7qww.text: I absolutely love this brunch spot! The service is fabulous. Dominique & Angela were so friendly. I came on my birthday & Angela went out of her way to make sure my day was special! The food was delicious. i highly recommend this place!

lqK59N9-w1iFMalOX53TGg.text: We've been to Hash Kitchen twice now in the past 3 days! Different locations but both equally wonderful. The very first time we went was for breakfast at the Chandler, Ray Rd. Location. I ordered the banana split French toast. It was spectacular! Decadent! Delicious! The coffee was full bodied as I like it. My husband had the corned beef hash scramble. He enjoyed his choice as well.  The second time we went we brought a cousin traveling with the Detroit Lions. It was Brunch Time, this time at the Scottsdale location. This time I ordered the overnight oats. It was wonderful. It never tastes that good when I made it! My husband had the corned beef sandwich which he raved about. The cousin we brought along had the burger with egg and avocado and onion crisps and aioli on it. (I forgot the name of it) He was also enthusiastic about his choice. Cousin also had the mimosa fleet which he enjoyed. I would wholeheartedly, enthusiastically recommend this place! Service was prompt and friendly at both places. Go....no... run to this place!

kf_k6Uw55MpcrJIXZjUZPA.text: This is probably my new favorite brunch place so far. Their menu is filled with such creative meals and drinks. Although, I wish they can expand a bit, especially on the drinks, but I understand and enjoy their concept. This place is always boomin with awesome choice of music. I really enjoy the cute and modern aesthetic to this place (great for photos). The portions of the meals are impressive and their service is awesome! The severs are very kind and make sure that they fill all of your needs. The manager, Dominic came to all of the tables to hear our feedbacks and was very welcoming. I will definitely be coming back! Thank you Hash Kitchen!!

7b6vveU4geXLQfqchibl3A.text: Awesome service! Loving the great music and DJ! So many yummy drinks and food on the menu - hard to choose! Dominic was so friendly and remembered us from our previous visit - made us feel so welcome. This place gets a 5 out of 5 from me!

Inh1v4CyA9IB1LoMs3B4wg.text: This is our first breakfast in Chandler and everything is great, nice coffee , egg and people

yDclMHFFjYMNsW4_qt46cg.text: Such a solid spot for breakfast. Very good food, awesome Bloody Mary bar, and a great staff!

oJOdoMPr_Z20TcLINZ7ShA.text: This is my new favorite place!  Had breakfast twice on a row.  I do not live in the area but I make the trip.  Soooo worth it.

gRevDV7BrHSBOVIozlR5Pw.text: I've been here many times, and have always had a marvelous experience.  The food, the drinks, the bloody mary bar are all outstanding.  Dominic and his staff were friendly, attentive, and gracious.  Our server, Melissa was excellent! My friends and I will definitely be back! Thank you all, for a marvelous time!

KAEbEojRXgOxd1NR4RTHoA.text: Great experience!! We searched for "best place for bloody Mary's". The search results returned "the biggest Bloody Mary bar"....We just had to check it out! On a Saturday 9am, the wait for inside seating was 45 minutes, outside patio was immediate. We chose the quickest route to the Bloody Mary bar! If you can catch a seat with shade it's rather comfortable. The Bloody Mary bar was excellent! DIY! The choices were so many, and a little confusing. I suggest asking for a tour guide to assist with getting the best for your $12! Although we didn't require much more food after eating our drink, but we order from they're diverse menu and were not disappointed.

XeyY6BU78Drgi5p60m7VxQ.text: Love this place! I went here a week or two after they opened on a Saturday. It was PACKED, so we sat at the bar. I'd like to go back to rate the service at an actual table, because sitting at the bar i think we got forgotten about a little bit. It took nearly an hour to get their bacon board appetizer by itself. The XXL mimosas we ordered were just about gone by the time the food came. But i will say that the bacon board was delicious and so was the drink. The environment is noisy, they have a DJ playing music, but it's great for a fun brunch! Not so much if you want to have a serious conversation (but who does that over brunch anyways right lol). I'll definitely be back to sample some more things on the menu. I would have given it 5 stars had it not been for the extremely long wait for the food, oh and some bare hand contact with the fruits and veggies being used for the drinks. I saw a lot of items being cut up and hands being wiped on jeans after and going right back to cutting up another item... I'm hoping this was just because of the rush and being forgetful. I also wish their parking situation was a bit different, the lot in front fills up quickly from the neighboring businesses so you end up having to park down at the Whole Foods and walking. Which isn't great when it's 100+ outside, not a deal breaker but plan accordingly. All of these things aside it seems like a solid choice for brunch. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. XXL passion fruit mimosa

Lgv10emK_gssIuwadpLiSw.text: We were prompted to go to hash kitchen after seeing them on the local news.  The first time we tried to get in it was a 90-minute wait and we couldn't do that.  Came back with the wife 2 months later to see if a party of 2 would have better luck and we did.  A wide variety of unique food; we went for the Hash menu (after all it is in the name).  Generally very good and very filling.  My wife likes her eggs to be more runny so she was slightly disappointed.  I am just not as much of a sweets fan otherwise there would have been much more of a selection for me.  We knew it would be pricey (and gourmet), but we left full and pretty satisfied - just didn't feel as though we had been shocked or amazed by something extraordinary.  Very very good service from friend folks.  Music so loud it was not always easy to hear one another.  If you want a unique date and feel you can spend extra, this is a good pick.  Not sure we will be regulars though.

Vi7jwrJEDxfwJNzC_M0kdw.text: Food was excellent but the Bloody Mary bar is just incredible. It literally has everything you could even need and can almost count as an entire meal on its own! Dominick and Kendra made sure all of our needs were attended to!

YwAmcObS2Sll3lBseuK8UA.text: Me and my girlfriend have been twice now! Both times were amazing! We were seated quickly by friendly staff and we didn't have to wait long at all for our food despite it being quite busy in the restaurant! The last time we went for breakfast on my girlfriends birthday and the manager Dominic sent over a birthday dessert for free. Excellent customer service and great food! Already planning a get together with friends to come back!

JfG-HM59yYM-lqi3nuWgiw.text: The food was great and the amount of food definitely fills you up.  If you come here hungry you will not leave that way.  Had some good tunes playing also.  Domenic was very helpful and checked in on us.   Will definitely be back.

FST0tX7kbEOdxTI7iKzlNw.text: Absolutely one of the best brunch places in Arizona. Period. Domenic and his team are so dedicated to delivering great service, I'm not going anywhere else for brunch. Mimosa flights are fabulous, food is absolutely phenomenal, this place is top-notch. If you're ever in the east valley, come here!

HtAUu3ADhYRIBOZPZjJnQQ.text: One of the best atmospheres for breakfast I have ever experienced. Very friendly staff and the menu was fantastic. Very generous portions with plenty of healthy options. The Bloody Mary bar is a cool twist! This place has to be one of the top breakfast options in the entire Phoenix area.

WwGqB666q_ef8H0iNNf86A.text: Love this place omg the bloody bar is second to absolutely none fantastic. The food is fantastic and portions are ridiculous.

R7lkgGw2nbpZFWjDPDxA5g.text: Absolutely best veggie frittata, Bloody Mary bar and staff ever! Love the DJ and disco ball on F, S, S. The manager, Domenic, was so friendly and welcoming! I will return with my family every time we visit from TX!

gCXtbuepp9r3iHIows7jbg.text: Truly unique and fun breakfast spot!! AMAZING Bloody Mary bar that can be a meal in and of itself! So many choices from the salt rim, type of vodka, spice level to tons of toppings....this will be any Bloody Mary fan's new favorite place! Innovative menu like the bacon board or sweet potato hash with crab meat and hollandaise sauce to fruity pebble pancakes. Lots of yummy choices!! Large portion sizes and fun beverages. Dominick (one of the managers) is supper friendly and helpful. A DJ spinning tunes makes the atmosphere lively. An all around fun and yummy place for breakfast or brunch! Great for a group of friends or even by yourself as the staff is super friendly! The only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5 is the corned beef hash appeared to be from a can vs fresh shredded corned beef ;-)

ii91JeqXrIHF9yiv8ShP2w.text: Such a fun vibe here at Hash Kitchen! Loved loved the Bloody Mary bar!!! DJ on the weekends... great service! Dominic who I believe is the manager, was very attentive and personable. I will be coming back for sure!

Wh2_z56uhdIJ-gNKR1zMgQ.text: I can't believe how cranky some of these reviewers are. I loved the atmosphere. The menu was inventive and the food was tasty. The service was friendly and the design was great. The patio was shady and the Bloody Mary was Devine. This new restaurant is much needed in the area and it caters to a clear audience. It will do very well and will hopefully encourage even more creative and well run businesses to enter the East Valley market.

DieEO-aeVBlDbycHdf2jvA.text: OMG! Ive been to Hash Kitchen three times and every time has been a phenomenal customer experience. Yummy food, and even for a Saturday the wait was no time! This place is amazing!

LCHpvDOW697crxPk7AvP_g.text: Amazing food, (large portions, share if you have the chance) atmosphere and the drinks!! Wow the drinks! So yummy. Managers were amazing and tentative to the needs of the customers and service was good! Only recommendation I would suggest Is more local beers on draft. Worth the wait!!

4zVzD16AbhPGqR62JTC3yQ.text: Best breakfast food I've ever had.  Can't wait to come again and again to try everything on the menu.  Dominique, the manager, was very caring and came and checked on us 3 times throughout the meal when place was packed and was very kind.  Jessica was very attentive and helpful as well.  Table of 10 and all of our food came out correct and within 20 mins, which is very impressive.  The Bloody Mary bar speaks for itself!

YPlA-Y8Lhp2bgKfXfQeNhw.text: I just finished having my first brunch here. Our server was great, I believe her name was Jessica.  The food was great.  At first I wasn't sure we were welcomed, at the hostess stand I cheerfully requested a table for two. One of the young ladies responded with it be 20 minutes maybe 55 minutes. Then went back to looking at her list. I stood there unsure of why she didn't ask if we would to wait. Finally I said aren't you going to take my name? No sorry, no smile, just a blank stare and unenthusiastic what's the name and she handed me a waitlist pager. We waited outside in the shade under misters enjoying awesome old school music. The pager went off in just 20 minutes. In under 30 seconds we were greeted by our server.  Impressive!  My husband did the Bloody Mary bar and loved it! Lots of food options on the menu. Potions were huge and delicious. I really wanted to get up and dance, the DJ was awesome.   We think this is our go to place for any out of town guest to provide an entertaining brunch.   Upon exiting the other ladies at the hostess stand were friendly and wished us a good day.   It would have been a 5 star experience if the one lady at the hostess stand had been welcoming oppose to indifferent.

IvbHodpx4kOTy-Gl8TnE_w.text: Had a great breakfast at Hash this morning. The manager Domenic made sure we were well taken care of. Food was excellent, service was great, and the atmosphere was really fun. There was a live DJ and the most insane Bloody Mary bar. We will definitely be back.

OCgmnDR36H45PhvzDV5Hew.text: The customer service was superb! Dominick and his waiters and waitresses work very hard to please you. I normally get the chicken and waffles which i love but this time i tried the steak. I will not get that again because it did not have any flavor. I did get full off the Bloody Mary plus bar! I think the price for the largest Bloody Mary at $32 was a little pricy but the overall experience was awesome!

Server was super.  Not even butter. No jelly with biscuit  no soda Chandler water   Corporate guy was quite rude too. Not a good choice

E_-KBthUhtMvyKzevxyI7w.text: A fun and trendy atmosphere! Pretty loud so go if you're looking to drink! The drinks looked awesome and the Bloody Mary bar was out of this world but the food was very very average. My food came out cold and it was just not tasty especially for the price.

m-5WOnLTweNTW3S8CgDYjQ.text: This was my first experience at a Hash Kitchen and all I'll say is that it was good enough to make me want to go back the very next weekend.  Had the breakfast burrito which was pretty good, but a bit on the small end, in my opinion. One of the managers chatted us up a bit too much, but I'd rather the staff be friendly then rude, so I'll take it.  Came here on a Thursday morning and it was pretty quiet, so this is a great place for a weekday morning meeting if you're looking for a spot.

c8GTf9pQI3oMRr20cXv1NA.text: Service was great, I was recommended the corned beef hash,  and all I can taste STILL (6 hrs later)are the over seasoned breakfast potatoes. It ruined the whole thing. Maybe I'll have to come for lunch and give it a more fair rating, but not anytime soon.

IuSFU2lmLy4JMir0J9x99w.text: The food was great, but so filling. Love the build your own Bloody Mary Bar. The service was quick and excellent and the manager Dominic made sure we were well taken care of.

4vpmYYvOyz8G-DMATB8Tuw.text: My fiance picked this place out for breakfast and seemed a little fu-fu for him to pick but thought the food would be good... the food was okay but nothing great.. service was good but the music was a little to loud in my opinion.. I don't think I'll come out of my way to come back here.. but each to their own I guess..

BKBfHBrCjwlqXFmILgbsLQ.text: Let's get down to it- HASH is SO trendy and cute and no one is denying that at all.. let's be honest. all of us want to let our inner basic out to enjoy some mimosas, and HASH is great for that. If you're really into the taste to price ration of the food, then maybe come somewhere else.  I've been to almost all of the locations in AZ (yes, I'm basic lol) and they're all upbeat and CROWDED sis, so the environment is very fun- it's almost like a party which is what I think they're going for which is dope, but its really really loud, so it's hard to really converse with people at your table. The wait on weekends are like 45 mins - an hour max which is a long time to wait if you just tryna get some eggs benedictine cha feel? I also feel like the food is kinda pricey for what you get. The drinks are pricey, but I personally don't mind paying a little extra for the cool bloody Mary bar, alcoholic boba, and other cool specialty drinks.  Overall, would i recommend, yeah but it depends on the mood. I wouldn't say this is an intimate brunch place but it's still lit

cQipMc9g5M_4O2oiV4fBEg.text: Awesome place..... but don't go on weekends for brunch if u just want a place to chat. It's like a dance club! With a dj and everything. So it's quite loud. Great Bloody Mary bar.

OnAcNZflOPdEsmAHqANFIg.text: Came here on a Saturday with a large party for brunch to celebrate a birthday. It is located in the same plaza as Whole Foods. Lots of parking spaces, however the sectioned off spots near the entrance do fill up quick during peak hours. Our server Jesus was beyond amazing. Attentive, charismatic about the popular dishes and overall a stand up dude willing to cater to our tables needs.  The food. Where to begin. I was drooling by the sight of each and every dish that was brought to our table. The portion sizes could feed a small family, so come hungry- this does offset the price tag for the meal, somewhat. I ordered the Herb Fried Chicken Benedict and my boyfriend chose the Lemon & Ricotta, which came recommended by our server. My food was savory and simply delicious, lots of flavor. The biscuits paired perfectly with the fried chicken that was not heavily battered, which I appreciated.   Did I mention they have a Build your own Bloody Mary bar? They say it's the biggest in Arizona, go see for yourself.   They do have a DJ playing on the weekends; some may say it is geared more towards a younger crowd, with a creative twist on most dishes. It is an upbeat place, so if you don't appreciate a louder environment this place may not be for you- try the closest IHOP instead. Loved the overall atmosphere, cute mugs, and the diverse selection on the menu. It is a cool place to brunch out. There's nothing like it in our neighborhood, I will definitely be back.

4Jz_UwYgxFsns9126LlQtg.text: This has become a favorite. I had the CORNBREAD & CARNE ASADA HASH. So good.  Someone had the Lemon ricotta Pancake which I also loved.   The patio was nice, dog friendly. We went early, just after opening, no crowd. Can't wait to try a bloody Mary.

h_tsAfsHPPHIobypq8lQFg.text: We have been coming here for 3 weekends straight to try to get in but it's always an hour or longer wait.  Finally, we got in after a 25 minute wait.  While waiting, you can head on up to the Bloody Mary bar to purchase your drink and add all the toppings you want, including hot meatballs!  If this is your thing, then go on with your bad self.  Not a fan of Bloody Mary's so we skipped that line.    We sat down inside were the DJ is spinning club tunes under the disco ball.  As we scan the room, we felt like we were in an episode of Phoenix House Wives!  As we watched the fufu drinks with cotton candy wrapped around two straws (cotton candy straws will set ya back $10...doesn't include cost of drink) and the many selfies being taken, we quickly calculated that this was more of an adult, club like setting only with brunch being served.    We received great service and overall had a good meal.  I ordered the banana French brioche which was huge, tasty but very sweet.  Only ate half.  My husband ordered the Italian hash dish.  The presentation was great on both meals.  But there was one thing missing from the dish....HASH!  Frozen diced potatoes with onions and green peppers is something I can pick up from the store!   When you come to a place with HASH in the title and HASH noted all over the place....you expect hash brown style potatoes in your meal.  And the eggs which look poached are over cooked!  The yolk should be runny, not well done.    Being a licensed chef, I can tell you from personal experience that when you have a large menu like this and the large amounts of dishes that need to be prepared and put out, your kitchen has far too many things prepared ahead of time.  Eggs are one of those dishes you can't prepared ahead of time unless you're hard boiling them.   And honestly...don't call a establishment Hash Kitchen if you don't serve hash!  That's like calling a a place a steakhouse but you don't have steaks on the menu. #Falseadvertising #chainrestaurantfail  If what you want to pay for is the ambiance and enjoy # tagging away at the selfie station, then by all means, wait for a table that comes with a #BIG$$$tag  Personally, we came, we waited, we ate, we left and we won't be back.  Granted we got two drinks (over $10.00 each); walked away spending over $60.00 for a breakfast not cooked right and no HASH for two people just having breakfast.    If you want both great service and food with little to no wait, I highly recommend that you skip this hash without the hash place and head to Matt's Big Breakfast or Downtown Chandler Cafe and Bistro.  Fresh food prepared the right way that won't break the bank.

MCOJh0lJVbTkoP7CLN0Z0A.text: Birthday brunch with friends was AMAZING! Server Amanda was attentive, professional & even surprised us with the BEST warm dense cake donut- we all found room to share despite our very full selves. Overnite oats fruity & not too sweet- agave is nice touch. Avocado toast they MUST be famous for- brioche toast perfect eggs- words cannot describe- must see! Clean, fresh lively environment. Great balance of busy, but not crowded- I don't rate many restaurants bc I rarely find any noteworthy. This place is the exception. All of us will be regulars,

shZc2a3-EoiUvyoqK_15cw.text: First time at Hash Kitchen with the wife and our friends. The environment is high energy, great music, amazing food and the service was top notch! Domenic the general manager stopped by our table twice to check in and make sure everything was great! We will absolutely be coming back and can't wait for the new Sicilian Butcher to open soon! Definitely recommend Hash Kitchen for a great brunch spot!

_anJwhwVyClqsOTVwUjH6Q.text: Had one of their specials, biscuits and gravy with Italian Sausage. Not very hot and the biscuits were kinda hard.  Sweet biscuits which is an interesting flavor mix. Could've been amazing with hot, fresh country style biscuits...

NlO6c_vCmE94bmhj0h6lBA.text: Great food and service! Very creative dishes and amazing cocktails. I've been here twice and  Dom, the GM chats w everyone at their table. Nice neighborhood restaurant. Music is loud but that's part of the ambiance. Amanda our server was very also wonderful. Will be back!

gGZGR3M-9SEt215LHhgthA.text: I am unsure of the negativeness towards this place! Yes, there is a DJ, yes it is loud and yes it is busy and if you don't like it or understand the concept then that is your fault.    The service is amazing. I mean, I came in by myself to meet my boyfriend and his best friend, they greeted me, were so nice (every person behind the bar) that they reserved two extra seats at the bar and while this may have pissed people off and made me look like a jerk, it was only for a few minutes and this is due to how packed this place is and parking so far away. No big deal, I got a pineapple mimosa and it was amazing!! My wonderful boyfriend got the Mimosa flight and our friend here from Iowa got the 32 ounce build your bloody. I got the smaller bloody with cilantro lime vodka. I made a bloody masterpiece!!! I came back from the bloody bar after meeting with Dominick and I must say, such a nice gentleman! He is the owner and makes a point to meet and greet every guest, stellar!  Oh, now on to the food....gosh, I am boring. I like two eggs over and dry toast. It came out perfect, eggs cooked just like they were requested. My better two thirds got the crab hash. This dish was excellent. It consisted of sweet potatoes that were shredded, eggs cooked however you want (scrambled in this case) and hollandais-ish sauce accompanied by a very generous portion of crab! Our friend got Fruity Pebble pancakes with a side of maple bacon. It was ridiculous, ridiculous is good. The bacon he got should seriously be patented. It was that good.   Thanks :)

xerrx7zSwYvnqJLidXBpog.text: The food we ordered were very oily. For a breakfast place, I expected it to be healthier.

UbbTnG8q-Xz5GJ9AoOd6sQ.text: This place is brunch on steroids. Lol! My friend brought us here because she raved about the cereal shooters and the live DJ from her previous visit.  We got in an hour before closing and they were packed. Unfortunately no DJ this time around! We were seated quickly and seeing how busy they were we had to wait a little and eventually flag down our server to place our drink and food orders before it got too late. I started with a Bloody Mary from the Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar (BYOBM) and the girls ordered a Lights Out Mimosa, French Vanilla Coffee In A Cone and the Mimosa Flight. I have never seen drinks like these before. I commend the BYOBM for letting you totally customize your Bloody Mary to the T (try their bacon infused vodka). For $13 you get to choose from 40+ toppings and make the Bloody Mary of yo dreams. The Mimosa Flight was also very generous, each serving was HUGE and they were strong. That's how Mimosas should always be.  As for our meals we ordered the S'Mores French Toast, Corned Beef Hash, Herb Fried Chicken And Waffles and the Mexicana Scrambler. These portions are no joke.. we ordered enough to feed a small village. As were were wrapping up one of the managers, Domenic came by to greet us and have a conversation with us. I was telling him how excited I was over the BYOBM Bar and he even let me go back to try some more of the toppings. Thank you Domenic for your hospitality!  When we got our checks there was a little misunderstanding regarding the order of my friend's French Vanilla Coffee In A Cone, but it was resolved immediately. As we were one of the last few to leave we did not feel rushed by any means to wrap up our brunch.  What a fun place! Coming back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary from Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar (BYOBM)

327Z5eYFCYHGgKetR0JHjg.text: Came here to see what the hype is about this place. Walked out disappointed and definitely won't return.   25 mins wait wasn't that bad for a popular restaurant. Music was too loud. Service wasn't that good. I forgot what my husband order, but I ordered the herb chicken hash and we shared the banana split french toast for dessert. The chicken hash dish was so bland and definitely need more seasoning. The fried chicken was nothing special.   My 3 star is basically for the french toast. Really good choice on the bread. Good french toast , but not good enough to make me return.

uWkM6hr8Din_maOKbpxczg.text: We got to Hash Kitchen and were told immediately that the wait was an hour. Since good things are worth the wait, I was adamant about waiting.   We decided to have the large Bloody Mary's at the Bloody Mary Bar. To quote Mr. T, I pity the foo. We definitely thought we could take it down but between the endless olives, meatballs, bacon, pickles and more we were wrong.  We sat out back behind the Bloody Mary bar while we waited for our table. Made some good conversation with the other patrons.   When we got our table we were able to see the entire restaurant including the bar and the tv. (Basketball was on.)   We orders Herb chicken and waffle, and sweet cornbread and carne asada. Oh My Goodness. We could have had one plate to be quite honest. It's so much food.   Throughout the mean not only did our waiter check on us but the manager Dominic did. He not only talked to us about the history of the location but also talked about further plans of a sister restaurant.   We already have plans to bring all our friends and I cannot wait!

5ixr5UAVjIfw8Y8kpg0PvQ.text: I seriously am obsessed with this restaurant. I originally tried this place back in March on my 1st trip to Scottsdale so when we decided to come to phoenix in August we had to come here again. We were excited to see a location opened up in the Phoenix area and I can't even believe the restaurant got better. The new menu options are out of this world. The new location offers a walk up bar that you can order from while you wait for your table. We came on a Sat for brunch and even with a party of 4 we only waited about 35 minutes. We got the avocado toast which can easily feed 3 people. The crunchy bread with the sweet braised pork was to die for. I can't stop thinking about it! The carnitas hash is an absolute must. The BYO bloody mary bar is Amazing. The meatballs were so flavorful I'm pretty sure we ate about 10 of those before we even ordered. We also ordered the sausage biscuits and gravy, the brioche french toast and the poutine breakfast fries. Everything was amazing. David, one of the managers I believe, came around greeting all the guests and he was incredible and so attentive to our table. We begged him to tell the owners to please open one of these in Sacramento, CA!!! Do not miss this place! Atmosphere is so cool as well as amazing food.

mnlfBe_BPH_eKZdOqjHDHQ.text: First time coming in and I LOVED the brunch concept. It was a Friday and they had a DJ so it was a bit loud in there but that didn't bother me (Just something to note for others who may be sensitive to loud sounds). The service was amazing and the food came out so quick - I was impressed! I'll definitely be back!

hnlmp8WSHSAYNrErllDMag.text: We had attempted to go to the Hash kitchen on several occasions, and each time there was a line out the door.  Today we "thought" we'd lucked out because the wait was short.   My wife and I picked the biscuit and gravy w/sausage.  We were also curious about the banana French toast, so we ordered that to split.   Both our meals were cold and the sausage was dry. I told our waitress, and she said she'd have another brought out. I HATE this solution, but she didn't offer an alternate.   My wife wasn't interested and decided to continue nibbling on the semi-warm sections of food on her plate.  I ended up eating 80% of the French toast while waiting the 15 minutes for my replacement meal.  The French toast was very good and hot.  After waiting the 15 minutes, I was no longer excited to see the new plate arrive. While hot; it was a waste.  The French toast had filled me up.  Food sometimes comes out cold.  To me, there's nothing worse than waiting for the replacement to arrive. I wish the waitress had offered to take it off the bill, or simply did it on her own.  We won't be back.

NcGBxOE8q9cGoEtMWXUEdA.text: Quick seating at 10am on a Friday. Tasty bacon infused vodka bloody Mary's. Breakfast scramble was very small portion and small side if hash browns. Taste was average. Very loud music inside. Difficult to hear friends around table if 4. $51 for 2 person breakfast of course included 2 drinks. Mexican place next door is next

It has fried onion, egg pouch, cheese and beef with a special house sauce. My first time here and I'm very satisfied.  My waitress was super nice, she helped with my order and stuffs. BWLZ9TXU9rjWmlG9Pmykxg.text: Overall fun! We missed the DJ but still had a good time sitting at a spacious table with cute hipster decorations and table settings. Being there was fun, the drinks were presented nice and were strong, but the food was kinda underwhelming. I had the bacon omelette and I subbed mushrooms for onion. There was hardly any seasoning and bacon in the egg, and the hash potatoes it came with weren't anything to rave about. My friend had the impossible burger, he said it was good, but nothing special. We also ordered the lights out mimosa in the passionfruit strawberry flavor that our server recommended. It was tasty and the cotton candy and little juice balls in them were a fun touch.  Sean was our server and he gave us good service. Parking was easy on a Saturday afternoon for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mug
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lights out mimosa
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bacon omelette

gfMRrnZTcPO17o3qQtEU5A.text: Oh my goodness! This place was absolutely delicious. Okay, so the prices were just a tad above average I would say; however, totally worth it. They have plenty of options and even a Bloody Mary Bar, which I have never seen before.   WARNING : The portions are HUGE lol  The avocado toast could feed four people I think   The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is because it did take a bit to get service after we were seated. This was at 11:00 on a Wednesday. This is double edge sword because it shows you just how good and popular the place is.   Either way, highly recommend and will be going back to try different dishes and the Bloody Mary bar when I'm not working.

ATqnkfMyIY1GJO-RfjgPyQ.text: Incredible place!  I came here Saturday with a few coworkers for Brunch. We had such a great time. The atmosphere is very lively with a Dj and a fun staff. Everyone was happy sipping on Brunch drinks and diving into their huge helpings of food.   The mimosa flights are a huge hit. They're colorful and vibrant and taste great!  You get a good amount of bubbly in each flight. They're also a great size to have a flight round and one additional drink.   There's a huge mimosa drink called the lights out (I believe). It has a whole bottle of champagne in it so be prepared to share... or not lol.   I tried my luck with the carne asada and cornbread hash. It was so flavorful and I couldn't get enough of the cornbread. My only complaint would be the steak being super chewy on some parts but it didn't take away from the amazing flavors of the dish.   All the portions are big so come prepared on an empty stomach!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne asada and cornbread hash

qNVWHR22NEep-Hvc3iBnCg.text: One of the coolest places I've ever eaten. Service was outstanding. I had the Chilachiles. It was OK. Not crazy about the their green salsa. But my best friend got the Banana Split Brioche French Toast--- OUTSTANDING! Maybe even sinful. So much sweet goodness.   I will definitely come back.   Manager Dominic came by the table and asked pointed questions about the food, the service AND the amount of time the food took to come out - it was blazing fast.   Atmosphere alone makes this a must go. Bring it to Birmingham, AL!!!

DCIfKeGOO7cliFmLw9TZWg.text: Great place for brunch but expect to wait. I came with a friend, party of 2 on a Sunday at 10:30am thinking that I was part of the early group and oooooh I was wrong. There was already a pack of people waiting to be seated. We were given an estimate of 45~ minutes.   Upon arrival I noticed the place was sha-poppin'. They had a DJ playing and it was like being at a day club. They had plenty of seating including the bar and patio. I also love that they had a DIY Bloody Mary bar - awesome concept. Plenty of people were grabbing one while they waited.   After waiting closer to 70 minutes, we decided to give up our wait for a table and snagged a seat at the bar (bar is first come first serve).   We were helped once seated and placed our orders. Portions are huge and food was yummy. What enticed me the most was the creative drinks they offer. I ordered coffee in a cone (alcoholic + non alcoholic available). They also had mimosa and cereal flights on top of plenty of other delicious choices.   Decor is very trendy- they even have one of those selfie cameras w/ the lights around it. A cool place to brunch just make sure you're not going right as you get hangry. Wait is worth though. #hashhashbaby

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. French Vanilla Coffee in a Cone
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Huevos Rachero

-rff8ZHnYrDxzAzBzFhqCg.text: For a group of 16 the team did well in getting us served once we were seated.  Getting seated however,  took over 2 hours esp when we were told 1 hour 15 mins......i was a tad bit disappointed in the hostess' for not regrouping and suggesting us be split on diff tables or something...the group was getting antsy waiting in the heat. I suggest the restaurant team look into a 2 hour limit for guests...atleast for large tables. Makes things move smoother for everyone.   However, when seated our waitress was great and our meals delicious. I ordered the chilaquiles and the chicken tinga was very tasty! I haven't found a place that makes it as well.  Others shared the avocado toast it being a large portion. The rest of the group ordered various things but everyone enjoyed their meals. The mimosa flights were definitely popular. You didn't get to select your flavors though just what is preselected.  I'd come back but maybe a smaller group to get seated quicker:)

lMokR3CWeOZ0chxg1e_Lxw.text: I never thought I would find a breakfast restaurant that would rival or even surpass Snooze AM but Hash Kitchen might be the one. We were seated right away (beat the brunch rush by arriving at 8:30 AM on a Saturday) and the waitress was there a few second later to take our drink orders.   I ordered the Chilaquiles and it was easily the best breakfast dish I have had. I am excited to come back soon to try several other things I saw on the menu and things tables near us ordered.  The manager, Dominic, stopped by twice to make sure everything was good and chat. Super nice guy and gave us a card to check out the other restaurant he manages (The Italian Butcher).

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles

rc8GWkAsyT-mBRFU-oDvdg.text: I have been wanting to go to this place couple of weeks now and finally got a chance for a lunch on a weekday.  The place is trendy with some nice wall graphics, blue & white seatings and a very nice bar set up. We were seated immediately but the service was a little slow considering there were only a few people at the restaurant.  We quickly ordered chicken frittata, French toast and veggie burger with fries. There was a little bit of a wait for the food to arrive.  Chicken frittata was average and not exceptional. The chilli sauce on the egg definitely made it better. The winner was the French toast and veggie burger. The toast had perfect amount of sweet, had some marshmallows and banana as a topping. The burger had yummy crispy onions inside with veggie patty.   The food portion was pretty big and we were all full by end of the meal. The average cost is about $15 per person. Overall a good brunch place, would definitely want to try other menu items. Keeping this place on my rotation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Frittata

5f41y5y75d2H9RWYH6UIOQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here this morning and even though the place was packed, we got a table within about 10 minutes or so. We were expecting pretty so-so food because usually brunch places don't deliver much in the way of quality but DAMN we're we wrong!! This place is fantastic. My boyfriend had the Lemon Meringue French Toast and I had the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and it was my first time ever trying hollandaise sauce. They delivered a French press machine TO OUR TABLE so we knew we were getting exactly what we paid for. Ugh I'm so pleased with my our experience and we will definitely be coming back asap! The food isn't too expensive and what you splurge on is definitely worth your money! The management is very kind too. Great staff, great food, great environment. I love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. HASH Bloody Mary and French Press Coffee

ckJX2fc6Ot1mUGY5_-XW4g.text: Woke up early on a Sunday and wanted to take advantage of coming here early before the crowd hit . My BF and i arrived around 7:45am and brought our pup and sat outside . The servers were friendly & brought our Coco (our dog) some water  and immediately the manager Dominic came up and greeted us . You don't get every where and I really appreciated him welcoming us - especially since it was our first visit . I of course ordered from the Bloody Mary bar which was delicious!! So many options- I am sucker for vodka anything so I was in heaven. My BF ordered the banana brioche French toast and omg !!!! Heaven !!! I ordered the corn bread and Carne Asada hash and wow !  Ever have tried something like that before and it was delicious!  Can't wait to come back to this place - I never really write reviews but this place was worth noting!!!

fhvuiA8QN_grZClIF710fw.text: If you like brunch (and let's be honest who doesn't?) And you're on Mesa, this is the place.  The atmosphere is great, music is playing, they have an incredible Bloody Mary bar, and the food?  Well it doesn't disappointe at all.  Don't be stupid and not go here, you'll regret it

NEBBjU2N8p0SWKXKrWyZOg.text: This is by far one of my favorite restaurants! The food is ridiculous and the environment is fun and the manager  Domenic v.  Is so nice and personable !  Excellent service and the coffee is to die for !

I4QdpCafjXrx_KHuFhYn8Q.text: This place is amazing. You feel like family and Dominic the manager will make you feel like you never need to be anywhere else but here.  The food is outstanding, the service is point perfect. Nobody and I do mean nobody does brunch better.

SMNtO9RFArcTlWqMjk8-kQ.text: Been here once and it was a great experience. We had two types of pancakes, they had a fluffy texture and good flavors.   The music seems odd at first but once you're seated it makes sense and you cannot imagine being here without it.   Not too expensive, about what you'd pay at another breakfast restaurant.   Will definitely be back to try something else.

EqfRShds8OjJ6cAEr0XWTQ.text: First time to Chandler location, third time overall. I really like this place and given they have only been open for a short time service and food was good. This place has loads of personality, including the upbeat and trendy interior to your hosts, all from Back East. Today we met Guido (middle name by the way)from Cape Cod area. He is one of the managers and stopped by a couple of times to check on our food and our service. This time around I had to try the Cannoli pancakes, I just couldn't resist. The stack was huge, I made it about half way through and they were a little thicker than I like (but that is personal preference of mine, I prefer thinner). They came with syrup and a maraschino cherry compote/syrup. I didn't use much of any of it because the mascarpone with chocolate chips between each pancake made it sweet enough. Also got a side of bacon which honestly was a great price (I paid $5 for 3 pieces last weekend at the Original Pancake House). The hubby got Chicken and Waffles, he said it was good but comes topped with a ton of fried onions, easy to remove like my hubby did.  The only concern and it was minor is that I ordered an iced almond milk mocha and it was given to me with whipped cream on it.  Luckily I can have a little bit of milk, but I despise whipped cream on my iced drinks. With an alternate milk being asked for they should leave it off or at a minimum ask. Past experiences were good as well, the Coconut Almond French Toast is good, not overalls sweet and the hubby had the Huevos Rancheros and Carnitas Hash. I am not a Bloody Mary fan but if I was this would be the place I would come as the make your own Bloody bar is pretty epic. Overall looking forward to coming here more often now that it is slightly closer for me. Would love for one to come out to Mesa or Gilbert. The challenge I have is that so many things sound good but honestly the portions are large and I should share with the hubby but we can't come to a compromise. Tough problem to have I know. See you again soon Hash Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cannoli pancakes

ElvSQ8ckt1AWmFKA8Dlf0A.text: Hash kitchen Chandler was really awesome.  I could literally eat breakfast at the Bloody Mary bar.  The servers were great.  The dj spinning tunes was awesome and hip vibe.  The food was excellent.  We went for a brunch and rolled out due to the portions and Bloody Mary bar.  Try it!

5McP9sZgL37rAAn1lZ6rPQ.text: Food was good.  Service was not. Our waitress, Melissa, was not attentive to our table.  It took 20 minutes to get an extra syrup and 20 min for our check.  Didn't check to see how we were doing or how the food was.  Disappointing first time due to the service.

mqwbEgWY_OFg7G4o_HCzmQ.text: Just finished enjoying a delicious breakfast on the patio at Hash Kitchen. The food was amazing! My scrambled eggs with salmon were tasty and cooked perfectly. We shared French toast which was not only enormous slices of bread, but absolutely yummy. Great service too. Our server and the manager, Domenic, were very attentive. We were greeted immediately with friendly smiles. Nice size patio, very comfortable.

k8Kak2eQT0bIJf0EOhBGFg.text: Best breakfast ... mimosa ... service, amazing. We were given the option to sit inside or sit outside we opted for outside, the service was impeccable it took approximately seven minutes from the time that we ordered to table. The manager, Dominic was absolutely amazing we have dubbed him "the little Italian"! Our server was Rachel and she was awesome constantly making sure we had enough to drink make sure if it was tasting good, it was so good we let our friends know and they showed to come eat. We then went home picked up our kids and brought them back, and I indulged in the giant Mimosa. We will definitely be back to try other menu items. We had the sweet potato crab hash... 2 thumbs up!

n90c4aJQRyfX_Vmls-KrJQ.text: Wait was crazy but we found seating at the bar no problem. Live DJ playing good music to get that Sunday brunch feeling going. Mimosas were solid, avocado toast enormous and delicious. Can't wait to go back and try the build-your-own bloody Mary!

1daIj_l00G5qHqJ-SosCFQ.text: Nice environment.  Delicious food.  Super friendly staffs and manager (I can't remember his name now).  This place is vegetarian friendly.  We substituted avocado slices on our Boring Egg Benedict instead of bacon and Vegetarian instead of the beef patty. We were here on a Tuesday so we can't drink since we have to go back to work.  The Bloody Mary bar is looking awesome though.  Can't wait to try them soon.

Our brioche Waffles were delivered while we finished up at Bloody Mary bar.           Our French toast was delicious too.  Domenic stopped at our table to introduce himself.  We loved meeting him and we saw him again before we left.   Ray is presented with a gorgeous cannoli for his BIRTHDAY         We loved our first time visit !!!!

7aov96r0swGeIkD4yTKiFg.text: This place was crazy busy for a Sunday but Dominique made sure to take care of us and get us seated fast. The serve was so fast and very friendly!!! Will definitely come back very soon!! Amazing experience!!!

nUOUtvY9xDAOyOn0dpeWnQ.text: This place is beyond Amazing! From the management to the serving staff everyone goes out of their way to make sure that your experience is perfect. We go to this location almost every Sunday we can. Portion sizes are perfect to share with friends and the food is delicious. There is something for everyone from pastries to down home food with a modern twist. The build your own Bloody Mary bar has over 40 items to choose from and make sure to get the MEATBALLS!!! If Bloody Mary isn't your thing try the mimosa flight or the giant mimosa with a full bottle of champagne!!! Small not there is a live DJ spinning for brunch on Sundays but the music adds to the awesome atmosphere. Will continue to go back anytime we can. Thanks Geno for the great hospitality and making us feel like family.

xgv5Zp3Od0upS4XTb2-lCw.text: Best service and environment...  Dominic the manager was maxing and friendly checked in with us talked and was very personable. Food was fantastic I will be back again and again!

JqNit_R1XLT1dpylH-H8vg.text: Place just opened. Build your own bloody bar. We shared a 32 oz Spicy Bloody. Delicious. Place was packed. Really casual fun layout. Built our own Omelets and Frittatas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

ko-21n6F4Z61omjxM_SfLA.text: Although they've only been open a week, the restaurant is doing a fine job of turning out quality food. Two of the managers, Dominic and Summer, introduce themselves and made sure we were well taken care of. I like the variety and the eclectic nature of their menu. I think prices are fair given the quality and the portion size. I had the mid iron steak hash, and the steak was done to perfection and was extremely tender. The poached eggs were also perfect. My friend enjoyed the Montecristo, and was surprised with the fresh pineapple that really set off the sandwich. The fries were also amazing, and fries or something that you often don't think about.  Definitely recommended and I will be going back.

22qatMWbZmP-s6dL3dTCoA.text: Food was amazing but the wait time was insane! We waited an hour and 30 mins to be seated which was really weird because a lot of people who arrived after us got seated before us. That made us a little upset. We ordered our food quickly because we just wanted to get out of there.   Overall, I recommend going very early or after 12pm to be seated at a reasonable time.

IhwwOpwUZh2PHD1vG6wm4g.text: This is an awesome brunch place! This restaurant has really change the brunching experience. If you're into a variety of mimosas and plenty of bloodily Mary topping then I highly recommended this place. Ohh not to mention to fill your belly with delicious brunching food.   However, you should expect to wait at least an hour or so during peak brunch hours. I wasn't to amazed with their service. After waiting for an hour for our table we waited another 15 minutes to get attended to. We actually had to ask someone who our server was.To compensate for that mishap, we did end up getting $5 off our meal from the manager of the restaurant.   All in all I recommend this place for the drinks, food and atmosphere. It can get very noisy which may bother people, but if you're looking for a good Sunday Funday this is the place.

7_1HU9j23uIzAeSymz3meA.text: Tried this for the first time today and we were blown away! Staff was super friendly as well as quick and efficient. Manager greeted us at the door and visited us at the table to check on the food and service. The food tasted great and we had lots of options to choose from. The kitchen made the food very quickly, which was help when dining with an infant in tow!

TnXzXLIO7GaiNBKDZcpamQ.text: Oh. My. Goodness.   I've been here twice and both times it exceeded my expectations. Dominic, the manager, welcomed us and later checked in on us during our meal. And the meal! Soooo delicious - everything I've tried here has been beyond perfect. The Bloody Mary bar is awesome and the chocolate frappaccino with COTTON CANDY topper was a perfect way to start the weekend. Add the DJ and the ambiance of the restaurant and you have the perfect mix.

m9MLZdtcK39H0O0ynaAXXw.text: All the way from CA to Hash to have brunch and was the best decision. Amie is the best. Made it so easy and enjoyable even we're not a super easy clients
