XFv_Y_zdF1qV_IvPPlKshg.text: This was our first time here but not our last. We had a wonderful breakfast on their dog friendly patio. The Corned beef hash was wonderful and my wife enjoyed the Brunch Bruschetta. Our server Baylee very friendly and helpful. We were then greeted and thanked by Domenic one of the managers. He told us that the owner Joey is very happy with the response from the community to his new restaurant. If you haven't been here yet you need to check it out.

z9_XgJjm74y8rCnW2tLbng.text: Best brunch experience I've had so far in Arizona. Breakfast was outstanding and there is nothing like the Bloody Mary bar. Our server, Jesus, was excellent, genuinely cared about helping us order the right item and was a wealth of knowledge when it came to knowing everything on the menu. Would recommend to anyone looking for the full brunch experience with fantastic service.

1YSWsyb4glMj31V7mrDfWA.text: Breakfast today, 4th time here, came opening day. Great service, awesome food. Absolutely love the crab with sweet potato hash. It's lump crab not the little pieces at some places. Domenic works the crowd, always smiling, greeting patrons like he's welcoming people to his home. You want great food, great music, great service... here's your place.

gsTtUVToeVfg-GNSjx6L1w.text: Bringing Prosecco Sunday back... Hash Hash Kitchen is our jam! If you haven't been here... YOU are missing out!! You guys, the gluten free pancakes and waffles are DELICIOUS!!! Excellence... Enjoyable... Epic come to mind when I think of my experiences here. CHEERS!

1Ah6xfAJ4H_0MZ-ZO2Sz-A.text: Amazing, fun place!! Dom, the manager, is super friendly.  Love the DJ! Such a great time. Food is out of this world.

1b79-KeJ_Y__-im50XwvbQ.text: I love this place.  It's hip, happening and the staff are super friendly.  Dominic the Manager always tries to stop by, say hi and make sure your having a great time.  Our server Nick was attentive, friendly and on the ball.  Lots of choices on the menu and the Bloody Mary bar is outstanding.  All I can say is bring the pancake flight option to Chandler.  Highly recommend.

1CQPiCs3TTHJklX9JUJBFg.text: Delicious food and fun atmosphere! Cannoli pancakes were heaven! The manager Domenic was super personable and made us feel right at home! Definitely will be back:)

ZvVTpn8afG81ULRo7hun_A.text: Great food,great atmosphere, the manager Domenic was super friendly and made sure we had a great time! 10/10 would recommend

hMK1n74zuwiH0u-_Q28k0Q.text: Such a fun place to be for brunch! The atmosphere was great - all servers were very nice, bubbly and looked happy to be there. The decor was cute and I loved having the DJ there! Dominic also came up and talked to us and was very friendly and talked to us like we were friends rather than a manager who needed to make his rounds talking to customers. Will definitely come back when I'm back in Arizona :)

XxHEfI4-8hGMU696-OsM1w.text: I want to start off by saying the managers Domenic and Gino are absolutely amazing!!! We came in on a Saturday and loved everything from the vibes, drinks and food so much we came back the very next day with some friends! Don and Gino not only recognized us and out little boy but showed their appreciation throughout our whole time there! We were blown away and that is how you do business! We can't wait to try their new Italian restaurant Sicilian Butcher!! Can't wait!

xVKJ6HtLvYA0peViTcbjNQ.text: Amazing!  I had the chicken fried steak and wow, talk about juicy and flavorful.  This place had the best DJ during breakfast...yes, breakfast!  Such a fun place!

oWx5fd23sCqaI2lOTVrd6g.text: Blown away by how good this place is! The food is delicious, big portions and very tasty. Drinks are incredible and service was outstanding!!! Dev was so friendly and attentive. Domenic was great! This is my new favorite go to spot for breakfast and brunch!!! Can't wait to try more of the menu!

7jhSqQKjQzw7tRc4A4WAkA.text: I went twice over the weekend. Friday morning was loud but not too extreme. My girlfriend and I had a lovely time and the manager even came and visited for quite some time asking how everything was. He was super nice and did a great job going around to the tables. Saturday morning, we took friends from Scottsdale and it was a completely different story. It was so loud, we were screaming across the table. We asked our waitress if they could turn the music down and she said they aren't allowed to- What?! That's terrible customer service. She even commented that she's having to yell at her customers! I love the look of the place, the food, and the service! For those, I give 3 stars...I understand wanting to have a lively place, but a nightclub feel at 10 am on Saturday morning isn't really enjoyable. I'm so sad because I loved my mimosa flight and the Bloody Mary bar looks amazing! My friend did that and she said the choices are endless! If you may be thinking we are just old and can't handle loud music, my husband has an app on his phone that ranks decibels and it was 95 decibels on Saturday morning - That's dangerous levels for a baby and young children. The table next to us clearly had a lot to drink and were up dancing. So, bottom line, if you want a nightclub atmosphere for a weekend breakfast, this is your place. I wish this place the best, but not sure I want to return if they truly can't turn music down- that's ridiculous. Many families around here like to go out for breakfast on the weekends - this place clearly is not geared for families.

covYrx-sDp9vvm_9ISxICQ.text: I came here for brunch with two friends on a sunday morning and definitely had a GREAT experience! The service was outstanding! Our server came to introduce herself and took our drink order very quickly. We ordered the cannoli pancakes, breakfast burrito, veggie scramble and bacon board, and everything was tasty and flavorful! We also got the mimosa flight and a bloody mary, but not the bloody mary bar, next time for sure! The service here was definitely one of the highlights of the meal, the manager, Domenic, came over twice to check on us and he was very friendly and engaging! Would definitely recommend this place!

QxDCTcf8jXC75ZqAGxORnA.text: Fast service, great food, decent prices. Domenic was very friendly. We totally recommend trying this place out.  I got the cous cous salad and it was way better than I was expecting!

dScgTf1Eqkkl517rwDDm5w.text: Love hash kitchen! The food, Bloody Mary bar, atmosphere, dj & manager Domenic were all amazing! Can't wait to come back!

ZRFUdHw14QE8_m-LQkM_sQ.text: Absolutely love this place! Went for the second time since they opened to close out my birthday weekend... and it was a blast   Our wait for two people was approximately 20 minutes (and the crowd was building up @ 9am).  When we got to our table our waitress Kim was wonderful and very sociable. Dom the manager is also fantastic, he stopped by our table a few times to make sure we were being taken care of. Customer service is so important and I believe that Hash Kitchen makes it a priority! Love the DJ music, some folks may not be into it and that's cool, for me I thought it was fun and really enjoyed it.  So, moving onto the drinks and food... We ordered the Cereal Flight as I was intrigued by the concept (who doesn't love cereal milk after its soaked up all the fun flavors: Fruit Loops, Cinnamon Toast, Coco Pebbles & Captain Crunch ). Although the drink tasted good I felt like I needed a little more of the cereal flavors and Kim was very accommodating by bringing me small bowls of each flavor to crunch on. For the main dish, I ordered the Smoked Salmon Frittata and substituted with egg whites and it was delicious! We then  decided that it was time for Mimosas and ordered the flight. This too was great, the glasses were larger than the Cereal Flight and the flavors were good. Liked that they rotate flavors of Mimosas (today's flavors were Blackberry, Kiwi, Strawberry and of course the Classic) all were yummy!  Hey did I mention it was my birthday? Breakfast ended with an Italian Donut with cannoli filling. Haven't had good cannoli in quite some time  so was happy with this sweet surprise!! I've read some of the other Yelp reviews and it's important to note that every place has opportunities and Hash Kitchen at this location has only been open for a month, so I would recommend giving it another try. Service, Food and Atmosphere is great, will definitely be back.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Birthday Italian Donut W/cannoli

osF2UCgtJ68kzgK_7uiBcg.text: This place is amazing. They have a huge Bloody Mary bar with toppings from olives to meatballs. The food is a little expensive but it comes in huge portions. They have great service and is overall an awesome atmosphere. If you're looking for a place to come for a special occasion, this is it.

uGmHKh8RMGWr4Oh78hthSA.text: Such a great brunch spot!! Service was on point with Jessica and the Mgr, Dominic, stopped by to make sure all was well. We got the French toast which was amazing huge pieces of brioche bread and the mimosa flight -u must u just must!

kJ_b4EdVE3tOy03ZsYf92Q.text: No wait, great service, great environment and really good food!!!  Thank you Dominic.  Also the live DJ made the experience even better.  Can't wait come back.

OHbESiCeH3de5zQhcpa_4w.text: What a great place to eat and buoy your friends!  Domenic, the manager, came by the table and he asked questions, but not in a rude way. The just wanted to find out if they did good and would I come back!  Definitely!  Jacquline our waitress was great. I truly recommend the Hash avocado toast!  Try it you'll, you will love it!

e8-bcgvwGd9mkz14Jb-9Gg.text: Service was super, Domenic was so helpful with menu suggestions. The food was unbelievable the avocado toast is best I've ever had.

h1ZthfhJEMTv2YS-uF8p6w.text: We were quoted an hour and half wait, and were seated within 20 minutes. The food and the staff are amazing. We had great service even though the place was completely packed. I will definitely return. The food was phenomenal.

bEcOXfZhhIhYKU0-b2yk2A.text: I have never heard of this place until I saw a friends Snapchat of a crazy looking Bloody Mary!! I literally landed in Phoenix this morning and absolutely had to come try this place out. We were greeted at the door, the hostesses and other employees all had the door opened for my boyfriend and I before we were even close to the door! Already a super warm welcoming. We were sat immediately and our server, Ryan, quickly came over and was the nicest person ever!! He went over a lot of the drinks with us, gave us his opinions on them and was super friendly and informative! It took us a while to make up our mind cause the menu is full of tasty stuff but we finally did and both of our meals were phenomenal! I headed over to the build your own bloody bar as soon as I placed my order and both bartenders were so awesome with helping me build my Bloody and were also recommending what was good! They even let me taste a mix! So above and beyond! Our food came out suuuuper quickly! Dominic, the manager, continuously checked up on us to make sure everything was great. He was very personable and nice! Our server was absolutely fantastic and continued to check up on us as well. It seemed like every server in there was our server because no matter what section they had, almost every single one of them offered us things and talked to us. One of my boyfriends drinks were made wrong, he didn't even know though because it was SO GOOD! And when the bartender realized he walked on over with a brand new one and he was able to keep his old one. Which they were both great drinks so it didn't even matter!! Overall this place is incredibly friendly, warm, tasty, and has the best customer service over any restaurant I've been to in arizona. Or anywhere really!!! Absolutely fantastic and we will be back!! Thank you Ryan and Dominic for making the experience great! :)

hLLBMsJ1mCjHNx8_0vaqqw.text: Fun, fun, fun!  Came here the first Sunday they were open and it was a blast. If you want to have a party with your meal this is the place to go.  If you want a quiet peaceful place to eat this might not be for you. The drinks are spectacular and well made.  The BYO Bloody Mary bar rocks.  I thought the food was outstanding and the service was solid for being their first really busy Sunday.  Plus they had a great DJ spinning. The manager Dom came by 2-3 times to check on us and make sure everything was running smoothly and we were enjoying our meal and drinks.  We will definitely be back.

7gKTJa58RRHrYeexkhF72g.text: Great concept.  Very good spin on comfort food.  The Bacon board is a must.  So good.  Bacon.  The Bloody Mary bar provides a huge selection of garnishes that starts with a very good home mix.  Did I say Bacon , all wrapped up with good service from Baylee.

NeWZAcXv82ENVFW-alUL3g.text: Great food and Large portions. My wife and myself were out for a Saturday morning motorcycle ride on 7/28. We were hungry and she mentioned a newly opened spot she wanted to try...enter Hash Kitchen. For only being open a few weeks this place is phenomenal. We decided to sit outside as the wait was a bit long for inside seating (but this is normal for AZ and is in no way a complaint). The misting system made i bearable. We were seated as soon as we walked in, we had water and drinks at the same time the menu's were presented. We ordered the Lump crab and sweet potato hash and it was big enough for 2 people to eat...Mind you it took us 7 minutes from when we place our order to when the food was on the table (yes i timed it). I eyed every other meal that was brought to the tables around us... and made the comment "I wish i would have ordered that". We enjoyed this so much we actually arrived home from out ride and grabbed out younger kids and took them there for breakfast along with a few friends that also loved it. Needless to say we will be return customers and it'll even be better sitting outside once the fans and shades are installed. Dominic checked up on us even before we had our food and came back after to ensure everything was up to par and it was. This will be our go to spot after our weekend rides.

c9pxn12KjwKlAmW6pjGtJw.text: Love the vibe!  Wow is it busy here... We were told our wait could be around 35min... It was actually only like 10min!! Service was on point. We were welcomed right away and has our drink order taken. LOVED the mimosa flight!  Although they called the one passion fruit, but really it is star fruit... It was the best however out of them all. Next time I would love to try out the make your own bloody Mary! On to the food. The corned beef hash was delicious, the egg cooked to perfection. I wish the potato to corned beef ratio was a little better.  OMGEEEE, their biscuits! At first glance I thought it was a roll...it was fluffy and flavorful with a nice crispy outer shell!! Hubby had the Monte Cristo; after finishing half of the plate he discovered a pineapple slice in the sandwich...props for getting my husband to eat fruit as he is usually not a fan. The French fries were on point. Crisp and fluffy...seasoned perfectly. It is a tad pricey, but understandable...

UJ545L-3kYTlRma6NnQxQA.text: This was our second time at Hash Kitchen. Once was just not enough!   The menu goes beyond the basics for breakfast and lunch (They close at 3pm) Today was Saturday and it was very busy. We had a little wait to be seated, but not too long. On the weekends, they have a DJ spinning tunes. The Bloody Mary bar seemed to be very unusual and very popular. Our server was very pleasant and accommodating. Our food arrived promptly and was DELICIOUS...looking and tasting! My husband had a breakfast burrito stuffed with egg, potato, steak, bacon, onion and peppers. My dish was a sweet treat. It was called "banana split brioche French toast". It was topped with caramelized bananas, blueberries and strawberries along with an ice  ream cone shell filled with vanilla mascarpone. As if all of that wasn't enough, the maitre 'd, Dominic stopped by our table to chat and make sure "everything was okay".  It was a very nice and thoughtful gesture . He made me feel that as a customer, I mattered. WE will be going back. There are too made things on the Hash Kitchen menu that I want to try!

WTkNn62NTnOhVPlr5eJtAg.text: Location is great, inside is fresh & vibrant, incredible looking bloody mary bar (if you like those), and a very nice Manager asking how your meal was. Menu was easy to read & service was above average. Con's- brioche french toast was dry & bottom burnt, maple syrup was very flavorful. Scramble would have been good if chorizo had an flavor at all. Had to ask for a tortilla to eat it & add hot sauce, so bland. My husband had the biscuits and gravy which i liked but again lacked flavor. Needed spice, biscuits tasted fresh by hard to cut open. Maybe worth a second try but overall a miss with flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Classic Brioche french toast, chorizo scramble &amp; biscuits &amp; gravy with sausage

MS4PNvnK5NhW9310h9Tsrw.text: This was our second time here.  The first time was a weekday.  If you can do a weekday, I highly recommend it.  This was a Sunday and there was a full hour wait to be seated.  No fear.  You can stop at the bar.  After all, that is what makes this experience so unique.  Well worth the wait.  They have a Bloody Mary bar, that I should have taken a picture of, but you can see our finished products.  It has basically anything and everything you could want to put in it.  Start by picking your salt; celery or bacon.  Bacon, duh!   Then pick your mix, al the way up to burning off taste buds.  Then the fixings.  Too many to list but included: slim Jim, pickled boiled eggs, different flavored pickles, cheese stuffed olives, meatballs, bacon slices, and my FAV jalapeno poppers.  They have more specialty drinks worth noting.  I saw one with cotton candy and a spinner in it.  They also do flights of mimosas in six fruity flavors.  They have a DJ on weekends.  Despite this place being slammed packed and really loud, the staff is so upbeat and friendly.  Jesus, was our waiter.  Polite, makes great recommendations, attentive and made for a great visit.  Dominic the manager is seen floating around.  Stopped and chatted with us.  See the pic!  You can always tell how management is running a business by the way the staff treats the customer.  They're rocking it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. The staff is always friendly and attentive.  The managers are always visible, outgoing, and keeping an eye on the service.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Banana split French toast.  Enough for 4 of us.

4Uijv-nNHOqlX68CpbtGbw.text: The food was amazing but the service was even better. My dad ordered the Chicken and Waffles and said they were the best he's ever had. They are visiting from San Diego are super disappointed there isn't a Hash Kitchen there. The manager, Dominic, was extremely friendly and very personable. You can tell he appreciates all his customers. We will for sure be back!

54x00XGjFGmZCFmdmMKvQQ.text: Came here for brunch around 10:20am and was told we had a 45 min wait - we got seated around 11am so estimation was pretty accurate. We got seated outside but the misters and fans helped with the heat and there was plenty of shade. This is the second time I've had Hash Kitchen and enjoy many of their dishes. We started with the donut cannoli to share - which cans with a cute wooden board of three. The sweetness of the cream was perfect and not too sweet, and definitely enhances the taste of the donut itself. We also each got juices for brunch and one mimosa flight. The orange juice was good, pineapple juice tasted not freshly made, and the grapefruit was good too. The mimosa flight had: orange, pineapple, strawberry and blueberry - the alcohol in the blueberry one was strongest. Their fruits are also seasonal so it changes depending on the fruit's season.   For the entree: - Fried Chicken Benedict: the chicken flavor was all there and not dry. The hollandaise sauce really brought together all the flavors and the buttered bread underneath was delicious on its own! The crispy onion bits sprinkled all over was one of the best things to top off this dish. - Carnitas Hash: flavor of the pork was on point. Lots of corn and potatoes mixed in with it. And you get a large scoop of avocado and tortillas on the side - yum! - Frittatas: made with lots of eggs and cake with tortillas on the side. This dish was very generous and good, but not my favorite out of the four we had. - Tamales Benedict: this tasted good and surprisingly went well with the Benedict and tamales combo. Worth trying!  Total was 109 without tips for the meal, which is an average price. Would recommend and return. However, we were disappointed in our food service when we ordered before most tables around us and they got their meals before us :/ not sure how that works but took us 40 minutes before we got food served. Otherwise the place is good and has an awesome DIY Bloody Mary bar for those into it. Lots of parking in the lot and free water while you wait through the hot weather.

UUCpWH7iZ257ZQYdh6kKNg.text: Hash Kitchen is now my go-to brunch spot. I've been in twice and have absolutely LOVED my meal both times. The scramble that has the chorizo in it is out of this world! So simple yet so full of flavor. The manager, Domenic, was very welcoming. He came by after to check on our experience and chatted with us for some time. Nice and entertaining guy! I love feeling like a guest more than a customer and he sure made my group feel that way. The only reason why I'm giving this 4 stars is because both times that I have been here the service has been extremely slow. The server took our order and then didn't return until our food was finished. I ended up having to ask the host for extra things that we needed during our meal - like another drink. Also - both times I have been here my mimosa has taken forever to get to my table. My food actually got to the table at the same time as my drink did the last time I was there. It's hot in Arizona so the drinks should be coming out faster than that! But anyways- if you don't mind the slow service, then everything else is a go from me!

The food was very creative but not very good I had a carnitas skillet which consisted a very little carnitas two eggs potato's topped with what seemed liked an entire can of Fried onions. Their food is the best I've ever had. Got the pretzel Benedict. It was so good I couldn't stop. Their mimosas are amazing. The kiwi mimosa and peach one are the best. I am not a bloody Mary fan but their Bloody Mary bar is off the chain. Love love the DJ and the ambiance is so fun. This is the best brunch place ever.  Go here. You won't be disappointed.

xcdqpRx6_PJlUTNnEZheKA.text: The food here is out of control. It's so so so so good. It's pricey, but it's great. I know I am going to sound old here, but it's so darn loud in there. I know it's supposed to be a place you go to keep the party going after you've been out all night, but by that time I usually have a headache. If I'm going there after I've slept all night, then I'd like to finish my breakfast and still be headache-free... but it's SO LOUD I usually leave with a throbbing head. I keep going back because the food is so good, but I wish they had a quieter area to sit.

I tried the biscuit and gravy and was shocked how much flavor it had. Very Good!!!! I did try this place on the weekend before and it was way to packed. 1.5 hour wait. m00PK1POM-wv3sCSFSpe5A.text: I think this is probably a great place for those who are under 40.  The ambient noise was very loud which makes having a conversation difficult, but this is probably fine for people who love to bury their nose in their cellphones instead of talking.  My husband had the huevos rancheros which he really liked.  I had the make your own scrambler, which was okay but the kitchen forgot the avocado.  The Bloody Mary bar looked interesting.  You could make a meal out of everything they offer, as long as you aren't looking for anything very healthy.  I can see why this is a big attraction.  I probably won't go back since I don't like eating breakfast or lunch in a nightclub atmosphere, want something more relaxing.

wGTVaHJZDW7d9kvu_g1zhw.text: Oh hash kitchen. So much potential. This place has the best atmosphere and really great drinks, the Bloody Mary bar is always the main attraction. I've been to all the locations except the Arcadia one.   They all leave me craving something more. The food is truly lack luster. The portions are large, I repeat LARGE. which is very nice, honestly you can split most of the dishes, but nothing on menu is ever "wow I can't wait to eat this again". I normally will eat here for the atmosphere and drinks  the food feels like an after thought. I do recommend giving it a shot! If your going Saturday or Sunday be prepared to wait an hour unless your very early or very late.

_PS2P7b72wxY84IpfxeAtw.text: Finally got to try this place after a couple times trying to come here, I got to say I was a bit disappointed. I don't think it lived up to the hype that everyone has put on it, we waited for a bit which seemed normal as every time we drive by there's a huge line. Which doesn't really effect my opinion, just an observation if you're trying to time your events.   We walked inside and there was a DJ playing music, which we thought was a bit odd as he was just standing there swaying and it was Sunday morning.   We came here with a group of people, about 7 or 8, and we were kind of squished together into a booth with a chair on the end. Our waitress was nice enough but was a bit rude at times. She brought our menus and gave us adequate time to review, I can really only speak on behalf  of my dish and my husbands, I was not impressed with mine. I got the chicken and waffles and was surprised at how plain and bland the chicken was. I enjoyed the light fry of it but it didn't taste like I thought it would, especially seeing other dishes going out that looked AMAZING. I was honestly bummed, the waffle was fine but I wasn't given enough syrup for my dish - in the phot it looks huge but it's about 2 tablespoons if tha, but the waitress took too long to check in on us I just used what I had.   My husband dish was pretty good, such a good idea for the tamales and pulled pork. It was truly a hit or miss for me, disappointed. Everyone's experience is though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

TC-o78GHsKbH2GWnZBXFVg.text: Hmmm... I struggle with this review a bit. Our bartender was awesome and attentive and bloody Mary's are amazing but here comes the big but.... i guess if you are looking for a super LOUD I mean we are talking even on a Friday morning at 10am they have a DJ playing music like you are in a nightclub working the tables, (which yes they actually do!) then this is the place for you. But I couldn't even hear myself think. I def. can see the appeal for younger folks wanting a cool hangout but I could never imagine coming here hung over or even with the smallest of headaches or kids.   Ok food: Chicken Tinga frittata $15- was pretty good (but I had to wait for it to be remade unfortunately as I had requested it without the caramelized onions and there was a lot on there), enough food for 3 people - had to have been made with at least 10 eggs if not more! I mean their portions here are HUGE! Split your meals people- they def. don't skimp on their food!   2 people- 2 bloody Mary's and 2 breakfasts = $72. (Including tip and tax)  All in all- it was a eh experience since I received my meal 15 mins after my husband.   I can see how people celebrating parties or groups hanging out could enjoy this place for sure though.

OZ83W3dKSGo_QoOxYwXYvA.text: This is how you would expect to brunch in Vegas  the whole atmosphere is a party vibe... from the live DJ, to the drink flights, and the build your own Bloody Mary bar. We always order the mimosa flight and the French Toast. The mimosa flight is awesome because you get to sample different juices and you honestly can't go wrong with any of the French Toast options. We also ordered the Chicken Tinga and it was simply okay. I would expect a lot more flavors with the chipotle, green salsa, shishito peppers, sour cream, avocado, and cotija cheese but it fell a bit short on the SAZON (which I totally get, we don't want to make chicken tinga too spicy there). Overall, Hash is still our favorite brunch spot in AZ hands down.

qOnrgte8DXDrS9z6hF9_9A.text: Great place for brunch! Very popular, younger crowd. There is a bar and outside seating too. The mimosa flight looked yummy! 20 minute wait, service was slow. DJ plays loud music. I had the Eggs Benedict with herbed fried chicken. Delicious! Hash potatoes were rubbery though- pass on those. Scramblers looked very appetizing.

9OjJGR6j093je7U2m6TlFg.text: I don't even know how to describe what I felt when I walked in the doors to Hash kitchen. It wasn't quite a sensory overload, but it hit that sweet spot right before overload. There was a Bloody Mary bar, a disco ball and a LIVE DJ! Did I mention it was only about noon?!   First off, the menu is pretty big, and EVERYTHING sounds yummy on there! We couldn't make up our minds, so we ordered 3 things... yes, just 2 of us. Chicken tinga, Avocado Toast, and Coconut and Almond encrusted french toast for the sweet tooth. The tinga came with potatoes and the egg was so dense - how come mine never turn out like that?!   Honestly the most outstanding and gustatory delight was the Avocado toast. They were large and heavy, layer after layer of goodness... I didn't want to miss out on any aspect of the toast, so I picked up a slice, opened wide and took a huge bite. It was messy and a little embarrassing (had I cared about what others may have thought), but good golly, that was the best mouthful of anything I've ever had! The girls sitting next to me giggled at me, but I didn't care... they were envious - in a good way, because they ordered the same thing and these prim and perfectly made up girls did the exact same thing I did when their Avocado toast got to them. We shared an inexplicable understanding at that point.   GO TO HASH KITCHEN! Order literally ANYTHING! You won't be disappointed!

iBtRrOpGi1FkutbzEusHWQ.text: Not your boring ol breakfast!  Great vibe, fun music and the food is delicious. Try the Bloody Mary bar or avocado toast, you won't go wrong with either

iR6-kD8u-1whqdzT_oQdTw.text: I don't know how I skipped out on this place for so long but this could be a monthly spot now for brunch on Sunday or every other week if I could weekly lol. They do close at 3 because it's brunch only but even then get there early because the wait can get long depending the time of morning.   The vibe just checking in for the waitlist is pretty cool, everyone inside talking having fun, enjoying the company and food plus there's a DJ. That was a great add it makes it feel like your in Vegas.  Right when you walk in to the right is this amazing Bloody Mary bar that you can add everything too. There is some upgrades you can do with a charge but they will tell you before you order.  There's no limit to what you can add to yours so be creative and have fun with it.  Oh ya and there's a mimosa flight that we of course couldn't pass on   The waitress we had was friendly and helpful just like everyone else there.  Now the food is ridiculous from what we ordered. I think our eyes were bigger then our bellies.  We got the brunch fries, the avocado toast and the lemon meringue French toast.  Holy call what flavors what taste and what big size portions the food was.   We were not disappointed here.   This is a place we will come back to and am excited to come try more food.

Z2iWlFxOiiWBitfu_h-0oQ.text: I was looking for a great breakfast / brunch place to go. I came across this gem (thanks to yelp) with a unique, eye catching killer menu. This location is a newer breakfast/brunch restaurant that's been in Chandler for about a year ( in July). They've originated in AZ with additional spots in Scottsdale, Glendale and opening another location in Arcadia soon!  Line was out the door Saturday morning about 10:00 AM when we arrived. Noted that the immediate feel of the hashery is a trendy plush place with exceptional offerings. When you walk into the restaurant you'll view their DIY Bloody Mary Bar & the live DJ too! Let's just start out by saying this is raising the game in Chandler!   We were seated "right away", after we went with "no preference"! However, we were sat outside with no shade ( in the direct sun) and to many flies. So, a place at the bar opened up and we moved over there!   They have a Bloody Mary Bar that's staffed and it provides many different Vodkas - several were house infused; everything from Bacon Vodka to Habanero Vodka. Then there were the mixers and they ranged from Classic Bloody Mary Mix to Mixed Chili Mix; along with a choice of rim salts - bacon or traditional. Then it gets interesting with all of the add ins you care to add in - Hearts of Palm, Lots of Pickles and Olives to choose from, bacon, beef jerky, Slim Jim's, fresh raw oysters, cheeses, and on and on. My Spicy Mary with Hearts of Palm, bacon, dill pickle spear and olives was truly one of the best Bloody Mary's I've had. They also have a flight of their signature mimosa.  So much to choose from on their menu The plates I saw coming out? "Holly Cow", the Chicken & Waffles looked incredible! I had a really hard time deciding so I ask the bartender for recommendations. She suggested many things, but did say that the Cliliquiles is a popular item. That's what I "originally" looked at, so went with it -YUM! It includes two eggs ( anyway you'd like um) with a red enchilada sauce and I also requested a side of the green chili too! My husband had the carne asada breakfast dish with two eggs over easy with house potatoes and tortillas. He really enjoy it. The meat was flavorful and tender. *The only downside for us both: we didn't care for one spice in the potatoes. It seemed to be a dry ( woody) rosemarie. I like the spice, but didn't care for it in this potato hash. Fresh would have been better or just omit it!*  We have guests coming to visit soon and you can bet where we will be having brunch one of those days!   GREAT Concept, GREAT Atmosphere & GREAT Customer Service. The female bartenders & bar back guy were extremely friendly, yet also very informative and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. CARNE ASADA &amp; EGGS
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

epPJqH5lgsA5Y5pSUKqeaA.text: This was our first time to #hash and honestly our expectations was great.  I love that this place is dog friendly!! We brought our pup for the his first outing and everyone was so nice and friendly with us and our dog. They provide a water bowl for him which is great especially in this AZ heat.  I ordered the chicken tinga not have favorite, however I will order something else next time I come.  The chicken was dry and chewy the bed of egg it was laying out didn't have much flavor, the hash browns that come on the side were dry and cold.   My fiance got the chicken and waffles and said it was very good.   So I believe it was just the thing I ordered. I don't take it out on anyone or the business it just might be my test.   I enjoyed the music and Bloody Marys!   Domenic was very nice and continued to check on us and our food. He was polite and showed he truly cares about the business and their customers.

K5e6uUH2yjAYaVYJD2i9Zw.text: We stopped in to Hash Kitchen around 7:30 for an early breakfast with the kids. We were seated quickly and  the host brought us a high chair.   I was a little disappointed with the vegetarian options. There are, of course, all the French toast, pancakes, and waffles and two egg dishes. I would really like to see a veggie Benedict, aside from being my go to at most breakfast places, it would just be nice to see the same creative flourishes elsewhere on the menu applied to the veggie options.  We decided on the Banana Split French Toast, the Sicilian Sausage Hash, and the Short Stack Chocolate chip pancakes. I really loved the French toast. It looked like it should have been sugar overload, but because of the thickness of the bread. That sweet marscapone was delicious even if it didn't resemble marscapone all that much. The ice cream cone was overkill--I gave it to my kid. We were all pretty happy with our food.  It was 7 AM, so we weren't drinking yet (it wasn't stopping anyone else), but the Bloody Mary bar looked amazing. There was also some kind of disco ball drink (I think it was the Lights Out Mimosa) that looked fairly insane. We'll have to try the booze out another day.  The service was okay, though we did sit for a while before anyone came to take our drink order. I think our server was just trying to let us get the kids settled.   We'll be back. Hopefully a little later in the day:)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Banana Split Brioche

IFtUPPz6sQR7AqfknCYl7g.text: The space is huge with plenty of tables plus seats at the bar and seating outside. The large windows let in a ton of light and the restaurant has a nice open feel to it. Bloody mary bar right as you walk in. I don't drink bloody mary's but this is genius! I would want a bigger glass to put all the goodies in if I was getting one though (it comes in a small mason jar glass).  The DJ is right in between the bar and bloody mary bar. It was a bit loud when we walked in especially with all the crowd chatter but it seemed to turn down a bit and was just right as we settled in. I'm not going to ever complain with a DJ spinning classic 80s hits and all the jams from the 90s, 00s to today. I will take a live DJ over pandora station any day. I'm in heaven and singing every word...makes me just want to get up and dance. Way to put me in a great mood to start my day ...thanks DJ C-Los!!  We only had to wait a few minutes to be seated. It's 1030am on a friday and the place is still packed! We are on vacation so it's understandable why we are there, but I am impressed with how busy it is on a weekday (do you all have off today?) Glad we checked it out today so we dont have to fight the weekend crowds, but it is worth it if you do have to wait. When we sat down I was most excited about the size of the mug on the table. I love big mugs and to get one at a restaurant with breakfast is rare for me. So I was stoked to get a nice hot tea with my meal and I was even more excited when it was served with my very own hot water pot. Bonus points for also having individual carafes for the coffee!! And no, it's not an excuse for the server to be lazy and not have to refill our cups...Angelina checked in on us frequently and filled up our waters and made sure we were satisfied with our meals multiple times. She was fantastic. With how busy it is, it would be really easy to get ignored after the food comes but that wasn't the case at all and she was amazing.   The food came out relatively quickly as well and it was nice and hot. My gut instinct was to say it was small portions for the price but I don't need massive portions and was pleased with how filling the food was. I got the veggie scramble. The eggs were airy and cooked thoroughly and the veggies were fresh and crisp. The hash potatoes were so aromatic I could smell them as soon as the plate was delivered. Loved the seasoning and how crisp they were on the outside with a nice soft center.  Hubby got the biscuits & gravy with Italian sausage and he took a bite and says holy sh*t that's good. The sausage was a little over cooked but the skillet was an awesome way to serve the dish and keep it all hot. Biscuits were light and fluffy, savory and slightly sweet and the eggs were cooked to perfection.   The snap a selfie station by the front door is such a cute touch and great idea to spread the word on social media about this hot spot and keep the millennials entertained while they wait to be seated ;)  At the end of our meal she offers us to go cups for our hot drinks. Hell yea that was the icing on the cake.  I didn't want to keep a table occupied to just drink my tea, so being able to take it to go and enjoy every last drop was sweet!! So glad we found this spot while in town visiting for the weekend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie scrambles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. My own tea pot with mini honey and big mug
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. View from front door with DJ and bloody mary bar

LwOxYNmQcY3_2jxU1ZuSsg.text: Hash Kitchen is unique and so much fun! I mostly come for the Bloody bar and mimosa flights, but having a DJ spin while you eat brunch is hard to beat too.   We come about once a month, and have found that if we stick to a few staples, everything is perfect. Some of the food is honestly just so-so, and it's kinda pricey. On the plus side, portions are large and it's easy to share anything. We're big fans of the avocado toast and the biscuits and gravy. Far from healthy, but worth the splurge! We've tried some of the skillet dishes and while none have been bad, they're simply not memorable. The ambiance is extremely memorable, so that just doesn't jive. Also, you can't come here without getting a Bloody (be sure to check out the hot chafing dishes at the very end...bacon, meatballs, and jalapeno poppers!) or a mimosa flight!  Be prepared to wait on weekends, but we usually put our names in, order a Bloody, and then manage to snag a spot at the bar within 15-20 minutes. Oh, and come ready to dance!

VdpCv1tM_wzmMMJ-Nga99Q.text: First time at any Hash Kitchen. Drove by a bazillion times tho. I arrived at 9 on a Tuesday morning and it was about 1/8 full. I was seated immediately but waited several mins for my server, Gabriel, to greet me. He generally ignored me during the entire meal.   I ordered the Corned Beef Benedict for $16.22 plus tip. My breakfast arrived in 8 mins.   The corned beef was rather dry, especially since there was very little hollandaise, and the biscuit was very ordinary. The eggs were woefully over cooked.  The hash potatoes were actually skillet potatoes with onions and bell peppers, served in a little bowl.   The meal was conceptually great. The execution was poor, due to the dryness of the meat, the potatoes and the over cooked eggs.   Service was minimal, the flavor was lacking and the value just wasn't there. I really wanted to like Hash, given the reviews. I'll try again, with a different server and definitely a different meal.

Og2xlVly8nfILwl8vZDZLw.text: While on a vacation me and my sister had decided to stop by this location to see how great the food really was. Upon arrivalI was greeted by friendly staff and a beautiful restaurant ambience. It was very early in the morning yet the location had already had plenty of customers.  After waiting for about 10 minutes, I was seated. Looking over the menu options, I noticed there were so many things to choose from that I really had a hard time choosing.  My lovely waitress, who I had forgotten her name was very helpful with choosing something that was appeasing to the eye and stomach. I ended up going with the French toast, and I added bacon, and Homestyle potatoes. This was such a delicious meal.  At first, I thought it was gonna be too sweet, but everything complemented each other from the Waffle cone, syrup,  fruit, and the banana and a delicious cream that was on top. I was really ecstatic to have tried this particular menu choice item and I actually recommend it as a favorite.  Leaving the location,  I felt not only satisfied with the menu choice of item, but grateful that I had a chance to experience the Hash Kitchen! For a person who travels a lot, I will have to mark this location as one of my favorites for brunch.

WIKLDWs9if2rwKXGKbKk7g.text: Went to Hash for the first time today and it was amazing! Great service, great food, fast service and most importantly, HOT COFFEE!   I had the carnitas hash and it was delicious!  My husband had the chilaquiles and they were tasty.  My mother in law had the tamales Benedict and really liked it. We order a half order of regular French toast which was amazing! And a gluten free pancake which was also very good!   I would say the carnitas hash and French toast was the best!   The manager, Domenic, came to greet us and check on how the service was and we let him know that service was fast and great! Our server Jesus was very polite, knowledgeable and provided excellent service and suggestions.    We will definitely come back and try out their new restaurant Sicilian Butcher!

kQvbD0ieTjOMZJQEXGgbbQ.text: This is not my first time here and definitely not my last! I love showing this place off to family, friends & clients. Guaranteed great experience, outstanding service and incredible food when you come at non-peak hours.   Service is stellar, everyone has a smile on their face all of the time. Management has the right amount of staff every single time am there, you never have to wait for anything, you never have to wave someone down and everyone works together to make the customer happy.  Food and drink presentation is out of this world. Over-the-top care goes into every single plate that leaves that kitchen. The drinks are fresh, fun and super creative.   The personal attention I receive every time I am there is so welcoming. Dominic is such a people pleaser, he makes sure everyone is personally welcomed, thanked and appreciated. You can't help but feel happier when you leave this place, the DJ is the absolute best!

4A-ZVNIdOtuZE7d64bV3tQ.text: Just ate here for the first time. Great carnitas hash and a killer, build your own Bloody Mary. Had a nice chat with Dominic., the boss. We'll be back the next time we're in this area.

BPohFI9FUFhLrs2m-Puy2w.text: Hash Kitchen is the bomb-diggity! From the food, atmosphere, the BYOBloody Mary Bar and the Manager..Dominic is personable, friendly and funny! The food is delish and choices are aplenty!! Come see this new establishment and see Dominic and his crew!!

pE7tfyTkfXVo2c8uxnqdMA.text: I got here today at 10:50 for my 11:00 reservations and the hostess said our table would be ready in 15 minutes.  We waited outside for forty minutes in the Arizona summer.  We spoke with the hostess multiple times and  were told it would just be a couple more minutes each time.  Eventually the manager told us that the party at the table we had reserved was taking longer than expected, and that they would buy us a drink for the inconvenience.  We left at 11:30 and went to a different restaurant.    Reservations are pretty basic and have been a part of the food service industry for a long time, pretty hard to screw that one up...  I was looking forward to the bloody marys, I could see the garnish bar from outside and it looked good for what its worth.

The server, Serina, was very helpful and one of the managers, Dominic, wanted to know our suggestions to make things better or future menu item ideas. We plan to come back!

9k40Shmw8A-9N_VtyGriBw.text: Went here and the atmosphere is so nice. It looks boujee but in a good way. A great place to take someone who you want to impress breakfast wise!!! I had chicken and waffles. I thought it was weird that everything was separate on the menu but trust me, it will be enough. Big portion or big plated food. C_YRVBPsvrXc7cTsJps2dQ.text: This is our first visit to this location. They have been open less than 2 weeks and they are already off to a good start. The atmosphere is awesome. There is a DJ, full regular bar and a Bloody Mary bar with dozens of toppings. The manager Dominic came to our table to welcome us. He was a wonderful host. I had the crab eggs Benedict and it was made with real lump crab, no filler. They use biscuits instead of English muffins. The muffins are fluffy and delicious. The smoked salmon Benedict was delicious as well. They have some many menu choices it's hard to decide because everything sounds good. Our server Vanessa was very sweet and attentive. Overall the place is a wonderful brunch spot. I wish I lived here, I would come every weekend!

eMBruMtGm8DQnP8R0zjDYw.text: This restaurant is very welcoming. It's open and bright, and the service is outstanding. I am a huge Bloody Mary fan and the idea of allowing your customers to customize their drink is absolutely genius, and I wish someone made this in LA !!! The service was absolutely amazing ! LD5suGQhGGwDWuJpoT48oA.text: Yesterday was my first time going to Hash Kitchen and I have to say, I was not disappointed. The hostess were very nice to start with. Our waitress was super nice and was totally singing songs with us. The Live DJ definitely made the environment very fun. The food was delicious and the flight of mimosas were definitely tasty. The manager Domenic came to our table a few times to make sure we were doing well and enjoying ourselves. I've never seen this type of customer service at a restaurant. I will definitely be coming back.

fw7EvJfFcFGAZYblqBiWIw.text: I've been looking forward to this grand opening for quite some time. In fact, I had the honor of being the first patron to sit at the bar. The Hash Kitchen is co-owned by chef Joey Maggiore and his wife Cristina Maggiore of Maggiore Culinary Concepts (who also own Tomaso's Italian Restaurant and Tommy V's Osteria Pizzeria). They are known for their crazy breakfast creations. This is the first location for the East Valley and they picked a pretty strategic spot next to Whole Foods and the 101 freeway. The spot was once a Paradise Bakery. The atmosphere was very inviting right when I first walked in as several people welcomed me. The restaurant is spacious and the decor is beautiful with their signature #Hash #Hash Baby signage all over the walls. Their popular build-your-own Bloody Mary bar with their many garnishes and bacon-infused vodka is the first thing you see as you walk in. I even saw oysters as a choice for your garnish. I sat at the bar and had fun chatting it up with the bartenders. I have yet to indulge in the Bloody Mary bar, but I did order one of their delicious blueberry craft mimosas with my meal (you can order a flight of mimosas as they have many flavors to choose from). I tried the Christina's Tamale Cakes for my meal. It's a form of an egg's benedict that combines sweet corn cakes, green chili pork, hollandaise and poached eggs. They come served on corn husks and I really enjoyed the spiciness of the pork with the sweet corn cakes. I wasn't a huge fan of the hash potatoes (a little dry) but the split biscuit was a pleasant surprise. Overall this was a nice experience and I'm super stoked to have a Hash Kitchen down the street. Hopefully my next visit will include a visit to the Bloody Mary bar.

FKZD1zaonpZp0s-w8QssPg.text: My boyfriend and I tried this location today. We got sat and it took 5-7 minutes before we were even greeted.  Once our server took our drink orders, it took her probably close to ten minutes to come back and take our food orders. My boyfriend had the poutine corn beef hash and I had the cannoli pancakes and a Bloody Mary. The food was good however, my boyfriend was almost finished with his meal before she came to check on us and I needed syrup before I could eat my meal. Our server wasn't very friendly and seemed to only be checking on the tables surrounding us and kept skipping over us. After I requested the syrup, it took quiet some time to receive that too and by the time it was all said and done, I was over it and didn't even feel like eating my food. I'm not sure if she wasn't checking on us because we are younger and thought we wouldn't tip well but I'm a server and a bartender and if she would have served us properly, she would have had a great tip from me. Not sure if we will come back here again. Very disappointed.

NxinNOwKVZNgL8UeornSqw.text: What a unique brunch experience! We waited about 45 minutes to get in and had gotten there around 9. So if you do not want to wait, get there early. I found it a little overwhelming and extreme for the brunch I was looking for that day with my mom.  I really appreciated the server that we had, who was very personable and attentive even though they were extremely busy. I had the pork hash and thought it was very tasty. I could not finish it all. My mom and husband also bought their food was tasty. I was unimpressed by the coffee. It was not very strong. Overall, I thought the food was good but a little over priced, but undoubtably, you are paying for the environment you are eating in.  I personally will not go back unless I am planning to be with a big group of people and am in the mood for some Bloody Mary's but am sure it is a fun place to go for the right group of people!

I ate almost the whole portion which is crazy! Hubby had the Avocado Toast. This was also super yummy. They serve it with a green sauce on the side. Use it! It tastes amazing! Having the sweet and the savory meals to balance each other was a perfect choice. Service was excellent. There was always someone coming by to clear dishes or fill up water. Can't wait to go back!

h5Tp2SOm5mNIF9DyU5m_XA.text: A friend and I went to Hash Kitchen for brunch, first time there. The first thing we noticed was the loud music and almost walked out to go somewhere else. The place was only about 25% full so we asked the hostess to seat us in the quietist part of the restaurant...her response was "the volume of the music is the same wherever you sit". We spotted a corner table in the back of the place which was probably a bit more quiet. The waitress wasn't very welcoming but took our order which came out rather quickly. The lemon ricotta pancakes were dry and a bit chewy, with only a hint of lemon taste. Note: I've had Lemon Ricotta pancakes at another popular breakfast/lunch restaurant that were served with lemon curd and actual ricotta cheese - so yummy! The vegetarian scramble was tasty but the hash browns were dry and a bit hard, as if they had been left over and sitting for a while. 'not sure we'll give this place another try.

mhWV3x93rXlMgA2cHf9TCw.text: Hipster is all I kept thinking.  I went here on a Sunday around 10am with a girlfriend. There were at least 30 people outside with the music blaring. People dancing inside. Was I going to the club or brunch??  Lol. We got sat in maybe 25 mins. We were busy talking so it didn't seem so bad. Wow the menu! Too many great choices and I kept changing my mind. The big start was the huge Bloody Mary bar. If I drank I would be all over that.  Service was great considering how packed it was. Food was tasty. Definitely will go back. Just not at 10 am on a Sunday. ;)

The s'mores pancakes had one chocolate chip in all of 3 pancakes & hardly any marshmallow cream. The breakfast potatoes were bland and the pancakes itself were pretty dry. It was doable but I wouldn't come back or recommend it to anyone. Our waitress also seemed to rush us and showed no patience or interest in helping us. I feel that this place has potential.

My recommendation to this place to make it even more amazing is to add a wait list ahead of time either through yelp or on their website!

0nBG73RZtnxejqzHm6RriA.text: If the food was excellent than I would say that maybe this place isn't for me but alas the food is very mediocre. We came in for brunch on Sunday morning and before 9 am a DJ was playing club music at decibels heard in a club. This alone would be a reason for me to not return add to this the high prices and poorly executed dishes.   I ordered the herb fried chicken benedict, it arrived and looked great upon tasing my chicken was room temp and did not taste of any herb, the best thing about the whole dish was the biscuits.  This place is definitely trying to put out the "scene" vibe and while the Bloody Mary bar may pull people in I suspect the high prices and lackluster entrees will prohibit them from returning.

4hS8dhXadablbiZlm8PwTQ.text: Top notch breakfast in Chandler, AZ.  The seating area is quite large, as well as their coffee mugs!  It can get a little busy on the weekends, but it's well worth the wait.  The pancakes are buttery, delicious, and perfectly cooked.  Can't wait to visit again!

dUnpKmuYHAsS06DmWXTwhg.text: Best breakfast spot ever! The drinks are amazing, the food is outstanding and the music is so lively! The wait is a bit long but well worth it! Domenic is a great manager and really puts in the effort to make sure his customers are taken care of. Highly recommend!!!

RXBM-3IO7LjPyWUAYQZgUg.text: We hadn't been to the Hash Kitchen for quite awhile so thought we'd go there today. I recently had a delicious Wild Salmon Omelet with Mascarpone at Eggstasy for $12.95 this past week. So when I saw the Spinach Smoked Salmon with Dill Mascarpone Frittata on their menu, I immediately wanted to try it and share it with my husband. When the food finally arrived, it looked like it was mostly spinach and very little salmon for $16! We got a little tin 3/4 cup with the tiniest overcooked potatoes I've ever seen. Couldn't even pick them up with your fork. We had to order an English muffin extra on the side! Like for $16 they couldn't include a 50 cent English muffin at their cost if even that! The frittata had VERY LITTLE salmon in it and when I looked, there was dark meat underneath the salmon. This was not acceptable for $16! In my husband's half, he had two tiny bites of salmon and the rest was spinach! If we would have wanted a SPINACH frittata, that's what we would have ordered! The salmon omelet at Eggstasy was FULL OF SOLID SALMON WITHOUT ANY DARK MEAT and we got half a plate full of hash browns or fruit, as well as, pancakes or toast for $12.95! Gave Hash Kitchen a second chance after 6 months and we'll cross this place entirely off of our breakfast schedule. Our waitress kept disappearing and when she did walk by our table, she looked straight ahead. We tried to get her attention about 3-4 times unsuccessfully. I had to repeatedly flag down other waiters to get more coffee, cream, and order our English muffin before our meal got cold. Not at all impressed. The main attraction here is their Bloody Mary bar. There were tons of empty tables at 9:00 AM when we left. Typically at that time, there's standing room only at Chandler breakfast restaurants. For a wonderful dining experience, good food at a better price, great Italian coffee and excellent service, go to Eggstasy on Gilbert Road south of Germann!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spinach Smoked Salmon with Dill Mascarpone Frittata

ssuf04fu57Dnr1CJcSGjiQ.text: Heard great things about this place and our team that participated in the Pat Tillman Run 2019 decided to "re-fuel" here.  Like most breakfast, lunch (brunch) places, this place gets busy...but many others had from the run had the same idea as us...so the wait was a little bit longer than the normal crowd.  Once we were seated we were greeted by our waitress immediately who took our drink order.  Many of us order the Build Your Own Bloody Mary (BYOBM) bar which was amazing.  So many items to garnish your drink and "make it your own."  I opted for the Corned beef Hash breakfast which came with homestyle potatoes as well.  It was presented in a skillet that was still very hot.  Everything was cooked to perfection and seasoned well.  My bloody mary base was green chili habenero, which was seasoned well, but lacked in spicy heat, for me.  Others may say it is a 5 chili rating, but me it was more like a 1 chili rating...but I like hot and won't & can't hold it against them; because it was tasty.  I would definitely come back again try other items on their menu as well as other bloody mary bases.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Corned beef Hash (comes with 2 eggs, your style)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Build Your Own Bloody Mary (BYOBM) green chili habenero base.  Bacon Salted rim

dU2fN9cewpvTUmbXrjFQ1Q.text: I came here for brunch with a large group after reading great reviews and wanting to show some out of town friends some cool local spots. Half of us went with the hashes and were disappointed when 80% of the entree was potatoes, and the rest being the meat and eggs. With such a premium price for breakfast I was definitely expecting more. The server was friendly but her attentiveness was pathetic, we were waiting on syrup for the pancakes for about 10 minutes, by the time my friend got her syrup her pancakes were soggy with the melted s'mores on them. Lastly, when the food was delivered it was like a minute between each entree was dropped leaving that awkwardness where everyone is waiting for the rest of the food to be delivered but wanting to eat their food while it's hot. You can do so much better in terms of breakfast/brunch places for half the price.

heIYfzDDQ0EMqZdbiGebDQ.text: The food here is good.   The atmosphere is better.   DJ - check.   Insane bloody Mary bar - check.   Bar - check.   Next time I'll split a meal and grab a bloody Mary.   I had the chicken and waffles.   Chicken was tasty but slightly dry.   The French toast was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Enough to share.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Breakfast is enough to share.

5e3mxQ_iGQYJgZlyxEBvnw.text: We just flew in to AZ and needed some breakfast before running around town for two days.  Plane landed at 7.30a, I scoured yelp for a nice breakfast place nearby my in-laws' house while my hubs managed car rental and luggage (aka all the hard work), we were seated at Hash by 8.30a.  It wasn't super crowded for a Friday morning but there was a ton of staff. There's nothing wrong with that, just an observation. I assume they were ready for a busy weekend brunch crowd.   They had a bloody mary bar that looked like it offered every option you could ever think of. I'm not a fan of bloody mary's, so I didn't bother to look but I know that's their selling point and they def made sure you knew it!  The place itself was super cute and clean. Tons of seating. Staff was extra friendly.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong things but I'm not dying to go back to try anything new. I ordered the bacon tray thing and my husband ordered some sort of cornbread hash. It was all GOOD but not great. It was a little too much flavor going on for my liking. The bacon had four different kinds of bacon - Jalapeno, black pepper, maple, and bacon jam. It came with cheese and some rolls. I am a MAJOR bacon fan and there was not one of those that I would order again. The has my husband got was delicious but there was SO MUCH going on. I cannot for the life of me remember which hash it was or what was in it. I couldn't comprehend the amount of things thrown in there, I guess. The fried leeks that they use as garnish and the coffee (nothing special, just coffee) were prob my fave part of the entire meal.  They did make gluten free pancakes for us! so...there's something!  It seemed a little pricey for Arizona. $14-ish/meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

U5BVTocjhvuIwC_PWNfQSQ.text: So we didn't actually eat here, but the experience was awful. There was a 30 minute wait, and we had initially said "no thank you, we will pass." Then we got swayed (a little desperately) to stay. So we waited about 10 minutes, and both decided that "hmm, we still really don't want to be here" and I went in to return the buzzer... the host argued with me to stay and I told her a couple times that "we're not interested."   Overall, I felt like they were very desperate for people to be there and will argue to get you to stay. The restaurant was busy enough, so I don't really understand. We just weren't in the mood to not be able to hear a thing with their blaring music.

uUvM7BJc8R1xddrF6aKQxw.text: Hash Kitchen is without a doubt the best brunch experience I've ever had. Their food is outstanding, the Bloody Mary bar is unbelievably stocked with toppings, mixes and other customizations. My husband and I just got married and we're enjoying a post wedding brunch here and the staff was so kind and congratulatory. I ordered the French toast, to die for. My husband ordered the herb chicken hash and it was totally crave- worthy. The real star of the show here was Domenic, one of the managers here. He was so genuinely kind and wonderful. I would return here just because of him quite honestly. It is apparent that he takes pride in his job and does it extremely well. He truly made my day better.   We will be here again and again. No doubt about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

VPMlPKcNizf7P1Y7nSCrMg.text: Listen, you are not even ready for this place! Brunching here is always such a great time!!! The music is loud enough to make you want to bust out some moves but good enough to still have a conversation with your girls/date/family. The food is incredible and the drinks... the drinks are delicious! You haven't brunched in Phoenix until you've visited the Hash Kitchen! I had the avocado toast (not pictured) the first time I was there (very big portion size, probably can feed two, depending on your appetite) and the last time I was there, I had the salmon platter and the mimosa flights, which was my absolute fave (see pictures).   Bottom line: Absolutely recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flights (seasonal flavors made by bar tender) Left to right: Orange classic mimosa, mango strawberry, pineapple and blueberry.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. My sister&#39;s order: corned beef Benedict with a latte  Disclaimer: if you do not like BBQ sauce, watch out for the hollandaise sauce
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Salmon Platter

G14wkOdIrFAQTRZ5dtwP_g.text: Go here if you want to start your day partying with a full belly of delicious food and bloody Mary's. The build your own bloody mary bar is awesome. Their mixes are tasty.  Service was ok. The wait was about 30 minutes. The presentation and the food tasted amazing! It was busy and the DJ was playing some fun, energetic tunes. I wouldn't recommend taking a baby or an elderly person because it is loud. Although, I was still able to have a good time and chat with my friend.  Overall, I had a fun time and enjoyed some great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Avocado toast was awesome
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cheers-ing to yummy bloody Mary&#39;s

2Nq6gUKnfceuRGkIbCTd-A.text: Treated my friend to a birthday brunch. Dominico and his staff were so accommodating the whole time! They even brought out a most delicious donut with a birthday candle and the server even serenaded my friend Happy Birthday in Spanish!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Birthday donut
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. chilaquiles!

TavAJXnwkfHNeewrzk_M4A.text: We tried Hash Kitchen for the first time for my birthday brunch and it was awesome! We went around 8:30 AM on Sunday. I called from the parking lot to see how long the wait was so I didn't have to get the kids out of the car if it was ridiculously long and it wasn't too bad. 15 minutes for inside, no wait for the patio. I told the hostess that we were calling from the parking lot and by the time we got in she already had our table on the patio ready. I had the mega mimosa since it was my birthday - fantastic! The strawberry boba bursts were so much fun! My husband had the cold brew colada and we split the carnitas hash and cannoli pancakes. Our kids split a side of toast, bacon and a short stack of pancakes. Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic. The food came out incredibly quickly and everyone was very attentive. The manager Domenic came by and had a great conversation with us. We are excited to try the Chandler location of the sister restaurant the Sicilian Butcher opening soon. We will be back to Hash Kitchen soon too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

Jp6o07qh2FzSCCoHa3rEqQ.text: Love you Dominic.  Thank you for the great birthday breakfast!!!! We were the 5 ladies at the birthday table this morning.   Food and atmosphere were fantastic!!

08pIFs3yLx2oGXhbEaqvSQ.text: This one of worst places I have gone to for breakfast. I love good corn beef hash and you would expect it to be good here. It was terrible. It was greasy had lots of potatoes and I believe it gave me food poisoning. I was sick next day after eating there.

PwrTPx7mTBACyM1HXqCXcA.text: One of the best breakfast restaurants I've been to! Their drinks are amazing, and the cereal flight is a must try! Our server, Jessica, was excellent and very attentive and friendly. It gets really busy on the weekends, so make sure you arrive early! One of the managers, Dominic, stopped by our table to check in with us as well. That added a nice touch as I can't remember the last time that happened when I was out to eat. Definitely add this place to your restaurant bucket list!

r5J9ktnV8BXDTQa2FXhyVw.text: The food was really good, the servers were very friendly but I'm sorry, the music was way too loud. It was jam packed with people so between the voice level & music it was a bit much for me.

tOovg4Fjh0S2KclagkXWKg.text: Melissa and Dominic were amazing and definitely made our first experience at hash kitchen memorable! I just completed a fitness competition yesterday and the wide variety of pancakes and French toasts hit the spot for my first meal post show. We are everything family style since it's hard to choose from the large selection of unique menu items and also each dish is enough to share!

IsEpngur5IoFYVWUau2C_g.text: It is a must stop weekend brunch stop! I live in DC and we live and die by brunch and this place is a cut above the rest. The Bloody Mary bar is just the start, there food is just stellar!

NGcKEE2k65M4gNmH4QTeSQ.text: This is the place to be!! Hash Kitchen is a great establishment that accommodates after-church goers, Sunday funday groups, and includes  a dog friendly patio as well!  I had question for the manager regarding a large group and Dominik came right over to greet me. He was genuine and showed he really cares about his guests and their experience. I found they provided great hospitality and were very accommodating to my needs. I would recommend this unique, fun-spirited environment to anyone and everyone!

UMtuD9ZvmHKAdRfWyLFN6g.text: The bloods were actually sub par. Many options as far as vodkas & different bloody mixes to choose from. Many of the veggies on the bar were hard to poke through making it difficult to load up your bloody as much as you would actually like to. Food was ok, not the greatest, nothing fancy about the egg's Benedict.

P-5KlI6T1a__03wnC9qY_g.text: Pretty solid spot! Was excited by the early hours they keep throughout the week. Had the salmon board and my guest had the make-your-own frittata, both I'd recommend. The portions are large, and super tasty. Decor was fun and young!

G2Ufb_SxIBXfcdzsnFSGow.text: Wonderful place in the valley. Very good food and wonderful staff. Owners came over and chatted with us made sure we were good  Absolutely Amazing

2XNZbGCeKMFLzhhabUF5ow.text: All I can say is WOW, YOU NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE!!! Bloody marry bar? Check. Amazing food? Check. Great Atmosphere? Check. If you are a foodie in Phoenix this place is a must! The Owner is Dom and he is awesome! He also has a great restaurant called Sicilian Butcher, it also has Amazing food and a great Atmosphere!!

O6_dyBwE9go9ba4MyNcwcg.text: So happy this location opened here, we used to drive 10+ miles to the Scottsdale location and now it's less than a mile away!! Dominic stopped by our table to check in, made sure we were taken care of and Serena our server was more than delightful. Will be back 100%.  keep it up guys!

7u_pGASs43FMnsSEiqCzWw.text: The food was amazing. The servers were bad, and one of them made a comment that made me feel really uncomfortable... The food is good enough to carry this place but their wait staff needs a serious overhaul.

cbnEHj2jr9Nx3m3GCBwXDw.text: Wonderful !!! Dominic and Austin provided great service. Food, drinks and atmosphere was great.

luNWDuaIlvVJW3Qz1IB2ZA.text: First time. Excellent food. Jesus was great. Large portions. A must try. Definitely coming back.

1iUf2nC_C-jhcILtJ9Ymjw.text: Pros: the service, attentive and fast. The Bloody Mary bar doesn't disappoint   Cons: the food, surprisingly. Had the tamale Benedict and build your own scrambles on our table. The hash potatoes were very run of the mill and needed more crispy texture and salt. My tamale Benedict was sickly sweet for some reason, like they put sugar in the masa. Kinda gross. Portion size a bit small too (very little of the pork). My friend said the eggs were also a bit dry/over cooked.   Overall it seems like people come here because of the Bloody Mary bar and loud music because otherwise the food needs a lot of work based on what we ordered.

gNlyXgB6gui73bTyGf18eg.text: This restaurant is awesome and hip! Domenic is the sweetest guy ever, such a gentlemen made me feel so welcome. Absolutely love this place!!!

DdeVnEBv2cnnCNqbtKzXIw.text: Everything looked great - I just wish it had the flavor to match. I had the chicken fried steak and waffle. It badly needed salt and the gravy was pretty flavorless. I also wish the fried leeks or onions on top were crunchy. My son had the kids chocolate chip pancakes and they were good. My husband had the carnitas hash and I tried some and it was decent, I just wish there was more flavor. I will say that the helpings of all dishes were very generous. I will go again as I am intrigued with their menu but hope they start seasoning more.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash

a7EHVeAvnd2chC2rOtWHaQ.text: I love this place!! My daughter had been twice and urged me to try it out and I fell in love. The DJ was great and the food was even better. Kendra was our server and as sweet as she can be. Domenic, one of the Managers, took time to come over and chat with us. We live down the street and have found our new breakfast spot!

7Vc9jiyEo9HzIsyze-nw8w.text: Pricey, but the food was decent . Manager checked on our table, very nice guy. Extravagant Bloody Mary bar was fun.

MxTH17OD7dWwG8j7A4EUsA.text: This place is worth going to. Phenomenal bloody mary bar and staff that is very welcoming. Dominic shows you the hospitality that you expect, great guy! Go Red Sox!!

m85vqFepKR4bo66f3y4Tpg.text: Food was so good!! The Avocado toast was huuuuge, and to die for. Domenic the manager was super friendly!

lHVLoaU8MMdJNLEi-vE9YQ.text: Do not order the gluten free pancakes.  They are the worst I've ever eaten.  The server was unfriendly.  The atmosphere was cool, the dj was playing loud music.  The Bloody Mary bar was amazing.  I didn't try it but I was jealous watching people walk away with those amazing creations.

ahxjhdEv_RywVzsAQPAf5A.text: This was an awesome brunch spot with really cool drink options and a DJ. The staff were extremely accommodating with special mention to Domenic and Amy who were super friendly and made sure we enjoyed our breakfast! Can't wait to come back and try out the Bloody Mary bar!

yulDHc2IFbSFQvrSTRb03Q.text: Visited Hash Kitchen twice recently and what a riot. Great food, excellent service and a great time when the DJ is doing his thing. Dominic was checking in with customers and sharing info about the Sicilian Butcher. Strongly recommend this spot for Brunch.

OIjSznDMjol6QZ4SzyZaOQ.text: Everything we expected!! Mimosa flight was amazing, plus the service! Dominic the manager was very friendly and personable, checking in on us twice. Food was all good, but I wouldn't recommend the Huevos Rancheros Hash. The carnitas hash, my boyfriend's order, was amazing!

lLDX7n3s2lHVnRzF6F9M7Q.text: Service was extremely attentive.  Good was unique, tasty, and a little greasy.  Overall I liked the experience.  They are working hard to impress you.

cXVAINmMeQuzqJz8Fb2MXw.text: Such good food.  Jessica had our drinks Toni's in minutes.  The service was amazing .

RzSWtt-UDDL8o5QQp3JVoA.text: Domenic, the manager was so kind to ask us how our service was and how the food was and if it got here quickly. Serena was our waitress and she was very helpful as it was our first time coming here. We'll surely be coming back to try other dishes on their menu. The food was above all, fantastic! If you haven't been here for Sunday Breakfast or Brunch you're missing out!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cannoli Pancakes
