5yDhfcY4fxr3G0BDjOrU9Q.text: Service was great! I had a party of 5 and one infant. They helped us get situated and our server was quite attentive. The downside was the food. It was not fantastic. Seemed bland to me. I had bacon scramble with hash potatoes. Potatoes seemed like those frozen Ore Ida potatoes. Eggs were scrambled with bacon, cheese and more potatoes. No creativity and too pricey for a simple dish. Another downside, I know it is common that restaurants are getting louder. This place was loud and they had a DJ in the morning. Not a great place to catch up with family.

1oXxndKZFDz8ELl1ysHuZQ.text: Excellent Experience !!!  Dominic (General Manager) came around multiple times to ensure a superb visit.  This place rocks.  Great food, Great Service !!! A must visit.  You have to arrive before 10:30 or you will have to wait.  Once you get seated - Wow !!!  I'll be back !!!

Uf-dpSd2eDJzqE8MDmbeNA.text: What a riot this place is. Bright, welcoming decor, and energetic vibe. Watching people at the build-your-own Bloody Mary bar was really entertaining, as was the DJ (a DJ for breakfast?). Our food was excellent. It's a creative menu, classic breakfast food with a fun spin. We had French toast, carne asada, and a couple of BYO scrambles. The service was fast, efficient and friendly. We're visiting from Chicago and next time we're in Chandler we'll definitely be back. Well worth a trip!

8UUGnCPRP5dmTJ91A0VouQ.text: Ordered eggs Benedict with the herb chicken. Everything was great except that the eggs were not poached just scrambled... which defeats the purpose of eggs Benedict. Waited an hour and half for not poached eggs but was too hungry to think straight to send it back to the kitchen. Also the cereal shooters were a disappointment. I thought it would be milkshake consistency but it's just blended up soggy cereal with alcohol.

m0yB6vW_FeaL7D7zrvJsFw.text: Went for lunch yesterday and ordered the corned beef sandwich.  I have to say this was the worst sandwich I have ever had.  Even though the menus did say thick cut marble rye bread this was ridiculous.  I tried to cut one of the pieces in half which was a messy disaster. Too much cole slaw on top of the terrible corned beef and dried out Swiss cheese resulted in huge waste of $15.00.  The only good thing were the fries.  Never again.

XYt-Q2Sdu-GonEsFua8rfg.text: Food and atmosphere is great! Awesome Bloody Mary bar and mimosa flightChilaquiles was delish and try the bruschetta as an appcan't wait to go back and try the French toast!

JORWAzJwNZ5kLGt1Eh3Agw.text: Love this place!  Great atmosphere and attention to patrons.  Food, of course, is always great!  Thanks Jasmine & Dominic!

1Y5ZlH-l89t1CYCSHhStmg.text: The food was excellent!! The Bloody Mary bar looks amazing and so did the mimosa flights! I had the chicken Benedict and it was delicious. My husband had huevos rancheros hash and he loved it. This is my new favorite breakfast place. Amanda was our server and she was awesome.

AYgcb2pBsVY5O_XC1tubyg.text: Love this place!  They have a Sunday morning DJ, great party atmosphere vibe.  Bloody Mary bar is amazing!  Food was excellent and our server gave great recommendations.  Will definitely be going back!

mpP-lm_4KBO4rkXr5Ngo0A.text: We enjoyed breakfast here. It was our first time...great vibe, music and service. Dominic stopped by our table several times to make sure everything was perfect. Amazing Bloody Mary bar! Not your typical breakfast place, but so much fun.

VtiqlLdh-913CBgXu3BYUA.text: Very cool breakfast spot. Creative menu and amazing drinks. Superior Service and excellent food preparation.

nKdhtgcwcEdbZkw1N7yRNw.text: Wow what an experience! Outstanding, unique selections for food and drinks. It was also very nice to be greeted by Mr. Dominic, the manager. Oh yes, the DJ added to a nice breakfast experiences as well. I'll be back!

tz0cNbd4mmGkVMSg52hGMQ.text: Great atmosphere, food and a love DJ! Best bloody Mary bar in the area. Not just dog friendly, they are dog inviting. Our waitress Jenn was great! Hostess could have managed her responsibilities better.

zajSwgFW19tdzlmrx4QPHQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!! Good food all aroundand the manager was super nice and it's kid friendly! The music is also so fun to listen to I would go to this place everyday if I could!

DZbpBTadgxuXHzBY0xEZ8Q.text: Great breakfast!! Loved the BACON!! Awesome atmosphere and great service!! Food was delicious and prompt. The eggs were fluffy and fresh and the bacon was thick and crisp!! Domenico the manager was a pleasure to talk to and made us feel right at home! Will definitely go back!!

p7j8I118cwzpkAuFY25gNA.text: Gino and Dominic make you feel like family!  Such a fun atmosphere with great food and out of this world drinks!

i8PTnBx4HttyqdMpyqN3WA.text: Had a great brunch with my girlfriends here. Great food, drinks and the service is amazing! Dominic was always around checking on us and if he could improve our experience-which he couldn't because it was so great! We will be back!!

TbKI263mkWoLA-8eJ5iREA.text: Domenic was great and took awesome care of us! Ryan was an amazing waiter! This was the most fun brunch place with a great DJ and great food! I will definitely come back many more times!!

sIuc1l9v6GiPIZTfk2xkCA.text: Decent but definitely not worth the wait. Was told it would be a 30-45 minute wait... turned into nearly an hour and a half. The table next to us sat down after us, had three more people than our group but managed to be served before us and finished before they brought our food out an hour later. They do have a nice Bloody Mary bar but really a bit overrated.

g9GjyFjyOQZGWMYXpidBlQ.text: This place is awesome! We got right in and Domenic does an amazing job with the restaurant! The food and bloody marry bar were out of this world! We will definitely be back!

somMUpvh7e_70i9nXc-yhQ.text: Great food and service all around! Mimosas were a hit! Shoutout to Dom and Jessica for always checking in and making sure we felt welcomed :)

bj_PRcCbv-DI9JTr3RzdGQ.text: The food was so GREAT! The atmosphere was different than a usual breakfast joint but it was a weekday and not crazy busy. I really like the concept of this place and wish I could have enjoyed some of their drinks- I worked the next day. Everything that came out of the kitchen looked delicious!

i6G0YpP-Wtma28ZMBoliOA.text: The service was good and staff was very friendly but the food left me unimpressed. I was so looking forward to trying this place too.

4f06XFnfYUyFQXSdoEbx_w.text: So we went to try Hash Kitchen at about 130pm and were immediately turned away because they were "booked for the morning" honestly super disappointing because places like Snooze which is 5 times busier never turns anyone away ESPECIALLY an hour and a half before close. I understand Saturday's are busy but it just seemed crazy to me and the staff was awfully rude about it and this has made me positive after that first impression I will never return to try their food.

2M987vA8We_n96xJvt0xBA.text: The wonderful Bloody Mary bar is not worth the wait or being subjected to the poor quality food! The frozen dry potatoes were mixed with frozen, soggy vegetables that arrived cold. I could've bought a fresher bag of frozen vegetables at Fry's (not that I ever would). The onions on top of the dishes were nothing short of crispy onions straight out of the can. Our server was not attentive and really new nothing about the menu. When we asked about the hash and what was good her reply was, "it is a hash kitchen". Apparently she hasn't tasted the food. We have no intention of going back!

m_807T9ckmnG6qAl6jJu_g.text: They have quite an interesting menu which I definitely will be exploring more.  The food was great and if you like Bloody Mary's it looks like a fun place to make your own at their bar.  Anyway, I was really impressed with the service as the manager made a point of going from table to table to see how everyone was.  In the words of the great Arnie, I'll be back.

4mChOqvmeWQ6YrEnZXCsGA.text: Wanted to try something new for my mom's birthday so we decided to come here for brunch. I loved the atmosphere and DJ. When we were first seated, it took over 5 minutes for someone to get us a water and 10 for our server to come to our table. Forgot her name but she had long blonde ish hair and tattoos. She was very helpful when ordering and a contagious smile. After we ordered, a random customer walked in and offered to take our picture as a family picture and was seated 8 tables down from us. We ordered at 2:04 (my family always times food because we go to a lot of restaurants) and at around 2:20 that same table got their food. At 2:25 we told our waitress and she apologized and OFFERED US to get the manager. She left and came back WITHOUT a manager but with the food. Then my dad asked her if the manager just didn't want to talk to us and she preceded to tell us how it was her fault and NEVER got the manager. She did nothing to take care of our bill or anything. The food was okay, nothing too exciting.  At the end of our meal we saw the manager next to our waitress and she STILL never told him to come to our table. How unprofessional and embarrassing. My dad then called the manager over and all he did was apologized and didn't offer to take care of anything. Everyone in my family works in a restaurant and our managers immediately take care of the bill. He was just as shocked to see that our food took 35 minutes. But did nothing. We weren't looking for getting our bill paid but the workers were just absolutely careless as well as the manager. When we said we won't return he just said "oh okay." Please DO NOT come here!!

V6GapXCAdNhS1nBU5S7MTQ.text: My husband and I loved this place! We live less than 2 miles yet we hadn't stopped in until today since we assumed it was mostly a breakfast place. I'm not a breakfast girl but when my husband read me the menu, I was excited to hear there are so many lunch items. We both ordered hash items- carne asada and carnitas. Both were great, both could have had less potatoes and more meat but the flavor, presentation and size were all good. The DJ was there and that was super fun and cool! The best part about the restaurant was meeting Dominic, the manager! He was so friendly and he seemed genuinely passionate about the restaurant and the family that owns Hash Kitchen. He gave us tips on the best time to come in on a Sunday, how to stack your Bloody Mary so it doesn't spill over and even gave us a heads up on the family's newest Italian restaurant Sicilian Butcher that will be opening soon in Chandler. Dominic has the perfect personality to be working at Hash Kitchen- fun, energetic, outgoing and seems to truly care about the diner's experience! Thank you Dominic, we will be definitely be back!

p8yxK2ERBSk4tP77B4Y_9g.text: Hash is great! Good food and great service. Dominic came to check on us to ensure everything was going well. Everyone was very accommodating.

c1oA0qIIOW8QLFG8Id5PIw.text: Service was ok. Filled my son's water glass but not my husband's.  Music was too loud to be able to speak comfortably so the people behind us were practically yelling. DH got the biscuits and gravy.....sweeter gravy and hard biscuits. My corned beef hash was made with bagged hash browns and the pieces of peppers and onion ranged from 1/4 inch to 3 inches long. The potatoes were not seasoned and were practically tasteless. All the salt, pepper and hot sauce at the table couldn't save it. For the price, I expected more than Denny's food. Strip mall food.

wcMrwMOCBVtF9fGCyzD4ew.text: Best part of the meal was the company. I took my mom to breakfast. You can't really screw up breakfast, I thought. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. The eggs were the only good part, the rest was dry and lacking flavor. Potatoes were dry and disappointing. Coffee was meh. Service was poor. Had to ask for coffee and water refills, server never stopped by to offer ketchup or hot sauce for dry food. Heard another customer say, "it's not worth the wait." While we were waiting. Next time I'll listen. Really not sure how this place has 4 star review. Prob Paying Yelp for positive reviews.

Mxe2KBVwHlTgHNKEiSeqdg.text: A very popular breakfast hangout with one very unique "bloody mary" bar for its patrons.  The restaurant is a great size given its recent notoriety in the area and the wait staff work hard to keep the food coming out quickly.  The menu has a wide variety of different takes on usual breakfast items and the food is delicious.  There is a dj playing music on the weekends to entertain the crowd, but it does make for a little trouble talking across the table with your guests.  Parking is not easy and you should plan on dropping off your guests at the front door ahead of your seating time.  HK will definitely be a repeat place for us in the near future.

qIfLK14Zu-dLdmkORE8TWQ.text: Tried this place out for the first time for brunch and love it!!  They have their own build your own Bloody Mary which you can add unlimited toppings of your choice.  Soo good. Their Mimosas are pretty good too. The food is delicious and for a place that's always packed, really good customer service. They have their own Dj too who plays  all the old school faves and new music. Great atmosphere but music is loud.  Highly recommend this place. Better than the Scottsdale breakfast joints.

Y9CNRFcVQCk6tfsXv1Lu6w.text: I usually enjoy this place but this Morning was the worse experience I have had! There was 2 guys that looked like managers that would only stop at every table that had all women to make sure they were having a great experience!  They looked right at us and kept walking by! Waited 15 mins for someone just to come to our table, when our food came I asked for hot sauce and never got it. Order 2 mimosas and only was given one. Waiter kept passing us by when he knew we were done. We literally waited 30 mins to pay because no one cared! Wow! I only have 1 star because you have to! If you are women feel free to come because you will have all the service you need!

Jy4Iv5Prw4hkVLsV6heKqw.text: Some of the best brunch ever. The mimosa flight was everything. I wish I had one of these in my home town.

dW2swBwpeOn1Xo_SmOnQ-w.text: Everything was amazing as always! I've been here a few times and always have the best service and the best meals. I brought my cousin who was in town for the weekend and decided that this place would be the perfect welcome meal! Kendra served us and she was so awesome and got our order in quickly. Domenic came around and made sure we were taken care of and definitely went above and beyond. And to top it all off, the DJ's play an awesome mix. This place has the best vibe and is the perfect combo for DJ tunes and fantastic food & drinks. Chandler is lucky to have a spot like this!

AR2NkWSMxQabLNtCuMbo4Q.text: Food was unique and fairly good. We sat outside because of the nice weather.   Inside the music is very loud so if you go for a quiet meal or conversation, you will be disappointed.

UPJiHaAE-Ye2geSqGC2MEA.text: Breakfast pretty good, ideas are interesting like the bloody Mary bar and mimosa flights, service was slow for the number of staff members they had working. I'd go back if I had more time. It's good for being in a strip mall

Qr-9RAMXVO1g48oXq5gx3A.text: Went to Hash Kitchen this morning with my mom. We beat the rush by arriving at 8:30. The staff was welcoming and great. Our waiter was speedy and attentive. Our food was AMAZING!! We got the banana split French toast and the Americano omelet. I highly recommend both. If you are looking for some great food and a friendly atmosphere check out Hash Kitchen.

5n185V4oFKLiAA0DOQmr9g.text: I stopped here because of the Yelp reviews.  I've never heard of this place before and the wait was about 35 minutes for a table for two.  I was very surprised when we went to notice a DJ giving us some great music for this brunch of ours.  I also immediately noticed the bloody mary bar and the 50 or so options to put in your bloody mary beverage.  Our waitress was amazing; quick and stealth like but also extremely happy.  It only took about 15 minutes to get our food.  I ordered the banana split French toast and it was amazing.  The French toast was perfect and it seemed more like a dessert.  It had bananas and strawberries all over with an ice cream cone holding about a ton of sweet sweet butter.  I also ordered bacon and it was perfectly cooked; not too crisp.  The orange juice tasted like it was freshly squeezed but I couldn't verify it.  The bathrooms and restaurant was very clean.  They also have a outside dog friendly tables if you bring your favorite pooch.  I will definitely be back and next time I will partake in the bloody mary bar.

Gzqx4zVeCJIsG9mzZU31YQ.text: We had a great brunch with family today. The food, drinks and service was amazing. We were very impressed with the Manager Dominique who checked on every table to get feedback on the service and his personality was charming. Our server Amy was on the ball, fun and entertaining. I would highly recommend it. The Bloody Mary bar is to die for:)

OHT-lwix1IthJ6qajQW5qg.text: Was excited about this place. Have been there twice now. Always crowded. The last time I was there I was sharing my table and food with three persistent flies. Not only annoying but gross when you think about it.

5X3emOZlzvlayPd6MrCe4w.text: Love this place. We had 13 women eating and drinking after a great run. The manager, Domenic checked on us several times. Our waiter, Shawn was great. Very attentive.

TJGTJ-_RheKoc6mrsPXDNw.text: Great place for brunch! Awesome Bloody Mary Bar, DJ and Manager Dominic is a great host!

4UXjao7W7yVWN73sT8VFkg.text: Today was my first time at Hash Kitchen and I can't wait to come back. The food was out of this world. We've been needing a good brunch spot in Chandler , and this far surpassed all of my expectations. The manager , Domenic is great. He stopped by and introduced himself and made sure everything was great, which it was. This restaurant is clean, quick, friendly service and the food is incredible. Oh, I can't forget the DIY Bloody bar. Don't question it. Just order it.

9cAddhmVAk_dr7CUwZaGkA.text: I ordered the biscuits and gravy and it was OK. The biscuits were super thick.... and costs more than I believe it should.... made my stomach upset after eating........   My mother in law got the pancakes and they were super good. My sister in law got the avocado toast and it was ALOT of food! She said it was really good. Biggest complaint is the music is SUPER loud.... so if that's your thing, you might enjoy it, but I couldn't hear the people talking across from me. Overall, not sure if I would go back again...

1YcSS-daby_UbZC-njF4YQ.text: I had friends fly in and we came straight here for drinks and A-Maz-ing food! Thanks to Domenic for making sure everything was wonderful!

THs17DDXEzTsyATItxpEmw.text: Great atmosphere! This was my second visit. If going expect a 30 min wait, which goes by before you know it! Cute place for brunch. The Bloody Mary Bar is delightful, although I do not drink Bloody Marys. Lol. The DJ was awesome. Reason for rating a 3 was due to the change in menu. The Lump Crab sweet potato dish was no longer listed on menu yet had excellent reviews.  The 4 flavored mimosas was not what I expected. They lacked flavor. My dish, beef hash was to die for!! It was a big portion. The server was really nice and very attentive.

82M5d0n-aHmeb6u6Jag5Kg.text: I'm mad I didn't know about this place sooner!  The food and the service was amazing- The manager Dominic clearly cares deeply about making the experience as good as possible for all patrons. We were holding a business breakfast, and he had the forethought to give us a large table in a section to ourselves and turn off the speaker over our table so we could hear each other better. He also came over to check in more than once. The food was delicious and clearly very fresh. All in all, great.   I will be going again!

FuyrLRrZXoqwhtYZsbZQmw.text: Absolutely amazing. I received a gift card for my birthday and waited 4 months until i could go with my girlfriend and our friend. We went on new years day and it was EXACTLY what we needed ofter a long night of drinking. The bloody mary bar is completely ridiculous, and the had a dj which gave an awesome vibe. Our server Jesus was awesome and the manager Domenic was amazingly attentive and super friendly. I had been wanting to try this place for months and it definately didnt disappoint. We had a pretzel benedict, chicken and waffkes and cirnbread and carne asada hash. All were great portions and delicious.  Cannot wait to go back

QqPaOmRU45jo1TDAmJSrRw.text: Dog friendly, food was great, cocktails were on point, there's a dj and a make your own Bloody Mary bar. We really enjoyed this place. Only down side was the menu selection. We really hoped for a few more choices in food and cocktails but I suspect it was a limited menu for Mother's Day weekend. We will come back next time we're here though!

bD9q-orgdcxP70Dn0c3wCg.text: Came here my first time and fell in love with the customer service from our waiter to Dominic the manager! The food it's self is incredible we had the avocado toast and it was huge and just tastes amazing!  The flight of mimosa's were amazing the kiwi especially!

sxmRe9-3neaYHPhNJNJlgA.text: Food is meh, more show and size than actual flavor and being well made. Everything I've had has been dry. Bloody Mary bar is the real kicker here. Do yourself a favor and load up your Bloody Mary with eggs, bacon, cheese, meatballs and everything else and call that your $15 meal.

dGlY0Ofnfnt2pX8u2Xy8eA.text: I have eaten breakfast at Hash Kitchen during the week and now I have tried lunch during the week. ( just note this is a breakfast, lunch, brunch place and you can get any of the items anytime of the day that  they're open. )Both times were great and seated right away. Next time I will try the Sunday brunch and bloody Mary bar which looks like a meal in itself. Just know in my opinion the portions are large and very shareable ,go hungry ,or if you like to take home -leftovers perfect choice.  The first time I dined there Dominic the manager came around and introduced himself and made sure everything was OK with our group. Today I had Dominic come over to the table so I could say hello to him and chat.  I appreciate a manager coming around even if just for a few minutes of their time -in my opinion it's great customer service and definitely makes me want to come back to a restaurant when I'm treated in that manner.   For breakfast I had the s'mores French toast and for lunch we had the Cubano sandwich and Salmon BLT which comes with a choice of fries or a green salad. We had the salad.The two dressing choices are ranch or balsamic vinegar .  Our server for lunch was Nicholas and he checked back on us a few times. At this restaurant there are food runners so your waiter or waitress may not bring you your food. Drinks were refilled in a timely manner .  I did not get any pictures of our food or the restaurant,but perhaps when I go for Sunday brunch I will add some photos. As others have said there is a patio and a pretty spacious dining room.  There are a mix of seating options. High tables that have a booth on 1 side and chairs on the other side- the chairs have backs, low tables and chairs, and  low tables that have booth style sitting on one side and chairs on the other. There are a few televisions and there is a bar area.   I have not experienced the entertainment on the weekends, but hopefully when I dine there for Sunday brunch the music isn't too loud. I appreciate a little entertainment music ,but usually when dining I like to chat with my table mates and have music as background.  Great neighborhood location that has opened up and great customer service by Dominic.

3fsgDRlahUVTy5OoUyp9zQ.text: Honestly such a big fan of this place - i love the vibe but also the food is incredible. Obviously check out the bloody bar and try the avocado toast if you're a fan. Also met Domenic who is a great guy! Keep up the incredible work on this spot!

wisem8q9grpxSHU3nQRpfQ.text: Thank you so much Domenic for everything!! You really made our experience so much better. You have such a good soul. The food is amazing & sooo tasty. The waffles are worth it. Mexicana is ALWAYS a favorite and the chicken and waffles was drool worthy. Thank you for such an amazing experience. Will definitely keep coming back!! If you go and Domenic is there get a chance to talk to him, do it. So worth it!!

z_IKyGsD2JgDfA4jlL-VOQ.text: First time coming here!  So amazing!  I had Carnitas hash and it was delicious!  If lived closer this would be an every weekend thing for me!  The music is fun and inviting!!!!

JtlnlS8Ouj3ub7KsbyXZIg.text: Have heard amazing things about Hash Kitchen, but when I tried it I wasn't that impressed. We came here during a week day around noon and it was relatively busy, but there was no wait. Me and my mom both ordered the Avocado Toast HASH style and it was gigantic! I was super excited about this as I have seen multiple pictures of this super delicious looking breakfast. Two thick slabs of brioche toast on a board loaded with yummy breakfast foods how could you go wrong? As I started to dig in I started having some problems. I first realized that they left off the pulled porked from my Toast, but my moms came out fine. I asked my server and she apologized and quickly brought out a side of pork for me to put on my toast. Another problem I had, but didn't say anything about is that I've seen from other people pictures that they get their avocado toast with two normal slices of bacon on each toast, but on mine I got 1 slice of bacon cut in half on one piece of toast and only half a slice of bacon on the other piece of toast? Also, even though there are other toppings, the lack of actual avocado on the toast was surprising, just thin layer seemly mixed with the bacon jam. I understand variation in orders, but with a missing ingredient , a scarce amount of another ingredient, and just the overall sloppy presentation that didn't appear to be the quality of food that others have received from this establishment. Despite the problems I had with the food I do have to admit it was very tasty so I will definitely be coming back and will hopefully have a better dining experience

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Avocado Toast

ckG_7EMxGYcTB0RR62vnJg.text: I have nothing negative to say. Food was to die for. Drinks were delicious. Overall vibe was so fun. Music and DJ are awesome. Service was perfect. Dominic and Kendra were so friendly and attentive. Definitely will come back. Can't wait for Phoenix to open

USyFpuxP-urFjvxyjeLoMQ.text: This place is the most amazing place to have breakfast  The pancakes were out of this world  The manager was very courteous and friendly as was our waitress  The portions are enough to share Can't wait to go back

EDlzuqMJILRBEGcm3dFUaQ.text: From the food to the environment to the AMAZING Bloody Mary bar, this place has it ALL! The hardest part about Hash Kitchen is picking what to eat because everything is fantastic. The portion sizes are huge so get a big group and order a variety of things to try. Make sure to experience the Bloody Mary bar and build your own. They also have great Mimosa flights. I will be back to check off trying everything on their menu!!!

p0RniQiEN0aw3d-9I-k1Wg.text: Been a few times with each visit progressively getting worse. This last time was more of the same...long wait, ok service, dry/flavorless French toast and pancakes and a bland frittata. Not to mention it's pricey. HK was a backup for brunch but after this we won't be returning again

oRWgkdYHycL-f9W8N0E5nw.text: We went there for breakfast. The portions were huge. My friend ordered a breakfast burrito, (the works). I ordered egg benedict with cured salmon and my husband ordered brioche with egg, bacon, etc. The food was excellent. We had a chance to talk to the manager, Domenic and congratulate him for the good service and delicious food!!

kpMDqCCa27FoY7LkFI7pVA.text: There are a variety of choices to choose from food wise which is always nice to have! The waitress, Angelina, was very considerate and checked in with us to make sure all was good! The manager, Dominic, was super nice and cared about our opinions on our experience. Overall I would recommend to others!

iEap8k0VUywkxFaBxeQGcg.text: This place is so good!! I ordered the avocado toast and split it with a friend because it was HUGE! Our waitress Angelina was so friendly and came back to the table often. The manager Dominic was also super nice and welcoming. Overall I enjoyed the atmosphere and will definitely be coming back:)

9SKGIhnEyWHTYJyyxwzdag.text: This was my 1st time at the Chandler Hash Kitchen location. The menu is large as are the portions. Between the 3 of us ordered the Avocado Toast, Banana Split French Toast & Biscuits and Gravy. We were all very impressed with the presentation and quality of each dish. As I mentioned,the portions are large and none of us finished everything. Service was perfect. No waiting around for someone to fill your water glass. Dom &  Amanda took good care of us. The vibe is hip with a DJ spinning tunes Fri - Sun. The music (80 decibels) is about 20 decibels too loud if you want to have a conversation w/o yelling. I look forward to coming back soon for a lunch to see if it is as amazing as breakfast.

BJvddfqEl55j68mRXTx8HA.text: Let me start off by saying the service we received here was AMAZING! We let Melissa know we needed to be in and out because we were on our lunch time. She was a bit hesitant but made it happen! The food was BOMB and we'll probably be back tomorrow! I have 0 complaints about the service and food here everything on the menu is delicious! The atmosphere is perfect! They have a DJ Friday's and Saturday's I believe and it literally just puts you in such a good mood. Me and my girls will def come back! Big thank you to Domenic the manager and Melissa the server you guys were amazing

vCJMX64VzexsQI8aup6EsA.text: I gathered here for friends birthday breakfast. Patio seating very nice. Service on the slow side, as was the food delivery but worth the wait. If  bloody Mary's  are your thing, the bar is extravagant. People lined up outside to try it the place . Inside seating not designed well for movement; very crowded accommodations for the indoor peeps. Very trendy, a bit noisy; not good for a quiet talking gathering.  Great for groups.

5YUVtrOiuSd9cPVKyhS4Kg.text: Great atmosphere,Friendly staff, amazing Bloody Mary bar and Delicious Breakfast! Definitely will return!

6-EOS6Cu_G3Hi4w_ILR7-A.text: I've been super excited to try this place since they opened and finally sucked up the 45 minute wait on a Saturday morning. You're able to kill some of the wait time by partaking in the Bloody Mary bar ($12 for small and an extra $4 to use Tito's vodka over well) or getting a mimosa flight. The prices were a bit high if you ask me, but the food was good. My favorite item was the breakfast bruschetta board with three different flavors- all delicious! Unfortunately, my has was really dry and my eggs were over cooked. My husbands fruity pebble pancakes were visually pleasing and very dense/ filling so a 1/2 order was perfect. They offer a $25 "bottle" of champagne mimosa that's served with strawberry boba, a pinwheel, and cotton candy. However, I'm pretty sure there was maybe 1/2 bottle in there aka a TON of orange juice. I might go back if I had plenty of time to waste or a friend wanted to give it a shot, but it'll definitely be after the dust of their newness settles.

GqPFdBb6nxXy31QAjpjcRw.text: The BYOBMB was the best!!! Domenic was so incredibly nice as he greeted and welcomed us to Hash at our table. Food was yummy and we will be back!!

Fmg7-NWEog8dqLSbVu5ZvA.text: Fantastic food, amazing service. Everything about this place is fantastic. A special shoutout to Dominic for his exceptional hospitality.

iYdlkyTIXPEtXsuJlkh7eQ.text: Had a great experience thanks to Vanessa! She was very helpful in choosing what to order. The service was great, and I reccomend the mimosa flight.

wWfeffeESLE2Hvuz3QQELg.text: Just finished a great brunch at Hash Kitchen!  This place rehabilitates the whole concept of the meal.  Build your own Bloody Mary bar?  Yes, please.

XTO0zFd8wF5__y3wGqveSw.text: Stopped in for breakfast and what a treat!  Domenic is the manager, very friendly and treats you as if you're a guest in his home.  Food is amazing but the Bloody Mary bar is the best!

v6fPQx7xqgW9VkwjpDN03w.text: I seriously couldn't wait for this one to open. My friend and I had talked about visiting the Scottsdale one for months and stalked their Instagram with food envy - then we found out Hash was coming to Chandler! The menu has a wide array of breakfast and lunch options for the child at heart, bruncher, or foodie complete with omnivore or vegetarian options for every one. I've not yet tried the Bloody Mary bar (always gone during work lunch break), but if it's anything like it looks, you're in for a treat! Dominic (on of the managers) is pretty awesome; he mingles through the guests and does more than the requisite "how was every thing" speech. He asks how you're doing, clears your table, and (most importantly) shakes your hand and talks to you like a person, not just a customer. I felt like I was in the Hash Kitchen inner circle! Go check them out, the food is great - the layout is awesome - and the staff are amazing and attentive!

PcVRmVHXxWkoCFTc-afknA.text: Good food, ok service, super loud.  I'm sure I will probably give it another shot at some point, but I doubt I will become a regular mostly due to PRICE.

zQLD5QEEMNF_LlFy6EvcRQ.text: This was our first time visiting hash kitchen and it was amazing! All of the staff was friendly, it was clean and inviting. Domenic the manager was so nice and checked on us throughout our meal.

vkVVNoi7JwaEWiRl8MzjBg.text: The vibe in this place is off the charts! Friendly staff, amazing food/drinks, great music. Domenic came over to our table a few times to check in on us and to see how everything was going. He was so friendly and gave excellent recommendations. This was our first time here, and we will definitely be back! Highly recommend

579RXsUIFiQ7kiWOj5_3Mw.text: Great brunch place!! Amazing service and food. Manager was so sweet, checked in on us multiple times. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

ki0dMa3KDyTxxo5X5tgM5g.text: This has become our new favorite breakfast/brunch spot.  We've gone 3 times this past month and all our visits have been excellent.  First, we went with some friends for the Sunday DJ brunch experience, then sat at the bar and enjoyed breakfast and bloody's, and this morning enjoyed a gorgeous morning on the patio with our 'golden doodle.  The food has been delicious and service great.  We've tried several different things...my wife loves the crab Benedict and hash, while I've enjoyed the chicken and waffles and corned beef hash.  You can't go wrong with the mimosa flights or Bloody Mary bar either! The service has been outstanding with Vanessa being our server this morning, who was great.  Domenic the owner (?) has also been extremely friendly and attentive to ensure we've had a great experience.  We highly recommend to anyone and we'll definitely be back!

JVirCRVLvHBN9-gScEbK5g.text: Fun environment, great food. Sat on the patio perfect day. Greeted and felt like I was at home by the little Italian manager Domenic I believe. Perfect brunch spot on the weekends!

DP4AKhy6Juv00pI1gBYmmw.text: This place was awesome! Adorable atmosphere, great bloody Mary bar, and the goat cheese frittata was amazing. I also recommend the bacon board... yummy! Service was great and Dominic, the manager, made sure that we were well taken care of. I'll be back!

HUCQs2PSmtuGUKzxcfekuQ.text: LA watch out! The Hash Kitchen in Chandler, AZ has raised the bar for trendy and tasty brunch spots. This oasis in the desert just opened mid July, and already boasts a packed house, with attentive and happy servers, mouth watering, artful displays of cuisine, and a flair of pizzaz in its' drink concoctions. I could hardly wait for the doors to open (pictures below) and when they did, it was worth the hour/s long wait for some, to experience the Hash Kitchen, which boasts the biggest Bloody Mary Bar in AZ.  Despite its daytime only hours, there's a DJ and a disco ball playing lively music. And for those who are waiting for a table, the inside/outside bar has cool air blowing, keeping the summer inferno heat at bay. Will and Toby are amazing bartenders, and their charm, skill, speed and hospitality make this my new neighborhood 'Cheers'. There wasn't a table when we arrived, so we chose to eat at the bar.  The outside seating area is also dog friendly, so I'll be bringing my Fido for a visit too!  I'm a vegetarian, so I ordered the Ricotta Lemon Pancakes. Absolutely delish and creative! For meat eaters, I can tell you the presentation of the food was outstanding, and the portions generous.  Hash Kitchen is such a great addition in Chandler. I just wish they were open evenings as well! Who doesn't like breakfast for dinner now and then?

Fzo8su7pgezweeV-XS6KBg.text: My first time to Hash Kitchen, and it didn't let me down. The bloody Mary bar is awesome and the food was very very good. Dominic was very in gauging and made the experience even more enjoyable. I will become a regular.

IT0ok6HGF_Xn8oa7QB0T9Q.text: Excellent food and service from the manager Dominick ... hard to have a real conversation these days. Thanks for making our experience a pleasure!

cisVEMVRVsOHm9As8glbdg.text: I've been here several times and the food/service is always amazing nothing less than great. I'm huge on consistency, which this place has been consistent every time. The manager checked up on us at each visit which was very nice. Most of my visits I had the pleasure of talking with the Manager Donovan. I always look forward to Brunch here!

3pfmQK-6IcMpS6iBcGrd3A.text: Great breakfast spot with a cool environment. Service was spot on and fast. Thanks Domenic for a wonderful experience. Highly recommended.

HITGRz616BF85wMxl5P-HQ.text: We loved this place. Great atmosphere. The food is all incredible it's so hard to choose. They have a great outdoor patio and a DJ. The bloody mary bar is seriously impressive and you can make your own scewer works of art. I don't even drink them but my friends do and they definitely enjoyed them. Various vodka flavors to choose from. If you are like me and like mimosas instead get the flight. Great flavors. Dominick is one of the managers and he was so nice. He came out to check on us and make sure everything was good. He told us about him and his family they just moved here from the East coast. It gave a nice touch of personalization and made us feel welcome. Bailey was our server. If was very busy when we arrived. She did a great job. I would definitely recommend checking this place out. If you have only gone to the Scottsdale location try this one out anyway. It is a different atmosphere and I enjoyed it more.

bPrMIFR--lDDfiiUsZw4Kw.text: Food was delicious, my mimosa was A+, service was pretty good and the management (Dom is who we met today) is SO nice. One of the best brunch places I've been to!!

We've been here 3 times now and I think my favorite is the lemon ricotta pancakes, which have a great "balance" of the flavors. The hashes were also good and the chilaquiles was amazing (but I'd like a little more chicken on there).  I don't like bloody mary's but my friends do and they highly recommend the bloody mary bar. ttMGqI_FsakakqrmjSyIlQ.text: Brunch at Hash Kitchen Chandler was so much fun. We arrived and were told that the wait time would be 30m, instead it was 15m. The bloody mary bar was amazing, as were the food and customer service. Our server Bailey was kind and efficient, the owners Geno, Dominic and Jenny were all attentive and on top of things. jZeI27EoMDtljfuSGD-52w.text: Since finding this place, it is one of our favorite brunch spots! The atmosphere is fun and friendly! We usually go on Sundays and they have a live Dj playing great music ranging from country to hip hop to oldies. So I'm sure you'll hear something you like! This place has only been open about 6 months and business is already booming so if you plan on going, be prepared to wait a little. Be patient! It's worth the wait! The longest I've ever waited to be seated was 30mins which is nothing to me. I'm a very patient person! Things to try the French toast, the scramblers and herb fried chicken with waffle! All excellent! The mimosas are great too! I love the owner, he is very personable and friendly, making sure all your needs have been met. I don't see why you would have any issues but if you ever did I'm sure he would fix everything immediately!

2Yah1xGHsltaPbUam982aA.text: This place is awesome!!! I've eaten breakfast there twice within the last 60 days and each time I was not disappointed...the  menu selection, food quality, & service was bar none !  It's a great place for a social gathering, lots a room, it's clean and fun. They have a DJ that plays different genres of music later in the morning and he's friendly just like the rest of the staff.   Domenic, the Manager, made our group feel very welcomed and you can tell he's a genuine Manager. He's not   the type of Manager that stops by to ask "how is everything ".. he has a conversation with you and likes to get  to know you, by the time we left it felt like he was an old friend!  My only word of caution is get there early because if you don't you WILL be waiting for a table. Yes,  it's THAT good and I will definitely be going back and will take new friends/family so that they can enjoy it too !

TxoNUyWOnDuqE9rUhXBJ-w.text: This is a great brunch spot. Mimosa flights were on deck, food was incredible and the DJ has great music playing. Loved the vibe. Will definitely be coming back.

t-n57OJ2T2W7vmpprpnTAQ.text: Amazing food, atmosphere, and service. Dominic, the GM, cane over to our table and made sure we felt very welcome. We'll definitely be back!

GS9H__kneue9OKGWkvU-Jw.text: My girlfriend and I had came in today, they said the wait would be around 45 min which is typical so we didn't mind waiting but the bar was open seating. Domenic one of the managers instantly approached us and had us sat at the bar, took such great care of us made sure we ate got our drinks. Such a sweetheart, such great service and amazing vibes! Dk6ft3Nc_4nBBFSrCt84-w.text: This is one of the best breakfast places around this place.  Great food and drinks. Eating here is like jump starting your day on high energy. It has a great mimosa bar, what better way to start your weekend. Do try their mimosa flight and there is nothing in the menu below average so try them all. The only downside about it is the wait time.There hasn't been anytime where we havent waited less than half an hour.

_QDt4o2V1gZhvmc6vu6JGQ.text: I got in right away, the food and service was amazing. Domenic, the manager is an awesome guy as well. Would definitely recommend this spot to all of my friends.

RdJu6IlcvFAy1xKIpbMZaA.text: The 5 stars is for the Bloody Mary bar. That's a nice buffet in itself. The food and service were very good as well. I will be back!

-NEaJVDEFVKYiow63uaPxg.text: All around this place was fantastic! Be ready for a wait on a weekend, but it'll be well worth it. Located in a typical urban plaza, tucked away in the corner of the parking lot, HK cultivates an environment unique to anything I've seen at a breakfast place. Upon stepping in I felt like I was in a beach club somewhere on vacation. Great music courtesy of a DJ (yeah, at breakfast!), smiling faces, and fresh air and sun flowing in from the patio.   This place has flow and ease. Servers danced their way around us, and though we had a dedicated server everyone was attentive to refilling our water, answering general questions, and cleaning off our table as we slowly made an attempt at the spread that covered our table. Jesus gave us recommendations based off his favorites, which we got two of: the chilaquiles and carnitas hash.   Started off with the bacon board. In retrospect, would not have gotten this. Not because it was bad, but because there was SO MUCH FOOD. Like omg, the three of us could have shared one plate but we had to try it all. Even as busy as it is, the tempo in the place is pretty quick. The time flies even faster if you treat yourself to the Bloody Mary bar. My recommended combo would be the cucumber vodka with medium mix (if you can take the heat), and then stacks on stacks of toppings. Get celery; it gives you more surface area to pin your toppings to!   The chilaquiles were all-star. Smothered in green sauce, but they were still amazingly crispy and warm. Carnitas hash was straight flame too, and fed us for the next two meals for the pre and post game after a night out on Mill. I got for myself the avocado toast, and while I admire the unique twist, if you're a lover of a wholesome and fresh avo toast this probably isn't what you want. The HK take on this dish is pretty dense topped with bacon jam, bacon and fried leeks. That was my mistake though as I didn't read the menu, but I chose with my eyes as I saw other plates coming out of the kitchen.   Honestly, can't wait to be back in the Phoenix area, because I know this will be a go-to for a good start to my day. See you soon! Thanks Jesus!

fH1wXBE8TGEERwLIvEREcA.text: I'm giving this a 4 star based on the vibe. The food was just ok and I would give it a 3 star! Nothing really impressed me however the waitress was very attentive. I thought the food was very bland and needed some seasoning badly!! The place looks vibrant, clean and the food is presented ok. I arrived around 7am it was very busy already!

gGAy3Dqtz8cf_Ne36TGWgQ.text: Best brunch experience ever. Caring and attentive service. Largest Bloody Mary bar I'll probably ever see - it's a breakfast in itself! There was even a DJ.   The owner walked up and asked about our experience and made himself open for feedback.   You can feel the passion and enthusiasm in this place. Best brunch ever.

0igX18TST6F_mFLiWkQB0Q.text: Long wait, not worth the hype. Food came out room temp. Waitress told me that they didn't serve a beer that I just ordered at the bar prior to being seated. Bloody Mary bar was cool. Probably wouldn't make it back.

Rvp_3XajqC9XVlaMdWP_2Q.text: Imagine if Hash House a Go Go indulged in one too many drinks from the bloody Mary bar, had a wild night with SumoMaya, then had a restaurant baby that they raised on the Jersey Shore. The result would be Hash Kitchen. When you see the upper echelons of management wearing unbuttoned chest-baring shirts adorned with large dangly gold chain necklaces + a load of swagger, a gigantic bloody Mary bar and an in-house DJ spinning loud beats you know you're READY to PARTY and GET DOWN.... at a breakfast spot in Chandler a few yards away from Whole Foods during lunch on a work day?  I'll be honest. I think the combination of party atmosphere and morning breakfast is a bit too much for me. But hey, that's just me. If I want to go to a club I'll go to a club. If I want to eat a meal with someone I want to be able to hear our conversation and not be drowned out by the background of the restaurant. Go ahead you can call me a party pooper. This might be a great spot if you want to indulge in their extensive list of alcoholic drinks, munch on expensive bites and feel like you're brunching with a crowd consisting of customers you might find on the weekend in a club in Old Town Scottsdale (Sans those golf carts strolling down the streets picking up the drunken and disorderly). At least that's the vibe I got when I ate here.   We got here a little bit before noon and it wasn't too bad of a wait on Friday, maybe 5 minutes. The menu online is slightly different from what is offered at this location but the selections still were intriguing. I was initially hoping to see the paella hash which was listed online but since it wasn't an option here I went for the flat iron steak hash. I figured when in a hash kitchen you might as well eat hash, right? I also had a bite of the chilaquiles.  Our food came out fairly quickly and the presentation looked so tempting! The flat iron steak hash comes with potatoes, a sugar coated buttermilk biscuit, 2 poached eggs, onion rings, shishito peppers, peppercorn demi glace, bell peppers and onions as well as the aforementioned steak. Cutting into the steak, it was perfectly medium rare as requested. I tried it with the peppercorn demi glace and found the sauce to have an odd background flavor to it that I didn't really like so I just ate it plain since the steak had enough bold flavor to hold up well on its own. The actual hash tasted decent but it looked a lot like a premade cubed potato mix that comes from a bag. I've seen other breakfast spots use a similar looking mass-produced potato and label it as home fries on their menu.  The chilaquiles tortilla chips were nicely light and crisp, smothered in a vinegary, tangy green sauce. The chicken on top had red sauce mixed in with it. The chicken was alright, not the most tender I've had but it was a good protein to have with the tortilla chips.  Service was excellent. We were checked up on as needed and drinks were filled when they got low.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Flat iron steak hash

slD97WA5l2ijOf0XEvMIug.text: Arizona's largest Bloody Mary bar?  I'm intrigued!  #HASH #HASH BABY!  We arrived during the opening weekend and wow, it was a packed house!  We were quoted a 45-60 min wait but it was actually closer to 20 mins.  What a lovely surprise!  We had a Matcha Latte, three different disco cocktails, the Chilaquiles as an appetizer, the Cristina's Tamale Cakes (keep in mind that this is a sweeter tamale since it's made with corn), the Steak Breakfast Burrito, the Lump Crab Hash, and the Mexican Scramble.  As to be expected during opening week, it was quite a wait for food.  Like... a 45min wait for our food to come out.  But when the food came out, everything was hot and fresh.  I won't go into great lengths about every dish but everybody was pretty much happy with their dish with the exception of the Lump Crab Hash which was more reminiscent to burnt stir-fry.  All-in-all, this is a great addition for the city of Chandler and I'm glad they're so close to my favorite spin class studio.  I'll work-out and then get to eat my calories back next door!

Ewbi2jiQhNuXPyYH4Jdb3A.text: Its was Ok for me.  I had breakfast here about 2 weeks ago.  Had an omelette that was very under impressive - especially the size for the price.  The ingredients we undercooked - especially the small fibrous  asparagus.  And more disappointing was that the egg 'product' was exactly that.  It was cut with water or something pre-mixed as the texture of the egg was spongy and just seemed to have more than just eggs and some cream/milk mixed in.  The bloody bar looks amazing and the service was good.

3GNSx1dfw59vAoOYkmcNOg.text: We went to Hash for the first time, last weekend with our kids and some friends.  We got there at 9:30 on Sat morning and we were promptly greeted and seated.  We had a party of 9 so it was nice to see the restaurant had a few large tables for us to choose from.   The Hash Kitchen has a build your own bloody mary bar so if you love a good Bloody Mary then you need to come check it out! The food was fantastic and the service was prompt.  Domenic came over to check on our table a few times just to make sure everyone was satisfied. I would recommend Hash Kitchen, so if you are at Ray and the 101 in Chandler, stop on in!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Eggs Benedict was so Yummy!!

z6aVwPxSdD9uQDTC51iLsA.text: This place surprisingly lived up to the hype. Came here around 1pm on a Saturday and got seated quicker than we had expected. It is a bit loud inside as there is a DJ that plays while you dine; music was poppin but the high volume it played at made it a little diffiult to talk amongst ourselves.  The portions are huge! Almost everyone had leftovers to take home. The Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict was so delicious. The English muffin was thick and fluffy, the eggs were cooked to perfection, there was more than enough smoked salmon, and the crispy capers and sauteed spinach were THE best touches. I'm drooling just thinking about it again. I also tried a bite of the banana split brioche and it was very tasty. You can taste the brown sugar and it was not overly sweet like I was expecting it to be.  The Build-Your-Own-Bloody Mary bar was intimidating with how many toppings there were. Priced at $13, you get a small mason jar cup for your customizable Bloody Mary. I tried the cilantro lime vodka and didn't love it, but I was told that it's their most popular. Will have to try the bacon vodka next time. There are tons of pickles, olives and other toppings (salami, cheese, boiled egg, etc.) available for you to top your Bloody Mary. Be sure to save some room for the big ol' meatballs at the end of the bar. Also found at the end are jalapeno poppers (did not get to try these unfortunately) and bacon.   Service was nice and attentive, which made my overall experience a great one on top of the great food.   Things that fell flat, while totally subjective: my meal came with a side of potatoes and they were meh. A little too soft for my liking, not crispy at all and the seasoning was a little bland (I prefer more salty potatoes). The mimosa flight came with four flavors: original, kiwi, strawberry, and blueberry. Between the five of us, only the kiwi and blueberry were popular. The kiwi was refreshing and strong in flavor.

5iUDwFTgbBUV1O8MeOxX5A.text: What can I say other than, we brunched SO HARD at Hash Kitchen today!!!  My best friend and I enjoyed people watching here. There were so many things to take in: live DJ, instagram friendly decor, energetic staff, and just so many different walks of life here!  Our server came by immediately to get our drinks started, which I found that later is by far the highlight of this establishment. I was excited to try the Bloody Mary bar, it was something that I missed on my last visit to the location in Chandler. It was cool! Soooo many toppings were available here - too many to list!!! My favorite topping was probably the kimchi.  Dominic, (possibly one of the Managers at this location), stopped by and acknowledged that they were very aware of the impact that social media had on their business and asked us to share our visit. He made sure everything was to our liking and  invited us to visit again - it was a very nice gesture! I always appreciate it when management takes the time to get to know their patrons.  Parking was a bit annoying. There is limited parking due to the popularity of this new restaurant, so bring your patience because you will probably need to park further out than most would like. It might be a good idea to drop someone off at the front door to put your name on the list and go find your parking space after that.   FYI: The wait this morning at 9:30 was about 45 minutes. - not too bad but the front area could definitely use some more misters. The coolest spot on the patio was on the "dog friendly patio". They had misters there, but everyone on the patio were without pets...LOL.  Overall, I think this will be a neat place to bring a group of friends for a good music, drinks, and brunch. I'm not sure this is the best place to bring your kiddos, but I did see a lot of families with young children and they do accommodate children with a kids menu.   I will be sure to visit again. For my next visit here, I would like to try their Mocha Frappuccino! Happy brunching!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

cl4M3LUX-rrhGwq1Fft3OA.text: I think this is really a fun place! The service was out standing! William and Toby took very good care of me. In fact I was looking for my morning cocktail and they did not have my Malibu rum, so Toby whipped up a really nice coconut pineapple ice drink with Bacardi and it was delicious!  On to the food... I really enjoyed the flavor of my smoked salmon eggs Benedict, but I really thought it was too much bread!  I must confess, I am an Eggs Benedict snob!They use biscuits instead of English muffins and the biscuits were very very thick. Don't get me wrong because the biscuits were awesome by themselves, but as part of the Benedict I don't think it worked well. It was too much bread and I  couldn't get one good all-inclusive bite with the salmon, poached egg, spinach, hollandaise sauce and capers.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is really funky! They have a DJ and she was jamming! She played Bruno Mars, The Police and a host of other good songs! They also have a Bloody Mary bar, which is really quite unique! I don't like Bloody Mary's but I can appreciate the fact that it was an awesome looking setup!. So if you like bloody Mary's and funky good music and really good food, you have to give this place a try!

0qS0XoKP0FzFvMMMgi8-IA.text: We had breakfast at the Hash Kitchen in Chandler this morning. Easily the best breakfast experience we have had in years! The restaurant had a comfortable ambiance and the food was excellent. Our server, Kendra, was knowledgeable, efficient and charming. The manager, Domenic, was engaging and was genuinely interested in our comments and in our having a good experience at the restaurant. Hash Kitchen is a great place for breakfast!

5aHocAgOpOOfDGoihhsShA.text: Visited Hash Kitchen for the first time with a friend who is in town for the weekend. Kane, our server and Dominic, the manager made it a great experience. The mimosa flight is a must do and the food is delish! I will definitely be back!

zdi2G8sDiLfpnBDUKHEbWQ.text: Ok. I've been to all three Hash Kitchen's now. My family was excited about the new chandler location cause it's closer to them but really far for me. Anyways, I'm always game to go to Hash Kitchen.   We got a big table towards the back. Huge wooden table that fit 9 people comfortable. I didn't even have to come through the front door but come in through the back side door because I saw our table. So I didn't even get to experience what the whole restaurant was like but it's just like all the other Hash Kitchen 's on the weekends. DJ playing loud music and lots of people.   I had the Asian Chicken Sandwich which had coleslaw. The bread was really fresh and the chicken and slaw was really good. Really good combination. It works really well together. It was perfect. Was great with the fries. Really filling and I loved it. Gave a bite to my wife and she really liked it too.  My son and wife got the Huevos Rancho Hash. They thought it was okay. The beef was a little over cooked but other than that it was pretty good. Everyone else really enjoyed their meal too.   We ended our meal with Cannoli Donuts. These are freshly fried donuts with the Cannoli inside in the hole of the donut. So you get the freshness of the donut with the sweetness of the Cannoli and it was so good. Really loved it  I thought the service was really good. We had Katrina and she was very good. Very friendly. Kept our water cups and coffee cups filled. We even had the manager Dominic come by and make sure our meal was satisfactory. He was very friendly and took care of us. The only problem we had was with the kitchen. They brought out half of the tables food and we were waiting for the other half for awhile. The people who got their food finished half way by the time we got our food. The server and manger apologized and tried to get our food out as quickly as possible.   So the place is just like the other Hash Kitchens. Very crowded. Very loud with DJ. Very good food but decent service due to the kitchen. We were also told that this location is the experiment menu. They try it out here before the menu item goes out to the other locations. So if you want to try new item on the menu then this is the place to go to.   We love HK and we will be back. Enjoy cause we did.

5CmAGV8ZD5Fa-6RfsHoxMw.text: The food and service is excellent! Domenic is the best!!! Will be back! Bring all you friends enjoy the music cause the DJ is Dope!!

UrV0zSxz7p_yKhEUVLDNHA.text: Trendy Alert! OMG MY BFF. You might want to enjoy good food or you might want to fist pump...either way, this place is for you. Usually a DJ is spinning some good beats and the Bloody Mary bar is popping. I personally don't like Bloody Marys, but if I did, I'd go ham (bacon, if you will) over there.  We've been here a handful of times and it's always a good time. Good people watching, good music, good food, good drinks. Just be warned, the only things you have to look out for are fist pumps and long waits...as they do get busy. What can I say, PHX people love their brunches.

uFfsn-zYHxKZR4crhDJsLg.text: This place is awesome on all accounts. The manager, Dominic. East coast Italian with family flair. Best brunch menu ever. Everything and anything. Outside dining was perfect. Cool breezes, good DJ food.  Never experienced a Bloody Mary bar. So great!  Thanks for making my moms birthday brunch very memorable.  Wisconsin Lisa

eBlbDgCD-CztAFqKWRK64g.text: WOW! My new favorite breakfast place!! Be WARNED the wait is a long one! Especially on the weekends we went on a Sunday morning and waited about 1.5 hrs! But it was 100% worth it!  It is a very loud "club" type vibe so if your looking for quiet place this is not it!  It's a  fun exciting environment! All the staff I interacted with were super friendly! And once we were inside at a table and ordered it went fast food and ddrinks came out in a very timely matter! HUGE portions and amazing taste! They have such FUN takes on your average breakfast! And they have really delicious breakfast cocktails!

Rvisq_DWHk0eQxCZyoeaeA.text: Our waiter Jesus was awesome! Jesus Gave us great recommendations and had a wonderful attitude for as busy as they were.  The entire menu is awesome and sounds wonderful and exciting!  I cant wait to come back and try a coffee in a cone!  Thanks so much!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

7Bttj8PiK_eizq2B6DYDXw.text: I'll be honest,  I went into this place not expecting to like it much.  It's very much "on trend" for the brunch scene and I'm usually wary of that.The wait was about 45 minutes on a 3 day weekend monday.  However once we sat down I was impressed.  The menu has a wide array of options and innovative drinks.  I personally went with mimosas, specifically one kiwi and one blueberry which were amazing and a great price at 6 a pop.  The food is on the pricey side but you get a lot of it. I had gotten the avocado toast. Don't let that fool you,  this is not healthy,  it's indulgent. You get 2 brick sized pieces of toasted brioche piled high. It was well worth the price  The biggest issue is there's inexplicably a DJ playing which quickly becomes overwhelming since it seems this place is also always packed.

kxBTnAyWmzo35vI0s4QWqQ.text: I took my wife here for our wedding anniversary and we really enjoyed the place. We loved the design with plenty of seating and outdoor area/bar and the food was great.   The only issue we had was the music was way to loud. For a nightclub it would have been fine, for a brunch spot, a bit much. The only reason for the lost star.

H4jMV54KSmpt1SBW6F85mw.text: So on 5/21/19 it was my husband and I 3 year wedding anniversary, we usually have a whole day planned and this year we decided to try this place for bunch to kick it off.  It was a mistake! We we seated immediately by a very nice hostess, even came around a few times to check on us and even took our drink orders.  Why? Because our waitress took FOREVER to get to us. The hostess said our waitress was behind or had a lot of tables but I observed the other waitresses chatting with other patrons, not about their food or etc.  Even observed what looked like a manager chatting and mingling with others next to our table but we were still unattended.  I got pissed!   We never get to really go out, I work full time and go to school, my husband works so much and we have kids.  So on our anniversary, we just needed time for ourselves and this is how it starts??  Anyway when the waitress did come she was handing me a ticket and impatiently looked at us like WE were crazy. I ordered the build your own Bloody Mary, our first time there, I have no idea what this ticket means. She finally says , didn't one of you order the Bloody Mary? I said yes but it's our first time there so I had no idea what she was handing me. She said go over to the bar and pointed to the BM bar and the bartender will start you off. I got even more angry, I felt like I inconvenienced her to tell me this information. The bartender was exceptional! I got my drink!   The food came, we both ordered the carne asada with egg whites, hash, onions , avocado and Pico. The meat was not medium as ordered, the avocado was as hard as a rock, the Pico tasted old. The hash and onions were good. We decided not to order desert as planned, given the risk, and then that was it.   The bartender- 5 stars  Waitress - 1 star  Restaurant - 2 stars since I loved the Bloody Mary   Unfortunately we will not be returning.

c8Oq4z15CXSZMVB5j_S5mw.text: Dominic, one of the managers, is the bomb!!! This is one of the best brunches around!!! He takes care of his staff and customers! Awesome food and awesome drinks! Thanks Dominic!!!

Cm7Tzsu-BFPNEDnjhcKQtQ.text: Went yesterday Labor day, our first time eating here. Very cool and fun place for Brunch. I had the chilaquiles my husband had the huevos rancheros very delicious.  My daughter had the pineapple upside down pancakes.. yummy.  And the mimosas flight is a must, highly recommend this place. We will definitely be back when we visit Arizona soon!

4ibFiFN6Xw8DVvsmSn62TA.text: Dominic and the staff were great.  The wait can be long but well worth it. Just grab a bloody Mary and chill for a 30 min. Go get some more goodies for the Mary at the bar and enjoy the atmosphere.  The food is really good. I haven't had anything on the menu that was bad. You'll need a nap afterwards but it's a good nap. Coffee is good too.

eGvwhcxh4TvQTB8302vhqQ.text: Food was absolutely fantastic and the service was like no other! We had Domenic, manager of the location come over and have an incredible conversation with us. Extremely personable! In addition, the food came out wicked fast!   Overall excellent experience with good vibes and great service! Oh, and if you're feeling a Bloody Mary, they've got the largest Bloody Mary Bar I've ever seen.

P2OlkEHmbRE5jQJvqp3_PQ.text: I have had the opportunity to eat at this location and the Scottsdale location on a Saturday morning at very busy times for the restaurant. Let me tell you that service between the locations is night and day.  I was personally greeted and asked about my service by the manager Dominic and received exceptional service from my server.  It's funny how huge of a difference management makes. My food was not only delicious but warm. I hade an iced mocha & they have almond milk which was awesome. Ordered a veggie frittata with egg whites only and it was a very nice size plate, left nice and full! Loved that they are pet friendly and good vibes. Will most definitely come again to this location no matter the drive.

iHH0joi0pFm4n03TCo1UVQ.text: Met my friend for breakfast and I am so happy I did!!   We went on a weekday and the restaurant was packed but we got a seat right away so that was a win!  The service was awesome and we got our food quick which was awesome for being so busy!!     My friend got the biscuits and gravy and she loved it!!  There was huge chunks of very tasty sausage!     I ordered the monte cristo sandwich.   So SO much food!!   It was so good!!      This will definitely become a favorite spot for us!!

RhUQxtU6Zv7r62atx-Nmtw.text: Omg - the wait was a lot - but after we got our food and drink we are all like WORTH IT!!! Worth every moment!! This food might very well best the brunch in town thank you Dominic for stopping by our table. You definitely have a handle on what people want for brunch.

sX9tP-UW9K3TK3SB7-z1-w.text: Outstanding food, service and atmosphere!  Best bloody mary bar in AZ no doubt!  The manager Dominic visited with us for a moment to make sure we were all enjoying ourselves and his demeanor is so fun, friendly and welcoming.  Best place for a fun brunch in Chandler!

_pYN0RzEzuiBMNb4jzoDZQ.text: Trendy restaurant with loud music.   I ordered the corn beef hash.  What I got was a large skillet with egg in top and more potato cubes than corn beef.    At $16 I feel that it was overpriced.

QJH2gDzauzMajl5nRKXR7g.text: Alright now, let's talk about the Bloody Mary bar here! Just kidding... I was not able to sample their Bloody Mary's but I was excited to see all kinds of toppings they offer. Seriously! It was the reason why we came here in the first place.   But let me just tell you about their phenomenal food and service! Beyond what you'd expect at a very busy restaurant. The manager came by several times asking if we were well taken cared of. Food servings is enough for sharing which we did we the avocado toast. We also ordered mimosa flights and a couple of scrambled dishes.   Can't wait to come back here for brunch!

YoiTHlxbG6GUDbsSi2dGtA.text: I LOVED this place! I came with some girlfriends early on a Saturday for brunch. Get an Uber because the food is amazing but the drinks are even better! The Bloody Mary bar is a site to behold! You basically could just eat that. There's also a mimosa flight just in case you want to try them all.   Start with a Bacon Board for your appetizer, you won't WANT to share but it's great size so you'll need to. I ordered the chilaqules and they were tangy, spicy, and just slightly crunchy. They were just perfect! If you want something sweet, the cannoli pancakes are the way to go! Sweet, fluffly, and massive! I came with a group and we all just ordered some  things and shared them all. Which is the best way to do!   If you want to try this place and haven't because its in Chandler and you think that you'll get the same experience....you won't. The Hash in Chandler is the only one I'll go to. I tried the one in Arcadia and was appalled by the service. The Chandler location is the only one that I'll visit! Not to mention that this one is the only one with the Bacon Board!

UDvsW82RQnw6G1d88hqGQg.text: Wow. I love a good brunch and this place surpassed all expectations. I was told this place always has a crazy long wait, but we were quoted 20 min and were sat in 8. Our server Kendra was busy with the whole patio and was still attentive and helpful throughout our meal.  The food was AMAZING. The pretzel benedict is one of the best brunch dishes I've ever had. I'm vegetarian so I subbed spinach for the bacon and it was surreal.  The bloody mary bar is an awesome idea. I had one that was awesome, but switched over to the mimosa flight and WOW! So good and only $16... definitely will be returning with more people next time.

GfadOWjXEyyOwY7mERKeLw.text: Great Bloody Mary bar! We had a great time creating our Masterpiece! I knew it was coming... the salt overload! The bar garnishes are meats, cheeses, olives, bacon, more processed meats, and pickles upon pickled items! Yummy, but yikes! I'm bloated. Hehehehehe! I ordered the carnitas hash. It was pretty good, I think I would order something else next time though. It wasn't second ordering worthy. The potatoes were cold at the bottom of skillet, and seemed old, or left over taste. We came at 12:30 on a Wednesday, was not busy. Our server was slow, and never offered us hot sauce, salsa or ketchup.  I'll give it another try, but my VERY FIRST impression was VERY DISAPPOINTING. So sad! I've been dying to come here!

VQrWdSlS7Kls0Iei3nDB7Q.text: So i'm semi new to the valley but i'm no fool to trends and especially attentive to trend setters. Hash kitchen is definitely the latter and I believe it will be a valley staple for decades to come.  The food magnificent,  the drinks spectacular,  and the wait for such quality and entertainment to be expected.  Anything you order will be good and plentiful.  Fantastic beverages great service friendly happy people,  a great way to start the day.  Order drinks from inside not at the outside window is my only BIG tip  (It'll save you the feeling of rejection at the outside window where you'll be directed inside).   Get the French toast for sure,  the skillets may be a little carb heavy as I prefer more protein.  If the state drinks for arizona are bloody Mary's and mimosas as I've come to see they are then this is definitely your spot.  Oh yeah.... live DJ(Great Music).

R6w01U9XQN7S5rnJtxKLRA.text: This place is really good to have breakfast or brunch! It is not your typical breakfast place at all! They have a live DJ inside the place, so it gets very loud inside, but people get their groove on while eating! They also have a Bloody mary bar on the side so people go up and pick out what they want in their drink!  Their food is very delicious! Their potatoes are so good! Their alcoholic drinks are pretty strong, so if you like to get tipsy in the morning then try the drinks! They are good too! This place is definitely worth the try!

n8X1hLcADVkit7W7HVbCLA.text: This place is the crown jewel of Brunch, best breakfast experience I have had outside a resort! This place is the Disney Land of breakfast and should be in every major city in America. This place should be 10 Stars! lOBw00KFTEEECL-Ezugrfw.text: First off we love this place!!! We will be going back for sure. Lots of reviews talking about the line being long and the music was loud and blah blah blah. This place is amazing and cool and hip and fun and something we have needed in this area for a while. Can't understand why people give bad reviews just because it's not their style. Just go back to your boring old place and have stale coffee and a typical grand slam breakfast.  Bloody Mary bar was so legit. It's a meal in-itself. We had the avocado toast and the corn beef hash Benedict. Both amazing. And could only finish half, it was so much food.  If you want something new and cool this is your place. If you want a typical breakfast this might not be for you.

JyPT_sYkUsBLlsrStIbIJQ.text: As I always say, I'm VERY particular and hard to please. That said, Newbie to Hash Kitchen. A group of us went on Saturday, most of us first timers.   Overall, it was a good experience. The cons: LONG wait times!! We went at 9:30 a.m. and we waited approximately 40 minutes to be seated "first available". We ended up being seated on the patio in the corner. Worst seat in the place but we did ask for first available. My recommendation, sit inside or you miss out on the ambiance and the cool vibe this place offers. Anyway, that was the only negative part of our experience. Positive: Excellent food, drinks, music, and service. Our server was very attentive. The manager Domenic was awesome and very entertaining to have a conversation with. Both made us feel very welcome and wanted to make sure we had an enjoyable first time experience. If you're a Bloody Mary kind of person, you'll LOVE the Bloody Mary bar as you get to build it yourself, so pile on the food and all the extras. I personally did the Mimosa flight. My daughter tried the Cereal flight and hubs had the Bloody Mary. Everyone in our group was highly satisfied with our choice of entree. Though we asked for extra crispy bacon, it came out limp both times. Entrees were very good portions. For example, one of us order buttermilk pancakes and you get a huge stack of 4 large pancakes. I personally had the sausage gravy and biscuits which were very tasty and filling.   FYI: If you plan on drinking and eating, plan on spending about $25 per person plus tax and tip for a flight or Bloody Mary and an entree. Also, if you're not into crowds and loud restaurants, this place is definitely not for you. They have a live DJ playing music. Parking is a bit crazy as the lot directly in front of Hash is small however there's a big lot to the west of the restaurant.   We are anxious to go back and this time we'll go early and choose to sit inside! Looking forward to it.

sPeZr9h--wNlVFGXAR-c1w.text: HANDS DOWN THE #1 Breakfast place in AZ. I am in love with this place. 10/10 for the Bloody Mary Bar. Yes, very trendy and totally packed.  Tip.....get there before 8am or prepare to wait.  It is the complete BOMB!!!!

mkTw457PzIUX9xikasuAWA.text: Amazing brunch!   Mimosas flight is incredible. Bloody Mary bar is outstanding!!!   Domenic the manager was super awesome!!!  The food is to die for!!!
