Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Just yummy!!!  This place Rocks!! DJ rocks!  Domenic is amazing!!  I will come again and again!!!

a0a6iMPkYAYng81-BQtrJA.text: I've been wanting to try this pace for a while. Met my husband for lunch today and I have to say I (we) were pretty disappointed.   They are very popular so they were pretty busy. Our server was nice and attentive despite how busy they were.   I ordered the herb fried chicken hash and my husband the huevos ranchero hash.   Our food came and looked good however the huevos rancheros has fried leeks all over it. My husband asked the waitress if it was supposed to come that way (because he would have asked for it to be left off) and she replied that it was. He said he didn't see it on the menu - she went to show him but turned out it wasn't on the menu at all. No offer to remake the meal but my husband decided to just pick them off. There was no avocado with the meal either which IS on the menu.   As we ate I noticed how dry my potatoes were. Just dry and a little old/cold and bland. It was my first time so I didn't know what to expect but in my mind a 'hash' shouldn't be so dry and bland. My chicken was pretty dry and over cooked as well. The egg was good.  Looking at the pics here, my food was nothing like those in the pics.   My husband's food was dry as well. So much so that he asked for extra red chili sauce commenting that his food was so dry and that it was much better the last time he was here. Still, no offer to remake the meal but the extra sauce he shared helped both of us eat our meals.   I really heard great things and was sad our experience wasn't good. The tables around us looked great - especially the bloody mary's!  I will probably try again and order something different.  My husband said he probably wouldn't be back.   Hash is literally in their name. The hash should be the best thing they serve - not the worst for $14 and $16!

y6DMXzR91Sy40LSjz4WrLQ.text: Yummy!! My family and I are big brunch fans, so when my parents said we were trying out a new brunch place... my expectations were pretty high. But what a pleasant surprise!! The vibes here were so fun and the atmosphere was incredibly welcoming and hip! Food came out at a reasonable time and exceeded expectations! Sooo yummy! All the classic breakfast foods had a yummy new twist to them. Like an over-medium egg with some delicious seasoning on it! And the lemon ricotta pancakes were TO DIE FOR! 4 pancakes, topped with powdered sugar, lemon, and a delicious ricotta spread. Our waitress, Amanda, was so kind and helpful with her suggestions!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lemon and Ricotta pancakes!

qHaMNlWXaARoMxTOWE3Jiw.text: First timers and this place is great!  Great food, great drinks, great service.  My cousin and I ordered the mimosa flights at $16 each.  That seemed steep but I still wanted to try them.  I was expecting miniature sized mimosas but instead received 4 nearly full sized mimosas.  The two guys ordered the Bloody Mary bar at $12 each.  Again, a little pricey but with over 40 items to build your own, it also felt like a decent value.    First impression of the menu was that it was like the drinks, expensive, but once you see the portion sizes and taste the quality, you feel like you're getting what you're paying for.     The vibe was cool too.  Loved the decor and atmosphere.  We went on a Tuesday and didn't have to wait for a table but I imagine the weekends with the DJ there, the wait time will be long.   Lastly, our server, Kim was amazing!  Fun lady to talk to and super knowledgeable and patient in answering our many questions!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Coconut/Almond encrusted French toast

R4p1br9BXUXE0-w_EDu5qw.text: Can lighting strike twice in the same place?  This is our second trip to Hash Kitchen.  Last time we thought the burgers were the best we'd ever had.  Worth driving a bit to get there. Then, even our leftover burgers eaten the next day were awesome (can that really be?).  The burgers were as good this time?  Is it the bacon?  The beef? We don't know.  While there we kept seeing interesting things at other tables that we wanted to come back and try.  Including Bloody Marys from the Bloody Mary bar and the enticing Mimosa flight.  Our waiter Jose gave us great service and Domenic the manager came by to check on us and chat.  Will definitely go back.

F7l48XX51V--rfW0siTuuQ.text: This place is everything you want in a brunch spot. Great food, service, booze before lunch time! The location and ambiance are top notch as well.  What a cool spot!

BFJYXjYetMaVWXVUdRjjkw.text: So much fun, even better food.  Live dj is awesome.  Definitely our go to for brunch!

G0UCyVSfRvk-n5NauhjC2g.text: Had never heard of Hash kitchen before but decided to try with a few co workers on a whim on a busy Saturday morning. We were quoted a wait time of an hour but were seated within 30 minutes which was nice.  I ordered I got the Italian Sausage Hash with egg whites. The food did take some time to come out but it was well worth the wait. It was clear that the restaurant had just opened at that location as the waitresss wasn't that knowledgeable about the menu but was still nice enough. Some sides were forgotten to be brought out, (side of sausage, side of potatoes) but waitress and management was super apologetic. Overall would definitely give this location a second visit to try out even more menu items!

125h3BWCJCUcVUjaDHmd3Q.text: Hash kitchen never fails for a GREAT Sunday Funday or any day of the week get together! Dominick makes us feel like family every time we eat there! The food is always amazing! The DJ plays the BEST music from old school to new! The atmosphere is amazing!! Their drinks are amazing! Good way to end the weekend before another busy one! Picture attached is the cereal shooters!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cereal Shooters

h5FjomhLmaKDQfo9OHlGFA.text: This place is amazing! So many fun dishes and drinks, it's a must for bloody Mary's! They have an entire bar dedicated to making your own custom one with different ingredients like bacon, fried ravioli, picked items etc. we loved our server Amy and the manager Dominic greeted us and was so sweet making sure we were taken care of, thanks Hash Kitchen!

fAcK3Izw47a0Fug_nxrhLw.text: What a great spot for an early Saturday morning of good food and excellent service. Go before 9am if you don't want to wait for a table. The Bloody Mary Bar is absolutely outstanding! Many different vodkas to choose from, along with probably 30 different items you can add to it! For my meal I chose the Pretzel Benedict. Amazing! My wife and her friend split the Avocado toast, which was definitely a plate for 2. Our server, Sarah, was super attentive and polite. The manager, Dominick, made sure to stop by our table and ask us how our food and service was. That was classy. They had a DJ come in around 9am and start mixing tunes. It's just a very cool and hip restaurant and atmosphere. I was definitely impressed with my first visit. You won't be disappointed!!

pVLMOkVkt_8couIgOBmUEw.text: Wow! We walked in Friday am and the place was packed, the DJ (yes, that's correct) was playing top 40 and the Bloody Mary bar was stocked to the brim. It was Way more than I expected for a breakfast spot in Chandler.  This was my first time visit and Our server told us it's been busy since they opened a week ago. Pasted on a wall was "The Brunch Life", which accurately describes the vibe of the restaurant. It's reminiscent of what you'd find in downtown Scottsdale.  The customers service was excellent. The hostess, servers and managers all checked on us to see how we were doing. The food was delicious and the coffee was strong. Next time I go, I look forward to trying some adult beverages like the mimosa flight or their disco ball slush that's topped with cotton candy.  This will probably end up being my go to brunch spot!   Cons: our server forgot to put our breakfast bruschetta order in and so once reminded it came out after we had eaten. It was delicious though. Also, the bathrooms were completely out of toilet paper. Annoying but both issues can be easily fixed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

Z7jSXjmGtLF3ZPL1IV0ggQ.text: This place is a fun place for brunch on Sunday Funday. Great atmosphere, awesome Bloody Mary Bar. If you come here on the weekend be prepared for a wait, though it is worth it. Food is delicious and great brunch options. Staff seems a little overwhelmed though and took awhile to gets drinks and the check.

5FQBjaTnHQryvoyn2uTBPw.text: Hash Kitchen was very aesthetic. I liked the Bloody Mary bar and the nova lox was great

KG440_spl4alwMAE93NQEA.text: Excellent food & service this morning at Hash Kitchen in Chandler!     Bloody Mary bar.   Pretzel with beer cheese & eggs.   Entire group of friends will return!!

4knZmcMsYGqcGx8IgTcajA.text: Domenic & Sammy are the best! Great experience and the food was so great! Cutest place to grab brunch with your friends!

rNfBJw-jCVlARknWlL1-eg.text: Enjoyed an awesome birthday brunch with friends! Great music and fantastic food. The manager, Domenic and the waiter Shawn were very welcoming and hospitable!! I joined my party late and my food came out with the rest of my friends!!

yoYd9K7ManGasH7nzgKXfg.text: This place was amazing! The food is huge in portions so sharing a meal would be best unless you're really hungry! The Bloody Mary bar was awesome! Loved the atmosphere and will definitely be back!

kUj6vtlWfwN4msw2mVL2dw.text: A nightclub disguised as a brunch place, please, really? I wanted to try the bloody Mary bar. Waited outside 20 min for a table today, Sunday. Inside hit by a tsunami of extremely loud club music. We couldn't hear each other speak. Friend joked, "we'll have to text each other". Menu looked good but I'll never know. Waitress said the music was this loud Friday through Sunday. Even if this place was in Scottsdale or downtown Phoenix I wouldn't eat there, this is not meant for Chandler. Bye bye

rrLfdhtActwTltmVyIGQmw.text: We went at 730 on Sunday and had no wait. Our server Jesus was pleasant and did not rush us. My husband loved the Bloody Mary bar, he thought all the toppings were fun but that the actual mix was delicious. My daughters enjoyed ordering fancy dishes. The portion sizes were huge. It was not cheap and as a family of 5 it will probably be a treat spot for us. It was a great way to indulge on a Sunday.

n_fHghMP6aBmAqymWL5UWw.text: My mom and I had a terrific lunch today. Food was excellent and the service even better. The manager, Dominic was so personable and attentive. Can't wait to go back.

nqXramNcGcNNi_R6ee2xQw.text: Get here early if you want to park close by! This place is fantastic for your weekend brunch. I mean, it has the largest bloody mary bar in the state!! I paired my bloody mary with the lump crab and sweet potato hash --just amazing. Thanks, Keri, for taking good care of us. We'll be back!

NKQjQ68H65Ji0A3W_L1S4A.text: OMG I don't think there's one bad item on this menu! My family and I came here around 10:30 on Sunday and it was packed!!! We had to wait for 35 minutes, but it was worth it! My husband and I went to the Bloody Mary bar while we waited! So good!!! We'll definitely be regulars here.

wNngTNJ9vkbK8q76f-d-1A.text: Such a fun place for brunch and amazing food too!  The manager Dominic was so welcoming and friendly.  We are definitely coming back!

Uysxrn8CxjGx1TMzZ-kxlQ.text: This place got a lot of hype on Facebook and in local groups. My experience today was less than desirable. My gal pal and I chose this place to have a nice chat and catch up. We had plenty of time to do that, because service was S.L.O.W.  It wasn't even crowded or busy and I noticed staffing wasn't an issue. Ordered a coffee drink to begin with and it took over 5 minutes to get and it tasted like the barista forgot the coffee. At $5, I should taste the coffee! We ordered a starter that took longer than anticipated to arrive. Enjoyed that for a while before the server came back to take our order. Breakfast took an hour and a half during slow business hours, I'd hate to go during peek business hours! We even had to ask for refills on water! Yikes! The food was wildly overpriced even though the food was picturesque. I suppose I was paying for presentation. I will not be going back, which I'm sure won't affect the hype, but if there is another 'hot & new' place recommended on Yelp, go there!

LtqCqI5XYj_voMoxZpa-cA.text: My new favorite brunch spot! Cannot wait to go back and try more on the menu! We (my honey and another couple) decided to try this place Saturday morning. SO glad we did. I kept it basic, pancakes (which were impossibly perfect, turkey bacon (major props for that option) and some potatoes. The man got the chicken and wafles (crushed it) and our friends got the breakfast steak burritos, which I kid you not are the size of a new baby and they said they were incredible! All kinds of hot sauces to choose from- again a huge win in my book. The people next to us got the fruity pebbles pancakes which they said were a big thumbs up too. So many fun dishes to come back and try.  Food was amazing. Bloody Mary bar is insane. You could make a meal there alone. Mimosa's...mmm. All kinds of fun drinks to try. Nice BIG coffee mugs. A plus for a guzzler like me.  Service was spot on. I am SO sad I cannot recall our server's name but she was amazing, I even looked at the receipt when we got home so I could give her a shout out...and it just said bar...  We sat inside by the bar, the atmosphere is great, family friendly but very cool for gathering with friends. Great looking patio, dj playing some fun music to get your morning started right.  Prices are really reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.  The manager Dominic came over and visited with us, ensuring everything was all we hoped and dreamed it would be. It was all that and more! I drive Lyft on the weekends and have been telling all my riders about how great this place is. In retrospect maybe I should have kept it a secret because it was already busy! But I was impressed with how quickly we were seated, greeted and fed. Definitely will return with the kids, more friends and family...

u6wg_pkrzl3ToAyYLd7H4A.text: This place is fire! So is the guy who runs the place, Dom! Funny dude who makes you feel important! Food is money. And the atmosphere is popping!

3Mnw6CL3l2CWNPq_XBiT-A.text: Sick spot. Good food, music and atmosphere. Definitely recommend if you want to start your day with excellent vibes.

1YYHMBVfOiioitV5K0HblQ.text: Thank you Domenic!  Excellent service from you and all of your staff as usual!  Food was excellent!

PHI_tamKoB_CbAS8DUf_qw.text: Great vibe, great food! Had the bacon platter sampler and the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were AWESOME! Staff was very friendly and attentive, food came out quickly and was fantastic - even though they were packed on a Sunday morning, the manager Dom came over and chatted up a storm! Would def recommend, will be back

ekkTarO_ja3H_7UAq7Y0KA.text: Our server Amy and manager Dominick were very inviting and detail oriented! They made us feel like we were eating at our own dinner table!! I would highly recommend indulging on a Saturday or Sunday morning for breakfast, it's one hundred percent worth it!

hMptQLyE0HsSdRY1Ya1TWg.text: Got us in right away .  Even when busy.  Domenic the manager was awesome.  The strawberry champs were amazing.  The salmon plate was amazing and super filling!  LOVE

kYxRn9jToN6du1TahaXjsw.text: i should change my password because with all my facebook friends on yelp someone could easily log in to my facebook. btw sorry to bother you brandon, you dont know me, and you will never know me. but if you dont change your password someone with malicious intentions could steal your data.

d8LbLHQ0V3ATmyJ2Vvw1qw.text: Yummy breakfast for kids and grown ups! The carnitas hash and monte cristo were excellent. Kids loved the chocolate chip pancakes. Bloody Mary bar was great too!

3Qgf1_ha74bla0u1r8zCjA.text: Love this place! The food is absolutely delicious, and they have lots of yummy gluten free options. Summer is also one of the best managers there, she makes everyone feel right at home. We always have good experiences at hash kitchen:)

kIsbIOlgYTV93Uv0YuhNqw.text: First time visit with our kids (adults) and started with the Bloody Marys. Great choice! Too many selections to name, but all were great. Followed up with humongous breakfasts artistically done! Will definitely return when they have oysters!

OrqpiGfReBURSF9l3tSLdA.text: This has officially became my FAVORITE breakfast place ever! Right when we walked in, the atmosphere was positive. Our server was great and the manager, Domenic went out of his way to check in on us throughout our meal. My husband ordered a tamale eggs benedict dish that was out of this world with flavor. I got the bagel breakfast sandwhich sliders that were also amazing and were presented on a wood board instead of a normal plate. On top of all of that we each got a "build your own" bloody mary. We got to choose the flavor of alcohol and got to pick out any toppings that we wanted; so awesome. At the end of our meal we also ordered some cereal shots that were so fun! I highly recommend trying this brunch paradise. There is an item on the menu for anyone! :)

61UFdQqgn53ZUlQc0vgvbg.text: Just went back for the 2nd time, and tried really hard to order something new but the Italian hash was so good I had to order again. Was not let down.  My girlfriend had the salmon board the first time, totally loved it and then the bruschetta 3 ways for round 2. Also DELICIOUS. The wait was expected, and turned out to be shorter than the estimate -both visits we were given a 45-60 minutes wait time and were sat within 30 minutes- and since you  can visit the bar while you wait, really not an issue  the DJ is kinda loud but I am also 34 so maybe I'm just old?  But really... it's Chandler, and aren't we all?  Whatever, not too loud to detour me from returning clearly. The patio is super nice, totally excited for fall brunch. The service staff is great, everyone is really nice and attentive. I'd give it 5 stars except there is no bottomless mimosa or bottle option and that's a bit of an issue for me and my girlfriends... after all what is brunch if not Mimosas with a side of good food?

2D6Xer1mK3fjZxxZYsQzTg.text: New place in Chandler. Met my friends there for a birthday get together and it was a lot of fun. The food and service was great and the music was popping! They had a Mimosa and Bloody Mary bar that housed an assortment of items to add to our drinks. The owner/manger Dominic came to our table to check to see if we needed anything and made sure we had enough seating for our large party. He was friendly and funny and made sure our birthday girl enjoyed herself.

LnruUz8v6vnOQ02boNqQhA.text: The music is way to loud you can't hear anyone not even your server. Food was okay but expensive-ish. The wait was about and hour so overall wouldn't do this again.

YcyGcvkigSRN8DGEKO6AlQ.text: I really wanted to like this place because I live right down the road. Ate there yesterday for lunch. Actually talked my friends out of going to Tempe Market and joining me. Bloody Mary bar is impressive but that was about it. We started with the bacon board. I ordered the Spaniard firtatta and my friend order Chicken Tinga and pancakes. When the bacon board was dropped off no one told us which bacons were which so we got to play the guessing game. I ordered my Firtatta with no tomatoes or potatoes and specified I was allergic. Also asked what I could get instead of the side of potatoes and was told fruit. When my food was dropped off it still came with a side of potatoes and potatoes in the dish. I said I couldn't eat it because I was allergic. They offered to remake it. My friend received his pancakes but never his chicken tinga. We just assumed they hadn't been rang in. At 1 point we had 2 managers at our table and they asked why I had no food in front of me. The acknowledged it would be out quick. When it did arrive it had a side of potatoes with it. If that's not a slap in the face when you've specified twice you have an allergy. After that our server was not to be heard from until we waved him down and asked for our check so we could pay. When the bill was dropped off everything was on there. The chicken tinga. The modifier that said no potato no tomato. Oh and my side of fruit that was 2.50 for a single piece of watermelon, , cantaloupe, and honey dew. Had to insist the chicken tinga be taken off because it never showed up. By the end it was just comical at how much the ball was dropped. Will most likely not come back.

zL6b2417uMju3OmoA8wazw.text: Great food, ambiance and staff! Dominic the manager is awesome...making sure your experience is the best it can be!

S1RP-wQ9KYaMiaRJEPlQSw.text: Ridiculously loud, not enough parking, crazy long wait times (1 hour) during morning brunch hours and they don't do call ahead or reservations. Definitely not the place to go if you want to have a conversation of any kind over breakfast/brunch and are on any kind of a time schedule.

VpP_4dLT7cMQBXFYexkIyQ.text: So I dragged my friend here to give it a shot. Walking in I shocked st hiw loud it was. They dont need a DJ but it's a cute gimmick. We were told it would be short wait and went to look at the bloody Mary bar and it's amazing I was just wowed. We asked if the bar was open and then decided to sit there. Both bar tenders were really nice. My water glass had some food in it so I asked for a new glass of water. We ordered our food and drinks which came out fast but I never got my ordered drink. I let it slide they were busy.As we our taking our first bite we found the longest hair in our Avacado toast. My hair is braided and my friend had short hair so we knew it wasn't ours and it was literally entwined in the food. We sent it back. This is when my drink finally shows up. I'd honestly forgot about it and was settled with my water. We were sharing and the bartender asked me do I want to send mine back too. Ummm yeah it's the same food. So we get new food and the rest of the food comes out. It's missing the bacon. So then she has to get a side order of bacon for the sandwich. As we are checking out the bartender spoke with the manager Dom and he took the avocado toast off the bill just because of what happened. The food was excellent but I had to knock off some stars but I'll probably try them again.

-rin5DMDBEC982eVFfqnKA.text: Just left this place and it was wonderful.  I had the Avocado Toast and it was the best I ever had.  My daughter had the lump Crab Benedict the biscuit was to die for.  Dominic the manager stopped by twice to check on us and Jennifer was amazing she made sure we were well taken care.  We will definitely be back.

sHCgSl9eItg8tFAB-HKRlw.text: This place is so good! The lemon pancakes are spot on couldn't get any bette! I love the decor and the menu is fun. I can't wait until the weather cools down so me and my girlfriends can meet up sit outside and drink mimosas and have the donuts they look delicious!!!

PFBnDpP7sEHGIyMK8ySDQQ.text: Dominic and the crew were AWESOME. Love the environment, food and location. Tried something new and loved it. We'll be back, the menu is EXTENSIVE!

YAf3qdWFKhVZWdY-ZMGXeQ.text: Had a great time with a large party, was seated in good time on a busy Sunday morning. Dj played great music and drinks were great. Definitely recommend the fight of cereal shooters and mimosas. Service was great and food was delicious!

u5xvmzfE-oOcbWG-Qc0VnA.text: I just ate at the new Hash Kitchen in Chandler. I sat at the bar and the Bartender was very friendly however there was a manager behind the bar trying drinks and never asked how I was doing or even said hello to me. The food was below average. I ordered the Cannoli Donuts and a Carnitas Hash. The donuts were so dense I could barely eat one. Also the hash was  below average as well, the potatoes were cold, the green chili pork was dry and had no sauce. The best part of the dish were the crispy onions on top.

TD1FGfrUXwsMKQEyGMF5bg.text: This place was through the ROOF. Right down the street from me so i decided to give it a go. Went with a friend & was immediately drawn in to the atmosphere. Had that scottsdale vibe with the loud music & busy-ness. Ordered the chorizo breakfast and instantly wished i had more room in my stomach for more!!! I also saw they had a bloody mary bar that i will be indulging in on my next visit!

8NUBNNWlsbLltmuljEpoBg.text: When you first hear the name, you think, "Oh it's probably just a low-key, hole-in-the-wall, mom and pop brunch place." Even standing outside you'd probably have the same thought. However, as soon as you open the door, you're slapped in the face by what can only be described as pure excitement. Now, I'm not much of a Yelp reviewer, but this place IS THAT GOOD. From the moment we walked in until the moment we walked out, the service was outstanding. The staff went above and beyond to make our first experience there one we will not soon forget. The music was fun and upbeat (in part because they had an actual DJ), and the food was to die for. We both ended up ordering something the server had suggested (I wish I would've remembered her name because she was incredibly helpful) and honestly we were amazed at how quickly it came out and how delicious it was. I'd go as far as to say it came out within seconds, but it was probably a few minutes. You get so caught up in all of the buzz happening around you, you aren't really paying that much attention. ANYWAY, on top of all of that...wait for it... THEY HAVE A BUILD YOUR OWN BLOODY MARY BAR. Now all the soccer moms are probably thinking, "shut the front door," but I crap you not, they have everything that your big kid hearts could ever want inside/on top of/around a Bloody Mary. Fast forward through our friendly banter and face shoveling, towards the end of our meal one of the managers came over to ask us about our experience and I didn't have as many words as I do now to describe it. To me, this said a lot about the company. When a manager is willing to take the time to walk around and chat with the customers about how the food or service is, ESPECIALLY when they have no idea if there will be bad or good reviews, that's when you know they mean it. DOM, thanks for showing us a good time and making sure that we enjoyed ourselves. I can safely say, that I will be spreading the word about this fine establishment.

cW75TWbJOfmb-vW5kaBoIA.text: Had a great brunch and restaurant has a great vibe. The management was super attentive. It is super loud but as long as you know the vibe going in it's all good. We waited 30 minutes on a Sunday at 11:30. My mom got the crab eggs Benedict and my sister had the salmon version. I just had a scramble but it was all great. By the way, my mom is 77 and loved it.

PDqSyleLIgAfRNij-1Vadg.text: Best bloody Mary's in Arizona. Huge plates of food best hangover spy you can think of

ZbZ7c045kbZRaYgaHJhCPA.text: I love this place. Food is excellent. Service is top notch. Atmosphere is fun and energetic. Everything about the place is 5 stars, with the exception of one thing: it's just too damn hot inside.. I'll keep going back with the hope that the a/c is cranking next time.

f6KPTRWD01voLWominRVdA.text: As soon as we walked in we noticed the beautiful decor. Our waitress was wonderful and so friendly. The mimosas were so good and the French toast i had was even better. Definitely the place to go for an awesome brunch experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

L7pMzYd-Xthi0hOgwCjdAw.text: I went here because the online menu said vegan options. Ive been a vegetarian for 14 years now and when i go out i aim to eat vegan. I was excited to have some options other than the usual pancakes or grilled cheese option. I decided to do the beyond burger since it sounded delicious with grilled peppers. As i was ordering it the waiter said "the bun isn't vegan, we don't have any vegan bread". So.. why say you have vegan options then, either do or don't, don't half-ass have vegan options. I would have had to get the burger with no bun in order to be vegan. The burger was alright but I wasn't impressed with their lack of options.

Ezi1I-examjPjYa8VUcTyA.text: First time here.. very energetic vibe. DJ spinning the toons.. good food, great service and music.. I appreciated The Manager Domenic coming to our table and asking about our experience. This is what sets these establishments apart from the rest. Keep up the good work! As long as the service remains great, and vibe. This place and the future locations will prosper and be very successful. Looking forward to coming back and trying out their new spot "The Sicilian Baker" in Phoenix.. chandler location coming soon.. cheers !!!

3J3O0hsaymVs6FxemjN_CQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!! The service is fast , friendly and  on point. When it comes to the food the portions are large so much so you have to take food home Togo. The taste is just right and when it come to the starters and the mimosas you can never over order ! We came with our daughter and she had so much fun with the music so it is definitely kid friendly. Last but not least the manager Dominic or as he said " the little Italian" was so friendly and ensured to check in on us.  We also had a very attentive waiter by the name of Truman he was so sweet with my daughter when she broke her crayons. If you have kids you know how it feels when people are just genuinely sweet with the kiddos !!If you have time make sure to stop in it will be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Daughter having fun with an amazing atmosphere!!

sSNFfUIgQSgA_OX4YxmsCw.text: Fun atmosphere, but the music is quite loud. Seems to be fitting for the Scottsdale crowd, but in chandler. Fun ideas on the menu. Mediocre execution. Maybe trying to do too much. 5 of us went for breakfast. We started with coffee, a few of the build your own bloody Mary's, and a mimosa. The drinks were average. For food, we ordered the avocado toast, berry waffle, overnight oats, veggie omelet, and the steak breakfast burrito. Sadly the oats were the best one, and it was pretty average. The avocado toast was massive and just not good. The burrito was mostly just potatoes, very little steak or bacon. The waffle was okay. The omelet was bland.  Service was also not great. We were wanting to ask for some hot sauce for the omelet and for the potato burrito, but waiter never came around until we were finished.   It is a fun looking place, with a fun looking menu, that really let us down with the delivery.

X2qRdMwvzCMePimQF4EveA.text: Wow if you have never been here and In the area your gotta try this place.  You're in for a surprise, they have their own DJ!  This Is the first place I ate brunch and danced in my seat lol. Great ambiance, they are known for the largest Bloody Mary bar and that's no joke!! Best of all the food is fabulous!!! Presentation also unbelievable.

qFGgLIWkcVjd52tcEr1HAA.text: I can die now.  I thought Sunday brunch was for basic bitches -- but we had family in town that weren't jazzed by the idea of a breakfast burrito from a taco shop.  An employee in one of the shops at Chandler Fashion Square recommended Hash Kitchen to my parents the night before and told them it was her new favorite restaurant.  We scoped out the menu and I was lured in by the promise of an enormous plate of cannoli pancakes.  Sold.  When we arrived, there was a huge crowd outside waiting to get in.  "No way, Jose," I informed my parents and attempted to leave the parking lot but they were insistent that we stay.  Upon entry, we were advised that it would be approximately 45 minutes before being sat.  Groan!  I NEVER wait 45 minutes anywhere.  I don't have the patience for it.    However... that 45 minute wait turned into the best brunch experience in the valley.  Hands down.   First of all, they opened an outside bar window for the people waiting to be sat so you could create yourself a bloody mary from a huge build-your-own bloody mary bar.  I went for the 32 oz bloody mary to calm my nerves from being stuck outside in anticipation of my food.  I loaded it up -- pickled eggs, bacon, a Slim Jim, mozzarella on a stick -- this bloody mary bar was INSANE!   I couldn't even list off everything I topped mine off with.  It was so nutty that when I was done, some German tourists asked me to take a picture with them and my bloody mary.  I'm an attention whore so I gladly helped them out.  We were sat in less than the expected wait time.  The atmosphere inside is like a bright, brunchy party with a DJ mixing up some dope ass beats.    Ashton was our server and she took great care of us.  She answered a lot of questions about the menu and really made us feel welcome.  We never felt rushed or like we were a bother when we needed refills or ketchup or had special requests.  Insanely good service.  The manager, Dominic, came out and introduced himself to us.  Not only was he a low-key sexy beast, but he made sure we were having a great experience.  Very nice guy and that goes a long way.  Not one of those managers that goes around and you feel like it's phony, part of their job.  You could tell he was genuinely concerned with any feedback we may have and had a desire to make sure we were happy and the restaurant as a whole was successful in all aspects.  A+++ for customer service from both management and wait staff.    The food -- huge portions, cool options.  Stop what you're doing and look at their pancake menu right now.  They have Fruity Pebble pancakes served with a rich vanilla custard sauce.  A member of our party got them and they were OFF THE CHAIN.  I got the fried chicken benedict and my mind was blown.  Gourmet, delicious, the food looked beautiful.    Brunch perfected.    I don't get all these people raving about the place and giving it four stars.  Star snobs!  This place is 5-star all the way in my book, baby!  Put that in your pipe and smoke it!    We will be back and my mind is forever changed about brunch.  A new favorite restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. This bloody mary was LIT!

gP9AKmDcqpMvDBVFh5OTzA.text: It's a fun atmosphere for brunch with food drink and goods. The Bloody Mary Bar is a must! We'll definitely come back.

ubuIUqV5YrQtAZqPc3bUXA.text: The reason I'm giving Hash Kitchen one star is because the music is so loud that you have to yell to talk and it's almost impossible to carry on a conversation. The atmosphere is like a nightclub with the music blaring which is ok if you are at a dance club but it's not ok for breakfast. I did like the music selection though; the DJ just needs to turn the music down.  The DJ did an excellent job with music selection!  It would be nice to hear the music and be able to talk at the same time and not have to yell.  You will definitely get a headache in this restaurant. The Hash Kitchen in Scottsdale plays music like this but it's not so loud that you have to yell to carry on a conversation! This restaurant could have the best of both worlds they just need to turn the music down a little bit. Definitely don't bring out of town guests here to catch up because you will not be able to talk and definitely don't bring your grandparents or in laws here!:)  Hehehehe!!

gRmsq6w6PV5BSD4l3aacuQ.text: Very impressed with this place. Loved the food. It came out fast and hot. Everything is prepared fresh which is wonderful. Loved the mimosa flight as well. The atmosphere is very modern, they have a live DJ that plays modern music which is great. Completely satisfied with not only my food but the experience as well. Worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States

29dxz9FSdNl6vbJCfwgB-w.text: How many ways can you spin a breakfast? I may or may not be the right demographic for this restaurant. Fancy new interesting dishes/menu to explore and an open environment. There the two bars, one is a bloody mary bar.   Although they were crowded, we got seated and served quickly. The server and Manager, Dominic were very nice. Surprised to hear the same owner as the Sicilian Butcher Block in north Phoenix. Good question from the server, sweet or savory? Since the size of the dish is large, my wife and I split the Carnitas Hash ($16) and half of the classic French Toast ($5.50) with two coffees ($5.50).  I loved the flavor of the Carnitas Hash. The diced potatoes, thin fried onions, pork, and over easy egg was great. The dish had a small amount of heat to it, which I liked. If I could recommend two things may be a bit more pork and green chili, for the price. I didn't see any chili, but I could taste it. I would have preferred to dip the tortilla into the skillet but there was no sauce to dip it into. Oh, you might want to use a spoon instead of a fork to eat all the potatoes.  I was happy for the quick service, but we were being interrupted often. After I finished the French Toast, still several pieces left for my wife to eat, a person who was not a server, possibly a manager came by to pick it up. I put up my hand to stop him, he said sorry. It's nice to have great service but to aggressive service can be bad.  Yes, we will be back. This breakfast or lunch restaurant is new and interesting. Be prepared to spend a bit more than the run of the mill breakfast restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar!

7_te-hyzAT-XgqxurWZjWQ.text: Great manager- Domenic has great customer service- great food, ambiance and great time!! Love the waffles and chicken! I'll come back for a great breakfast and. A great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. #brunchsohard
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosas Flight for breakfast- bottoms up!

8gKstpDgDzpUwQOG0rsWtQ.text: We have been to this restaurant several times.  The food is always excellent!  Dominic, the manager, visits with all the customers and keeps the staff moving at a steady pace.  The staff is very nice.  Our orders are always correct.  The food arrives at the table hot.  Even the eggs!!   Thanks for keeping the quality up!  Everything is delicious!

NAa37xYwhxVTvZmTHoJ-4A.text: I have been there a couple of times and there is just something about the food I just don't like. The food looks so appetizing on the menu but not so much when the plate is in front of you. The "dj" music is loud at all times making it difficult to have a conversation with a group of four people or more.

vmaXpIyuzm5vj52KQnzEaQ.text: I ordered the corned beef sandwich and was largely underwhelmed. Obviously it was not a real Reuben--and it was not billed as such so that's fine--but regardless, I found it cold at the center and the cheese literally wasn't even melted, making for a less than pleasing textural encounter. Fries were redeeming and saved this venue from a 2-star review.   Service was fine, but not particularly mind-blowing considering that this is one of the pricier venues in the East Valley. Also, there was randomly a DJ and I still have no clue if I thought that was cool or not because on one hand, "Cool! A DJ!" And on the other hand, "Oh my god I can't hear anything over this mix of hot songs from 2015 blaring out of the speakers on a Sunday morning."

UP4J25XsBQsyLSBVsQJ5uA.text: Totally open to giving it another try but my experience sucked. They told me there was no egg dish i could have because their eggs come premade in bags with milk (I have an allergy so immediately knew I couldn't eat much for breakfast). We got a mimosa flight which is a cool concept but didn't taste great. Service wasn't accommodating or very suggestive on ways to overcome any dietary restrictions just put me on the spot to think of what a solution would be.... not very impressed :(

BpuaOMo6LEz1GlimLT49sQ.text: The ambiance is weird. Seeing a DJ in a breakfast place with a mini disco ball above his head seems super corny. The Bloody Mary bar seems cool but if you don't like bloody Mary's the drink menu appears original and fun but the drinks taste very basic. Food wise it was very mediocre. To spend 17 dollars on a plate you think it would have a better spread. They use frozen potatoes yet emphasize how good the potatoes are. I expected fresh ones. the steak we ordered we asked for medium rare and it was well done and not seasoned. Everything was just bland. The decor is nice but I wish they put more effort into their food. I was really really let down.. also... flies are everywhere and it's gross.

I8gnw1f-gIXc21nq3_pNog.text: This place has the best breakfast food by far! Not only is the food delicious, but the service was perfect. Sarah was our server and she was extremely sweet and attentive. Our food came out fast and correct, as I changed a few things, and she even went through the menu with me to ensure I'd like what I ordered! I'm a server too so I am an extremely hard critic on service and she was excellent! I will always come back and ask for her.

MWgZjLxfIzZ0dbs43IOXSg.text: Amazing amazing and the funnest I've had at breakfast in my lifetime. The music, vibe, staff, drinks, and food are all 10/10. Can't wait to go back! I hate bloody Mary's but after seeing their bar I might have to try loving them. The Bloody Mary bar is ridiculous

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Now that&#39;s a hash!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Chandler, AZ, United States. Our neighbors self made Bloody Mary from their bar.

9JoB1Q7aaQikltxbxdTM1Q.text: Excellent brunch spot. The food was tasty and the ingredients were great quality.  They did have a decent wait time (we were told 65mins but were seated in about 25). Will be returning!

QUavoUQPlSBJCCOW891MYA.text: Awesome!! First time here.. great atmosphere and vibe!! Domenic was outstanding and coming back for ine of those delicious french toast dishes next time

uSA6V0FbGvwn5kBBtF7fAw.text: Literally the best chicken and waffles I've ever had in my entire life! The service was just as great, the food came out super fast & the wait to get seated wasn't long at all. I will definitely be back !!! Gabriel was our server & he recommended the mimosa flight it's a must !! The manager Domenic also came over and made sure our experience was up to par & it sure was

LSLe8cXH5pWCAdKI00dFsg.text: Tasty food and great Mimosa "flights". The Chilaquiles and biscuits and gravy are great! They have a DJ playing loud music which can be a bit annoying in the morning.

HU_LWhGzRDysuNk-FLr5Mg.text: We just had a great experience at the Hash Kitchen in Chandler! Great menu, nice portions, fantastic mimosas, live music (DJ). Domenic the manager, was extremely on top of things, a fellow New Englander that made the day even better!

2wp2dC3Ej-uyHeAc7glFyg.text: This is such a hotspot for a breakfast place. It is the best atmosphere with the DJ playing in the background, food is outstanding and their drinks are amazing. I recommend the Bloody Mary bar for sure. Also the cereal shots so yummy! Dominic the manager was so personable and very outgoing. He was very welcoming and kept checking on to see if we needed anything. Thank you Dominic for making our experience awesome. We will be back for sure!

GQ6FW9k_3hfUKG9zpIa6yg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  Excellent staff and atmosphere.  The Bloody Mary and Mimosa Bars are amazing. What a great way to have breakfast! There is a wait on Sundays, but it is worth it. Both managers, Domenic and Gino, came out to greet me and were very personable. Did I mention the DJ? Yes....music and atmosphere in the morning! The food was well prepared and our Server knew the Menu. I am a fan! #congratulatuonsMrJoey

xqcwPtSv9Ygz0O0hfYrqBg.text: Awesome vibe and fun brunch! Bloody mary bar was delicious. The cereal shooters had quite the kick but still yummy. Hash potatoes were my favorite part of the meal. Can't wait to explore more the menu.

oi6YLGcwJUafXHjVqLEDgQ.text: Great atmosphere! Great food! Our server was attentive and kept our drinks full. Dominic, the manager was kind and also made sure my guest where having a good time and good food. If it's first time, I would recommend splitting the avocado toast with a buddy it's huge and if your like me and don't like blood Mary's, the mimosa flight never disappoints!

v_WHohGu5pNjA6_ugLuWrQ.text: Great breakfast in a lively, loud, happening restaurant. Music was awesome, wanted to dance through my meal!! Food was delicious and lots of choices - hard to decide what to try. Bloody Mary Bar also incredible. Dominic was very welcoming and Gabriel provided excellent service. Will definitely be back!

wCY6ONypSCfV8WIkWNpfLw.text: Wonderful Service by Master Jesus for his professional and great customer service! Loved the music and Vybz at Hash Kitchen!!

zIZ2a03zy0edz8S6z0NoiA.text: This place is so awesome. I have been in twice and both times the food was amazing! The first time I had the pretzel Benedict and my lord was it tasty. The second time I had the sweet corn tamale Benedict. It was heaven. The coffee is delicious and they serve it in giant mugs and leave the carafe at the table which makes you feel like you're getting your monies worth. They have a huge Bloody Mary bar that I have not had the pleasure of trying, but definitely will when I return. I love the DJ playing music. The service was nice and speedy and at the end of our meal the manager Dominic came by and chatted for a few minutes. This gave the Hash Kitchen a personal touch by going the extra mile in their customer service. Not only will I be coming back to this restaurant, but I will definitely recommend to my friends.

Bg29viuEBNF8QNH--z9cOA.text: I went here this morning my mom had just gone there and really liked it but said music was a little too high. We were seated right away and ordered pastry board a quinoa burger for one and the Mexican scramble for me. Waitress never checked on us for water or coffee refills and wait was long but it was busy so we understood. However the music was so loud you could not talk to each other because we could not hear. The pastry board was ok nothing wow'd the food finally came and it was cold. I could literally put my finger in the center of my eggs and cold and the quinoa burger and the bun were only warm on the edge center was ice cold. We sent it back and still  o refill on water. Not sure why so cold but we sent it back paid the bill and left. Mom was so disappointed because she really liked it last time for me total bust

XU54J3D7i-FJAr7TiyDEPw.text: Start with the Bloody Mary bar, replete with pickled vegetables, pickled eggs, meatballs and jalapeno poppers, and then you'll only want a small breakfast. Our large party of 7 only waited about 30 minutes on a busy Sunday and the food came out quick and hot and was delicious, served by the knowledgeable Melissa. I split a hash with chicken dish with my husband and the large portion was perfect. The DJ gave the breakfast spot a fun and active feel but prohibited cross-table conversation. The manager stopped by our table and thanked us for coming in. Will definitely go back and try the mimosa flight.

Gbhgn-nDDis4E53wHn4NXg.text: The food was amazing. The lemon ricotta pancakes are a must! The service was also incredible. Our server Amy knew exactly what to bring without us asking and the manager Dominic V. was very accommodating. We will definitely be back.

u_hE_PnO2d7GLc4FKUGbMA.text: We had brunch today at Hash Kitchen. Domenic is amazing! There was a wait and he offered to get us in right away and set us up with a perfect table outside with a heater. The food and service was great. Love the build your own Bloody Mary bar. Great place to bring out of town guests with positive atmosphere.

8bwmA4hBJgc6WhiRhM0qWw.text: Food was good. And the place looks awesome. However, it seems like they only tend to female customers. We sat (2 males) for 15 minutes before we were even greeted. After ordering we were not brought the condiments we asked for. And sat there as we watched every waiter and manager in this place make small talk and flirt with every all female table. Waited 20 minutes to ask for the check. And then another 15 for it to be picked up. Giving 2 stars because the DJ was playing the jams!

w9WoWJph2w2WRU9dq2EJQg.text: Just had a great breakfast with a friend here this morning. We sat outside on the patio and they adjusted the umbrella for optimal shade for us. Service was wonderful and food was great., my only concern was the fact that the ingredients were not incorporated into the frittata but rather on top and the egg part was a bit flavorless and dense however the chicken Tikka was delicious. We were later greeted by Dominic and he was very pleasant and informed us of another great place opening soon. We will absolutely be back and will check out the new places!

X3VtE1x1BNdL2bV0kKQJrg.text: Food not good... okay, waaaaay too noisy for brunch- ugh. Wait staff needs customer service training.

RV_fu8BTsh3JEKJQ2sfoCg.text: How in the world this place got 4.5 stars is beyond me. A friend and I went for the first time this morning for brunch and immediately thought we had walked into a night club. The bar was full, a DJ was playing loud music... I mean, A DJ.. at 10am on a Saturday morning. Not my ideal for a nice brunch the morning after a typical Friday night out, but we decided to give it a shot. The food -as fancy as the presentation is- is mediocre at best. Their so-called "best seller" Lemon Ricotta Pancakes lacked flavor and was disappointing. Oh, and how do you mess up biscuits and gravy? By slopping on a pile of scrambled eggs and seasoning all over it. There wasn't enough gravy so I asked the server if I could have a little more, and the guy tells me that the gravy is MEASURED and that he would have to charge me for extra! Measured?? Seriously? I declined, but when the manager (Dominic) came around to our table while making his rounds, I mentioned how the dish needed more gravy and he happily brought me more and ensured that we enjoyed the rest of our meal. The spot has a cool vibe and seems like the trending place to be, but don't go here if you're looking for a quiet brunch or excellent food.

AzGqL1jyN6jXVaK4LH-g1Q.text: After looking the menu online my family and I were eager to try the fruity pebble pancakes. Both times we have gone here the fruity pebble pancakes were not infused like promised on the menu. Instead, they were just thrown on top of normal buttermilk pancakes. We have been very disappointed both times with these pancakes. While the other food was decent the major reason for eating here was to try these pancakes.

LwPqaAm5GBPi7Hl191fvRg.text: This was our first time here and the experience we got was not one to remember.  I initially called around noon to see what the wait time was for a table for two and was told 15-20 minutes.  My other half and I drove here and the Hostess was very polite and professional.  I asked about the bloodymary bar and she explained how it worked.  You basically get a ticket from your waitress and go up there to redeem it.  Simple I thought.  We were seated, sat and waited and waited and waited, and our assigned waitress never acknowledged us, nor did anyone else and there we were surrounded by empty tables.  Dumbfounded by why this restaurant has so many positive reviews with almost 5 stars we were not happy with being first time customers!  I ended up getting up to ask the Hostess if she could see about sending over our waitress/waiter to our table.  In the meantime, the bartender got our drink orders.  Our waitress came a few minutes later and walked up to us and right off she asks, "What can I get you guys to eat?"  Not a single hi how are you, sorry for the wait or let me tell you how Hash Kitchen works.  I was kind of pissed, annoyed and ready to leave.  Even the manager apologized but not to my satisfaction.  Even though the experience was bad we still payed full price.  Now the taste of food....I ordered a scrambler and added (what I thought was going into my scrambler since they call them adds) green bell peppers and avocado.  Instead they put my avocado on the side! Put my green bell peppers on top of my scrambler!  Really, Hash Kitchen cooks?!  I was again not impressed.  My husband ordered waffles and chicken and the chicken was very bland, no flavor at all.  Between service and food we were not impressed one bit.

UnP_n2dh6hEFloSbAwyx2w.text: We visited less than a week after it opened.  We were quite impressed by the food and the service.  The manager came over to greet us and ask for our feedback on everything.  We were a little surprised by the availability of seating here, but I think once they have their official grand opening and get some buzz, it will be packed for lunch.

tuD6D6ZqRhX-upbQcdFy6g.text: Tried this place for the first time today. The food was amazing!! The atmosphere is very fun, they actually have a DJ set up. Employees were very friendly. It seems a little loud at first, but you are able to carry on conversations with no problem. Because they are so new, I think they are still working out some service kinks. Our food took a while. The table next to us was occupied when we sat down. They paid their bill and left. Then, a couple sat down , ordered and their food arrived before ours. (we were a party of 2 as well) Also, the fried herb chicken hash that I ordered surprised me when it arrived without an egg. I commented to the manager that I found it odd that hash would come without eggs and he stated that some of the hash plates do come with egg and some don't. Well, I checked the menu when I got home and it should have come with a poached egg!!!! Avocado hash toast was the other dish that we ordered and it was delicious!  Dominic was the manager that checked on us. He was very genuine and seemed to appreciate our honest feedback. (It didn't hurt that he was a fellow Bostonian..... fellow Cape Codder actually. ) I will definitely be returning ....... there were several more menu items that looked amazing.

xtKVBak7LbB60MPZRNNOmw.text: I had no idea what to expect coming in here but the menu sounded AMAZING and a friend had said she heard it was good. So me and a friend went for brunch on a Friday morning at 11am and walked in to ridiculously loud music. I didn't notice the DJ set up until the server pointed it out. It was quite awful. This place is very hipster which combined with the music is 100% not my scene so I felt uncomfortable there from the get. I was just there for a good meal! Having looked at the menu ahead of time, I knew I wanted Dr Art Mollens veggie frittata. It was apparently loaded with veg and topped with goat cheese which is my fave. It also came with a side of potatoes and a biscuit and while I don't eat either typically, I figured I would try both seeing as how the food has such rave reviews. The food came and presentation was great. I took a bite of my frittata and it tasted... like goat cheese. The bites that I took with no goat cheese tasted like plain egg. I am 100% not exaggerating when I say there was NO seasoning added to this frittata. None. I doused it in salt and pepper to give it some. I tasted the potatoes which were not even salted. Not only that, but I would bet they are frozen Ore Ida hash browns ... the ones that have the little peppers and onions in them. They look identical. But again, flavorless. The last thing to try was the biscuit. So I break off a little piece and immediately notice it is soooo dry. SO. DRY. So I put some butter on it and drizzle some honey and what did I taste? Some honey. Again, the dry ass biscuit had no flavor. The entire meal was a complete let down. The food sucked. The ambience was miserable with the loud music. Service was awful. I will absolutely never ever return. There are way too many good breakfast restaurants out there. I don't know how people are giving the food high ratings. Maybe they were already drunk off the Bloody Mary bar.

sqZvUvwt4bSmy3khMaRREQ.text: Okay.... I have been to Hash Kitchen twice before with a friend and loved the food and just knew my husband would love the bloody mary bar!!!  So, my husband, daughter and I went.  We got our table... sat there for at least 7 to 8 minutes before our server acknowledged us.  By then we knew exactly what we wanted to order!  Our server, Kim, took all of our information and we waited.  When you order the Bloody Mary from the table you have to wait for your server to give you a ticket.... we waited .... and waited some more and then Dominick came to the table.  Told him we would really like to get the ticket for the bar.  Finally.... my husband gets it and while he is having to wait in a long line out comes our food!  At which time my food comes without butter and syrup and my husband is still in line.... By this time another manager, Summer, comes to our table and asks if everything is okay.  At first I give her a thumbs up then she continues to ask so I tell her.... we have waited and now my husbands food is getting cold because he is having to wait some more, I have no syrup or butter.  She insisted that she was going to have his food fired up again and she would take care of us.  I told her I'm not looking for anything free I would just like to have a nice breakfast with my family!!!  She told me she was going to make sure I had a great day and that everything was going to be okay and off she went.  Never saw her again!!!  My husband ate the cold breakfast.... our waitress told me she would talk to the manager and get his breakfast removed from our ticket.  Needless to say nothing was ever said or done... $72.00 later we walked out of there with less than stellar thoughts!  I will say, we enjoyed the atmosphere!!!  If I ever go back we will go first thing, different waitress and order the bloody mary in advance of getting seated!!!!  The table next to us had sat after us, ate, left and another group was sitting there almost done eating by the time we left!!!  Incredible!!!  Step it up Kim, Summer and Dominick!!!

47ozEPEMOFuAJwncui_PWw.text: Our group of four stopped by for a late breakfast/early lunch on a Friday around 11:30am. The place was packed with a twenty minute wait for a table. Being a regular customer, our previous visits were always between Mon-Thur, this was our first Fri visit. We did not realize there was a DJ playing very loud music Fri-Sun. While we enjoyed the upbeat music, we felt it was extremely loud and very difficult to hold a normal conversation. We decided that we would never visit Fri-Sun because of the music. Suggest the music volume be reduced to allow for normal conversation (I assume diners are flocking in for the excellent food, not the music). Our group ordered the following: Avocado Toast Hash Style (HUGE portion and delicious), the Bacon & Egg Burger (made as requested, medium-well and delicious), Cubano sandwich (excellent), and last, Biscuits/Gravy & Italian Sausage (not your traditional biscuits and gravy). The food was great as usual but our complaint was that our meals came out sporadically and there was a long wait for for one person in our group (not pleased). The first two meals arrived in a reasonable time and the third entree came five minutes later. We were not pleased that one person was without a meal so we waited and stayed patient and politely asked another server to check on our last entree. After another ten minutes, the fourth entree arrived. We found our server was very friendly but not very attentive (likely too busy juggling all her tables). I do give a lot of credit to our server, she apologized at the end of our meal for the long gap between the delivery of our entrees and notified Dominic (Manager) of the issue we encounterd. Dominic delivered our bill and apologized profusely for the issue and he had adjusted our bill to make things right. We all appreciated Dominic's openness and actions to correct the situation.  We realize things happen so this issue will not deter us and we will return, just not Fri-Sun.
